faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Barbados?
faqs.answer: Indian nationals wishing to travel to Barbados for vacation and/or for business are required to obtain a visa beforetravelling to Barbados regardless of whether they are travelling by air, cruise ship, or private yacht. The visa must be applied at the British High Commission in India.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Barbados visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straightforward and effortless process to apply for a Barbados visa online through Akbar Travels: Choose your preferred type of Barbados visa based on your travel type Pay online & - Submit documents through our pick up & drop service We verify, complete your application online & book an appointment On the appointment day, visit the High Commission for biometric & document submission Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: What are the different types of Barbados Visas?
faqs.answer: Visitor Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to enter Barbados for tourism, leisure, visit or business. Transit Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to transit through Barbados. Holders of passports issued by any country can transit through Barbados for 12 hours, except for nationals of Algeria and Morocco, who must obtain a transit visa. Student Visa: Applicants intending to study or go to school in Barbados require a student visa. Student visas are only issued by the Immigration Department in Barbados.There is an application fee of US$100.00. Work Visa: individuals who have special skills which are in short supply in Barbados may be granted a work permit for a specific post if there is no qualified Barbadian available for the post. Applications for work permits in these cases are processed by the employer and not the prospective employee.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Barbados visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Barbados visa is three months before the date of travel to the country.In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted four weeks prior to travelling.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Barbados visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The British High Commission issues a Single and Multiple entry visa for Indians. The Single entry is issued for a period of 3 months only, whereas a multiple entry visa is issued for 6 months.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?

faqs.question: What is the Barbados visa fee for Indians?
faqs.answer: The fees vary depending on the type of visa you require.Since the Consulate issues single & multiple type visas, the cost for each entry type differs as follows: Single entry – INR 8,999/-(Permission to make one (1) entry within a three-month period) Multiple entry - INR 15,899/-(Permission to make numerous entries within a six-month period.)

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Consulate will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Barbados visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa application is normally processed within 15 working days.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Barbados visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: why are you visiting Barbados how long you intend to stay in Barbados how will you support yourself during your time in Barbados what is the purpose of your visit to Barbados type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid where do you intend to travel following your visit to Barbados if you have a permit to enter the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Barbados

faqs.question: How do I receive my Barbados visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will bestamped on your passport.

faqs.question: Is it possible to obtain a visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: No. Indians travelling to Barbadosmust obtain a visa before their arrival in the country. Visa on arrival service is not available for Indian nationals.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Barbados Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Yes, an appointment is mandatory for a Barbados Visa in order to provide your biometrics and submit your visa documents.

faqs.question:
Do I have to apply in person for the
                            Barbados Visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted nor are travel agents authorized to submit applicants on behalf of the applicant. The Barbados visa application should be presented in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: What should be done if my Barbados visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: In the case of a Barbados visa rejection, the Embassy will state the reason for rejecting your visa application. You may also appeal against the decision if you find it necessary.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the event of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to visit Oman?
faqs.answer: Yes. All Indian nationals require a Visa to travel to Oman.

faqs.question: What is an Oman e-Visa?
faqs.answer: The Oman eVisa is an Electronic Visa that can be issued online through us, without the effort of applying through the embassy, making it easy to obtain from any place in the world. The e-Visa is a travel permit for tourist purposes only

faqs.question: What are the requirements for issuing an Oman eVisa?
faqs.answer: To apply and be approved for the Omani e-Visa, applicants have to meet the following requirements: Applicants must be outside the Sultanate of Oman when applying for an e-Visa; Applicants must be citizens of one of the eligible countries; Applicants must not possess a valid Omani travel permit when applying for the e-Visa; Applicants’ passports must be valid for at least 6 months from the day of the arrival in Oman; Please note that a valid e-Visa does not guarantee entrance into the Sultanate of Oman. You will be allowed to enter only after a Royal Oman Police Officer has examined your documents at the point of entry.

faqs.question: What types of Oman visas can I apply online?
faqs.answer: You can apply online for a tourist e-Visa only.

faqs.question: How do I apply for my e-Visa to Oman?
faqs.answer: We have the complete process simplified for you and will take care of the complete visa process right from verifying your documents to approval of your eVisa. We have it all covered for you.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Oman Consulate/Embassy to get my e-Visa?
faqs.answer: No. You do not need to visit the Consulate/Embassy. We will process your e-Visa online as Indians are eligible for an Oman e-Visa.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get an Oman e-Visa?
faqs.answer: Once the application is submitted with complete proper information, it will be processed within 6 working days.

faqs.question: How long is the Oman Visa valid for?
faqs.answer: The Oman Visa is valid for upto 3 months and cannot be extended. One can stay in Oman depending upon the type of Visa applied ie either for 10 days or 30 days. You can reapply for a new online travel document, but, first, you will have to leave Oman.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Oman with an e-Visa?
faqs.answer: The maximum stay allowed is upto one month.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to be outside of Oman at the time of applying for the e-Visa?
faqs.answer: Yes. Applicant must be outside of Oman at the time of application.

faqs.question: Do I need a printed copy of the Omani eVisa?
faqs.answer: Yes. We will forward you an email from the Government of Oman with the details of your eVisa included in this email such as your application ID, visa number, and visa validity. Print a copy of the approved e-visa and make sure the printed copy is clear and legible. Kindly be reminded that your Oman e-Visa printout is crucial and must be presented upon your arrival at the Oman entry checkpoints.

faqs.question: What are the passport requirements for applying for an Oman eVisa?
faqs.answer: The Applicant’s passport should be valid for atleast 6 months with minimum 2 blank pages from the date of entry into Oman.

faqs.question: On arrival into Oman, what documents do I need to present?
faqs.answer: At entry, you must show that you have a valid hotel booking, confirmed return tickets and sufficient cash in addition to your valid passport and e-Visa.

faqs.question: Do I have to submit my passport for stamping before I travel?
faqs.answer: No, you will receive an electronic visa, which does not require anything to be stamped on your passport ahead of travel. All visa copies are sent by email. You should print a copy of your e-visa and carry it with you when you travel to Oman.

faqs.question: What is OK to Board (OTB) and why is it needed?
faqs.answer: Due to an expansion in fake visas to Oman, many Indian passengers were deported back in the past. In order to control the fake visa issuance and any fraudulent activities; airlines and sponsors double check the Oman Visa and Air tickets before departure and only after checking the visa authenticity, airlines update visa message in the respective PNR.

faqs.question: What is the time taken to get the OTB?
faqs.answer: The Airline verifies the Oman Visa and only then updates an Ok to Board message against the PNR. Airlines generally will take at least 24-48 working hours to update PNR after issuance of the Oman VISA.

faqs.question: What is the main purpose behind updating the OTB?
faqs.answer: Your airline mandates you to update OTB message in the PNR primarily to confirm the legitimacy of your Oman Visa as well as other relevant travel documents, thereby eliminating the chances of travellers making entry to the country with a forged visa and subsequently getting deported by the Oman immigration.

faqs.question: What if my OTB status is not updated?
faqs.answer: In such circumstances, your airline has the complete right to disapprove your boarding. To resolve this issue at the earliest, do not delay getting in touch with our Qatar Visa Experts.

faqs.question: What are the advantages of applying for an Oman e-Visa?
faqs.answer: Minimum document requirement; Swift processing-subject to qualifying the eligibility criteria and meeting the documents requirement, your visa can be processed within 3 working days; Convenient and cost effective i.e. most economical visa fee/charges; Electronic visa can be sent anywhere in the world through Email.

faqs.answer: You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself in Oman as medical treatment can be very expensive in Oman. faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Uzbekistan from India?
faqs.answer:
Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Uzbekistan. All visa applications to travel to Uzbekistan must be submitted to the Consular Section of the Embassy of the Uzbekistan in New Delhi, India.
The type of visa to enter Uzbekistan will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration. However, Indians travelling for solely tourism purpose can now apply for an eVisa. All other visa types such as business visa, private visa, transit visa must be applied at the Embassy.

faqs.question: What is an eVisa?
faqs.answer: An Electronic Visa or "e Visa" is an electronically issued and stored authority for travel to The Republic of Uzbekistan, which replaces the traditional paper visa process in most cases.Once your visa application is approved, you will receive the visa copy via email right in your inbox.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a traditional visa (sticker pasted on the passport) and an eVisa?
faqs.answer: Both documents allow to visit the Republic of Uzbekistan in accordance with the legal framework governing the type of visa / eVisa obtained. Tourist visa will be issued over email which must be printed and presented upon arrival at the Uzbekistan airport, whereas other visas, for e.g.: a business, private or transit visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Uzbekistan visa for Indians?
faqs.answer:
Tourist eVisa is valid for 90 days from the date of issue and one can stay for maximum 30 days on each visit. Applicants can choose from a single, double and multiple entry. 
For other types of visas, the Embassy issued Single entry visas with validity of up to 7 days, 15 days, 30 days, 3 months, 6 months and 1 year. Multiple entry visas are valid for up to 1 month, 6 months and 1 year. The visa fee will differ upon the entry type and visa validity.

faqs.question: What is the Uzbekistan visa fee?
faqs.answer: The tourist eVisa fees are as below: Tourist eVisa Single Entry INR 2,850/- Double Entry INR 3,850/- Multiple Entry INR 4,900/- The fees for other visa types are: Single entry Upto 7 days INR 5,200/- Upto 15 days INR 5,900/- Upto 30 days INR 6,500/- Upto 3 months INR 7,900/- Upto 6 months INR 10,900/- Upto 1 year INR 13,900/- Multiple entry Upto 1 month INR 6,900/- Upto 6 months INR 12,800/- Upto 1 year INR 6,500/- Upto 3 months INR 19,950/-

faqs.question: What is the tourist eVisa processing time?
faqs.answer: Tourist evisa is processed in 3 working days. Whereas processing of other visa applicationstakes up to 10 working days if documents have been submitted in established order.

faqs.answer: It is a straight forward and effortless process to apply for a uzbekistan visa online through Akbar Travels: Choose your preferred type of Guyana visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.answer: No. You are not required to visit the Uzbekistan Embassy personally. We will submit the visa application on your behalf.  However, you may be called for a personal interview. Whether the interview is required or no, will only be intimated after submitting documents to the Embassy.

faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Uzbekistan How long you intend to stay in Uzbekistan How will you support yourself during your time in Uzbekistan What is the purpose of your visit to Uzbekistan Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Uzbekistan If you have a permit to Uzbekistan the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Uzbekistan

faqs.question: Do I need visa for Kuwait from India?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Kuwait. Indians are eligible for an eVisa. The electronic visa system (eVisa) will allow foreign citizens to receive Kuwait visa online, relieving them from necessity of applying for the visa at the Embassy. It is the simplest and the fastest way to get your visa. Once your visa application is approved, you will receive the visa copy via email right in your inbox.

faqs.question: What is an eVisa?
faqs.answer: An Electronic Visa or "e Visa" is an electronically issued and stored authority for travel to The Republic of Kuwait, which replaces the traditional paper visa process in most cases.

faqs.question: What is an Kuwait eVisa?
faqs.answer: A Kuwait visa is a legal document which lawfully allows its holder to enter and stay within the country for a certain number of days as mentioned on the visa. The Kuwait entry requirements are determined by the applicant’s nationality and reasons to visit Kuwait.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Kuwait visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: A Kuwait visa is most appropriate for Indians travelling to Kuwait for recreational purposes such as holidaying, sightseeing, or even short family visits. The type of visa to enter Kuwait will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a traditional visa (sticker pasted on the passport) and an eVisa?
faqs.answer: The support is the only difference. Both documents allow to visit the Republic of Kuwait in accordance with the legal framework governing the type of visa / eVisa obtained.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Kuwait visas for Indians?
faqs.answer:
Kuwait has different visa types created to differentiate between the visitor’s entry requirements, lengths of stay and purpose of their trip: A Kuwait tourist eVisa allows visitors to enter and travel around Kuwait for touristic purposes
                                        A Kuwait visit visa must be sponsored by a Kuwait company or by a relative that is a resident foreigner staying in the country. Before traveling to Kuwait, a visitor can have his visa processed and passport stamped at their nearest Kuwait embassy. If you’re visiting Kuwait and in a need for a Kuwait transit visa, then you can obtain it from the port authority in Kuwait or from its consulate aboard. You have 7 days maximum to put that visa in use or else it will expire and you’ll have to get a new one.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Kuwait Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Kuwait visit visas (and also entry permits) are valid for entry within 90 days of issue.  Visitors can stay in Kuwait up to 30 days after entry.

faqs.question: Is it possible to extend the Kuwait visit visa?
faqs.answer: If you are holding a Kuwait visit visa, you can only stay up to a maximum of 30 days in the country. If you extend your stay, you will have to pay KD10.00 per day.If your Kuwait visit visa is expired, you will not be allowed to leave the country until you pay the total fine.

faqs.question: What is the Kuwait eVisa processing time?
faqs.answer: The processing time for a Kuwait eVisa is between one (1) and three (3) business days. Once approved, the eVisa is sent to the traveler by email. This saves the hassle of going to an embassy or consulate to submit a visa application. The Kuwait eVisa is a single-entry visa which allows visitors to spend up to 90 days in Kuwait.

faqs.question: How will I receive the Kuwait visa online?
faqs.answer: Applicants will receive their visas via email, after filling the application form with the necessary information and submitting the supporting documents online. The eVisa must be presented upon crossing the state border of Kuwait along with the valid travel document. The Kuwait Immigration Department, however advises all travelers to keep a hard copy or soft copy at all times during the trip.

faqs.question: When can the earliest possible application be made for a Kuwait visa online?
faqs.answer: We recommend that you apply for eVisa online at least 10 days prior to your entry in Kuwait. However it is not possible to apply more than 60 days before your date of entry to Kuwait.

faqs.question: Which are the entry requirements after you arrive in Kuwait?
faqs.answer: Passport valid for at least 6 months beyond your intended stay period Printed Kuwait eVisa Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Kuwait Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to your business trip

faqs.answer: Yes. Each traveller must have a separate e-Visa.

faqs.question: I do not want to apply for an e-Visa. Can I get a visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: No. Indians are not eligible for visa on arrival and must apply for the visa before travel. Arriving without a visa constitutes an undocumented traveler. You can be fined or refused entry into Kuwait.

faqs.answer: Yes. Indian citizens are required to obtain a visa prior to entering the Republic of Somalia. Visas may be obtained from the Embassy of Somalia in India. faqs.question: What are the different types of Somalia Visas?
faqs.answer: Visitor Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to enter Somalia for tourism, leisure, visit or business. Transit Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to transit through Somalia within a period of three to four days. Student Visa: Applicants intending to study or go to school in Somalia require a student visa. Work Visa: individuals who have special skills which are in short supply in Somalia may be granted a work permit for a specific post. The work visa is issued for multiple entries, valid for 1 year. The work visa fee is INR 22,599/-

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Somalia  visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Somalia visa is one months before the date of travel to the country. In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted ten days prior to travelling..

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Somalia visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The Embassy of the Federal Republic of Somalia issues a Single and Multiple entry visa for Indians. The Single entry is issued for a period of 3 and 6 months,whereas a multiple entry visa is issued for up to 1 year.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Somalia once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.question: What is the Somalia visa fee for Indians?
faqs.answer: The fees vary depending on the type of visa you require. Since the Embassy issues single & multiple type visas, the cost for each entry type differs as follows: Single entry – INR 13,999/- (Permission to make one (1) entry within a three-month period) Single entry – INR 16,999/- (Permission to make one (1) entry within a six-month period) Multiple entry - INR 22,099/- (Permission to make numerous entries within a one-year period.)

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit my passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Immigration division will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Somalia visa for Indians?

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Somalia  visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Somalia How long you intend to stay in Somalia How will you support yourself during your time in Somalia What is the purpose of your visit to Somalia Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Somalia If you have a permit to Somalia  the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Somalia

faqs.question: Do I need any specific vaccinations?
faqs.answer: Yes. As per the Somalia visa requirements, a yellow fever vaccination is mandatory. The certificate of the same is required to be attached along with other documents when applying for the visa.

faqs.question: How long is my vaccination certificate valid for?
faqs.answer: A certificate for yellow fever vaccination has a validity lasting up to 10 years. It must be counted 10 days post the date of vaccination.

faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Somalia visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Somalia tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country on a Somalia tourist visa.

faqs.question: What is a Hungary Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Hungary Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the Schengen
                                countries including Hungary for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s dream
                                where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along with Hungary.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all 26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Hungary), unless it is marked otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European territory
                                of Hungary. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons of
                                your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following countries:
                                Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary,
                                Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway,
                                Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number of
                                entries".

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer: You are free to apply again for a Schengen Visa if your application has been refused earlier.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: the purpose of your trip when and where you intend to travel how your trip is going to be funded day-by-day itinerary for your trip duration of the trip

faqs.question: As a Hungary short-stay visa holder can I extend my Schengen Visa while in Hungary?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your Hungary short-stay while in Hungary except in special circumstances, and
                                exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and apply
                                for another Hungary Visa if necessary.

faqs.question:
If my Hungary short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long
                            can I remain in the Hungary territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Hungary territory for a maximum
                                period of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 5-15 working days from your appointment
                                date.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain a Hungary Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Hungary Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 10 to 15 days to process in the
                                Hungary Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Hungary Visa is dependent on several
                                factors and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my Hungary Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Hungary visa application online using the Hungary VFS Reference
                                number and Date of Birth. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of the VFS Hungary
                                website.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Hungary Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Hungary Visa in order to provide your biometrics and submit
                                your visa documents.

faqs.question: My family is also applying for the Hungary Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question:
I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first port
                                of entry.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation, travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Hungary Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years period.

faqs.question: What is the role of VFS?
faqs.answer:
VFS Global Services Pvt Ltd (VFS) is the Service Delivery Provider for the Embassy of Hungary
                                in New Delhi. The role of VFS is to accept visa applications and to dispatch passports and
                                documents back to clients, on behalf of the Embassy of Hungary. VFS does not play any part
                                in or influence the outcome of your visa application.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: What are the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question: Can you process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa, you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

                                tourism sector with over 40 years of experience. Through our expertise, in-depth knowledge
                                and integrity, we commit to delivering an exceptional experience to our customers each and
                                every time you use our service. In order to help us understand your unique visa needs, please
                                drop in your query and our Expert will get in touch with you.

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer:

                                reasons
                                for the refusal are notified using a standard form that is handed out by the Member
                                State's
                                consulate that refused the visa. The notification of the refusal must include the
                                reasons,
                                on which the refusal were based, and the procedures and deadlines for submitting an
                                appeal.

                                it
                                is recommended that you take note of the reasons for the earlier refusal before
                                submitting
                                a new application and make amendments, where necessary. The visa fee is not refunded if
                                the
                                visa is refused. The visa fee covers the cost of the examination of the visa
                                application.

                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: the purpose of your trip when and where you intend to travel how your trip is going to be funded day-by-day itinerary for your trip duration of the trip

faqs.answer:

                                criminality.

                                apply

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you

                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during

faqs.question:

faqs.question: I am a family member of an EU-citizen. Are the standard requirements applicable to me?
faqs.answer:
Family members of EU citizens who have exercised their right of free movement (meaning
                                that the
                                EU citizen resides in or travels to a Member State other than his/her country of
                                origin)
                                benefit from certain procedural facilitations. The basic criteria to be fulfilled are
                                the
                                following: the EU citizen has exercised his/her right of free movement the family member (applicant) belongs to one of the categories covered by Directive
                                    2004/38/EC the family member (applicant) accompanies the EU citizen or joins him/her in the
                                    Schengen
                                    State of destination.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Denmark Visa?

                                (VIS), all

                                the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications
                                within

                                VIS.

                                applicant

faqs.question: What is a Sweden Schengen visa?

                                countries including Sweden for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s dream

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all 26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Sweden), unless it is marked otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European territory
                                of Sweden. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons of
                                your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following countries:
                                Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary,
                                Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway,
                                Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number of
                                entries".

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Nigeria ?
faqs.answer: Yes.Indian citizens are required to obtain a visa prior to entering the Republic of Nigeria.Nigeria Visa must be applied in person at the Embassy/High Commission/Consulate of Nigeria or designated Visa application center in person. Based on the purpose of your visit to Nigeriayou may apply for a Tourist visa, Business Visa, Student Visa,Transit Visa,Temporary Work Permit, Journalist Visa, Spouse Visa & many more. Before applying for a visa please check which visa type you are eligible to apply for.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Nigeria visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straightforward and effortless process to apply for a Nigeria  visa online through Akbar Travels. Choose your preferred type of Nigeria  visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: What are the different types of Nigeria Visas?
faqs.answer: Tourist Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to enter Nigeria for tourism, leisure, or visit purpose. Business Visa: Business visa is for those applicants who wish to travel to Nigeria for the purpose of Business conference and meetings, attending conferences and any other Business related meetings Transit Visa: Transit visa is for those applicants who wish to travel to Nigeria for the purpose of transiting Nigeria and then traveling to another country. Temporary Work Permit: TWP visa are for those applicants who wish to travel to Nigeria fir work for a temporary period. Journalist Visa: Journalist visa are for those applicants who wish to visit Nigeria for Journalist.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Nigeria  visa online?

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Nigeria visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: This visa is valid for 90 days.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Nigeria visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The processing time for the application at the Embassy of Nigeria is minimum 03 weeks days.All application submitted today will be processed the next working day please plan your travel and submission accordingly

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Nigeria once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once.

At the time of appointment, an applicant needs to submit one set of hard copies. Kindly carry your original supporting documents required only for verification.

faqs.answer: Biometrics is the process of collecting your finger prints.The Nigerian Immigration Service has commenced Biometric Visa Enrolment for all visas to Nigeria.

faqs.question: What if my Nigeria visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Nigeria visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: What is a Belgium Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Belgium Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the Schengen
                                countries including Belgium for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s dream
                                where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along with Belgium.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all 26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Belgium), unless it is marked otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European territory
                                of Belgium. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons of
                                your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following countries:
                                Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary,
                                Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway,
                                Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number of
                                entries".

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer: You are free to apply again for a Schengen Visa if your application has been refused earlier.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: the purpose of your trip when and where you intend to travel how your trip is going to be funded day-by-day itinerary for your trip duration of the trip

faqs.question: As a Belgium short-stay visa holder can I extend my Schengen Visa while in Belgium?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your Belgium short-stay while in Belgium except in special circumstances, and
                                exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and apply
                                for another Belgium Visa if necessary.

faqs.question: If my Belgium short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long can I remain in the Netherlands territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Belgium territory for a maximum
                                period of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 5-15 working days from your appointment
                                date.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain a Belgium Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Belgium Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 10 to 15 days to process in the
                                Belgium Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Belgium Visa is dependent on several
                                factors and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my Belgium Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Belgium visa application online using the Belgium VFS Reference
                                number and Date of Birth. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of the VFS Belgium
                                website.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Belgium Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Belgium Visa in order to provide your biometrics and submit
                                your visa documents.

faqs.question: My family is also applying for the Belgium Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question: I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first port
                                of entry.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from my travel document with the Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation, travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Belgium Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years period.

faqs.question: What is the role of VFS?
faqs.answer:
VFS Global Services Pvt Ltd (VFS) is the Service Delivery Provider for the Embassy of Belgium
                                in New Delhi. The role of VFS is to accept visa applications and to dispatch passports and
                                documents back to clients, on behalf of the Embassy of Belgium. VFS does not play any part
                                in or influence the outcome of your visa application.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: What are the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question: Can you process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa, you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident. For financial safety
                                and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel insurance
                                and avail our special offer.

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a Visa to travel to Maldives?
faqs.answer: In order to enter Maldives the Indian nationals visiting Maldives as a tourist do not require any pre-arrival visa. A free Maldives Tourist Visa which is valid for approximately ninety days is issued to Indian nationals on arriving at the Male airport.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for Maldives visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Travellers must meet the following criteria: Should possess a valid passport and; Have a valid ticket to continue the journey out of Maldives Have enough funds to cover the expenses for duration of the stay in Maldives. (US$100 + $50 dollars per day) or Confirmation of reservation in a Tourist Resort or a Hotel. Invitation letter and any additional original documents to supplement your purpose of visit (for business travelers)

faqs.question: How long is the Maldives visa valid for?
faqs.answer: A Tourist Visa allows you to stay in the Maldives for 30 days, but may be extended for another 60-day period. Full 30 – day visa is not a right of the passenger to claim, but lies at the discretion of the Immigration to issue not more than thirty days and any period less than thirty days.

faqs.question: How much is the Maldives visa fees?
faqs.answer: A Maldives Tourist Visa on arrival is free of cost.

faqs.question: Is there any fear of Maldives visa rejection on arrival?
faqs.answer: Indians are not liable to face a rejection. However, the above said documents are necessary to enter the country. Failure to produce any of the documents may result into rejection of your visa, thereby barring you from entering the country. The final decision to grant an entry permit is solely at the discretion of the Immigration officials at Maldives airport.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get the visa?
faqs.answer: Usually, it takes around 20 minutes to get all formalities done and get the visa on arrival. However, the time may vary depending on the peak travel period.

faqs.question: What is the process of getting a Maldives visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: After landing at Maldives airport, kindly head to the Immigration counter. The immigration authorities will most likely ask basic questions such as the reason for travel and duration of stay. Overall, it takes about 15-20 minutes to issue an entry permit. The whole method is hassle-free and easy.

faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the event of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Madagascar ?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indians need a visa to travel to Madagascar. You are required to obtain a visa from the MadagascarEmbassy/Consulate in your country prior to traveling to Madagascar. You will not be allowed entry at theborder if you do not have this visa stamped in your passport. A Madagascar visa for Indians can beprivate, tourist, business and work – depending on the purpose of a visit.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of a Madagascar Visa?
faqs.answer: A Madagascar visa allows Indian passport holders to visit the country for a specific purpose. You cannot violate the terms laid out in the visa.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Madagascar visa online?

faqs.question: Which are the different types of Madagascar Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer:
Based on the purpose of your travel to Madagascar, you can choose from a 30-day Tourist Visa or a 30-day Business Visa. If you are visiting Madagascar just to see the popular attractions or have some close friends or family that you want to meet, then applying for a Tourist Visa would be the right choice.
                                If there is a company in Madagascar with which you want to enter into a business agreement or want to participate in an industrial fair or exhibition as a representative of a company outside Madagascar, then you need to apply for a business visa.

faqs.question: What is the entry type provided for Madagascar Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: You are granted single entry in most cases for Madagascar Visas.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for Madagascar visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: why are you visiting Madagascar how long you intend to stay in Madagascar how will you support yourself during your time in Madagascar what is the purpose of your visit to Madagascar type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid where do you intend to travel following your visit to Madagascar if you have a permit to enter the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Madagascar

faqs.question: What is the Madagascar visa processing time?
faqs.answer: Typically, it takes 3-4 working days to process a Madagascar visa application.

faqs.question: Is it possible to obtain Madagascar visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: For short visits (90 days or less), every visitor, regardless of nationality, can obtain a visa upon arrival at the airport in Antananarivo, provided the visitor's passport is valid for at least 6 months beyond the last day of the intended stay in Madagascar, return flight tickets and sufficient funds for the entire trip. Since obtaining a visa o arrival is not guaranteed, we recommend all travellers to obtain a visa prior to their journey

faqs.question: Is the Madagascar visa fee inclusive of all charges?
faqs.answer: No, it is exclusive of taxes and is subject to change depending on the Embassy’s directive.

faqs.question: Is the Madagascar visa valid for the whole of Madagascar?
faqs.answer: Yes, the visa is valid for travel throughout Madagascar, subject to Embassy directives.

faqs.question: What will I face if I overstay my visa?
faqs.answer: If you overstay your Madagascar visa for more than 30 days, a 5-year ban will be imposed on you.

faqs.question: When is the earliest I can apply for Madagascar visa online?
faqs.answer: You should apply a month before the proposed date of travel. It takes 2 to 3 business days to process the application.

faqs.question: What are my options in case of rejection of my Madagascar visa?
faqs.answer: A Madagascar visa rejection or approval is at the sole discretion of the Embassy of Madagascar, New Delhi. You have to accept their decision, and no appeal will be entertained or refund given.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Botswana?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indian citizens are required to obtain a visa prior to entering Botswana.Botswana visa may be obtained from the Embassy of Botswana in New Delhi or Botswana Consulate in Mumbai. Based on the purpose of your visit Botswana you may apply for a Business Visa, Tourist Visa, Visit Visa, Official Visa, Diplomatic Visa, Student/Research Visa, Transit Visa, Crew Visa & many more. Before applying for a visa please check which visa type you are eligible to apply for.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Botswana visa online?It is a straightforward and effortless process to apply for a botswana visa online through Akbar Travels.Choose your preferred type of botswana visa based on your travel typePay onlineSubmit documents through our pick up & drop serviceReceive your visa once approved
faqs.answer: It is a straightforward and effortless process to apply for a botswana visa online through Akbar Travels. Choose your preferred type of botswana visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Botswana visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Botswana visa is one months before the date of travel to the country. In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted ten days, prior to travelling.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Botswana visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: This visa is valid for up to 90 days. The validity and stay period is decided by the Embassy on the basis of the purpose of your visit and visa type. It can be issued for one, two or multiple entries.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Botswana once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit my passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Botswana visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Please allow 14 working days for visa processing which should exclude the submission day, weekends and bank holidays.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Botswana visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting botswana How long you intend to stay in botswana How will you support yourself during your time in botswana What is the purpose of your visit to botswana Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to botswana If you have a permit to botswana the country you intend to travel to after your stay in botswana

faqs.question: How do I receive my Botswana visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: What if my Botswana visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Botswana visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued. You are free to reapply for the visa.

faqs.question: Are there any chances of my Botswana visa application getting rejected?
faqs.answer: Yes. Like other country visas, your visa application for Botswana can be rejected for a number of reasons. The most common Botswana visa rejection reasons are: Invalid and damaged Passport Incomplete Visa Application form Applied Wrong visa category Current Botswana visa still valid Incomplete documents submitted Intention of returning to home country not clear Purpose of travel not clear Insufficient bank balance Criminal history

faqs.question: Which are the necessary documents required to be presented on arrival in Botswana?
faqs.answer: Passport valid for at least 6 months from your date of entry. Valid Botswana visa Boarding Pass Return ticket to your country or next destination Accommodation proof or invitation letter for family visits Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Botswana (cash, debit/credit card etc) Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to business trip (invitation letter, business card etc) Note: It should be noted that the possession of Visa is not a final authority to enter the Republic of Botswana. The Immigration Officer at the Entry point may refuse a holder of visa to enter, if he is satisfied that the holder is unable to fulfil Immigration entry requirements or if the presence of such person or visitors in the Republic of Botswana would be contrary to the National Interests.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Botswana tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country on a Botswana tourist visa.

faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the occurrence of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: Is Croatia in the Schengen Zone?
faqs.answer: Despite being part of the EU, Croatia IS NOT part of the Schengen Zone.

faqs.question: I have a valid Schengen Visa. Can I travel to Croatia without applying for a Croatia Visa?
faqs.answer:
Indian nationals who are holders of valid Schengen visa for two or multiple entries, as well
                                as national visas and residence permits of Bulgaria, Cyprus, and Romania do not require an
                                additional (Croatian) visa for Croatia with a stay period not exceeding 90 days in any 180-day
                                period.

faqs.question: My Schengen Visa is only valid for one entry. Can I enter Croatia if I haven’t used my Schengen visa prior to coming to Croatia?
faqs.answer: No, only two or multiple entry Schengen visa is valid for entering the Republic of Croatia.

faqs.question: What is the validity of the Croatia Visa?
faqs.answer:
You can stay in the territory of the Republic of Croatia for a maximum of 90 days in any period
                                180 day-period. It is issued for one, two, or multiple entries for the purpose of transit,
                                tourism, business, private or other purposes. Its validity period depends on the circumstances
                                of the visitor’s travel to Croatia and may not exceed five years.

faqs.question: What is the Croatia Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Croatia Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to Croatia.
                                In your cover letter you should explain: the purpose of your trip when and where you intend to travel how your trip is going to be funded day-by-day itinerary for your trip duration of the trip

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Croatia Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Croatia visa application 3 months before your date of departure. Standard
                                visa processing time is 15 calendar days from the day of receipt of the application at the
                                Embassy. In case the documents are not submitted as per requirements or due to other factors
                                or justified reasons, the processing time may be extended to 30 or 60 days.

faqs.question: Is Personal Interview required for Croatia Visa application
faqs.answer:
Personal interview is not mandatory for applying Croatia Visa. The Embassy may call the applicant
                                for a personal interview if there are doubts regarding the application. The Embassy also
                                has a right to request additional documents.

faqs.question:
If I have a valid multiple entry Schengen visa and I am planning to go to Croatia, but my child who is included in my passport
                            does not have any visa, do I have to apply for a visa for my child?ry?
faqs.answer:
Yes, in case your child is included in your passport but does not have a visa, you, as a parent
                                or legal guardian will have to apply and prepare a complete set of documents according to
                                the purpose of visit.

faqs.question: What is the role of VFS?
faqs.answer:
VFS Global Services Pvt Ltd (VFS) is the Service Delivery Provider for the Embassy of Croatia
                                in New Delhi. The role of VFS is to accept visa applications and to dispatch passports and
                                documents back to clients, on behalf of the Embassy of Croatia. VFS does not play any part
                                in or influence the outcome of your visa application.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my Croatia Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Croatia visa application online using the Croatia VFS Reference
                                number and last name. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of the VFS Croatia
                                website.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of applying for Croatia visa through Akbar Travels?
faqs.answer:
By contacting Akbar Travels for your visa application, you can eliminate the need for personally
                                visiting the Embassy for your application. All you will have to do is apply online on our
                                website and get your visa processed within the set timeframe. Minimal documentation and quick
                                processing is another of the key highlights. In most case, the visa processing takes about
                                10-15 working days.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Croatia Consulate/Embassy to get my Visa?
faqs.answer:
No. You do not need to visit the Consulate/Embassy. We will take care of the complete visa process
                                right from verifying your documents to stamping of your visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. The Travel health insurance should cover the possible expenses related to repatriation,
                                for health reasons, urgent medical assistance and/or urgent hospitalization, with the minimum
                                coverage of EUR 30 000. The insurance must remain valid during the entire stay of the visitor
                                in Croatia. The applicant for a multiple-entry visa must have travel health-insurance policy
                                that covers the period of the first visit to Croatia.

faqs.question: Can you process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Croatia Visa, you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical treatment
                                can be very expensive in Croatia. Your travel insurance offers protection against unexpected
                                emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight delay and
                                cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial safety and

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a Visa to travel to Grenada?

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for Grenada visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Travellers must meet the following criteria: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry and with two blank pages within Return ticket to your country Confirmation of accommodation for duration of your visit Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Grenada Detailed itinerary of your trip Invitation letter and any additional original documents to supplement your purpose of visit (for business travelers)

faqs.question: How long is the Grenada visa valid for?
faqs.answer: Maximum stay for visitors is up to 3 months only.

faqs.question: How much is the Grenada visa fees?

faqs.question: What is the Bahrain visa photo size requirement?
faqs.answer: The Bahrain visa photo must meet the requirements described below. If not, the application will be delayed until you provide correct photos: Photo must be 45 mm X 35 mm in size The face should cover 70-80% of the photo In colour white and black photo won’t be accepted Taken against a plain white background Taken within the last 3 months Your head should face the camera directly. It should not be tilted or turned, even slightly The head must be centred in the image. You must look directly at the camera and show your full face Do not wear sunglasses or tinted/coloured glasses. If you normally wear glasses, your eyes must be clearly visible in the photo

faqs.question: Can my Bahrain Visa get rejected?
faqs.answer: Yes. Like other country visas, your visa application for Bahrain can be rejected for a number of reasons.
