faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Aruba?
faqs.answer:
Yes, all Indian passport holders require a short stay visa (for a stay of 90 days or less) to visit Aruba. The Dutch Embassy in New Delhi and the Consulate-General in Mumbai use the services of Visa Facilitation Centre VFS Global to handle short stay visa requests.
                                The type of visa to enter Aruba will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: Is Aruba part of the Caribbean?
faqs.answer: Yes. Aruba visa is also called Caribbean visa. The Caribbean visa is valid for all four parts: Aruba, Curaçao, St Maarten and the Caribbean Netherlands. However travelling from one part to the other still requires passing through normal immigration procedures for each separate part.If you live in India and want to apply for a visa to visit Aruba, Curaçao or the other Caribbean parts of the Kingdom for up to 90 days, you must apply for a Caribbean visa at the Netherlands Embassy or Consulate in India.

faqs.question: Are there any visa exemptions for Indian Nationals?
faqs.answer:
Indian Nationals holding following visas do not need an Aruba/Caribbean visa: Holders of a valid residence permit for the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom or one of the Schengen countries. Indian passport holders who have a valid US or Canadian visa Holders of a valid multiple entry Schengen visa Holders of a valid residence permit for the French part of Sint Maarten Holders of a valid residence permit (for a stay for longer than 6 months) for Aruba, Curaçao, St Maarten or the Caribbean Netherlands. Captains, passengers or crew of ships or aircraft landing in Aruba, Curaçao, St Maarten or the Caribbean Netherlands for a period of not more than 48 hours who do not constitute a threat to public order or security in the Caribbean Netherlands.
                                        Passengers on cruise ships staying not more than 48 hours on the island/country. Holders of a Laissez Passer issued by the United Nations and its affiliated organizations.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for an Aruba visa online?
faqs.answer: Applicants are encouraged to apply three (3) weeks to (1) one month in advance of travel.The earliest you can apply is 3 months before you intend to travel. In most cases, you’ll be informed within 15 calendar days whether your application has been successful.

faqs.question: What is the validity of an Aruba visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The maximum period of time that a person can be admitted to Aruba as a tourist is 30 days. The total amount of days a person can stay in Aruba, as a tourist cannot exceed 180 days per year. The entry type will be at issued at the discretion of the Embassy.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Aruba once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Aruba visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The purpose of Aruba visa can be utilized forvacation and relaxation, sport, health reasons, family matters, study, religious purposes or a business visit. During their stay in Aruba tourists are not allowed to work.

faqs.question: What are the Aruba transit visa requirements?
faqs.answer:
There are no transit visas or airport transit visas for Aruba, Curaçao, St Maarten or the Caribbean Netherlands.
                                Nationals who require a Caribbean visa who are in transit via one of the international airports of Curaçao, St. Maarten or the Caribbean Netherlands wanting to leave the transit area for more than 48 hours must apply for a visitor’s visa. If they do not leave the transit area, or if they leave it for less than 48 hours, they do not require a visa.
                                Please bear in mind that for ARUBA the applicant can only stay for a maximum of 24 hours after which period a visitor’s visa is required.

faqs.question: Do I need to apply for an Aruba visa in person?
faqs.answer: The visa must be applied for in person at an embassy or consulate of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in India.Applications by mail will not be accepted nor are travel agents authorized to submit applications on behalf of the applicant.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit my passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get an Aruba visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa application is normally processed within 15 working days.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for anAruba visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: Why are you visiting Aruba How long you intend to stay in Aruba How will you support yourself during your time in Aruba What is the purpose of your visit to Aruba Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Aruba If you have a permit to Aruba the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Aruba

faqs.question: What are the entry requirements after arriving in Aruba?
faqs.answer: Upon arrival in Aruba a tourist must have: A passport that is valid upon entry and for the duration of stay in Aruba. If the tourist holds a passport from a visa required country then he/she must have a valid visa sticker in his/her passport (see list in visa section to determine if a visa is necessary) A completely filled-in and signed Embarkation and Disembarkation card (ED-card). A valid return- or onward ticket. The necessary documents for returning to the country of origin or to a country that he/she has the right to enter, for example a valid residence permit (temporary or permanent), a re-entry permit or a (entry) visa. If so requested, the tourist has to be able to prove to the satisfaction of the migration officer that he/she has a valid reservation for an accommodation in Aruba (e.g. hotel or apartment) or that he/she owns property in Aruba (a residence, condominium, apartment, timeshare apartment or a pleasure yacht moored in Aruba with a length of at least 14 meters (46 feet) measured at the nominal water line). If so requested, the tourist has to be able to prove to the satisfaction of the migration officer to dispose of adequate financial means to provide for hotel expenses (if applicable) and living expenses during his/her stay or that he/she has a declaration of guarantee from a legal resident of Aruba. Required vaccinations and certificate of proof for required countries.

faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to anAruba visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country on an Aruba tourist visa.

faqs.answer: You must submit avalid travel insurance from your insurance company. The document must prove that the insurance is in your name. faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country on a Macedoniatourist visa.

faqs.question:
What is
                            a Netherlands Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Netherlands Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among
                                all the
                                Schengen countries including Netherlands for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is
                                a
                                traveller’s dream where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen
                                countries
                                along with Netherlands.

faqs.question:
The
                            Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all
                                26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Netherlands), unless it is
                                marked
                                otherwise on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the
                                European
                                territory of Netherlands. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence
                                for
                                the reasons of your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the
                                following
                                countries: Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France,
                                Germany,
                                Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta,
                                Netherlands,
                                Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question:
How long
                            can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your
                                passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This
                                means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The
                                precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the
                                heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only
                                once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A
                                two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the
                                Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number
                                of
                                entries".

faqs.question:
Will all
                            Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the
                                Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your
                                flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question:
Can I
                            apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer:
You are free to apply again for a Schengen Visa if your application has been refused
                                earlier.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a
                                country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: - the purpose of your trip - when and where you intend to travel - how your trip is going to be funded - day-by-day itinerary for your trip - duration of the trip

faqs.question:
As a
                            Netherlands short-stay visa holder can I extend my Schengen Visa while in Netherlands?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your Netherlands short-stay while in Netherlands except in special
                                circumstances,
                                and exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or
                                criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and
                                apply
                                for another Netherlands Visa if necessary.

faqs.question:
If my
                            Netherlands short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how
                            long can I remain in the Netherlands territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Netherlands territory for a
                                maximum
                                period of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question:
How long
                            before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of
                                departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as
                                certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the
                                processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 5-15 working days from your
                                appointment
                                date.

faqs.question:
How long
                            does it take to obtain a Netherlands Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Netherlands Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 10 to 15 days to
                                process in
                                the Netherlands Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Netherlands Visa is
                                dependent
                                on several factors and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion.

faqs.question:
How can
                            I check the status of my Netherlands Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Netherlands visa application online using the
                                Netherlands
                                VFS Reference number and applicant name. Kindly visit the Track Your Application
                                section
                                of the VFS Netherlands website.

faqs.question:
Is it
                            mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Netherlands Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Netherlands Visa in order to provide your
                                biometrics and
                                submit your visa documents.

faqs.question:
My
                            family is also applying for the Netherlands Visa, how many appointments should we
                            make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question:
I am
                            traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will
                                be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then
                                you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first
                                port
                                of entry.

faqs.question:
Can I
                            leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01".
                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during
                                the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only
                                once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a
                                multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity
                                period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I
                            have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At
                                the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional
                                documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and
                                the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the
                                documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation,
                                travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question:
Do I
                            have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be
                                presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question:
Why is
                            personal appearance mandatory for Netherlands Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System
                                (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide
                                biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at
                                the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications
                                within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the
                                VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will
                                again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the
                                applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it
                                cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years
                                period.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the role of VFS?
faqs.answer:
VFS Global Services Pvt Ltd (VFS) is the Service Delivery Provider for the Embassy of
                                Netherlands
                                in New Delhi. The role of VFS is to accept visa applications and to dispatch passports and
                                documents back
                                to clients, on behalf of the Embassy of Netherlands. VFS does not play any part in or
                                influence
                                the outcome of your visa application.

faqs.question:
Do I
                            need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel
                                insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical
                                reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their
                                stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid
                                throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended
                                stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question:
What are
                            the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer:
Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following
                                requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question:
Can you
                            process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa,
                                you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical
                                treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection
                                against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses,
                                flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For
                                financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase
                                travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

What is
                            the easiest way to apply for a Netherlands Visa?
faqs.answer:
The easiest way to apply for a Netherlands Visa is to contact us. We are experts in the
                                travel
                                and tourism sector with over 40 years of experience. Through our expertise, in-depth
                                knowledge
                                and integrity, we commit to delivering an exceptional experience to our customers each
                                and
                                every time you use our service. In order to help us understand your unique visa needs,
                                please
                                drop in your query and our Expert will get in touch with you.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Chad?
faqs.answer: Yes.Indian citizens are required to obtain a visa prior to entering the Republic of Chad.Visas may be obtained from the Republic of Slovenia or at the VFS Visa Application Centre in India. Based on the purpose of your visit to Chad you may apply for a Business Visa, Tourist Visa, Visit Visa, Official Visa, Diplomatic Visa, Student/Research Visa, Transit Visa, Crew Visa& many more. Before applying for a visa please check which visa type you are eligible to apply for.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Chad Visas?
faqs.answer:
Tourist Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to enter Chad for visits, residence or business.

                                Transit Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to transit through Chad within a period of three to four days.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Chad visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Chad visa is two months before the date of travel to the country.In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted ten days, prior to travelling.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Chad visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: This visa is valid for 30 days. Visas can be extended on request. However the final decision lies with the Immigration officials at Chad.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Chad visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa application is normally processed within 10 working days.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Chad visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: Why are you visiting Chad? how long you intend to stay in Chad how will you support yourself during your time in Chad What is the purpose of your visit to Chad Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Chad if you have a permit to enter the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Chad

faqs.question: How do I receive my Chad visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will bestamped on your passport.

faqs.question: Is it possible to obtain a visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: No. Indians travelling to Chad must obtain a visa before their arrival in the country. Visa on arrival service is not available for Indian nationals.

faqs.question: Do I need any specific vaccinations?
faqs.answer: Yes. As per the Chad Visa requirements, a yellow fever vaccination is mandatory. The certificate of the same is required to be attached along with other documents when applying for the visa.

faqs.question: How long is my vaccination certificate valid for?
faqs.answer: A certificate for yellow fever vaccination has a validity lasting up to 10 years. It must be counted 10 days post the date of vaccination.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Consulate/Embassy to submit my documents?
faqs.answer: No. You are not required to visit the Chad or Slovenia Consulate/Embassy personally. We will submit the visa application on your behalf.

faqs.question: What if my Chad visa gets rejected??
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Chadvisa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Chadtourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country ona Chad tourist visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the event of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Chile?
faqs.answer: Indian nationals holding valid US visas (B1/B2 Visa) or Residence Permit (Green Card) from US with current validity of six months that are valid for at least six months do not require a Chilean tourist visa (either Simple Tourism or Multiple Tourism or Multiple-Business). This came into effect from the 1st April 2019. Travelers will be permitted to stay for up to 90 days and may extend their visa-free stay one time for an additional 90 days.

faqs.question: What if I do not have a US Visa?
faqs.answer: In case you do not have a US visa, you will need to apply for a visa before you travel to Chile. All visa applications must be submitted to the Chile Embassy in India.

faqs.question: Can Indians travel visa-free to Chile?
faqs.answer: Indian nationals with US visas that are valid for at least six months may now enter Chile for business or tourism without obtaining a separate Chile visa. Travelers will be permitted to stay for up to 90 days and may extend their visa-free stay one time for an additional 90 days.

faqs.question: What are the different kinds of Chile visas for Indians?
faqs.answer: Indians travelling to Chile can choose from 90-day tourist visa or 90-day business visa depending on their reason for travel. Chile visas are issued for recreation, sport, health, study, business, family, religious or other similar purposes, with no intention of immigration, permanent residency or performing remunerated activities.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Chile?
faqs.answer: A Chile Visa for Indians allows a maximum stay of 90 days. Although the validity is 90 days, one cannot overstay the specified period.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for Chile visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: -why are you visiting Chile -how long you intend to stay in Chile -how will you support yourself during your time in Chile -what is the purpose of your visit to Chile -type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid -where do you intend to travel following your visit to Chile -if you have a permit to enter the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Chile

faqs.question: What is the Chile visa processing time?
faqs.answer: Processing an application for a Chile visa normally takes 6-10 working days.

faqs.question: Do I need to submit my passport when applying for a Chile visa online?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Chile visa for Indians is a stamp or sticker that is placed on an empty page of a passport. Therefore, the original passport with two consecutive blank pages is required to be submitted in person.

faqs.question: From when is my visa valid?
faqs.answer: Your visa is valid from the date your visa was issued. It should not be calculated from the date of entry into Chile.

faqs.question: Is my visa valid for the whole of Chile?
faqs.answer: Yes, the visa is valid for travel through the whole of Chile, subject to Embassy directives.

faqs.question: Do I need travel or medical insurance plan?
faqs.answer: Travel insurance is not one of the necessary Chile visa requirements. However, it is always advised to be insured in case of medical or travel emergencies. Akbar Travels can assist you with the ideal insurance policy to protect yourself against medical emergencies during travel as well as damage or loss of baggage.

faqs.question: What if my Chile visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: Chile visa rejection is wholly a decision by the Embassy of Chile situated in New Delhi. Make sure you submit all the correct documents as specified to avoid a visa rejection.

faqs.question: Can I get a refund in case of Chile visa rejection?
faqs.answer: In the case of visa rejection, no refund will be granted. A new visa can be applied for.

faqs.question: What else do I need to know about the Chile tourist visa from India?
faqs.answer: A Chile tourist visa is a legal document allowing entry into the country. Hence, in the case of a stamped visa, it is necessary to keep the passport in safe custody.

faqs.question: What is the easiest way to apply for a Chile visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The easiest way to apply for a Chile visa is to apply through an experienced travel agency like Akbar Travels having 40 years of experience in the tourism sector. If you wish to get more Chile visa information, simply fill in the query form, and a Visa Expert will contact you right away.

faqs.question: Do I need visa for Kyrgyzstan from India?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Kyrgyzstan. AnKyrgyzstan visa is most appropriate for Indians travelling to the Kyrgyzstan for business and recreational purposes such as holidaying, sightseeing, or even short family visits. The type of visa to enter Kyrgyzstan will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration. Once your visa application is approved, you will receive the visa copy via email right in your inbox.

faqs.question: Can I apply for Kyrgyzstan Visa online?
faqs.answer: Yes. Kyrgyzstan visa for Indians can be acquired in a breeze with the convenience of online Kyrgyzstan Visa application processes. The Kyrgyzstan Embassy has launched a new online visa system, wherein you can submit an application and receive your Kyrgyzstan visa entirely online – without having to submit your passport for stamping.

faqs.question: Is Kyrgyzstan visa an eVisa?
faqs.answer: Yes. An eVisa is an authorization to enter Kyrgyzstan issued via email. An eVisa grants the same right to enter Kyrgyzstan territory, as ordinary sticker-visa in the passport.

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a stamped visa or an e-Visa?
faqs.answer: Indians travelling to Kyrgyzstan are required to obtain an e-Visa only.

faqs.question: What is the validity of an Kyrgyzstan eVisa for Indians?
faqs.answer: eVisas are issued to an applicant, intending to visit Kyrgyz Republic, for a period up to 90 days. The entry type can be single or double depending upon purpose of trip

faqs.question: What kind of Documentation I need to apply for e-Visa?
faqs.answer: You will need valid Passport, digital Photo and optional documents relating to profession. All documents should be scanned images to attach them to your electronic application according to the visa type.

faqs.question: What are the requirements to my travel document/passport?
faqs.answer: Your passport must meet the following criteria: Its validity shall extend at least for 6 months after the validity period of requested Kyrgystan visa Document should include atleast two pages Should not be damaged and should not include unofficial remarks.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Kyrgyzstan?
faqs.answer: Tourist visa: Issued to an applicant, intending to visit Kyrgyzstan with the purpose of tourism, for a period up to 90 days. Business visa: Issued for applicants, entering Kyrgyzstan with business purposes, to participate in negotiations, conferences and meetings, sport events, organized by state offices and local governments, international organizations and legal entities up to 90 days. Transit visa: Issued to applicants travelling to a third country via Kyrgyzstan, for a period of up to 5 days. Student visa: Issued to an applicant, entering Kyrgyz Republic to study up to 90 days. Student visas can be extended for a period up to 1 year if studying at a higher educational institution or for the duration of a studying course in the initially declared educational institution of Kyrgyz ReEmployment visa: Issued to applicants, for whom, in accordance with the Law of the Kyrgyz Republic “On External Labor Migration” there is a different procedure of performing labor activity, without getting work permit, up to 90 days. public, registered on the territory of Kyrgyz Republic. Diplomatic visa: Issued to a foreign citizen, holder of the diplomatic passport, intending to visit Kyrgyz Republic with official affairs.

faqs.question: What is the Kyrgyzstan visa processing time?
faqs.answer: The processing time for a Kyrgyzstan visa application is up to 2 to 3 working days from the date of submission.

faqs.question: How will I receive the eVisa?
faqs.answer: In the legally designated time, the applicant will be notified via e-mail about the outcome of the review application. In case of approval, the applicant will receive eVisa in PDF format.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Mozambique?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indians passport holders require a visa to travel to El Salvador. Visas for El Salvador can be applied at the Embassy or obtained on arrival.

faqs.question: What is the validity of Mozambique touristvisa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Tourist/Visitor visas are valid for 30 days and it is no longer possible to get extensions once in the country. Travellers should keep up to date with the latest advances as the visa ruleskeep changing at the Embassy’s discretion.

faqs.question: What is the basic requirement for Mozambique visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: A valid passport for at least six (6) months beyond the intended period of stay, a ticket for return or onward travel to another country and sufficient funds are required.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for Mozambique visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: All Categories need: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry Return ticket to your country Confirmation of accommodation for duration of your visit Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Mozambique Detailed itinerary of your trip

faqs.question: What is the Mozambique Visa fee on arrival?

faqs.question: Can I obtain the Mozambique visa in advance? If yes, what is the process?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is a straight forward and effortless process to apply for Mozambique visa online before travel through Akbar Travels: Choose your preferred type of Mozambique visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved!

faqs.question: When can the earliest possible application be made for a Mozambique Visa online?
faqs.answer: You can apply a month before the planned date of travel for your Mozambique visa. The application would be processed in 10 to 15 working days.

faqs.question: On what circumstances can I be denied a Visa on Arrival?
faqs.answer: The Mozambique visa for Indians can be denied on arrival if the applicant doesn't have necessary documents pertaining to the trip.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the event of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: What is the easiest way to get a Mozambique Visa?
faqs.answer: Contact our Visa Experts and apply for your Mozambique visa instantly with minimum documents and lowest visa fee. No need to visit our office and no need to deal with the Embassy. We do it all for you.

faqs.question: Are you still having doubts about the Mozambique visa process?
faqs.answer: Please feel free to contact us for all your Mozambique visa worries. We have you covered across India with presence in all the major cities like Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, Bangalore, Chennai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and many more. Important Notice: The information provided here are subject to change without prior notice. For confirmation on visa requirements and fees, you may consult with theMozambique Embassy or Consulate for near you.

faqs.question: What is a Sri Lanka ETA for Indian Citizens?
faqs.answer:
Sri Lanka government introduced a new Electronic Visa called ETA (Electronic Travel Authorization,
                                Srilanka eVisa) for a short visit to Sri Lanka on 1st January 2012. Travellers intending to visit Sri
                                Lanka for a short stay must have a valid visa issued by Department of Immigration & Emigration, Colombo,
                                Sri Lanka. The Sri Lanka e visa is a complete online process and the approval for the same will be
                                communicated via email. The ETA (Electronic Travel Authority) replaces the need to apply for a Sri Lanka
                                visa in person through the Sri Lankan Embassy/Consulate.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Sri Lanka Visas for Indians?
faqs.answer:
There are four types of short term Sri Lanka Visas (ETA Approvals) like Tourist, Visit, Business and
                                Transit depending upon your purpose of travel. Sri Lanka Tourist Visa - Issued for the purpose of tourism, sightseeing and lesiure. Srilanka Visit Visa - Issued for visiting family, friends or relatives in Sri Lanka. Sri Lanka Business Visa - Issued for the purpose of undertaking business activities in Sri Lanka
                                    such as attending meetings, conferences, seminar or training. Sri Lanka Transit Visa - Issued if you are transiting to a third country via Sri Lanka.

faqs.question: Do I need to submit my original documents for Sri Lanka Visa processing?
faqs.answer:
The Sri Lanka e visa is issued online; it is not required to submit the original passport or other
                                original documents for processing. Simply share all your Sri Lanka Visa documents online through our
                                secured online document locker and we will process the e visa Srilanka online and email the approval
                                notification to you. You just need to take a print out of the Sri Lanka e visa and travel.

faqs.question: Can I obtain a Srilanka Visa for Indians upon arrival?
faqs.answer:
It is possible to obtain Srilanka Visa for Indians upon arrival at the port of entry. However,
                                Travelers are strongly encouraged to get the Sri Lanka Visa in advance to avoid lengthy delays at the
                                airport or other Sri Lanka port of entry. Many a times, travelers have complained about long waiting
                                queues to get the Sri Lanka Visa at the airport and also the cost is comparatively higher than applying
                                for a Sri Lanka Visa prior to travel. In addition, please note the airport transaction is conducted in
                                local currency versus USD. We highly recommend travelers to save time and money by applying for your
                                Srilanka Visa for Indians through us.

faqs.question: What are the disadvantages of Sri Lanka Visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Time consuming & tiring, long waiting queues. (can go up to 2 to 3 hours) The visa on arrival has a higher Srilanka Visa cost than Sri Lanka e visa application. Obtaining Sri Lanka Visit Visa for Indians online is easier and hassle-free process.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for the Sri Lanka Visa?
faqs.answer:
One of the Sri Lanka Visa requirements is that you can only apply up to 60 days (2 months) prior to
                                your departure date. We recommend applying for your Sri Lanka visa one month prior to your intended date
                                of travel.

faqs.question: What type of Srilanka e visa do I need for the trip?
faqs.answer:
If you wish to visit Sri Lanka for a short stay, you must obtain an e visa Srilanka prior to arrival.
                                Sri Lanka visa is issued for the purpose of tourism, visit, business or transit purposes. Srilanka Visit Visa/Tourist Visa: sightseeing / holiday visiting friends and relatives medical treatment including Ayurvedic (herbal) and yoga participate in sporting events, competitions and activities relating to cultural performance Srilanka Business Visa: participate in business meetings and negotiations conferences, workshops and seminars short training courses participate in art, music and dance Sri Lanka Transit Visa: transiting through Sri Lanka on the way to another destination.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit your office for my Sri Lanka visa application?
faqs.answer:
No, you don’t need to visit our office personally. We have simplified the Sri Lanka visa process for
                                Indians. Applying for a Sri Lanka Visa through us will be an easy and hassle free process as we will
                                take care of your complete visa process right from completing your Sri Lanka visa application online,
                                getting your documents ready to issuing of your Sri Lanka e visa online.

faqs.question: How long will it take to grant a Sri Lanka Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer:
In most of the cases, your Sri Lanka Visa will be processed within 48 hours. During peak travel, the
                                Srilanka visa for Indians may take longer time to process. Apply for Sri Lanka ETA at least 30 days
                                prior to your trip.

faqs.question: Is my personal information & online payment safe for online application?
faqs.answer:
The Sri Lanka visa is hosted on secure servers and is protected with security socket layers, thus your
                                data is safe and secure.

faqs.question: Do I need any stamp on my passport for the Sri Lanka e visa?
faqs.answer:
The Sri Lanka eVisa is electronically linked with the passport number, so you don’t need any stamp on
                                your passport.

faqs.question:
I need to attend a business convention in Sri Lanka and attend a few meetings, am I covered by my Sri
                            Lanka visa for this?
faqs.answer:
As long as you do not intend to stay in the country longer than 30 days, you can take part in
                                conventions and conferences as well as meetings whilst in Sri Lanka.

faqs.question: What do I need to do after I apply for the Srilanka Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer:
Once the Sri Lanka e visa is approved, we recommend that you keep a copy of the e visa Srilanka
                                approval notification to carry with your passport. Upon arrival in Sri Lanka, ETA holders should produce
                                the following requirements at the port of entry: Sri Lanka Visit Visa for Indians; A passport valid for at least 6 months beyond stay; A confirmed onward or round trip ticket; Sufficient funds to meet the expenses during stay in Sri Lanka.

faqs.question: What is the validity of the Srilanka Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer:
The Sri Lanka e visa is valid for 3 months with a double/multiple entry and you can stay for a maximum
                                period of up to 30 days on each visit. While the Sri Lanka tourist visa is issued with double entries,
                                the Sri Lanka business visa is issued with multiple entries.

faqs.question: Can I extend my Srilanka Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer:
The e visa for Sri Lanka from India will allow a stay of 30 days from the date of entry to Sri Lanka,
                                but it may be extended for up to 90 days by submitting e visa Srilanka application at the Head office of
                                the Department of Immigration and Emigration (DI&E) in Sri Lanka.

faqs.question: Do I need to take a travel insurance for my Sri Lanka trip?
faqs.answer:
You are strongly advised to purchase a travel insurance to cover yourself in Sri Lanka as medical
                                treatment can be very expensive in Sri Lanka.
                                Along with your Sri Lanka Visa, we can certainly assist you with the travel insurance as it’s an
                                absolute necessity for International travel in the event of unexpected events such as medical
                                emergencies, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question:
I have been issued a new passport because my other passport was lost / stolen.
                            I have not entered Sri Lanka yet, what happens to my Srilanka e visa?
                            Do I need to re-apply?
faqs.answer:
Since your Sri Lanka eVisa is attached to your old passport number, you will need to re-apply for a new
                                Sri Lanka eVisa that will get linked to your new passport number.
                                Srilanka e visas are not transferable between passports.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a multiple, double and single entry?
faqs.answer:
A multiple entry Sri Lanka Visa for Indians permits you to go to the country multiple times within the
                                term of validity of the Visa.
                                With a double-entry Sri Lanka Visa, you can travel to the country two times and with a single entry
                                Visa, only one time.

faqs.question: Do I need a printed copy of the Sri Lanka ETA?
faqs.answer:
Yes. We will share your Sri Lanka visa on email.
                                The Sri Lanka e visa will contain your personal details, travel details, ETA number and Visa validity.
                                We suggest travelers print the eVisa confirmation and keep a copy with their passport.

faqs.question: How to apply for a Sri Lanka Visa online?
faqs.answer:
Sri Lanka visa for Indians can be acquired in a breeze with the convenience of our online Sri Lanka
                                Visa application processes.
                                We are experts in the travel and tourism sector with over 40 years of experience.
                                Through our expertise, in-depth knowledge and integrity, we commit to delivering an exceptional
                                experience to our customers each and every time you use our service.
                                In order to help us understand your unique visa needs, please drop in your query and our Expert will get
                                in touch with you. How to apply for Sri Lanka Visa for Indians online: Choose your preferred type of Sri Lanka Visa based on your Travel type; Make payment online; Submit documents online on our portal; Receive your Sri Lanka Visa (e visa Srilanka) once approved.

faqs.question: Are you still having doubts about the Sri Lanka Visa process?
faqs.answer:
We have you covered across India with presence in all the major cities like Mumbai, Pune, Delhi,
                                Bangalore, Chennai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and many more.
                                Apply for Sri Lanka ETA on saathivisa.com.

faqs.question: What is the Sri Lanka Tourist Visa Cost for Indian citizens?
faqs.answer: Sri Lanka Visa Cost for Indian Citizens Type of Sri Lanka Visa (e visa Sri Lanka) Sri Lanka Visa Price 30 Days Srilanka Visit Visa/Tourist Visa ₹ 1,999 30 Days Srilanka Business Visa ₹ 2,699

faqs.question: I plan to travel to Sri Lanka need Visa from India?
faqs.answer:
Yes. All Indian passport holders need to apply for Sri Lanka visa from India. The Srilanka visa for
                                Indians is issued in the form of an electronic visa. On processing of the eVisa, applicants will receive
                                the Sri Lanka eVisa on their registered Email Id which must be printed and carried along with the
                                passport and other travel documents.

faqs.question: Is the Sri Lanka Visa easy to get?
faqs.answer:
Most of our customers will agree that Sri Lanka visa for Indians is as easy to get as other top tourist
                                countries such as Dubai visa, Singapore Visa Malaysia visa and Thailand visa among others.

faqs.question: What is Sri Lanka eVisa?
faqs.answer:
Sri Lanka eVisa is an online Visa, Issued by the Sri Lankan Government for Indians who wish to visit
                                Sri Lanka for a short period of time. The e visa Srilanka online visa application procedure is quite
                                simple and hassle free.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Srilanka Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer:
Srilanka Visit Visa - Issued for the purpose of visiting friends or family in Sri Lanka. Srilanka Tourist Visa - Issued for tourism, sightseeing and leisure purpose. Srilanka Business Visa - Issued to take part in business activities such as meetings, conferences,
                                    seminars etc.

faqs.question: Can I extend my eVisa for Sri Lanka?
faqs.answer:
According to the Sri Lanka e visa guidelines, the Sri Lanka cannot be extended in India. There is
                                strictly no extension of visa validity or change of Sri Lanka visa type. Extension is only possible in
                                Sri Lanka at the discretion of the Immigration Officials. You can submit a fresh visa application upon
                                the expiry or upon utilisation of your current visa.

faqs.question: Should I re-apply for new eVISA if my departure date changes and the new date is after 3 months?
faqs.answer:
Yes. You will need to re-apply a new eVISA since the approved visa issuance date by the Department of
                                Immigration to enter Sri Lanka is valid for 3 months only

faqs.question: How Do I make payment for Sri Lanka Visa online?
faqs.answer:
After choosing the preferred Sri Lanka visa type and submitting your personal information, you will be
                                directed to the secure online payment procedure. Select your preferred payment method and pay online.
                                Your online visa application will then be processed by our Sri Lanka Visa Experts online.

faqs.question: Is the Sri Lanka e visa issued for single or multiple entries?
faqs.answer:
The Sri Lanka tourist visa for Indians is valid for double entries while the Sri Lanka business visa is
                                valid for multiple entries within the visa validity.

faqs.question: Am I required to submit any physical document when applying for my Srilanka visa for Indians?
faqs.answer:
No, You are not required to submit any physical documents unless requested by the Sri Lanka High
                                Commission in India.

faqs.question: How long does it take to process my Sri Lanka e visa?
faqs.answer: Sri Lanka e visa processing time is up to 48 hours.

faqs.question: I received my Sri Lanka visa on email? What should I do?
faqs.answer:
Take a print out of the e visa Srilanka copy and keep it along with your passport, flight tickets and
                                other travel documents. You will need to present it at the time of check in, arrival and immigration
                                countries. With the Srilanka e visa, you are ready to travel.

faqs.question: What is the minimum passport blank pages prior entry into Sri Lanka?
faqs.answer: There should be at least be three (3) blank pages in your passport for immigration stamps etc.

faqs.question: What are the requirements for Sri Lanka visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: You must ensure the following documents are valid prior to apply for a Sri Lanka eVisa: Passport front and last page (Passport with minimum 6 months validity and 3 blank pages). Confirmed Return flight booking. Address of Indian and Sri Lanka company (For Sri Lanka business visa)

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Srilanka e visa?
faqs.answer: Sri Lanka e visa can be applied through our website saathivisa.com

faqs.question: How can I pay the Srilanka Visa cost?
faqs.answer: The visa cost for e visa Srilanka can be paid online at the time of submitting your visa application.

faqs.question: How many days can I stay in Sri Lanka with the eVisa?
faqs.answer: You are allowed to stay in Sri Lanka up to a maximum of 30 days on each entry.

faqs.question: How to check visa validity?
faqs.answer: The Sri Lanka visa validity and stay period are printed on the e visa.

faqs.question: What is the difference between validity of Sri Lanka visa and period of stay?
faqs.answer:
Visa validity and period of stay are two different aspects. Visa validity is the period during which a
                                visa can be used to enter Sri Lanka. Period of stay is the number of days the visa holder is allowed to
                                stay in Sri Lanka. For instance, the validity of a Sri Lanka visa is 6 months and stay period is 30
                                days. The visa holder can enter Sri Lanka anytime within the 6 months period from the date of issue but
                                will be permitted to stay for up to 30 days only. The Sri Lanka visa validity and stay period are completely at the discretion of the High Commission of
                                Sri Lanka and are displayed on the e visa Srilanka copy.

faqs.question: Do I need to apply for a new Sri Lanka visa if the visa validity period ends before my return date?
faqs.answer:
There is no need to apply for a new Sri Lanka visa as long as your travel date to Sri Lanka is within
                                the visa validity.

faqs.question: Can the validity period of the Sri Lanka eVisa be amended?
faqs.answer:
The Srilanka e visa validity period cannot be amended once the visa has been issued. You may wish to
                                approach an authorised Travel Agent to submit a new application

faqs.question: What will happen If I overstay on my Sri Lanka visa?
faqs.answer:
You will be subjected to an administrative fine by the Sri Lankan local authorities and your next entry
                                into Sri Lanka may be denied for a certain period of time if you failed to stay within the stipulated
                                time. Moreover, violating the visa rules by overstaying will also impact all future Sri Lanka visa
                                applications.

faqs.question: Can I apply my e visa while in Sri Lanka?
faqs.answer: No. The Sri Lanka e visa must be obtained prior to your entry into Sri Lanka.

faqs.question:
What is
                            a Norway Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Norway Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all
                                the Schengen
                                countries including Norway for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s
                                dream
                                where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along with
                                Norway.

faqs.question:
The
                            Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all
                                26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Norway), unless it is marked
                                otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European
                                territory
                                of Norway. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons
                                of
                                your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following
                                countries:
                                Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece,
                                Hungary,
                                Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands,
                                Norway,
                                Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question:
How long
                            can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your
                                passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This
                                means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The
                                precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the
                                heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only
                                once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A
                                two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the
                                Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number
                                of
                                entries".

faqs.question:
Will all
                            Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the
                                Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your
                                flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question:
Can I
                            apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer:
You may appeal against this decision. The decision to refuse a Schengen visa and the
                                reasons
                                for the refusal are notified using a standard form that is handed out by the Member
                                State's
                                consulate that refused the visa. The notification of the refusal must include the
                                reasons,
                                on which the refusal were based, and the procedures and deadlines for submitting an
                                appeal.
                                You are free to re-apply again if your application has been refused earlier. However,
                                it
                                is recommended that you take note of the reasons for the earlier refusal before
                                submitting
                                a new application and make amendments, where necessary. The visa fee is not refunded if the visa is refused. The visa fee covers the cost
                                of the
                                examination of the visa application.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a
                                country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: - the purpose of your trip - when and where you intend to travel - how your trip is going to be funded - day-by-day itinerary for your trip - duration of the trip

faqs.question:
As a
                            Norway short-stay visa holder can I extend my Schengen Visa while in Norway?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your Norway short-stay while in Norway except in special
                                circumstances, and
                                exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or
                                criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and
                                apply
                                for another Norway Visa if necessary.

faqs.question:
Can I
                            leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01".
                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during
                                the
                                validity of the visa.

faqs.question:
If my
                            Norway short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long
                            can I remain in the Norway territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Norway territory for a
                                maximum period
                                of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question:
I am
                            going to Norway via KLM with a stopover in Amsterdam. Do I need to apply for multiple
                            entries?
faqs.answer:
No. A single entry visa will suffice as long as you do not go in and out of the Schengen
                                area.

faqs.question:
How long
                            before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of
                                departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as
                                certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the
                                processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 5-15 working days from your
                                appointment
                                date.

faqs.question:
How long
                            does it take to obtain a Norway Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Norway Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 10 to 15 days to process in
                                the
                                Norway Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Norway Visa is dependent on several
                                factors
                                and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion. This period may be
                                extended
                                up to 30 days or 60 days.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the role of VFS?
faqs.answer:
VFS Global Services Pvt Ltd (VFS) is the Service Delivery Provider for the Embassy of
                                Norway
                                in New Delhi. The role of VFS is to accept visa applications and to dispatch passports
                                and
                                documents back to clients, on behalf of the Embassy of Norway. VFS does not play any
                                part
                                in or influence the outcome of your visa application.

faqs.question:
How can
                            I check the status of my Norway Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Norway visa application online using the Norway VFS
                                Reference
                                number and Date of Birth. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of the Norway
                                VFS
                                website.

faqs.question:
Will I
                            get my visa at the end of the process?
faqs.answer:
As an application centre, the Norway Visa Application Centre (VFS) will not be able to
                                guarantee
                                you a visa. The issuance or refusal of a Norway visa is the sole prerogative of The
                                Embassy/Consulate.
                                The Norway Visa Application Centre cannot influence this decision in any way.

faqs.question:
Is it
                            mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Norway Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Norway Visa in order to provide your biometrics and
                                submit
                                your visa documents.

faqs.question:
I have a
                            valid long stay visa/residence permit for a country that is part of the Schengen
                            area. Do I need another visa to travel to other Schengen states?
faqs.answer:
No. A long stay visa or a residence permit issued by a Schengen State allows you to
                                travel or
                                stay in other Schengen States, while respecting the maximum duration of a “short stay”
                                (a
                                stay of "90 days in any 180 day period")

faqs.question:
My
                            family is also applying for a Norway Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question:
I am
                            traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will
                                be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then
                                you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first
                                port
                                of entry.

faqs.question:
Can I
                            leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01".
                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during
                                the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only
                                once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a
                                multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity
                                period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I
                            have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At
                                the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional
                                documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and
                                the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the
                                documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation,
                                travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question:
Do I
                            have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be
                                presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question:
Why is
                            personal appearance mandatory for Norway Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System
                                (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide
                                biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at
                                the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications
                                within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the
                                VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will
                                again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the
                                applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it
                                cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years
                                period.

faqs.question:
Do I
                            need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel
                                insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical
                                reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their
                                stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid
                                throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended
                                stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question:
What are
                            the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer:
Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following
                                requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Bosnia and Herzegovina. Visa must be obtained from the Embassy of Bosnia and Herzegovina in India. All Indian visitors entering into Bosnia and Herzegovina must have a valid visa and passport or travel document, as well as onward tickets and sufficient funds to support themselves while in the country. The type of visa to enter Bosnia and Herzegovina will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.
