faqs.question: What are the different kinds of Bosnia visas available?
faqs.answer: Short Term Visa C is issued for trips related to business, education training, tourism, private affairs, politics, science, sport, religion or other purposes. Applicants can only stay for 90 days in a period of six months from the date of entry. Long Term Visa (Visa D) shall be issued exceptionally in such situations where for the purposes of stay in Bosnia and Herzegovina a period of more than 90 days is required within the period of six (6) month. Stay cannot exceed 180 days in the period of one year beginning from the day of the first entry. Visa D may be valid up to maximum of one year, exceptionally more. To obtain Visa D applicants are obligated to submit the same documents as for Visa C, but the documents must demonstrate the need to stay longer than 90 days.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Bosnia and Herzegovina visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: TheBosnia and Herzegovina Embassy issues a Single and Multiple entry visa for Indians. Stay cannot exceed 90 days in the period of six months beginning from the day of the first entry. The visas may be valid up to a maximum of one year, exceptionally more.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Bosnia and Herzegovina once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.question: What is the Bosnia and Herzegovina visa fee for Indians?
faqs.answer: Since the Embassy issues single & multiple type visas, the cost for each entry type differs as follows: C Visa Single entry for 3 months – INR 4,100/- C Visa Multiple entry for 6 months - INR 6,050/- D Visa – INR 7300/-

faqs.question: hat are the eligibility criteria for Bosnia and Herzegovina visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Bosnia How long you intend to stay in Bosnia How will you support yourself during your time in Bosnia What is the purpose of your visit to Bosnia Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Bosnia If you have a permit to Bosnia the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Bosnia

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Bosnia and Herzegovina visa online?
faqs.answer: Applicant for ‘C Visa’ must apply at least 3 (three) days to 1 (one) month prior to the date of travel. Applicant for ‘D Visa’ must apply minimum 1 (one) month to maximum 3 (three) prior to the date of travel.

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Bosnia and Herzegovina Visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, Applicant need to visit the Embassy of Bosnia and Herzegovina in New Delhi personally, as there will be an interview conducted by the Visa officials. Applications by mail will not be accepted nor are travel agents authorized to submit applications on behalf of the applicant.

faqs.question: What should be done if my Bosnia and Herzegovina visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: In the case of aBosnia and Herzegovina visa rejection, the Embassy will state the reason for rejecting your visa application. You may also appeal against the decision if you find it necessary.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Person who wishes to apply for visa to Bosnia should possess travel/health insurance which in case if needed will cover any cost related to condition of his health and death. Health/travel insurance should be valid on whole territory of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a Visa to travel to Dominica?
faqs.answer: No, Indian citizens do not require a visa to enter Dominica for a short stay, if the purpose of visit is tourism, visit or business. Indians enjoy visa free travel to the country. Visitors are also required to hold valid passport, proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay, accommodation proof and return flight tickets to their home country.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Dominica without a visa?
faqs.answer: You can stay in Dominica for up to 6 months without requiring a visa.

faqs.question: What are the Passport requirements?
faqs.answer: All visitors arriving in Dominica must have a valid passport or other travel document issued by the government of the country of citizenship or nationality. The document must be valid for at least 120 days beyond the date of entry.

faqs.question: Is Dominica and Dominican Republic the same?
faqs.answer: No! Though they lie in the same region of West Indies, they are completely different countries and are not related. Dominica nestles in the Windward Islands between the North Atlantic Ocean and the Caribbean Sea and also somewhere between Tobago, Trinidad and Puerto Rio, while the later lies on the Hispaniola island.

faqs.question: What are entry requirements for visitors entering Dominica?
faqs.answer: The immigration officials at the Airport may check the below documents: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry Dully filled Immigration Card Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Dominica Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to your business visa

faqs.question: Do I need visa for Lesotho from India?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Lesotho. Indians are eligible for an eVisa. The electronic visa system (eVisa) will allow foreign citizens to receive Lesotho visa online, relieving them from necessity of visiting the Lesotho Embassy or Consulates. It is the simplest and the fastest way to get your visa. Once your visa application is approved, you will receive the visa copy via email right in your inbox. The type of visa to enter Lesotho will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: What is an eVisa?
faqs.answer: An Electronic Visa or "e Visa" is an electronically issued and stored authority for travel to The Republic of Lesotho, which replaces the traditional paper visa process in most cases.

faqs.question: What is a Lesotho eVisa?
faqs.answer: A Lesotho visa is a legal document which lawfully allows its holder to enter and stay within the country for a certain number of days as mentioned on the visa.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Lesotho visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: A Lesotho visa is most appropriate for Indians travelling to Lesotho for business and recreational purposes such as holidaying, sightseeing, or even short family visits.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a traditional visa (sticker pasted on the passport) and an eVisa?
faqs.answer: The support is the only difference. Both documents allow to visit the Republic of Lesotho in accordance with the legal framework governing the type of visa / eVisa obtained.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Lesotho Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Single-entry visa holders may remain in Lesotho for a maximum period of 44 days. Applicants with multiple entry visa may travel in and out of Lesotho within 180 days multiple number of times. They must apply for an extension if their stay is prolonged.

faqs.question: What is the eVisa processing time?
faqs.answer: The Lesotho visa is processed online within 5 working days.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single-entry multiple-entry Lesotho Visa?
faqs.answer: A single-entry visa allows entry to Lesotho only once, meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the after leaving, while a multiple-entry Visa allows multiple entries into Lesotho within the visa’s validity period.

faqs.question: How will I receive the Lesotho visa online?
faqs.answer: Applicants will receive their visas via email, after filling the application form with the necessary information and submitting the supporting documents online. The eVisa must be presented upon crossing the state border of Lesotho along with the valid travel document (passport).

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Lesotho visa online?
faqs.answer: With Akbar Travels, the process of applying for a Lesotho visa online is easy and seamless. The steps are: Choose your preferred type of Lesotho visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents via whatsapp or email Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: When can the earliest possible application be made for a Lesotho visa online?
faqs.answer: We recommend that you apply for eVisa online at least 10 days prior to your entry in Lesotho. However it is not possible to apply more than 30 days before your date of entry to Lesotho.

faqs.question: Which are the entry requirements after you arrive in Lesotho?
faqs.answer: Passport valid for at least 6 months beyond your intended stay period Printed Lesotho eVisa Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Lesotho Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to your business trip

faqs.question: Do I need to obtain a separate e-Visa for persons accompanying me?
faqs.answer: Yes. Each traveller must have a separate e-Visa.

faqs.question: Can I get a refund if I do not use my visa?
faqs.answer: No. We cannot refund payments for unused e-Visas. The fee is a processing fee.

faqs.question: I do not want to apply for an e-Visa. Can I get a visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: No. Indians are not eligible for visa on arrival and must apply for the visa before travel. Arriving without a visa constitutes an undocumented traveler. You can be fined or refuse entry into Lesotho.

faqs.question:
What is
                            a Poland Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Poland Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all
                                the Schengen
                                countries including Poland for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s
                                dream
                                where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along with
                                Poland.

faqs.question:
The
                            Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all
                                26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Poland), unless it is marked
                                otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European
                                territory
                                of Poland. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons
                                of
                                your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following
                                countries:
                                Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece,
                                Hungary,
                                Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands,
                                Norway,
                                Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question:
How long
                            can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your
                                passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This
                                means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The
                                precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the
                                heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only
                                once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A
                                two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the
                                Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number
                                of
                                entries".

faqs.question:
Will all
                            Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the
                                Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your
                                flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question:
Can I
                            apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer:
You are free to apply again for a Schengen Visa if your application has been refused
                                earlier.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a
                                country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: - the purpose of your trip - when and where you intend to travel - how your trip is going to be funded - day-by-day itinerary for your trip - duration of the trip

faqs.question:
As a
                            Poland short-stay visa holder can I extend my Schengen Visa while in Poland?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your Poland short-stay while in Poland except in special
                                circumstances, and
                                exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or
                                criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and
                                apply
                                for another Poland Visa if necessary.

faqs.question:
If my
                            Poland short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long
                            can I remain in the Poland territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Poland territory for a
                                maximum period
                                of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question:
How long
                            before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of
                                departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as
                                certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the
                                processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take up to 14 working days from your
                                appointment
                                date.

faqs.question:
How long
                            does it take to obtain a Poland Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Poland Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere between 10 to 14 days to process
                                in the
                                Poland Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Poland Visa is dependent on several
                                factors
                                and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion.

faqs.question:
Is it
                            mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Poland Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Poland Visa in order to provide your biometrics and
                                submit
                                your visa documents.

faqs.question:
My
                            family is also applying for the Poland Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question:
I am
                            traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will
                                be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then
                                you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first
                                port
                                of entry.

faqs.question:
Can I
                            leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01".
                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during
                                the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only
                                once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a
                                multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity
                                period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I
                            have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At
                                the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional
                                documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and
                                the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the
                                documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation,
                                travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question:
Do I
                            have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be
                                presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question:
Why is
                            personal appearance mandatory for Poland Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System
                                (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide
                                biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at
                                the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications
                                within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the
                                VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will
                                again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the
                                applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it
                                cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years
                                period.

faqs.question:
Do I
                            need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel
                                insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical
                                reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their
                                stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid
                                throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended
                                stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question:
What are
                            the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer:
Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following
                                requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question:
Can you
                            process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa,
                                you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical
                                treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection
                                against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses,
                                flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For
                                financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase
                                travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

                                please
                                drop in your query and our Expert will get in touch with you.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Nicaragua ?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indians need a visa to travel and enter Nicaragua. You are required to obtain a visa from the Nicaragua Embassy in your country prior to traveling to Nicaragua. You will not be allowed entry at the border if you do not have this visa stamped in your passport.A Nicaraguavisa for Indians can be private, tourist, business and work – depending on the purposeof a visit.

faqs.question: What is a Nicaragua Visa?
faqs.answer: It is a straight forward and effortless process to apply for a Nicaragua  visa online through Akbar Travels: Choose your preferred type of Nicaragua  visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: What is a Nicaragua Visa?
faqs.answer: It is a legal document that allows citizens of India to enter the country of Nicaragua for a certain period of time.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Nicaragua Visas?
faqs.answer: Nicaragua Tourist visas for Indians are issued for a short period of leisure travel to or visiting family and friends in Nicaragua and no business activities will be permitted. Nicaragua Business visas for Indians are issued for participating in short term business activities in Nicaragua. Nicaragua Transit visas for Indians are issued for 3 days or less, for transferring through a port in Nicaragua to a third destination. The other types of Nicaragua visas are student visa, temporary work visa, parent visa, spousal visa/partner visa and marriage visa.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Nicaragua visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Nicaragua visa is two months before the date of travel to the country.

faqs.question: What is the validity of my Nicaragua visa?
faqs.answer: A Nicaragua visa is valid for one journey and the traveller has to use it within 30 days after the issuing date except if a visa for multiple entries or exits is issued; validity varies between 3 and 6 months.

faqs.question: Can I extend my stay in Nicaragua?
faqs.answer: It is possible to extend the intended stay against an extra charge for each day of stay.

faqs.question: What is the Nicaragua for Indians visa processing time?
faqs.answer: Processing an application for a Nicaragua visa normally takes up to 4 to 6 weeks for processing.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for Nicaragua visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: why are you visiting Nicaragua how long you intend to stay in Nicaragua how will you support yourself during your time in Nicaragua what is the purpose of your visit to Nicaragua type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid where do you intend to travel following your visit to Nicaragua if you have a permit to enter the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Nicaragua

faqs.question: What if my stay exceeds the validity of my visa?
faqs.answer: If you happen to stay longer than the approved duration, you may be required to pay a fine and face deportation or a travel ban to the Nicaragua for a certain period of time.

faqs.question: Can I get a visa on arrival in Nicaragua?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indian passport holders having a valid visa issued by USA, United Kingdom, Schengen or Canada can obtain a visa on arrival for a maximum stay of 30 days.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for Visa on arrival at Nicaragua airport?
faqs.answer: Travellers must meet the following criteria: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry and with two blank pages within Return ticket to your country Confirmation of accommodation for duration of your visit Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Seychelles Detailed itinerary of your trip

faqs.question: What type of entry is granted for a Nicaragua Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: A single entry is granted. The visa cannot be used for multiple entries into the country.Multiple entries are issued on special requests and the validity varies between 3 to 6 months.

faqs.question: If there is a change in my travel dates, can I change the date on my visa?
faqs.answer: No. If you do not use your Visa during its validity period, you will need to apply for another one.

Based on the purpose of your visit Gambia you may apply for a Business Visa, Tourist Visa, Visit Visa, Official Visa, Diplomatic Visa, Student/Research Visa, Transit Visa, Crew Visa & many more. faqs.question: What is the validity of a Gambia visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Tourist visa is issued for up to 90 days, whereas business visa is issued from 30 days to 365 days. The validity and stay period is decided by the Embassy on the basis of the purpose of your visit and visa type. It can be issued for one, two or multiple entries.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Gambia once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Gambia visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Gambia visa is one month before the date of travel to the country. In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted ten days, prior to travelling.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Gambia visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Please allow 7 working days for visa processing which should exclude the submission day, weekends and bank holidays.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Gambia visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: why are you visiting Gambia how long you intend to stay in Gambia how will you support yourself during your time in Gambia what is the purpose of your visit to Gambia type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid where do you intend to travel following your visit to Gambia if you have a permit to enter the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Gambia

faqs.question: How do I receive my Gambia visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: What if my Gambia visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Gambia visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued. You are free to reapply for the visa.

faqs.question: Are there any chances of my Gambia visa application getting rejected?
faqs.answer: Yes. Like other country visas, your visa application for Gambia can be rejected for a number of reasons. The most common Gambia visa rejection reasons are: Invalid and damaged Passport Incomplete Visa Application form Applied Wrong visa category Current Gambia visa still valid Incomplete documents submitted Intention of returning to home country not clear Purpose of travel not clear Insufficient bank balance Criminal history

faqs.question: Which are the necessary documents required to be presented on arrival in Gambia?
faqs.answer: Passport valid for at least 6 months from your date of entry. Valid Gambia visa Boarding Pass Return ticket to your country or next destination Accommodation proof or invitation letter for family visits Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Gambia(cash, debit/credit card etc) Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to business trip (invitation letter, business card etc) Note: It should be noted that the possession of Visa is not a final authority to enter the Republic of Gambia. faqs.question: Do I need visa for Albania from India?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indian citizens require a visa prior to enter the Republic of Albania. Albania visas must be obtained from the Embassy of Albania in India. The type of visa to enter Albania will depend on several factors such as purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: Is there any visa exemption for Indians?
faqs.answer: Indian nationals can enter and stay in the Republic of Albania for up to 90 days to 180 days without a an Albania visa if: 1.They have a valid multiple entry Schengen visa, with the condition that the visa issued must have been used previously in one of the countries of the Schengen area or persons have a valid residence permit in one of the countries of the Schengen area; 2. They have a valid multiple entry visa or a valid residence permit issued by the United States of America, Great Britain and Northern Ireland, with the condition that visa issued must have been used previously in the country issued; 3. Who can enter and stay in the Schengen states without a visa.

faqs.question: What is the validity of an Albania visa for Indians?
faqs.answer:
Short stay visa is issued to foreign nationals that wish to enter the Republic of Albania, are entitled to stay for a maximum period of 90 days out of a 180-day period, from their date of first entry.
                                This visa type is issued with one, two or multiple entries.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for an Albania visa online?
What are the types of Albaniavisa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Albania Tourist Visa: It is a visa which is issued to persons intending to enter Albania for tourism, sightseeing, leisure or visiting relatives and friends. Albania Business Visa: This visa is issued for a short visit to conduct conferences, trainings, discussions, seminars, negotiations, and/or any other commercial activities, but not to take up employment.> Albania Transit Visa: Transit visa allows a visitors to travel across or through Albania on way to another country. The visa is issued for a limited period and the applicant of this visa must provide proof of a Visa of the destination country and/or onward ticket. Albania Student Visa: Student visa is granted to Indian nationals who are enrolled at qualified educational institutions. This Visa may be issued for a specific period of time.

faqs.question: What is the Albania visa photo size requirement?
faqs.answer:
The Albania visa photo must meet the requirements described below.
                                If not, the application will be delayed until you provide correct photos. Photo must be 45 mm X 35 mm in size The face should cover 80% of the photo In colour. White and black photo won’t be accepted Taken against a plain white background Taken within the last 3 months Your head should face the camera directly. It should not be tilted or turned, even slightly The head must be centred in the image. You must look directly at the camera and show your full face Do not wear sunglasses or tinted/coloured glasses. If you normally wear glasses, your eyes must be clearly visible in the photo The photo must be different from the passport photo.

faqs.question: What is the relationship between the validity of an Albania Visa, number of entries and duration of stay?
faqs.answer:
Validity of an Albania Visa refers to the period within which the visa holder is allowed to enter Albania. The number of entries refers to the number of times the visa holder is permitted to enter Albania within the visa’s validity.
                                        One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry,
                                        its holder can only enter and leave Albania only once. Whereas, with multiple entries,
                                        he/she can enter or leave more than once within the visa validity. Duration of stay refers to the longest period the visa holder is allowed to stay in Albania on each visit,
                                        and this is counted from the day following entry into Albania. When all the permitted entries are used up, the visa will no longer be valid. Even if there are unused entries,
                                        the visa will no longer be valid if the validity has already expired. In either case, the visa holder should apply
                                        for a new visa if another visit to Albania is planned. The holder of a visa is eligible to enter Albania at any time prior to the expiry of its validity provided that permitted entries on the visa have not been used up; the holder’s planned duration of stay in Albania must not exceed the duration stated on the visa.

faqs.question: Are there any chances of my Albania visa application getting rejected?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Like other country visas, your visa application for Albania can be rejected for a number of reasons.
                                The most common Albania visa rejection reasons are: Invalid and damaged Passport Incomplete Visa Application form Applied Wrong visa category Current Albania visa still valid Incomplete documents submitted Intention of returning to home country not clear Purpose of travel not clear Insufficient bank balance Criminal history After refusal of a visa, the applicant has the right to reapply only after the appeal’s procedure has ended or after three months from the date of receiving the decision.

faqs.question: How can I avoid anAlbania Visa Rejection?
faqs.answer: While there may be many more reasons for anAlbania visa refusal, the most common reasons are mentioned above. If you hope of getting that refusal overturned, or a second application approved or above all just get the Albania Tourist/Business visa successfully in the first attempt itself, here are some of the things that you can do to avoid a Albania visa rejection: Make sure your passport meets the standard requirements for applying for Albania visa online It is really important that you provide all the documents required for your application. Different visa categories require several supporting documents, so it is important to make sure your application is specific to you, and that nothing is missed out. Be clear on your purpose of visit. If travelling for tourist purpose; specify that and submit documents supporting your Albania tourist visa application. Similarly, vice-versa for Albania business visa. Apply for the correct visa category. Make sure that your previous visa is not valid before applying for a new Albania visa. Submit confirmed return tickets as an assurance that you will return back to your home country & your purpose of travel is temporary. Seek assistance from a reliable travel agent to process your application smoothly without any hiccups. They are professionals who have the right training and knowledge to guide you correctly.

faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passportholders require a visit to visit Antigua and Barbuda.Citizens of few countries including India are eligible for an eVisa. faqs.question: What is an eVisa?
faqs.answer: An e-Visa is an electronic acknowledgement permitting entry into and travel to Antigua and Barbuda. The e-Visa is an electronic visa that is similar to visas issued at Antigua and Barbuda consulates or at the ports of entry. You will receive your Antigua and Barbuda visa entirely online – without having to submit your passport for stamping.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Antigua and Barbuda visa?
faqs.answer: An Antigua and Barbuda visa is most appropriate for Indians travelling to Antigua and Barbuda for business and recreational purposes such as holidaying, sightseeing, or even short family visits. The type of visa to enter Antigua and Barbuda will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Antigua and Barbuda  Visas?
faqs.answer:
The categories of visas available for Indians visiting Antigua and Barbuda depends on the purpose of the visit.
                                If you are visiting Antigua and Barbuda for sightseeing or meeting friends or family, then you should apply for a tourist visa.
                                If you are visiting Antigua and Barbuda for commercial reasons or participating in a business fair or exhibition, then a business visa is applicable.

faqs.question: What is the validity of an Antigua and Barbuda Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: eVisas are issued to an applicant intending to visit Antigua and Barbuda for a stay period of 30 days. The entry type can be single only.

faqs.question: I would like to stay in Antigua and Barbuda for a period of time longer than the e-Visa permits. What should I do?
faqs.answer:
If you wish to stay in Antigua and Barbuda longer than your e-Visa permits, you must apply to the Immigration Department for an extension of your entry permit.
                                Please note that an e-Visa is granted only for short stays If you overstay your visa, you might be asked to pay fines, deported or banned future travel to Antigua and Barbuda for a specific period of time

faqs.question: What kind of Documentation I need to apply for Antigua eVisa?
faqs.answer: Scanned copy of a valid passport. (Please note, passports must be valid for a minimum of 6 months from the date of arrival in Antigua and Barbuda.) A recent color passport photograph (45mm x 35mm); all photos are to be on a while back ground only, and not altered or edited from its original state. Evidence of proposed journey into and out of Antigua and Barbuda i.e. ticket or confirmation of your booking from the travel agent. Proof of accommodation for the length of your stay or a letter of invitation from your sponsor. Students, must provide the acceptance letter from your school, and the details of where they will be staying during their studies. Individuals traveling on business are to provide a letter from your employer stating the purpose of your trip. (business covering letter, invitation letter etc) Proof of funds to finance the trip i.e. bank statements for the previous three months. A recent police record. (Discretion may be taken by the visa-issuing office.) Birth certificate for children travellers

faqs.question: What is the eVisa processing time?
faqs.answer: The application is decided by the relevant Senior Officers of the Antigua and Barbuda Immigration Department. The processing time of the application is seven (7) working days. This time can be extended for up to 15 days and in exceptional cases for up to 30 days. The decision of the Immigration Department is based on the presented supporting documents

faqs.question: How will I receive the eVisa?
faqs.answer: In the legally designated time, the applicant will be notified via e-mail about the outcome of the review application. In case of approval, the applicant will receive eVisa in PDF format. You are advised to keep a copy of the eVisa with you during the trip.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Zimbabwe?
faqs.answer: Citizens of few countries including India do not need to apply for a visa in advance. They can get a Zimbabwe visa upon arrival in Zimbabwe provided they have the valid travel documents.The visa application is done when your flight lands or your car crosses the border into Zimbabwe.

faqs.question: What is the process to get Zimbabwe Visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: When you arrive at the airport or border post in Zimbabwe, head to the Immigration counter where you will be given an ‘Immigration Declaration Form’ to complete. Please fill the form and pay the visa fees in cash. (Take the exact change if possible).

faqs.question: What is the basic requirement for Zimbabwe visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months from the date of arrival in Zimbabwe and should have at least 2 blank pages left in it. You should have proof of onward/return tickets out of the country.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: All Categories need: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry. Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Zimbabwe. Detailed itinerary of your trip

faqs.question: What is the Zimbabwe visa fee on arrival?
faqs.answer: The Zimbabwe visa fees are as below: Single Entry - USD 30 Double Entry - USD 45 Multiple Entry - USD 55

faqs.question: Is the visa fee the same for children?
faqs.answer: Yes. The visa fee is same for adults and children. Zimbabwe will now be charging FULL VISA fees for any individual who is required to have a VISA despite their age. This includes infants and children who were previously being exempted from this.

faqs.question: Can I get a multiple entry visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Multiple Entry Visas cannot be obtained at the port of entry into Zimbabwe.  You may enter Zimbabwe on a single-entry visa and then obtain a Multiple Entry Visa from the town office - but this may take up to 7 working days to be issued.Alternatively, a multiple entry visa can be obtained from the Zimbabwe Embassy in your country prior to departure for Zimbabwe and Akbar Travels can help you obtain the visa successfully.

faqs.question: What is a Kazakhstan visa?
faqs.answer: It is an endorsement on a passport indicating that the holder is allowed to enter, leave, or stay for a specified period of time in the country.

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a visa for Kazakhstan?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indian citizens who wish to travel to Kazakhstan are required to obtain a visa for travelling to Kazakhstan.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Kazakhstan visa online?
faqs.answer: With Akbar Travels, the process of applying for a Kazakhstan visa online is easy and seamless. The steps are: 1.  Choose your preferred type of Kazakhstan visa based on your travel type 2.  Pay online 3.  Submit documents through our pick up & drop service 4.  Receive your visa once approved!

faqs.question: What are the different kinds of visas available?
faqs.answer: The Kazakhstan visa authorities may issue a Tourist, Business, Diplomatic, Official or several other types of Kazakhstan visas depending on your purpose of visit to Kazakhstan and your passport type.

faqs.question: What is the Kazakhstan visa processing time?
faqs.answer: Processing an application for a Kazakhstan visa normally takes up to 5 working days.

faqs.question: What kind of entry is my Kazakhstan visa?
faqs.answer: In most cases, a single entry is granted.

faqs.question: Are multiple entry visas issued?
faqs.answer: Yes. Those entering and exiting Kazakhstan multiple times are required to issue a multiple entry visa.

faqs.question: From when is my visa valid?
faqs.answer: Your visa is valid from the date your visa was issued. It should not be calculated from the date of entry into Kazakhstan.

faqs.question: What conditions should my passport fulfil?
faqs.answer: Passport provided by the recipient of a visa should meet the following criteria: 1) should not cause doubts in authenticity and belonging to its owner, have marks of extension, reservations, notes, erasures and corrections, torn or unsewn pages; 2) should have at least 2 blank pages; 3) should expire no earlier than 3 months from the expiry date of the requested visa.

faqs.question: Does Kazakhstan issue electronic visa?
faqs.answer: Yes. The Kazakhstan Online Visa is an electronic visa which will allow travelers to enter the country without obtaining a conventional visa from an embassy or consulate. The entire application process will be completed online and has been designed to be quick and straightforward.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for a Kazakhstan online visa?
faqs.answer: Eligible citizens from 117 countries including India can now obtain the eVisa online by receiving an invitation from the Kazakhstan side and completing the application form. It’s a complete online process. Once an application has been completed and approved, the Kazakhstan eVisa will be sent to the applicant by email. It will then be possible to enter Kazakhstan by presenting the eVisa, along with the corresponding passport, at the Kazakhstan border — only at the international airports of Astana and Almaty.

faqs.question: Can Indian citizens obtain an e-Visa for Kazakhstan?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indian nationals may be issued an electronic single entry tourist visa to the Republic of Kazakhstan.

faqs.question: On what circumstances is a Kazakhstan e-Visa issued?
faqs.answer: An electronic visa (business, tourist and medical treatment) is issued based on a valid invitation from the Kazakh side, considered by the migration service units of the Ministry of Interior of the Republic of Kazakhstan under the established procedure. Indians can enter/exit the territory of the Republic of Kazakhstan using a valid electronic visa only through the checkpoints of international airports of Astana and Almaty.

faqs.question: What are the documents required by Indian nationals to transit via Kazakhstan?
faqs.answer: The condition is that they must be flying to another country via Kazakhstan and possess the proof of the same i.e confirmed ticket of final destination.

faqs.question: Do I need a travel or medical insurance?
faqs.answer: It is advisable to purchase a medical and travel insurance plan. Akbar Travels can assist you with the ideal travel insurance plan to cover any emergencies during travel, damage and loss of baggage.

faqs.question: Do I need to be vaccinated before travelling to Kazakhstan?
faqs.answer: No. It is not mandatory to be vaccinated.

faqs.question: What if my Kazakhstan visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: A Kazakhstan visa rejection is wholly the decision by the Official Embassy of Kazakhstan in New Delhi. In case of rejection, a new visa can be applied for.

faqs.question: Can I get a refund in case of visa rejection?
faqs.answer: No refunds will be entertained in case a Kazakhstan visa is rejected.

faqs.question: What else do I need to know about the Kazakhstan tourist visa from India?
faqs.answer: The Kazakhstan visa for Indians is a legal document. Upon damage of the visa page or loss of passport (in case of a stamped visa), a new one will be required to carry on with travel plans. A tourist visa cannot be used in place of other visas; it only covers travel within designated areas in Kazakhstan for the purpose of sightseeing.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Brazil visa?Short stay Brazil visas are mainly issued for tourism, business as well as other travelling needs including a single, double or multiple entries. The type of visa to enter Brazil will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.
faqs.answer: Short stay Brazil visas are mainly issued for tourism, business as well as other travelling needs including a single, double or multiple entries. The type of visa to enter Brazil will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Brazil Visas?
faqs.answer:
Please find below the different types of Brazil visas. Before submitting your application, you are required to identify the visa category that best suits the purpose of your visit to Brazil. VISITOR VISA (VIVIS) (The visa holder must not engage in remunerated work in Brazil and the activities must not exceed 90 days) Tourist Cultural, educational or recreational activities Family visits Participation in conferences, workshops, congresses or reunions Performing voluntary work Research, learning or academic extension activities Participation in meetings, fairs and business events, as well as prospecting business opportunities Media/film coverage As an auditor or consultant To join aircraft or vessel as part of its crew. Travelers transiting through Brazilian airports to other countries, whenever the onward flight is booked under a separate ticket and/or different code. The other types of Brazil visas are: PRE-APPROVED WORK VISA (VITEM) (Application to be submitted by Brazilian company to the Brazilian Ministry of Labor) Work under a Brazilian-ruled employment contract approved by the Ministry of Labor Local provision of services of any nature, including technical assistance and technology transfer Provision of services to a Brazilian government agency/organization under a contract or an international
                                        agreement Employees of foreign corporations to work as trainees or interns at their subsidiaries in Brazil,
                                        as well as intra company or intra-conglomerate professional training or professional exchange program Post graduate students seeking short term professional training during school holidays or vacation,
                                        without a formal employment relationship with a Brazilian company Scientists, researchers, professors, technicians to work with public or private entities,
                                        educational entities or science/technology entities Instructors or professors traveling to Brazil to teach a foreign language Professional athletes Crew member of a foreign tourism vessel operating in Brazilian waters, without local contract Crew member of fishing vessel operating in Brazilian waters, chartered by a Brazilian company Crew member of vessel or platform operating in Brazilian waters as the result of a lease contract with
                                        a Brazilian company Professionals without a work contract with a Brazilian company travelling to Brazil to perform studies and/or research regarding the preparation of bidding proposals for train lines. FAMILY REUNION/DEPENDENT VISA (VITEM XI) Family reunions/dependent visas are suitable for: Family members of an individual ( “sponsor”) holding any Temporary visa to Brazil Descendants (sons, daughters, stepson, stepdaughter, or minor under the custody) of a Brazilian
                                        national or Foreign Temporary or Permanent Resident under the age of 18 years Descendants (sons, daughters, stepson, stepdaughter, or minor under the custody) of a
                                        Brazilian national or Foreign Temporary or Permanent Resident over the age of 18 years who are
                                        Ascendants of a Brazilian national or Foreign Temporary or Permanent Resident, when there is evidence
                                        that the applicant needs to be under the care of the Brazilian national or Foreign
                                        Temporary or Permanent Resident Brother/sister, grandson/grand daughter, great-grandson/great-grand daughter of a Brazilian national or
                                        Foreign Temporary or Permanent Resident, when orphan, single and under the age of 18 years of age,
                                        or of any age, when unable to provide for himself/herself Spouse or civil-union or life partner of a Brazilian national or Foreign Temporary or Permanent Resident, regardless of gender/sex. CULTURAL AND ACADEMIC VISA (VITEM I) Scientists, professors, researchers (including post-doctoral students) and other professionals intending
                                        to pursue activities related to science, technology and innovation under an international cooperation
                                        program between research or educational entities, without a work contract in Brazil Technical training in the operation and/or maintenance of machinery or equipment made in Brazil Paid participation (“pro labore”) of scientists, professors, researchers or other professional to participate
                                        in a conference, seminar or congress, characterized as a set and defined event, for a
                                        maximum period of 30 days Experts traveling under an international cooperation agreement Community services and volunteering activities with non-profit NGO or religious
                                        social assistance organization for periods exceeding 90 days Training in Brazil as a young amateur athlete (above 14 years and under 18 years) Exchange student attending a regular course under a program sponsored by a cultural exchange organization STUDENT VISA (VITEM IV) Student attending primary or or secondary school Students attending University-level courses (undergraduate or graduate studies,
                                        including "sandwich" programs) registered at the Ministry of Education and Culture
                                        (MEC) in Brazil Specialization or graduate studies in the medical field Student under PEC-G or PEC-PG program Student travelling to Brazil for supervised academic internship Theology students Students of general courses, including language and technical courses PRE-APPROVED PROFESSIONAL ARTIST AND/OR SPORTS EVENT VISA (VITEM XII) Artists and athletes, as well as technicians that perform activities
                                        related to an artist or athlete (no employment with a Brazilian company or entity -
                                        requires prior approval by Ministry of Labor in Brazil) MISSIONARY WORK VISA (VITEM VII) Clergymen and missionaries with theological or academic religious education who intend to go to Brazil for religious purposes. DIPLOMATIC AND OFFICIAL VISAS (VIDIP/VISOF) Government officials and employees of international organizations on long-term mission to Brazil require a visa. Diplomatic and official passport holders on short-term stays (90 days or less) are exempt from a visa. For longer stays and accreditation, a visa is required. The application for these visas could be submitted in India or in Brazil.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Costa Rica Visas?
faqs.answer: Costa Rica Tourist visas for Indians are issued for a short period of leisure travel to or visiting family and friends in Costa Rica and no business activities will be permitted. Costa Rica Business visas for Indians are issued for participating in short term business activities in Costa Rica. Costa Rica Transit visas for Indians are issued for 3 days or less, for transferring through a port in Costa Rica to a third destination. The other types of Costa Rican visas are student visa, temporary work visa, parent visa, spousal visa/partner visa and marriage visa.

faqs.question: What is the validity of my Costa Rica visa?
faqs.answer: Visitors are allowed to stay in Costa Rica for a maximum period of 1 month.

faqs.question: What is the Costa Rica for Indians visa processing time?

faqs.question: Can I extend a Costa Rican visa?

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Tonga from India?
faqs.answer:
Indian nationals are required to obtain visas before traveling to Tonga, for tourism purpose. Aside from the valid visa, Indians are also required to present passports with remaining validity of at least 6 months beyond the date of departure from Tonga, onward or return tickets, and evidence of sufficient funds for their stay in the territory in order to be allowed to enter Tonga. The e Visa is valid for single entry, good for 30 days from the date of issue for a stay up to the expiration date listed on the visa. It is very easy to apply for and does not require sending your physical passport to us for processing.
It is the simplest and the fastest way to get your visa. Once your visa application is approved, you will receive the visa copy via email right in your inbox.

faqs.question: What is an eVisa?
faqs.answer: An Electronic Visa or "e Visa" is an electronically issued and stored authority for travel to The Republic of Tonga, which replaces the traditional paper visa process in most cases. You will receive your Tongavisa entirely online – without having to submit your passport for stamping.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Tonga Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The visitor’s visa issued to travelers is usually valid for 30 days. Indians are advised that it is illegal to take up employment, business or schooling while in Tonga on a visitor’s visa. They must also take careful note of the validity of their visa and make sure not to overstay as anyone in breach of the immigration act may be prosecuted and subject to a term of imprisonment or fine or both.

faqs.question: Is the Tonga visa extendable?
faqs.answer: Yes. Initially you’ll be granted 30 days stay in Tonga. This can be extended for another 30 days at an additional fee.

faqs.question: What is the Tonga visa fee for Indians?
faqs.answer: The Tonga visa fee is TOP 70. The visa fee payment must be made at the border/airport immigration officer in Tonga. They only accept TOP currency, so if you don’t have it, they’d let you in the airport to take from ATM or exchange currency, and come back in to pay for it. However, we recommend you carry TOP currency from India itself for a hassle free experience.

faqs.question: Is there any additional charges applicable for processing Tonga eVisa through Akbar Travels?
faqs.answer: Yes, Akbar Travels charges a nominal service fee for processing your eVisa online. We take care of the complete visa process; right from registering your application online to obtaining your eVisa.

faqs.question: Can I pay the Tonga visa fee in advance at the time of online application?
faqs.answer: No, the Tonga visa fee can only be paid on arrival to the Immigration officials at Tonga airport. There is no facility to make the payment in advance

faqs.question: What kind of documentation I need to apply for Tonga eVisa?
faqs.answer: Scanned copy of a valid passport. (Please note, passports must be valid for a minimum of 6 months from the date of arrival in Tonga) A recent color passport photograph (45mm x 35mm); all photos are to be on a while back ground only, and not altered or edited from its original state. Evidence of proposed journey into and out of Tonga i.e. ticket or confirmation of your booking from the travel agent. Proof of accommodation for the length of your stay or a letter of invitation from your sponsor. Proof of funds to finance the trip i.e. bank statements for the previous three months. Birth certificate for children travellers

faqs.question: What is the Tonga eVisa processing time?
faqs.answer: If your requirements are complete, visa should be processed within 1-2 weeks in your email. You have to print this visa to present at the departing city and upon entry to Tonga airport,

faqs.question: How will I receive the Tonga visa online?
faqs.answer: In the legally designated time, the applicant will be notified via e-mail about the outcome of the review application. In case of approval, the applicant will receive eVisa in PDF format. You are advised to printing the electronic visa, to keep on hand and to present to all authorized control officers before, during and after the trip, in particular on arrival at the border posts and during the stay in Tonga.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Tonga visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Tonga How long you intend to stay in Tonga How will you support yourself during your time in Tonga What is the purpose of your visit to Tonga Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Tonga If you have a permit to Tonga the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Tonga

faqs.answer: Tonga Visa for Indians can be applied online from anywhere, anytime No personal presence of the applicant required Minimum document requirement Convenient and cost effective i.e. lowest service charge Electronic visa can be sent anywhere in the world through Email

faqs.answer: No. We cannot refund payments for unused e-Visas. The fee is a processing fee.

faqs.answer: No. Indians are not eligible for visa on arrival and must apply for the visa before travel. Arriving without a visa constitutes an undocumented traveler. You can be fined or refuse entry into Tonga.
