faqs.question: What is a Greece Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Greece Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the Schengen
                                countries including Greece for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s dream
                                where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along with Greece.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all 26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Greece), unless it is marked otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European territory
                                of Greece. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons of
                                your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following countries:
                                Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary,
                                Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway,
                                Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number of
                                entries".

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer:
You may appeal against this decision. The decision to refuse a Schengen visa and the reasons
                                for the refusal are notified using a standard form that is handed out by the Member State's
                                consulate that refused the visa. The notification of the refusal must include the reasons,
                                on which the refusal were based, and the procedures and deadlines for submitting an appeal.
                                You are free to re-apply again if your application has been refused earlier. However, it
                                is recommended that you take note of the reasons for the earlier refusal before submitting
                                a new application and make amendments, where necessary. The visa fee is not refunded if the visa is refused. The visa fee covers the cost of the
                                examination of the visa application.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: the purpose of your trip when and where you intend to travel how your trip is going to be funded day-by-day itinerary for your trip duration of the trip

faqs.question: As a Greece short-stay visa holder can I extend my Schengen Visa while in Greece?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your Greece short-stay while in Greece except in special circumstances, and
                                exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and apply
                                for another Greece Visa if necessary.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the visa.

faqs.question:
If my Greece short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long
                            can I remain in the Greece territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Greece territory for a maximum period
                                of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 5-15 working days from your appointment
                                date.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain a Greece Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Greece Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 10 to 15 days to process in the
                                Greek Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Greece Visa is dependent on several factors
                                and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion. This period may be extended
                                up to 30 days or 60 days.

faqs.question: What is the role of GVCW?
faqs.answer:
Global Visa Center World (GVCW) is the sole Visa Service Provider for Greece in 4 geographical
                                zones, assisting the Hellenic Consular Authorities in the respective countries in their work
                                in issuing Schengen visas to foreign applicants. GVCW is the only European Service Provider
                                Company serving the first EU Government, the Greek Government. In this highly competitive
                                field of Visa Providers, GVCW is a European Service Provider Company serving the Greek Government,
                                assisting its consular authorities in issuing Schengen visas.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my Greece Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Greece visa application online using the Greece GVCW Application
                                Id and Date of Birth. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of the Greece GVCW
                                website.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Greece Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Greece Visa in order to provide your biometrics and submit
                                your visa documents.

faqs.question:
I have a valid long stay visa/residence permit for a country that is part of the Schengen
                            area. Do I need another visa to travel to other Schengen states?
faqs.answer:
No. A long stay visa or a residence permit issued by a Schengen State allows you to travel or
                                stay in other Schengen States, while respecting the maximum duration of a “short stay” (a
                                stay of "90 days in any 180 day period")

faqs.question: My family is also applying for a Greece Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question: Which countries are part of the Schengen Area?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen area covers 26 countries ("Schengen States") without border controls between them.
                                These countries are: Austria, Belgium, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France,
                                Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta,
                                the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden and Switzerland.
                                These countries apply the common visa policy for short stay Visas. This Visa allows you to
                                travel through Greece and the Schengen area for up to 90 days.

faqs.question:
I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first port
                                of entry.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation, travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question:
I am a family member of an EU-citizen. Are the standard requirements applicable to
                            me?
faqs.answer:
Family members of EU citizens who have exercised their right of free movement (meaning that the
                                EU citizen resides in or travels to a Member State other than his/her country of origin)
                                benefit from certain procedural facilitations. The basic criteria to be fulfilled are the
                                following: the EU citizen has exercised his/her right of free movement the family member (applicant) belongs to one of the categories covered by Directive 2004/38/EC the family member (applicant) accompanies the EU citizen or joins him/her in the Schengen
                                    State of destination.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Greece Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years period.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: What are the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question: Can you process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa, you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

faqs.question: Do I need a South Africa Visa?
faqs.answer:
All Indian Citizens require a visa to travel to South Africa, whether for business or tourism.

                                the entire visa application.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in South Africa?
faqs.answer:
You can stay for a maximum period of 90 days in South Africa, however the grant & validity of
                                South Africa Visa is solely at the discretion of the Embassy.

faqs.question: What is a South Africa Visa?
faqs.answer:
A South Africa Visa is a stamp or endorsement placed by officials of South Africa on a passport
                                that allows the bearer to visit South Africa. Visas are obtained from the Embassy or consulates
                                of South Africa for your visit. "Visit" is further defined as the reason for entry, usually
                                business, tourist or transitory.

faqs.question: How long does it take to process the South Africa Visa?
faqs.answer:
Minimum processing time for Delhi and Mumbai is 05 working days and for other locations is 07
                                working days from the date your visa application reaches the South Africa High Commission,
                                New Delhi / South African Consulate General, Mumbai. The processing time for a visa is dependent
                                on several factors and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion

faqs.question: What funds do I need to show in my bank statement at the time of applying for a South African Visa?
faqs.answer:
You need to show at least South African Currency R 3000 or equivalent in INR for Delhi and Mumbai
                                at the time of applying for your South Africa Visa.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a South Africa Visa?
faqs.answer:
You are strongly encouraged to file your South Africa Visa application at least 20 working days
                                prior to the date of departure and not more than 60 days before departure. This will allow
                                an orderly examination of your application and limit the chances for delay in decisions on
                                visa applications.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the South Africa Visa Application centre for my visa application?
faqs.answer:
No, you don’t need to visit the South African Visa Application centre personally. We will simplify
                                the visa process for you. Applying for a South Africa Visa through us will be an easy and
                                hassle free process as we will take care of your complete visa process right from getting
                                your documents ready to stamping of your South Africa Visa.

faqs.question: Is Yellow Fever Certificate mandatory while applying for my South Africa Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yellow Fever certificate will be required if the applicant will travel through or stay in yellow
                                fever belt.

faqs.question: Is South Africa Visa tracking possible and if yes, how do I to track my South Africa Visa status?
faqs.answer:
Yes, South Africa Visa tracking is possible on the VFS South Africa website. You can track your
                                South Africa visa status by entering your Reference Number and your date of birth.

faqs.question: Do you provide health/travel insurance?
faqs.answer:
You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself in South Africa
                                as medical treatment can be very expensive in South Africa. We can certainly assist you with
                                the travel insurance as it’s an absolute necessity for International travel in the event
                                of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Burundi?
faqs.answer: Yes.Indian citizens are required to obtain a visa prior to entering the Republic of Burundi.Visas may be obtained from the Embassy of Burundi in India. Based on the purpose of your visit to Burundi you may apply for a Business Visa, Tourist Visa, Visit Visa, Official Visa, Diplomatic Visa, Student/Research Visa, Transit Visa, Crew Visa& many more. Before applying for a visa please check which visa type you are eligible to apply for.

faqs.answer: Choose your preferred type of burundi visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: What are the different types of Burundi Visas?
faqs.answer: Tourist Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to enter Burundi for tourism, leisure, visit or business. Transit Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to transit through Burundi within a period of three to four days.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Burundivisa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Burundi visa is two months before the date of travel to the country.In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted ten days, prior to travelling.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Burundi visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: This visa is valid for 30 days. Visas can be extended on request. However the final decision lies with the Immigration officials in Burundi.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Burundi visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa application is normally processed within 15 working days.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Burundi visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: Why are you visiting burundi How long you intend to stay in burundi How will you support yourself during your time in burundi What is the purpose of your visit to burundi Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to burundi If you have a permit to burundi the country you intend to travel to after your stay in burundi

faqs.question: How do I receive my Burundi visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will bestamped on your passport.

faqs.question: Is it possible to obtain a visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: No. Indians travelling to Burundi must obtain a visa before their arrival in the country. Visa on arrival service is not available for Indian nationals.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Burundi once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once

faqs.question: Do I need any specific vaccinations?
faqs.answer: Yes. As per the BurundiVisa requirements, a yellow fever vaccination is mandatory. The certificate of the same is required to be attached along with other documents when applying for the visa.

faqs.question: How long is my vaccination certificate valid for?
faqs.answer: A certificate for yellow fever vaccination has a validity lasting up to 10 years. It must be counted 10 days post the date of vaccination.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Consulate/Embassy to submit my documents?
faqs.answer: No. You are not required to visit theBurundi Embassy personally. We will submit the visa application on your behalf.

faqs.question: What if my Burundi visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Burundivisa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Burundi tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country ona Burundi tourist visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the event of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: What is the easiest way to get a Burundi Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Contact our Visa Experts and apply for your Burundivisa instantly with minimum documents and lowest visa fee. No need to visit our office and no need to deal with the Embassy. We do it all for you.

faqs.answer: Please feel free to contact us for all your BurundiVisa worries. We have you covered across India with presence in all the major cities like Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, Bangalore, Chennai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and many more. faqs.question: What is a Portugal Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Portugal Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the Schengen
                                countries including Portugal for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s
                                dream where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along
                                with Portugal.

faqs.question: Who issues Visas for Portugal in India?
faqs.answer:
In India, The Embassy of Portugal in New Delhi and The Consulate General of Portugal in Goa are
                                the sole representatives of Portugal, who issue visas for their country.

faqs.question: Is the visa valid for Portugal only?
faqs.answer:
The Embassy and Consulate General of Portugal issues visas for Portugal and Schengen visa which
                                is common to all Schengen States. The Schengen visa issued by the Embassy/Consulate gives
                                an applicant access to 26 Schengen countries in totality. However, the Schengen Visa applications will only be accepted by Portugal Visa Application
                                Centre if Portugal is the country of maximum stay. Should the duration of the stay be the
                                same in several Schengen States, then Portugal must be the first point of entry.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all 26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Portugal), unless it is marked
                                otherwise on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European
                                territory of Portugal. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the
                                reasons of your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following
                                countries: Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany,
                                Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands,
                                Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number of
                                entries".

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer:
You may appeal against this decision. The decision to refuse a Schengen visa and the reasons
                                for the refusal are notified using a standard form that is handed out by the Member State's
                                consulate that refused the visa. The notification of the refusal must include the reasons,
                                on which the refusal were based, and the procedures and deadlines for submitting an appeal.
                                You are free to re-apply again if your application has been refused earlier. However, it
                                is recommended that you take note of the reasons for the earlier refusal before submitting
                                a new application and make amendments, where necessary. The visa fee is not refunded if the visa is refused. The visa fee covers the cost of the
                                examination of the visa application.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: - the purpose of your trip - when and where you intend to travel - how your trip is going to be funded - day-by-day itinerary for your trip - duration of the trip

faqs.question: As a Portugal short-stay visa holder can I extend my Schengen Visa while in Portugal?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your Portugal short-stay while in Portugal except in special circumstances,
                                and exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and apply
                                for another Portugal Visa if necessary.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the visa.

faqs.question:
If my Portugal short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long
                            can I remain in the Portugal territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Portugal territory for a maximum
                                period of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 5-15 working days from your appointment
                                date.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain a Portugal Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Portugal Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 10 to 15 days to process in the
                                Portugal Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Portugal Visa is dependent on several
                                factors and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion. This period may be extended
                                up to 30 days or 60 days.

faqs.question: What is the role of VFS?
faqs.answer:
VFS Global Services Pvt Ltd (VFS) is the Service Delivery Provider for the Embassy of Portugal
                                in Delhi. The role of VFS is to accept visa applications and to dispatch passports and documents
                                back to clients, on behalf of the Embassy of Portugal. VFS does not play any part in or influence
                                the outcome of your visa application.

faqs.question: What proof will I have that the Portugal Visa Application Centre has my visa application?
faqs.answer:
When your application is registered in the VFS system, you will be issued a receipt for the fees
                                that you have paid and an acknowledgement receipt of the acceptance of your passport will
                                be given to you.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my Portugal Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Portugal visa application online using the Portugal VFS Reference
                                number and Date of Birth. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of the Portugal
                                VFS website.

faqs.question: Will I get my visa at the end of the process?
faqs.answer:
As an application centre, the Portugal Visa Application Centre (VFS) will not be able to guarantee
                                you a visa. The issuance or refusal of a Portugal visa is the sole prerogative of The Embassy/Consulate
                                General of Portugal. The Portugal Visa Application Centre cannot influence this decision
                                in any way.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Portugal Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Portugal Visa in order to provide your biometrics and submit
                                your visa documents.

faqs.question: Is Personal Interview mandatory for Portugal Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Personal Interview is mandatory for all first time travellers and applicants who haven’t
                                travelled to any Schengen country in the last 3 years.

faqs.question:
I have a valid long stay visa/residence permit for a country that is part of the Schengen
                            area. Do I need another visa to travel to other Schengen states?
faqs.answer:
No. A long stay visa or a residence permit issued by a Schengen State allows you to travel or
                                stay in other Schengen States, while respecting the maximum duration of a “short stay” (a
                                stay of "90 days in any 180 day period")

faqs.question: My family is also applying for a Portugal Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question: Which countries are part of the Schengen Area?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen area covers 26 countries ("Schengen States") without border controls between them.
                                These countries are: Austria, Belgium, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France,
                                Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta,
                                the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden and Switzerland.
                                These countries apply the common visa policy for short stay Visas. This Visa allows you to
                                travel through Portugal and the Schengen area for up to 90 days.

faqs.question:
I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first port
                                of entry.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation, travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question:
I am a family member of an EU-citizen. Are the standard requirements applicable to
                            me?
faqs.answer:
Family members of EU citizens who have exercised their right of free movement (meaning that the
                                EU citizen resides in or travels to a Member State other than his/her country of origin)
                                benefit from certain procedural facilitations. The basic criteria to be fulfilled are the
                                following: the EU citizen has exercised his/her right of free movement the family member (applicant) belongs to one of the categories covered by Directive 2004/38/EC the family member (applicant) accompanies the EU citizen or joins him/her in the Schengen
                                    State of destination.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Portugal Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years period.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: What are the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question: Can you process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa, you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Uganda?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Uganda. All visitors from India need to obtain entry visas online, prior to arrival. It is the simplest and the fastest way to get your visa. Once your visa application is approved, you will receive the visa approval via email right in your inbox. The type of visa to enter Uganda will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: What is an eVisa?
faqs.answer: An Electronic Visa or "e Visa" is an electronically issued and stored authority for travel to The Republic of Uganda, which replaces the traditional paper visa process in most cases, relieving applicants from necessity to stand in queues in Uganda consulates or at the border.

faqs.question: What is a Uganda eVisa?
faqs.answer: AnUganda visa is a legal document which lawfully allows its holder to enter and stay within the country for a certain number of days as mentioned on the visa.Indians are now eligible for an eVisa,

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Uganda Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Tourist and business single entry visas are only valid up to three (3) months upon arrival. For all the multiple entry visas, however, you can be granted validity for either six months, one year or 2 years after arrival.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for a Multiple entry visa?
faqs.answer: There are three sub-categories; 6 months and 12 months and 24 months First time applicants can only be granted a 6 months Multiple-Entry Visa and must have proof of having travelled to Uganda, at least five times within a period of one year immediately preceding their application. They should always ensure to apply for a 6 months Multiple-Entry Visa. They will be able to apply for more time upon expiration of the 6 months. Applicants who have continually travelled to Uganda over a period of more than one year can apply for a period exceeding 6 months, that is, 12 and 24 months. And they must also have proof of continuous legal travel in and out of the country to that effect. For any of the applications, whether 6 months or more, one must have proof of continuous travel into the country in the stated period of time if their application to be considered. Any person who applies for a period beyond which they do not qualify, will if approved, only be granted a visa commensurate to the time they qualify for.

faqs.question: What is the eVisa processing time?
faqs.answer: The Uganda visa is processed online within 10 working days.

faqs.question: How will I receive the Uganda visa online?
faqs.answer: The decision taken on the application will be sent electronically through the email provided by the applicant.If approved, an approval letter will be sent as an attachment to the email provided. The eVisa must be presented upon crossing the state border of Uganda along with the valid travel document.

faqs.question: When can the earliest possible application be made for a Uganda visa online?
faqs.answer: We recommend that you apply for eVisa online at least 10 days prior to your entry in Uganda. However it is not possible to apply more than 30 days before your date of entry to Uganda.

faqs.question: Which are the entry requirements after you arrive in Uganda?
faqs.answer: Passport valid for at least 6 months beyond your intended stay period Printed Uganda visa approval Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Uganda Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to your business trip Note: It should be noted that the possession of Visa is not a final authority to enter the Republic of Uganda. The Immigration Officer at the Entry point may refuse a holder of visa to enter, if he is satisfied that the holder is unable to fulfil Immigration entry requirements or if the presence of such person or visitors in the United Republic of Uganda would be contrary to the National Interests.

faqs.answer: Yes. Each traveller must have a separate e-Visa.

faqs.question: Can I get a refund if I do not use my visa?
faqs.answer: No. We cannot refund payments for unused e-Visas. The fee is a processing fee.

faqs.question: Do I need any vaccination while travelling to Uganda?
faqs.answer: All travellers to the Republic of Uganda must have a valid Yellow Fever Immunization certificate. Vaccination is required at the time of visa application and during travel to Uganda.

faqs.question: Do I need travel or medical insurance plan?

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Tunisia?
faqs.answer: Indian citizens do not require a visa to travel to Tunisia for tourism purpose.Stay in Tunisia should not exceed three months. However, Indians are required to obtain a visa in advance, if the purpose of travel is other than tourist i.e. business, transit etc. Visas may be obtained from the Embassy of Tunisia in India. Before applying for a visa please check which visa type you are eligible to apply for.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Tunisia without a visa?
faqs.answer: You can stay in Tunisia for up to 3 months without requiring a visa, provided your purpose of travel is tourism only.

faqs.question: What are entry requirements for visitors entering Tunisia?
faqs.answer: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry Dully filled Immigration Card pay online Dully filled Immigration Card Dully filled Immigration Card Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Tunisia Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to your business visa

faqs.question: What are the different types of Tunisia Visas?
faqs.answer: Tourist Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to enter Tunisia for tourism, leisure or visiting relatives and friends Business Visa: This visa is issued for a short visit to conduct discussions, negotiations, and/or presentations, but not to take up employment. Transit Visa: Transit visa allows a visitors to travel across or through Tunisia on way to another country. Commonly, it allows the in-transit passenger to go out of an airport or port for an overnight stay.

faqs.question: How do I receive my Tunisia visa online?

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Tunisia visa application?

faqs.question: Do I need Tourist visa for Dubai from India?
faqs.answer:
Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visa to visit Dubai.

faqs.question: Can I get Dubai Visa on Arrival?

                                Permit and the EU Resident Permit must be valid for at least six months from the date of
                                arrival into the UAE. The Dubai visa on arrival will be valid for 14 days, extendable for a
                                similar period one time only. The validity of the passport must be not less than six
                                months and the fee for an entry permit will be Dirham 100 (Rs 1,750).

White and black photo won’t be accepted Taken against a plain white background Taken within the last 3 months Your head should face the camera directly. It should not be tilted or turned, even

faqs.question: Is the Dubai visa for Indians a single entry or valid for multiple entries?

faqs.question:
What is the relationship between the validity of a Dubai Visa, number of entries and
                            duration of stay?
faqs.answer:
Validity of a Dubai Tourist Visa refers to the period within which the visa holder is
                                    allowed to enter Dubai. The number of entries refers to the number of times the visa holder is permitted to
                                    enter Dubai within the visa’s validity. Duration of stay refers to the longest period the visa holder is allowed to stay in
                                    Dubai on each visit, and this is counted from the day following entry into Dubai. When all the permitted entries are used up, the Dubai visa for Indians will no longer be valid. Even
                                    if there are unused entries, the visa will no longer be valid if the validity has
                                    already expired. In either case, the visa holder should apply for a new visa if
                                    another visit to Dubai is planned. The holder of a tourist visa for Dubai from India is eligible to enter Dubai at any time prior to the expiry
                                        of its validity provided that permitted entries on the visa have not been used
                                        up; the holder’s planned duration of stay in Dubai must not exceed the duration
                                        stated on the visa.

faqs.question: How will I receive the Dubai Tourist Visa?
faqs.answer:

                                Visa at all times during your trip.

faqs.question: Is the Dubai Visa price inclusive of all charges?

faqs.answer: You will be liable to pay a heavy penalty for overstaying the Dubai Tourist visa.

faqs.question: What is OK to Board (OTB)?
faqs.answer:
Ok to Board is a verification procedure undertaken by the airline to check the
                                authenticity of your Dubai visa. OTB is a message entered in the airline’s reservation
                                system against your PNR number. It means that your paper-based visa (one that is not
                                stamped in the passport) has been inspected and validated, and that airline check-in
                                staff can issue you a boarding pass and allow you to board the flight.

faqs.question: Why is OK to Board required?
faqs.answer:
Typically, if an airline lets a passenger without a valid Dubai visa and OTB to board a flight,
                                they will be fined by the authorities in UAE, and will also be made to bear the cost of
                                repatriating the offender. To combat this, airline check-in staff ensures that the
                                passenger has a valid passport and Dubai visa prior to issuing a boarding pass.

faqs.question: Is Ok to Board mandatory?
faqs.answer:
Due to an increase in fake visas to the UAE, many Indian passengers were deported back to
                                India in the past. To minimize the fake visa issues, airlines flying to the UAE re-check the
                                applicant’s Dubai visa and the return airline ticket before the departure to the UAE.

faqs.question: What happens if the OTB status is not updated?
faqs.answer:
The Airline will not allow you to board the flight. You may also not get any refund for
                                your flight ticket.

faqs.question: Why was my Dubai Visa rejected?
faqs.answer:

                                number of reasons. The most common Dubai visa rejections are: Errors in the Dubai Visa Application Blurred Photograph Criminal Record (past or current) Prior Employment Visa Previous Dubai Visa unused Profession in the Passport Single Lady Traveller

Make sure that your previous visa is not valid before applying for a new Dubai visa. The final decision about approval and rejection of your Dubai tourist visa rests with the Dubai
                                Immigration. If you are unsure about the Dubai visa online application process, it would be best to

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a Visa to travel to Seychelles?
faqs.answer: No, Indian citizens do not require a visa to enter Seychelles for a short stay. A visitor’s permit is issued on arrival in Seychelles to travelers visiting for the purposes of holiday, business, visiting friends or family.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for Seychelles visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Travellers must meet the following criteria: Is not a prohibited immigrant Is not a holder of a valid permit which entitles the holder to reside in Seychelles Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry and with two blank pages within Return ticket to your country Confirmation of accommodation for duration of your visit Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Seychelles (Approximately US$50 per day) Detailed itinerary of your trip

faqs.question: How long is the Seychelles Permit valid for?
faqs.answer: Indians will be issued a Visitor’s Permit valid for a stay of up to 30 days. The stay can be extended in 3 month increments to an aggregate stay of 1 year.

faqs.question: Is my permit valid for the whole of Seychelles?
faqs.answer: Yes. The permit is valid for the whole of Seychelles.

faqs.question: Can Indians apply for the Visitor Permit in advance before travel?

faqs.question: Is there any fear of Seychelles Visitor Permit rejection?
faqs.answer: Indians are not liable to face a rejection. However, the above said documents are necessary to enter the country. Failure to produce any of the documents may result into rejection of the Visitor permit, thereby barring you from entering the country. The final decision to grant an entry permit is solely at the discretion of the Immigration officials at Seychelles airport.

faqs.answer: Foreign nationals of any country do not need to apply for a Comoros visa in advance. They can get a Comoros visa upon arrival in Comoros provided they have the valid travel documents. Thevisa application is done when your flight lands in Comoros.

faqs.question: What is the basic requirement for Comoros visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: A valid passport for at least six (6) months beyond the intended period of stay,approval letter from the Embassy/Consulate, a ticket for return or onward travel to another country and sufficient funds are required

faqs.question: Do I need to fulfil any pre-arrival formalities for obtaining Comoros Visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Indian nationals must obtain the approval letter from the Comoros Embassy or Consulate to be issued a visa on arrival. Applicants are advised to carry the approval letter along with their passport to be presented to the Immigration officials.

faqs.answer: Why are you visiting comoros How long you intend to stay in comoros How will you support yourself during your time in comoros What is the purpose of your visit to comoros Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to comoros If you have a permit to comoros the country you intend to travel to after your stay in comoros

faqs.answer: The Comoros visa on arrival is EUR 30 / USD 50 for stays up to 45 days.

faqs.question: Is a transit visa required in Comoros?
faqs.answer: Travellers who transit via Comoros do not need a transit visa.

faqs.question: What is the duration of transit in Comoros?
faqs.answer: The duration of transit permitted to travellers is for a maximum of 24 hours only.

faqs.question: Do I have to pay a transit fee?
faqs.answer: No. There is no transit fee applicable. Thus, it is free for travellers for a maximum period of 24 hours only.

faqs.question: On what circumstances can I be denied a Visa on Arrival?
faqs.answer: The Comoros visa for Indians can be denied on arrival if he/she doesn't have necessary documents such as a passport with minimum 6 months validity, approval letter from the Consulate of India,proof of accommodation, sufficient funds and possession of a return ticket with full-fledged travel itinerary. Comoros visa rejection or approval is wholly a decision by the immigration authorities in Comoros.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the event of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Consulate/Embassy to submit my documents?
faqs.answer: No. You are not required to visit the ComorosnConsulate/Embassy personally. We will submit the visa application on your behalf.

faqs.question: What if my Comoros visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy of Comoros, New Delhi, has the final call when it comes to a Comorosvisa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Comoros tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country ona Comoros tourist visa.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for Mauritius visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Travellers must meet the following criteria: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry and with two blank pages within Return ticket to your country Confirmation of accommodation for duration of your stay Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Mauritius(cash, debit/credit cards etc) Detailed itinerary of your trip Invitation letter from Mauritius company and any additional original documents to supplement your purpose of visit (for business travelers)

faqs.question: Is there any fear of Mauritius visa rejection?

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Moldova from India?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Moldova. A Moldova tourist visa is most appropriate for Indians travelling to the Moldova for business and recreational purposes such as holidaying, sightseeing, or even short family visits. The type of visa to enter Moldova will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration. Indian passport holders travelling to Moldova for tourist purposes can apply for Moldova visa online. Once your visa application is approved, you will receive the visa copy via email right in your inbox.

faqs.question: Can I apply for Moldova Visa online?
faqs.answer: Yes. Moldova visa for Indians can be acquired in a breeze with the convenience of online Moldova Visa application processes. The Moldova Embassy has launched a new online visa system, wherein you can submit an application and receive your Moldova visa entirely online – without having to submit your passport for stamping.

faqs.question: Is Moldova visa an eVisa?
faqs.answer: Yes. An eVisa is an authorization to enter Moldova issued in PDF format. An eVisa grants the same right to enter Moldovan territory, as ordinary sticker-visa in the passport.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Moldova eVisas available for Indians?
faqs.answer: Indians travelling to Moldova can choose from Type (C) 90-day tourist visas or Type (C) 90-day business visas depending on their reason for travel. However, only short stay visas (type C) can be obtained online through the electronic system. For other types of visas such as A, B, D visa types, travelers need to submit their application to the Moldovan Embassy in India.

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a stamped visa or an e-Visa?
faqs.answer: Indians travelling to Moldova are required to obtain an e-Visa only.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Moldovan e-visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The Moldovan e-visa is valid for up to 90 days.

faqs.question: What is the Moldovan visa processing time?
faqs.answer: The processing time for a Moldovan visa application is up to 10 to 20 working days from the date of submission to the Embassy.

faqs.question: Who issues the Moldova eVisa?
faqs.answer: The General Consular Directorate of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and European Integration of the Republic of Moldova in cooperation with other relevant authorities issues the eVisa.

faqs.question: How will I receive the eVisa?
faqs.answer: In the legally designated time, the applicant will be notified via e-mail about the outcome of the review application. In case of approval, the applicant will receive eVisa in PDF format.

faqs.question: Is a Moldovan e-Visa the same as a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: No. Moldova is not part of the Schengen states. Hence, it must not be mistaken for a Schengen Visa.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a Moldovan e-Visa and a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: A Schengen visa is a short-stay visa that allows a person to travel to any of the 26 members of the Schengen area. Hence, one visa allows travel to all the listed countries. A Moldovan e-Visa allows travel only within the Moldovan region and does not legally allow travelling to a Schengen country unless a tourist holds a valid Schengen visa.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Ghana?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indians need a visa to travel to Ghana. Ghana visa for Indians can be obtained at the Ghana Embassy or Consulate. In order to get visa Ghana from India, it is necessary to fulfil the visa requirements and submit the necessary documents. A Ghana visa for Indians can be private, tourist, business and work – depending on the purpose of a visit.

faqs.question: What is a Ghana visa?
faqs.answer: It is a conditional approval of the request to enter Ghana for the stipulated number of days.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Ghana visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straightforward and effortless process to apply for Ghana visa online through Akbar Travels. - Choose your preferred type of Ghana visa based on your travel type - Pay online - Submit documents through our pick up & drop service - Receive your visa once approved!

faqs.question: What are the different categories of Ghana visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Indians travelling to Ghana can choose from single entry three months tourist visa or three months business visa, or multiple entry six months or one-year business visa depending on their purpose of the travel. Tourist visa is for those who would like to go sightseeing, recreation or visit friends and families in Ghana. Business visa is ideal for the ones attending meetings, conferences or business events in Ghana.

faqs.question: What is the Ghana visa processing time?
faqs.answer: Typically, it takes 3-5 working days to process an application for a Ghana visa.

faqs.question: What kind of entry is Ghana visa for Indians valid?
faqs.answer: In most cases, a single entry is granted unless multiple entries are requested.

faqs.question: Is the Ghana visa fee inclusive of all charges?
faqs.answer: No, it is exclusive of taxes and is subject to change depending on the Embassy’s directive.

faqs.question: Do I need to submit my passport along with my application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Ghana visa is a vignette that is placed on an empty page of a passport. Therefore, the original passport with two consecutive blank pages is required.

faqs.question: Is the Ghana visa valid for the whole of Ghana?
faqs.answer: Yes, the visa is valid for travel throughout Ghana, subject to Embassy directives.

faqs.question: Can I extend a Ghana visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can request Immigration Headquarters or the nearest Regional Commands of the Service to extend your visa. The approval of extension is subject to the officer’s decisions and Embassy directives.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for Ghana visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: -why are you visiting Ghana -how long you intend to stay in Ghana -how will you support yourself during your time in Ghana -what is the purpose of your visit to Ghana -type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid -where do you intend to travel following your visit to Ghana -if you have a permit to enter the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Ghana

faqs.question: Can I get a Ghana visa while in the country?
faqs.answer: No, you cannot get a Ghana visa while in the country.

faqs.question: From when is my visa valid?
faqs.answer: Your visa is valid from the date your visa was issued. It should not be calculated from the date of entry into Ghana.

faqs.question: What if my Ghana visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The High Commission of the Republic of Ghana, New Delhi, is responsible for approval and rejection of Ghana visa applications from India. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final, and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: Do I need travel or medical insurance?
faqs.answer: It is wise to purchase medical insurance to cover unforeseen medical emergencies in Ghana. Akbar Travels can assist you with the best possible travel insurance to insure yourself against medical emergencies during travel, damage and loss of baggage while applying for your Ghana visa online.

faqs.question: What else do I need to know about the Ghana tourist visa from India?
faqs.answer: The Ghana visa for Indians is not replaceable; upon loss of this visa, a new one will need to be applied for. Please bear in mind, that the tourist visa, cannot function as a transit visa, or as a proof of entry for other purposes like business, work or internships.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Iraq from India?
faqs.answer: Yes.Indian citizens are required to obtain a visa prior to entering the Republic of Iraq.Visas may be obtained from the Embassy of Iraq in India. The Embassy does not issue tourist visas. Applicants can only travel to Iraq for business purpose.

faqs.answer: Approved applicants will be issued single-entry visas valid for three months from the date of issuance. In some cases, multi entry-visas valid for six months and one year will be granted.

faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for an Iraq visa is three months before the intended date of travel to the country. In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted at least fifteen days prior to travelling.

faqs.question: Are the Iraq visa fees inclusive of all charges?
faqs.answer: The Iraq Visa fees are exclusive of taxes and are subject to change as per the Embassy’s notification.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get an Iraq visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Iraq Visa application is normally processed within 12 working days.

faqs.question: Which are the necessary documents required to be presented on arrival in Iraq?
faqs.answer: Passport valid for at least 6 months from your date of entry. Valid Iraq visa Boarding Pass Return ticket to your country or next destination Accommodation proof or invitation letter for family visits Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Iraq (cash, debit/credit card etc) Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to business trip (invitation letter, business card etc) Note: It should be noted that the possession of Visa is not a final authority to enter the Republic of Iraq. The Immigration Officer at the Entry point may refuse a holder of visa to enter, if he is satisfied that the holder is unable to fulfil Immigration entry requirements or if the presence of such person or visitors in the Republic of Iraq would be contrary to the National Interests

faqs.question: What is the Iraq visa photo size requirement?
faqs.answer: The Iraq visa photo must meet the requirements described below. If not, the application will be delayed until you provide correct photos. Photo must be 45 mm X 35 mm in size The face should cover 80% of the photo In colour. White and black photo won’t be accepted Taken against a plain white background Taken within the last 3 months Your head should face the camera directly. It should not be tilted or turned, even slightly The head must be centred in the image. You must look directly at the camera and show your full face Do not wear sunglasses or tinted/coloured glasses. you normally wear glasses, your eyes must be clearly visible in the photo The photo must be different from the passport photo.

faqs.question: What type of entry does the business visa provide?
faqs.answer: There are single and multiple-entry options for anIraq Visa. The entry type will depend upon the type of visa you apply for.

faqs.question: What is the relationship between the validity of anIraq Visa, number of entries and duration of stay?
faqs.answer: Validity of anIraq Visa refers to the period within which the visa holder is allowed to enter Iraq. The number of entries refers to the number of times the visa holder is permitted to enter Iraq within the visa’s validity. One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Iraq only once. Whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once within the visa validity. Duration of stay refers to the longest period the visa holder is allowed to stay in Iraq on each visit, and this is counted from the day following entry into Iraq. When all the permitted entries are used up, the visa will no longer be valid. Even if there are unused entries, the visa will no longer be valid if the validity has already expired. In either case, the visa holder should apply for a new visa if another visit to Iraq is planned. The holder of a visa is eligible to enter Iraq at any time prior to the expiry of its validity provided that permitted entries on the visa have not been used up; the holder’s planned duration of stay in Iraq must not exceed the duration stated on the visa.

faqs.question: Are there any chances of my Iraq visa application getting rejected?
faqs.answer: Yes. Like other country visas, your visa application for Iraqcan be rejected for a number of reasons. The most common Iraq visa rejection reasons are: Invalid and damaged Passport Incomplete Visa Application form Applied Wrong visa category Incomplete documents submitted Intention of returning to home country not clear Purpose of travel not clear Insufficient bank balance Criminal history

                                        If you hope of getting that refusal overturned, or a second application approved or above all just get the Iraq Business visa successfully in the first attempt itself, here are some of the things that you can do to avoid anIraq visa rejection: Make sure your passport meets the standard requirements for applying for Iraq visa online It is really important that you provide all the documents required for your application. Different visa categories require several supporting documents, so it is important to make sure your application is specific to you, and that nothing is missed out. Be clear on your purpose of visit. If travelling for business purpose; specify that and submit documents supporting your business visit such as invitation letter etc Apply for the correct visa category. Make sure that your previous visa is not valid before applying for a new Iraq visa. Submit confirmed return tickets as an assurance that you will return back to your home country & your purpose of travel is temporary. Seek assistance from a reliable travel agent to process your application smoothly without any hiccups. They are professionals who have the right training and knowledge to guide you correctly.

faqs.answer: You will be liable to pay a heavy penalty for overstaying the Iraqvisa. Applicants must take careful note of the validity of their visa and make sure not to overstay, as anyone in breach of the immigration act may be prosecuted and subject to a term of imprisonment or fine or both and also face a ban from entering Iraq.

faqs.answer: All Indian nationals wishing to travel to Kenya will need an e- Visa.

faqs.question: Who needs to obtain an e-Visa?

Once the Kenya E-Visa gets issued it will be sent immediately to your email. You must print a

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Kenya eVisa?
faqs.answer:
An eVisa to Kenya once issued is valid for 3 months before you travel. Once you present yourself
                                to immigration control at the port of entry, you may be issued with a stay period not exceeding
                                90 days, which may be renewed for a further 90 days at the immigration headquarters. The
                                maximum number of days a visitor may stay in Kenya is 6 months.

faqs.answer:
No, once the application has been submitted to the Kenyan government, the eVisa application fees

faqs.answer:
Yes, when your visa is used or expired you need to apply for another visa in order to travel
                                to Kenya again.

faqs.question: Can I extend my stay in Kenya?
faqs.answer:
After the initial days allocated by the immigration control at the port of entry have elapsed,
                                you renew your visa at the immigration headquarters in Nairobi. The maximum number of days
                                a visitor may stay in Kenya is 6 months.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Kenya eVisas?
faqs.answer:
There are three e-visa types for people traveling to the Republic of Kenya temporarily: 1. Single Entry visa Issued for single entry to persons whose nationalities require a visa to enter Kenya either for
