                                hours. Those connecting flights directly without leaving the airport dont need to apply for
                                Transit visas. 3. Courtesy visa Issued to Diplomatic, Official and Service passport holders coming into the country on official
                                duties or transiting through Kenya to a third country for official business or duties. It
                                is also issued to government officials and dignitaries on official duties but holding ordinary
                                passports. It is issued free of charge / gratis Do I have to submit my passport for stamping before I travel? No, you will receive an electronic visa, which does not require anything to be stamped in your
                                passport ahead of travel. All Kenya eVisas are sent by email. You should print out a copy
                                of your Visa before you travel, and carry it with you. What are the benefits of applying for Kenya visa through Akbar Travels? By contacting Akbar Travels for your visa application, you can eliminate the need for personally
                                visiting the Embassy for your application. All you will have to do is apply online on our
                                website and get your visa processed within the set timeframe. Minimal documentation and quick
                                processing is another of the key highlights. In most case, the visa processing takes only
                                2-3 working days. Do I need to personally visit the Kenya Consulate/Embassy to get my Visa? No. You do not need to visit the Consulate/Embassy. We will take care of the complete visa process
                                right from verifying your documents to approval of your eVisa. On arrival into Kenya, what documents do I need to present? At entry, you must show that you have a valid hotel booking, confirmed return tickets and sufficient
                                cash in addition to your valid passport and e-Visa. Do I need to take a health/travel insurance? You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself in Kenya as
                                medical treatment can be very expensive in Kenya. Your travel insurance offers protection
                                against unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses,
                                flight delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer. What is the easiest way to apply for a Kenya Visa? The easiest way to apply for a Kenya Visa is to contact us. We are experts in the travel and
                                tourism sector with over 40 years of experience. Through our expertise, in-depth knowledge
                                and integrity, we commit to delivering an exceptional experience to our customers each and
                                every time you use our service. We are available by phone and e-mail on all 7 days of the
                                week. In order to help us understand your unique visa needs, please drop in your query and
                                our Visa Expert will get in touch with you.

faqs.question: What is a Spain Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Spain Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the Schengen
                                countries including Spain for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s dream
                                where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along with Spain.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries??
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all 26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Spain), unless it is marked otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European territory
                                of Spain. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons of your
                                stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following countries: Austria,
                                Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland,
                                Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland,
                                Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number of
                                entries".

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer: You are free to apply again for a Schengen Visa if your application has been refused earlier.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: - the purpose of your trip - when and where you intend to travel - how your trip is going to be funded - day-by-day itinerary for your trip - duration of the trip

faqs.question: As a Spain short-stay visa holder can I extend my Schengen Visa while in Spain?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your Spain short-stay while in Spain except in special circumstances, and exceeding
                                your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or criminality. Instead,
                                you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and apply for another
                                Spain Visa if necessary.

faqs.question:
If my Spain short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long can
                            I remain in the Spain territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Spain territory for a maximum period
                                of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 5-15 working days from your appointment
                                date.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain a Spain Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Spain Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 10 to 15 days to process in the Spain
                                Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Spain Visa is dependent on several factors and
                                can change without notice at the consulate's discretion.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my Spain Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Spain visa application online using the Spain BLS Reference
                                number and Date of Birth. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of the BLS Spain
                                website.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Spain Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Spain Visa in order to provide your biometrics and submit
                                your visa documents.

faqs.question: My family is also applying for the Spain Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question: Which countries are part of the Schengen Area?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen area covers 26 countries ("Schengen States") without border controls between them.
                                These countries are: Austria, Belgium, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France,
                                Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta,
                                the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden and Switzerland.
                                These countries apply the common visa policy for short stay Visas. This Visa allows you to
                                travel through Spain and the Schengen area for up to 90 days.

faqs.question:
I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first port
                                of entry.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation, travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Spain Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years period.

faqs.question: What is the role of BLS?
faqs.answer:
BLS is the outsourced partner to the Embassy of Spain and the Consulate General of Spain in India.
                                The Spain Visa Application Centre of BLS functions as a collection and processing centre
                                to guarantee a better service in response to the growing demand for Spanish visas from applicants
                                residing in India. BLS does not play any part in or influence the outcome of your visa application.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: What are the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question: Can you process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa, you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Georgia from India?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Georgia. Indians are eligible for an eVisa. The electronic visa system (eVisa) will allow Indians to receive Georgia visa online, relieving them from necessity to submit original documents or visit Georgian Embassy or Consular Office.Once your visa application is approved, you will receive the visa copy via email right in your inbox.

faqs.question: What is an eVisa?
faqs.answer: An Electronic Visa or "e Visa" is an electronically issued and stored authority for travel to The Republic of Georgia, which replaces the traditional paper visa process in most cases.

faqs.question: What is a Georgia eVisa?
faqs.answer: A Georgia visa is a legal document which lawfully allows its holder to enter and stay within the country for a certain number of days as mentioned on the visa.After receiving your Visa through email, print it out and carry it along when you travel to Georgia.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Georgia visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: A Georgia visa is most appropriate for Indians travelling to Georgiafor short term purposes such as holidaying, sightseeing, business activities or short family visits. The type of visa to enter Georgia will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Georgia visas for Indians?
faqs.answer: Short stay – Indians who are visiting Georgia for short-stay purposes must apply for an ordinary visa. An ordinary visa shall be issued, to persons arriving in Georgia for tourism purposes; to persons arriving in Georgia to visit relatives and friends; to persons arriving in Georgia to hold business meetings and negotiations. C1 category – to persons arriving in Georgia for tourism purposes. Ordinary visas of the following categories shall be issued: C2 category – to persons arriving in Georgia to visit relatives and friends; C3 category – to persons arriving in Georgia to hold business meetings and negotiations; participants of scientific workshops, conferences or other research, pedagogical, cultural or sports events; persons arriving in Georgia to engage in journalistic activities; crew members of ships anchored in Georgian harbours, unless visa-free travel of the crew members is provided for by an international agreement of Georgia; principal drivers and co-drivers of cargo/passenger vehicles during international cargo/passenger transportation; C4 category – to persons arriving in Georgia to receive or provide humanitarian assistance during situations posing risk to life and health, or to carry out charity activities; a guardian or a custodian of a Georgian citizen; persons under guardianship or custody of a Georgian citizen; persons arriving in Georgia for medical reasons; persons visiting graves of relatives and friends; persons arriving for pilgrimage and establishment of religious contacts; Official visit – Indians who are visiting Georgia with official visit purposes must apply for diplomatic or special category short-term visa. This visa type shall be issued to top officials of foreign legislative and executive authorities,  to members of foreign delegations; persons holding business/official passports and arriving in Georgia on a working visit;  based on the national interests of Georgia, to persons arriving in Georgia on various missions. Diplomatic rotation – Indians who are visiting Georgia with the purpose of diplomatic rotation must apply for diplomatic or special category long-term visa. This visa type shall be issued to employees of diplomatic and equivalent missions accredited to Georgia, and to consular officials and their family members; to employees of representation offices of international organizations located in Georgia, who have been granted the diplomatic status by Georgia, and to their family members. Transit – Transit visas shall be issued only for transiting the territory of Georgia (10 days) in order to enter a third country. Immigration – Indians who are visiting Georgia for immigration purposes must apply for an immigration visa. This visa type shall be issued to persons arriving in Georgia to conduct labouractivities; to persons arriving in Georgia on scientific, sports, cultural or educational mission; to persons arriving in Georgia for family reunification

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Georgia Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The eVisa will be valid for 120 days from the date of issue with the right to stay in Georgia for up to 30 days during the validity period. Number of entries permitted is multiple.

faqs.question: What is the difference between validity period and Duration of stay?
faqs.answer: Please, note that the validity period of your e-Visa is different than period of stay. The validity period of visa shows time when you can use your visa. Duration of stay indicates number of days you can be in Georgia within the validity period of visa. It is your responsibility not to overstay your visa, otherwise you will be required to pay fines, deported or banned from future travel to Georgia for certain period of time. Number of entries means the number of times a visitor can enter Georgia within the validity of the eVisa.

faqs.question: What is the eVisa processing time?
faqs.answer: It takes not less then 5 working days to make a decision on a visa application.

faqs.question: What are the passport requirements for applying for the eVisa?
faqs.answer: Your travel document must meet the following criteria: Its validity shall extend at least for 3 months after the validity period of requested Georgian visa Document should include not less than 2 free pages. Should not be damaged and should not include unofficial remarks. It should be issued within the previous 10 years.

faqs.answer: Applicants will receive their visas via email, after filling the application form with the necessary information and submitting the supporting documents online. The eVisa must be presented upon crossing the state border of Georgia along with the valid travel document.

faqs.answer: We recommend that you apply for eVisa online at least 10 days prior to your entry in Georgia. However it is not possible to apply more than 30 days before your date of entry to Georgia.

faqs.answer: Passport valid for at least 6 months beyond your intended stay period Printed Georgia eVisa Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof or invitation letter (if visiting family & friends) Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Georgia Detailed itinerary of your trip Travel Insurance Documents relating to your business trip

faqs.question: How can I prove that I possess sufficient financial funds?
faqs.answer: You can prove possession of sufficient financial funds by presenting: Bank statement of the past three months, reference from your Employer which includes information regarding your position and income, document proving possession of real estate, letter from a sponsor. Letter from a sponsor (dated and signed) should include Name and Surname of sponsor, address, Contact Information, relationship between applicant and sponsor, place of destination and duration, list of costs covered by a sponsor.

faqs.answer: Yes. Each traveller must have a separate e-Visa.

faqs.answer: No. Indians are not eligible for visa on arrival and must apply for the visa before travel. Arriving without a visa constitutes an undocumented traveler. You can be fined or refused entry into Georgia.

faqs.answer: Person who wishes to apply for visa to Georgia should possess travel/health insurance which in case if needed will cover any cost related to condition of his health and death. Health/travel insurance should be valid on whole territory of Georgia.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Central African Republic visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The Central African Republic Embassy issues a Single and Multiple entry visa for Indians. The Single entry is issued for a period of 3 months only, whereas a multiple entry visa is issued for 6 months and 1 year respectively.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Central African Republic once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.answer: In the case of a Central African Republic visa rejection, the Embassy will state the reason for rejecting your visa application. You may also appeal against the decision if you find it necessary.

faqs.answer: Yes.The citizens of India are required to obtain a visa to enter Colombia. Visas may be obtained from the Embassy or Consulate of Colombia in India. A Colombia visa for Indians can be private, tourist, business and work – depending on the purposeof a visit.

faqs.question: Is there any Colombia visa exemption for Indians?
faqs.answer: You do not need a visa to enter Colombia if you are a US or Schengen visa holder with a minimum validity of 180 days at the time of entering Colombia (an airport transit visa is not admissible) or you have residence permit in a Member State of the Schengen Area or in the United States of America. Otherwise you must apply for a visa

faqs.question: What are the different types of Colombia Visas?
faqs.answer:
Visitor Visa (type V): for the foreigner wishing to visit Colombia eleven or several times or to stay temporarily in the country without this being permanent. 
This visa allows the holder to carry out, among other activities: airport transit, tourism, business, academic exchange and studies in art or trades and graduate courses, medical treatment, administrative and / or judicial procedures, boat or coastal platform crew, participation in events , residencies or internships, volunteering, audiovisual and / or digital production, journalistic coverage, temporary service provider, intra-corporate personnel transfer within the framework of current international instruments, foreign government commercial representative or official, vacation - employment program and courtesy. Resident Visa (type R): for those aspiring to establish themselves or begin permanent residency in Colombia due to: having renounced Colombian nationality; being the parent of a Colombian national by birth; accumulated time of permanence; foreign direct investment. Migrant Visa (type M): for the foreigner who wishes to enter or remain in the national territory with the intention of establishing himself / herself and does not meet the conditions for a type R visa. This visa may apply to the following condition: Spouse or permanent companion of Colombian national; parent or child of Colombian national by adoption; migrant under the Mercosur Agreement; to refugee; job; businessperson; practice a profession or independent activity; religious; elementary, middle, and undergraduate students; real estate investor; retiree or landlord.

faqs.question: What is France Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
France Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the
                                Schengen
                                countries including France for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s
                                dream
                                where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along with
                                France.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all
                                26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of France), unless it is marked
                                otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European
                                territory
                                of France. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons
                                of
                                your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following
                                countries:
                                Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece,
                                Hungary,
                                Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands,
                                Norway,
                                Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your
                                passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This
                                means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The
                                precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the
                                heading

                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number

faqs.question: Which countries are part of the Schengen Area?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen area covers 26 countries ("Schengen States") without border controls
                                between them.
                                These countries are: Austria, Belgium, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland,
                                France,
                                Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg,
                                Malta,
                                the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden and
                                Switzerland.
                                These countries apply the common visa policy for short stay Visas. This Visa allows you
                                to
                                travel through France and the Schengen area for up to 90 days.

faqs.question:
I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply for my
                            Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will
                                be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then
                                you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first
                                port
                                of entry.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01".
                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during
                                the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only
                                once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a
                                multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity
                                period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from my
                            travel document with the Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At
                                the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional
                                documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and
                                the

                                documents

                                travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for France Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System
                                (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide
                                biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at
                                the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications
                                within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the
                                VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will
                                again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the
                                applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it
                                cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years
                                period.

faqs.question: What is attestation d’accueil?

                                d’accueil”
                                has to be sent by your host in France. This form is available at the local town hall.

                                is a compulsory requirement for people applying for a France Visa to visit family or
                                friends
                                if they are staying with this person at their home in France. The validity of the
                                France
                                Visa you may be granted will not exceed the dates stated on this certificate. Therefore

                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid

                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Puerto Rico  ?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Puerto Rico. Visa must be obtained from the nearest Embassy of Puerto Rico. The 90-day "visitor" visa is a non-immigrant visa to enter the country temporarily. The type of visa to enter Puerto Rico will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.Visitors are also required to hold valid passport, proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay, accommodation proof and return flight tickets to their home country.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Puerto Rico once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Tourist and Business visa?
faqs.answer: Tourist visas are for those Indian citizens travelling to Puerto Rico for sightseeing, recreation and casual visits to friends or families. Business visas are ideal for Indian citizens travelling for Business Meetings, Conference, etc. for a shorter period of stay.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit my passport along with the application?

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Senegal?
faqs.answer: Citizens of few countries including India do not need to apply for a visa in advance. They can get a Senegal visa upon arrival in Senegal provided they have the valid travel documents. The visa application is done when your flight lands or your car crosses the border into Senegal.

faqs.question: What is the process to get Senegal Visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: When you arrive at the airport or border post in Senegal, head to the Immigration counter where you will be given an ‘Immigration Declaration Form’ to complete.

faqs.question: What is the basic requirement for Senegal visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months from the date of arrival in Senegal and should have at least 2 blank pages left in it. You should have proof of onward/return tickets out of the country.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to visit São Tomé and Príncipe?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is necessary to obtain a São Tomé and Príncipe visa for Indians to travel to the country. The type of visa required varies depending on the purpose of the visit.

faqs.question: When is the best time to apply for my São Tomé and Príncipe visa?
faqs.answer: It is ideal to apply for a visa at least 1 month before your tentative travel date.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a São Tomé and Príncipe Visa online?
faqs.answer: With Akbar Travels, the process of applying for a São Tomé and Príncipe Visa online is easy and seamless. The steps are: 1. Choose your preferred type of São Tomé and Príncipe visa based on your travel type 2. Pay online 3. Submit your documents through our pick up & drop service 4. Receive your visa when approved

faqs.question: What are the types of entry available on a São Tomé and Príncipe visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The entry signifies the number of times you can enter a country while on one valid visa. Single entry guarantees only one entry and exit. Multiple entries mean you can enter and exit the country multiple times within the period of validity. The São Tomé and Príncipe tourist visa from India, as well as the business visa, can allow single or multiple entries.

faqs.question: What is an "Entry" (Single / Double / Multiple)?
faqs.answer: Single entry visas allow you to enter São Tomé and Príncipe one time within the validity of the visa. Double entry visas allow you to enter São Tomé and Príncipe two times within the validity of the visa. Multiple entry visas allow you to enter São Tomé and Príncipe an unlimited amount of times within the validity of the visa.

faqs.question: What is an E-Visa?
faqs.answer: An e-visa is a sticker-less electronic visa that grants applicants the same right of entry as the regular São Tomé and Príncipe visa online. The e-Visa system was launched in 2012. Applicants can currently obtain e-visas for 30-day business and tourist visas. It cannot be used for employment.

faqs.question: Who can apply for e-Visa?
faqs.answer: Anyone with a valid passport who wishes to enter São Tomé e Príncipe, as a visitor for 30 days or less is eligible to apply. Applicants of the e-Visa should have a passport with at least 1 year valid before expiration.

faqs.question: What types of e-Visas are available?
faqs.answer: Currently the only visa available on line is 30-day tourist visa and 30-day business visa. Tourism includes holidays, recreation and seeing family and/or friends. Business purposes may include attending a conference, negotiation or exploratory business visit.

faqs.question: Is the e-Visa accepted at all of Sao Tome's borders?
faqs.answer: No. The e-visa is only valid for entry by air at the Sao Tome and Principe International Airport (TMS).

faqs.question: What happens after I apply for my e-Visa?
faqs.answer:
As soon as your application is received, you receive an immediate confirmation with the reference number that your application is assigned. After that your application goes through a verification process… The process takes 5 business days (excluding Saturday, Sunday and National Holidays).
Once approved, applicants will receive their Visa Approval letter by email. Print it out and take it with you to the airport.

faqs.question: How long are eVisas valid?
faqs.answer: e-Visas are valid for travel for up to 30 days from date of issue. They are good for a single entry, and a stay of up to up to 30 days. Duration of stay is included in the validity.

faqs.question: Can I extend my visa?
faqs.answer: The e-visa cannot be extended, so ensure that you exit São Tomé and Príncipe before your visa expires to avoid fines.

faqs.question: When is the best time to apply for my São Tomé and Príncipe visa?
faqs.answer: The best time to apply for your São Tomé and Príncipe is 3 to 4 weeks before your travel date. Although the visa itself may only take a few days to process it is always best to add as much of a buffer as possible incase any issues arise during the process.

faqs.question: Do I need travel or medical insurance?
faqs.answer: Although not part of the São Tomé and Príncipe visa requirements, medical insurance is advisable for medical emergencies during travel and travel insurance for theft, damage or loss of baggage.

faqs.question: Do I need a Bangladesh visa?
faqs.answer:
All Indian nationals require a visa for Bangladesh which should be applied prior to the intended
                                travel date.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of the Bangladesh Tourist visa?
faqs.answer:
The Bangladesh tourist visa can only be used for leisure and recreational purposes in Bangladesh.
                                You are not entitled to work or seek employment.

faqs.question: What are the rights granted by the Bangladesh Business visa?
faqs.answer:
The Bangladesh business visa is mainly for people who want to participate in business meetings,
                                conferences, etc in Bangladesh. Visa holders are not allowed to work or seek employment in
                                Bangladesh.

faqs.question: Is the Bangladesh Tourist Visa a multiple entry visa?
faqs.answer:
No. Tourist visas for Bangladesh are issued for single or double entry only. Only Business visas
                                have a multiple entry option.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Bangladesh Tourist visa?
faqs.answer:
The tourist visa grants you the right to stay in Bangladesh for a maximum of 60 days for leisure
                                or recreational purposes.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Bangladesh on a business visa?
faqs.answer: The business visa grants you the right to stay in Bangladesh for a maximum of 180 days.

faqs.question: Can I obtain my Bangladesh visa on arrival?
faqs.answer:
Indians are not eligible for a Visa on Arrival and need to apply for the Bangladesh Visa at the
                                High Commission, New Delhi. We are happy to assist you in obtaining your visa prior to your
                                travel to Bangladesh.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain a Bangladesh visa?
faqs.answer:
The Bangladesh visa normally takes upto 7 working days to process in the Bangladesh High Commission.
                                The processing time for a visa is dependent on several factors and can change without prior
                                notice at the High Commission’s discretion.

faqs.question: What is the Bangladesh Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Bangladesh Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to Bangladesh.
                                In your cover letter you should explain: the purpose of your trip when and where you intend to travel how your trip is going to be funded day-by-day itinerary for your trip duration of the trip

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for a Bangladesh Visa?
faqs.answer:
No. You do not need to apply in person. We will take care of the complete visa process right
                                from verifying your documents to stamping of your visa.

faqs.question: What is the mode of receiving the visa?
faqs.answer: Once your visa is processed, it will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of applying for visa through Akbar Travels?
faqs.answer:
By contacting Akbar Travels for your visa application, you can eliminate the need for personally
                                visiting the Embassy for your application. All you will have to do is apply online on our
                                website and get your visa processed within the set timeframe. Minimal documentation and quick
                                processing is another of the key highlights. In most case, the visa processing takes about
                                seven working days.

faqs.question: Do I need to take a health/travel insurance?
faqs.answer:
You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself in Bangladesh
                                as medical treatment can be very expensive in Bangladesh. Your travel insurance offers protection
                                against unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses,
                                flight delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident. For financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

faqs.question: Do Indian passport holders require a visa to visit Ethiopia?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indian passport holders require an electronic visa (e-Visa) to visit Ethiopia.

faqs.question: What is an Ethiopian e-Visa?
faqs.answer: It is an authorisation document that allows citizens of India to enter the Republic of Ethiopia for a specific number of days. An e-Visa gives you the same right to enter the country as an ordinary sticker-visa in the passport.

faqs.question: How can I apply for an Ethiopian Visa online?
faqs.answer: With Akbar Travels, the process of applying for an Ethiopian Visa online is smooth and seamless. The steps are: 1. Choose your preferred type of Ethiopia visa based on your travel type 2. Pay online 3. Submit your documents through our pick up & drop service 4. Receive your visa when approved

faqs.question: What are the different types of Ethiopian visas?
faqs.answer: Indians travelling to Ethiopia can choose from 30-day tourist visas or 30-day business visas depending on their reason for travel. Tourist visas are popular among those travelling for recreation while Business e-Visas are ideal for Indian citizens wishing to attend business meetings. In case a person wishes to stay for more than 30 days, they can opt for a 90-day Tourist/Business e-Visa.

faqs.question: What is the processing time for an Ethiopian visa?
faqs.answer: Processing an application for an Ethiopian visa takes typically 2-3 working days.

faqs.question: How much is the Ethiopian e-Visa fee?
faqs.answer: The e-Visa application fee depends on the type and validity period of visa you require.

faqs.question: What kind of entry is my Ethiopian visa?
faqs.answer: The Ethiopian e-Visa is granted for a single entry.

faqs.question: Can Ethiopian eVisa for Indians be used for multiple entries?
faqs.answer: If your e-Visa is issued for a single entry, it cannot be used for multiple entries into Ethiopia. Ethiopia allows travellers to apply for multiple entry visas with applicable charges to it.

faqs.question: How do I receive my eVisa Approval letter?
faqs.answer: On successful approval of your application, an approval letter is sent to your designated email address. You need to then take a print out of the eVisa & securely keep it in your passport.

faqs.question: Is the Ethiopian visa for Indians valid for the whole of Ethiopia?
faqs.answer: Yes, the visa is valid for travel through the whole of Ethiopia, subject to Embassy directives.

faqs.question: Can I get an Ethiopian visa while in the country?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can get an Ethiopian e-Visa on Arrival while in the country. However, travellers must get their Visa on Arrival only from Bole International Airport in Addis Ababa. Entry through other ports is not allowed. Also, it is advisable to apply for an Ethiopia visa before your travel itself in order to avoid long, tiring queues and last-minute hassles.

faqs.question: From when is my visa valid?
faqs.answer: Your Visa is valid for up to 3 months from the date of issue, not from the date of entry to Ethiopia or any other date.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of online visa application over visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: The online visa application saves your time. There are no visits to embassies or consulates and no complex paperwork. The online process is very easy, more secure than traditional visa application processes and it allows you to have your approved e-Visa ready before you leave for your trip. You will also be able to beat the long queues at the airport

faqs.question: What must I do if my Ethiopian visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: In the case of Ethiopian visa rejection, the authorities’ decision is final. It is crucial that the applicant submit complete and vetted documents as per Embassy directives.

faqs.question: If my application is rejected, will I receive a refund?
faqs.answer: No. As per the Embassy's rule, no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: May I know the reasons for my visa rejection?
faqs.answer: No. If it is rejected, the office will notify you of the rejection but not the reason why.

faqs.question: Do I need a travel or medical insurance?
faqs.answer: Travel insurance is not one of the necessary Ethiopian visa requirements. However, it is always advised to be insured in case of medical or travel emergencies. Akbar Travels can assist you with the ideal insurance policy to protect yourself against medical emergencies during travel as well as damage or loss of baggage.

faqs.question: Do I need to get any vaccinations?
faqs.answer: Yes. Travellers are required to be vaccinated for Yellow fever as well as Polio. It is a must to obtain a certificate for the same which is a mandatory document to enter Ethiopia.

faqs.question: Is there anything else I need to know about the Ethiopian tourist visa from India?
faqs.answer: Possession of a valid tourist visa when travelling is important and the same must be kept in safe custody. The Ethiopian visa for Indians is not replaceable; upon loss of this visa, you will need to apply for a new one in its stead.

Our visa experts will help you find the right visa type, prepare all documents and follow through with the visa application process. To get more Ethiopian visa information, get in touch through a query form and a Visa Expert will give you a call.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Algeria?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indians need a visa to travel to Algeria. Algeria visa for Indians can be obtained at the Algeria Embassy or Consulate. In order to get visa for Algeria from India, it is necessary to fulfil the visa requirements and submit the necessary documents. An Algeria visa for Indians can be private, tourist, business and work – depending on the purpose of a visit.

faqs.question: What is an Algerian visa?
faqs.answer: It is a document endorsed on your passport that allows citizens of India to enter the Republic of Algeria for a stipulated number of days.

faqs.question: How can I apply for an Algeria visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straightforward and effortless process to apply for an Algeria visa online through Akbar Travels. - Choose your preferred type of Algeria visa based on your travel type - Pay online - Submit documents through our pick up & drop service - Receive your visa once approved!

faqs.question: What is the type of Algerian visa that I need?
faqs.answer: Indians travelling to Algeria can choose from 30-day tourist visas or 30-day business visas depending on their reason for travel. Tourist visas are common for tourism and leisure purposes only whereas business visas are for those travelling for official/work reasons.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for Algeria visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: -why are you visiting Algeria -how long you intend to stay in Algeria -how will you support yourself during your time in Algeria -what is the purpose of your visit to Algeria -type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid -where do you intend to travel following your visit to Algeria -if you have a permit to enter the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Algeria

faqs.question: What is the processing time of an Algerian Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Processing an application for an Algerian visa normally takes 5-7 6working days.

faqs.question: What kind of entry is my Algerian visa?
faqs.answer: A single entry is granted on the usual basis.

faqs.question: Can I apply for an Algerian multiple entry visa?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indian nationals can apply for 90-day multiple entry visas with an applicable fee higher than the usual visa fee for Single entry visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to submit my passport when applying for an Algerian visa online?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Algerian visa is a stamp or sticker that is placed on an empty page of a passport. The original passport is required to be submitted with at least two consecutive blank pages.

faqs.question: Is the Algerian visa valid for the whole of Algeria?
faqs.answer: Yes, the visa is valid for travel through the whole of Algeria, subject to Embassy directives.

faqs.question: Is the Algerian visa for Indians available on arrival?
faqs.answer: No, you cannot get an Algerian visa while in the country.

faqs.question: From when is my visa valid?
faqs.answer: Your visa is valid from the date your visa was issued. It should not be calculated from the date of entry into Algeria.

faqs.question: What if my Algerian visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy of the Republic of Algeria, New Delhi, is responsible for approval and rejection of Algerian visa applications from India. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final. Thus, applicants are advised to submit all valid documents as mentioned by the Embassy.

faqs.question: Do I get my fee refunded in case of visa refusal?
faqs.answer: No. As per the Embassy's rule, in the case of Algeria visa rejection, no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: Do I need travel insurance?
faqs.answer: It is advisable for every visitor to purchase a travel insurance plan before taking up travel. Akbar Travels can assist you with the same to cover your medical expenses, damage and loss of baggage that may occur during travel.

faqs.question: What else do I need to know about the Algerian tourist visa from India?
faqs.answer: An Algerian visa is a document that legally allows inbound citizens to enter the country. It is advisable to keep the passport and visa page in safe custody. Upon loss or damage, a new visa will be required.

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a Visa to travel to Cape Verde?
faqs.answer: Yes, Indian citizens need a visa to travel to Cape Verde.They may obtain a visa on arrival at Sal, Boa Vista, São Vicente or Santiago international airports, provided they have the valid travel documents. The visa application is done when your flight lands in Cape Verde.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for Cape Verde visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Travellers must meet the following criteria: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry and with two blank pages within Return ticket to your country Confirmation of accommodation for duration of your visit Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Cape Verde Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to business trip

faqs.question: How long is the Cape Verde visa valid for?
faqs.answer: Maximum stay for visitors is 30 days only.

faqs.question: Are there any pre-arrival formalities to be fulfilled before travelling to Cape Verde?
faqs.answer: Before travelling to Cape Verde you should register with the Cape Verde authorities via an online platform. When arriving by air – in most cases – you have to pay a security fee (Airport Security Fee – TSA). Registration and the security surcharge can be paid via an online platform (preference). This can be also arranged at the border (customs). It is essential to do the registration at least 7 days before your travel date. Once you have registered, your passport will be stamped when you arrive at passport control in Cape Verde. This stamp is your entry visa. There's no need for you to approach the Visa office at the airport - simply proceed through to baggage reclaim.

faqs.question: Can I extend my stay in Cape Verde?
faqs.answer: Yes. You can extend your stay in Cape Verde. The easiest way is to prolong your visa before it expires. You can have your visa extended at the office of “Direcção de Emigração e Fronteiras” in Sal, Boavista, Praia (Santiago), Mindelo (Sao Vicente) or at a police station. For the renewal of your visa you need: a valid passport with current visa, passport photo and usually also proof of where you are staying. If you are staying for a long time in Cape Verde for example for work, a rental or purchase contract is also needed.

faqs.question: Is there any fear of Cape Verde visa rejection?
faqs.answer: Indians are not liable to face a rejection. However, the above said documents are necessary to enter the country. Failure to produce any of the documents may result into rejection of your visa, thereby barring you from entering the country. The final decision to grant an entry permit is solely at the discretion of the Immigration officials at Cape Verde airport.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get the visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Usually, it takes around 20 minutes to get all formalities done and get the visa on arrival. However, the time may vary depending on the peak travel period.

faqs.question: What is the process of getting a Cape Verde visa?
faqs.answer: After landing at Cape Verde airport, kindly head to the Immigration counter. The immigration authorities will most likely ask basic questions such as the reason for travel and duration of stay. Overall, it takes about 15-20 minutes to issue a visa. The whole method is hassle-free and easy.

faqs.question: What happens if I overstay my visa?
faqs.answer: If you get beyond the maximum length of stay you will have to pay a fine. If this is only a few days then customs usually turn a blind eye to it. A fine can be up to a few hundred euros.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the event of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: Are you still having doubts about the Cape Verde visa process?
faqs.answer: Please feel free to contact us for all your Cape Verde visa worries. We have you covered across India with presence in all the major cities like Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, Bangalore, Chennai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and many more. Important Notice: The information provided here are subject to change without prior notice. For confirmation on visa requirements and fees, you may consult with the Cape Verde Embassy or Consulate near you.

faqs.question: Do I need visa for Benin from India?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passportholders require a visit to visit Benin.All foreign nationals including Indians are eligible for an eVisa. After its official launch on Monday, April 23, 2018 by the Government of Benin, the digital platform for the application and issuance of entry and short-stay visas in Benin has become active. The e Visa is valid for single or multiple entries, good for 30 - 90 days from the date of issue for a stay up to the expiration date listed on the visa. It is very easy to apply for and does not require sending your physical passport to us for processing. It is the simplest and the fastest way to get your visa. Once your visa application is approved, you will receive the visa copy via email right in your inbox.

faqs.question: What is an eVisa?
faqs.answer: An Electronic Visa or "e Visa" is an electronically issued and stored authority for travel to The Republic of Benin, which replaces the traditional paper visa process in most cases.You will receive your Benin visa entirely online – without having to submit your passport for stamping.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Benin visa?
faqs.answer: A Benin visa is most appropriate for Indians travelling to Benin for business and recreational purposes such as holidaying, sightseeing, or even short family visits. The type of visa to enter Benin will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a traditional visa (sticker pasted on the passport) and an eVisa?
faqs.answer: The support is the only difference. Both documents allow to visit the Republic of Benin in accordance with the legal framework governing the type of visa / eVisa obtained.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Benin visas for Indians?
faqs.answer: The categories of visas available for Indians visiting Benin depends on the purpose of the visit. If you are visiting Benin for sightseeing or meeting friends or family, then you should apply for a tourist visa. If you are visiting Benin for commercial reasons or participating in a business fair or exhibition, then a business visa is applicable.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Benin Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: eVisasissued to an applicant intending to visit Benin are: Thirty (30) day visa with single entry Thirty (30) day visa with multiple entries Ninety (90) day visa with multiple entries

faqs.question: What is the Benin visa fee for Indians?
faqs.answer: Since the Embassy issues single & multiple type visas, the cost for each entry type differs as follows: Single entry for 30 days – INR 4899/- Multiple entry for 30 days - INR 6999/- Multiple entry for 90 days – INR 8999/-

faqs.question: I would like to stay in Benin for a period of time longer than the e-Visa permits. What should I do?
faqs.answer: If you wish to stay in Benin longer than your e-Visa permits, you must apply to the Immigration Department for an extension of your entry permit. Please note that an e-Visa is granted only for short stays. If you overstay your visa, you might be asked to pay fines, deported or banned future travel to Benin for a specific period of time.

faqs.question: What kind of Documentation I need to apply for Benin eVisa?
faqs.answer: Scanned copy of a valid passport. (Please note, passports must be valid for a minimum of 6 months from the date of arrival in Benin) A recent color passport photograph (45mm x 35mm); all photos are to be on a while back ground only, and not altered or edited from its original state. Evidence of proposed journey into and out of Benin i.e. ticket or confirmation of your booking from the travel agent. Proof of accommodation for the length of your stay or a letter of invitation from your sponsor. Students, must provide the acceptance letter from your school, and the details of where they will be staying during their studies. Individuals traveling on business are to provide a letter from your employer stating the purpose of your trip. (business covering letter, invitation letter etc) Proof of funds to finance the trip i.e. bank statements for the previous three months. Birth certificate for children travellers

faqs.question: What is the eVisa processing time?
faqs.answer: The Benin visa is processed online within 48 hours.

faqs.question: How will I receive the Benin visa online?
faqs.answer: In the legally designated time, the applicant will be notified via e-mail about the outcome of the review application. In case of approval, the applicant will receive eVisa in PDF format. You are advised to printing the electronic visa, to keep on hand and to present to all authorized control officers before, during and after the trip, in particular on arrival at the border posts and during the stay in Benin.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Benin visa online?
faqs.answer: With Akbar Travels, the process of applying for a Benin visa online is easy and seamless. The steps are: - Choose your preferred type of Benin visa based on your travel type - Pay online - Submit documents via whatsapp or email - Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: When can the earliest possible application be made for a Benin visa online?
faqs.answer: We recommend that you apply for eVisa online at least 7 days prior to your entry in Benin. However it is not possible to apply more than 90 days before your date of entry to Benin.

faqs.question: Which are the entry requirements after you arrive in Benin?
faqs.answer: Passport valid for at least 6 months beyond your intended stay period Printed Benin eVisa Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Benin Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to your business trip

faqs.question: What are the advantages of applying for a Benin Visa online?
faqs.answer: Benin Visa for Indians can be applied online from anywhere, anytime No personal presence of the applicant required Minimum document requirement Convenient and cost effective i.e. lowest Benin visa price Electronic visa can be sent anywhere in the world through Email

faqs.question: Do I need to obtain a separate e-Visa for persons accompanying me?
faqs.answer: Yes. Each traveller must have a separate e-Visa.

faqs.question: Can I get a refund if I do not use my visa?
faqs.answer: No. We cannot refund payments for unused e-Visas. The fee is a processing fee.

faqs.question: I do not want to apply for an e-Visa. Can I get a visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: No. Indians are not eligible for visa on arrival and must apply for the visa before travel. Arriving without a visa constitutes an undocumented traveler. You can be fined or refuse entry into Benin.

faqs.question: Do I need travel or medical insurance plan?
faqs.answer: It is always advised to be insured in case of medical or travel emergencies. Akbar Travels can assist you with the ideal insurance policy to protect yourself against medical emergencies during travel as well as damage or loss of baggage.

faqs.answer: Contact our Visa Experts and apply for your Benin visa instantly with minimum documents and lowest visa fee. No need to visit our office, no need to submit physical documents and no need to deal with the Embassy. We do it all for you.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Peru ?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indians need a visa to travel to Peru. Peru visa for Indians can be obtained at the Peru Embassy or Consulate. In order to get visa for Peru from India, it is necessary to fulfil the visa requirements and submit the necessary documents. A Peruvisa for Indians can be private, tourist, business and work – depending on the purposeof a visit.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Peru  visa online?

faqs.question: Which are the most common Peru visas?
faqs.answer:
Foreign nationals wishing to visit Peru and require a visa, according to their country of origin, may apply for a Tourist visa if they have recreational or similar purposes.
Anyone travelling to Peru for business purposes, especially when business contracts or agreements are signed or business-related financial transaction are made, has to apply for a business visa at a Peruvian Consulate before entering the country. Student visa is issued for students planning to study at a Peruvian educational institution or wanting to do an internship / apprenticeship (without payment) at a Peruvian company.  the Peruvian educational institution or training facility has to be recognized by the Peruvian Ministry of Education or the National Assembly of University Rectors.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Peru  visa ?
faqs.answer: The Peru tourist visa is a single-entry visa and is issued for maximum period of 183 days. Whereas the Peruvian business visa is a multiple entry visa and entitles its holder to enter Peru within a time period of 12 months from the date of issue. The maximum stay on a business is 183 day per year, but the consulates abroad reserve the right to grant visas for shorter stays.

faqs.question: Can I extend my Peru visa?
faqs.answer: it is NOT possible to extend your tourist visa once you have entered Peru!!! When arriving at the airport or border, make sure you get a visa for the time you intent to stay. After Peruvian law the maximum time for a tourist to stay in the country is 183 days per year.

faqs.question: What is the Peru visa processing time?
faqs.answer: Peru visa is normally processed in up to 5 working days from the day of application within regular service.

faqs.question: What kind of entry is my Peru visa?
faqs.answer: Tourist visas are issued for single entry whereas Business visas are issued for multiple entries. The maximum stay on each visa is up to 183 days only.

faqs.question: Do I need to submit my passport along when applying for a Peru visa online?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Peru visa is a stamp or sticker that is placed on an empty page of a passport. Therefore, the original passport with two consecutive blank pages is required to be submitted for the visa application..

faqs.question: How far is Peru from India and how long will it take to reach?
faqs.answer: The distance between India and Peru is 17,122 km and it will take 21 hours and 47 minutes via a flight.

faqs.question: Is it a safe country?
faqs.answer: Peru is a safe country and terrorist attacks are not common here. In terms of security, it is important to note that crimes like pickpocketing or theft in tourist areas can happen. We advise to keep your belongings locked and documents photocopied. If you sense danger in the place of accommodation, then check out immediately to avoid an incident. Also, make sure you do not take drugs as the rules are strict on the consumption of narcotics.

faqs.question: Are the climatic conditions favourable to travel?
faqs.answer: Peru has two kinds of weather; dry and wet. Travellers will experience diverse weather conditions as it is covered by two oceans, the Andes range, and Amazonian forests. There is hardly any rain in the coastal region whereas precipitation is frequent in the mountain region. The warmer months are from mid-November till the starting of April and the cold months range from April till the first week of November. Avoid visiting the country between January to April, as these are the most rainy seasons with high humidity.

faqs.question: Is it essential to learn Spanish or English is enough?
faqs.answer: If you are planning a trip to Peru, then you must know that not many people in the country are well versed in English, especially in small villages. Learning Spanish or having a translator will make the trip, though it is not one of the Peru Visa Requirements

faqs.question: What happens if I lose my passport in Peru?
faqs.answer: In case you have lost your passport, then a police report has to be immediately so that they record the statement and give you a copy of the complaint registered. Also, you need to report at the Indian Embassy in Peru and apply for re-issue of passport along with required documents.

faqs.question: How can I get the currency exchange?
faqs.answer: It is advisable to take cash in the form of Euros or Dollars and then get it to exchange in Sol (PEN) after you enter the country.

faqs.question: Can a tourist apply for a student visa while in Peru?
faqs.answer: If you are visiting as a tourist and wish to study in Peru, then you need to get the visa changed to a student visa. Visit the Indian Embassy in Peru along with required documents and apply for the student visa.

faqs.question: Which visa shall I apply for volunteering in Peru?
faqs.answer: For volunteering in Peru, you need to apply for a tourist visa and can volunteer for 180 days in a year in any non-profit organization or NGO.

faqs.question: Do I need a travel and medical insurance?
faqs.answer: It is advisable for every traveller to purchase a travel insurance to stay protected from emergencies. Akbar Travels can assist you with the same to cover your medical expenses, damage and loss of baggage that may occur during travel.

faqs.question: What if my Peru visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy of the Peru in New Delhi is responsible for Peru visa approval or rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final. Travellers are advised to submit all necessary documents when applying for the visa.
