faqs.question: What is a Slovakia Schengen visa?
faqs.answer: A Slovakia visa (Schengen visa) is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the Schengen countries including Slovakia for a maximum period of 90 days. Slovakia is part of the Schengen agreement. This is a traveller’s dream which lets you travel to all the Schengen countries on one visa.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer: Schengen Area comprises of the following countries: Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Slovakia on the basis of my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer: The Slovakia Visa (Schengen visa) is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport. The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in 6 months.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Slovakia Visas for Indians?
faqs.answer: Depending on your reason for travel, you can either choose tourist or business visa. Both of them are issued for a period of 90-days. A tourist visa is for you if you are willing to visit Slovakia for sightseeing and recreational purposes. Business visa is for you if your reasons are professional in nature and have business-related meetings with Slovakia companies.

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer: No, not necessarily all Schengen visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?

faqs.question: What is the Slovakia Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer: The Slovakia Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: the purpose of your trip when and where you intend to travel how your trip is going to be funded day-by-day itinerary for your trip duration of the trip

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for the Slovakia Visa?
faqs.answer: You may only submit your Slovakia visa application 90 days before your date of departure.We recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain the Visa?
faqs.answer: Typically, a Schengen Visa takes approximately 10 to 15 days for processing.However, the processing time is dependent on several factors and can change without notice at the embassy's discretion.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Slovakia Visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Slovakia Visain order to provide your biometrics and submit your visa documents.

faqs.question: I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy/Consulate of the country where you will be staying for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country, then you must apply to the Embassy/Consulate of the country which you will be entering first.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: A single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once, meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question: Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen externalborders apart from my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the border (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provideadditional documentation, for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient meansto cover the stay and the return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry withyou copies of the documents which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g.letters of invitation, travel confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of yourstay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Slovakia Visa (Schengen Visa)?
faqs.answer: Do I have to apply in person for the Slovakia Visa (Schengen Visa)?

faqs.question: Do I have to inform my exact travel dates and itinerary while applying for visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is important to provide a day wise detailed itinerary of your trip along with the internal sector travel tickets

faqs.question: What should be done if my Slovakia visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: In the case of a Slovakia visa rejection, the Embassy will state the reason for rejecting your visa application. You may also appeal against the decision if you find it necessary.

faqs.answer: Travel medical insurance with minimum coverage of 30,000 EUR is one of the mandatorySlovakia visa requirements. The insurance should cover all the Schengen countries as well.Akbar Travels can also assist you in choosing the perfect travel or medical insurance policy to protect you against unforeseen medical or travel emergencies.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Andorra?
faqs.answer: Indian citizens are not required to obtain a visa prior to traveling to the ­Principality of Andorra, as there are no border formalities in Andorra. However, since Andorra can only be accessed by passing through Spain or France, Indian visitors are required to obtain a multi-entry Schengen visa.

faqs.question: Is Andorra part of the Schengen territory?
faqs.answer: Andorra is part of Europe, but not a member of the Schengen territory.

faqs.question: So, in order to visit Andorra, I must apply for a France or Spain Visa (Schengen visa)?
faqs.answer: Yes. Since the country is only accessible via the Schengen countries of Spain or France, entrance is not possible without entering the Schengen area first and the Schengen visa rules apply. Simultaneously anyone visiting a Schengen country can enter Andorra with a valid Schengen visa.

faqs.question: What is a Schengen visa?
faqs.answer: A Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the Schengen countries for a maximum period of 90 days. It is a traveller’s dream which lets you travel to all the Schengen countries on one visa.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer: Schengen Area comprises of the following countries: Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Andorra on the basis of my Schengen visa?

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for Schengen visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Andorra How long you intend to stay in Andorra How will you support yourself during your time in Andorra What is the purpose of your visit to Andorra Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Andorra If you have a permit to Andorra the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Andorra

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer: No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer: You are free to apply again for a Schengen Visa if your application has been refused earlier.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer: The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country that is part of the Schengen area. faqs.answer: Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Schengen Visain order to provide your biometrics and submit your visa documents.

faqs.answer: A single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once, meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question: What is the purpose of the Namibia business visa?
faqs.answer: All visitors travelling to Namibia for business purposes need a Visa prior to travel. The business visa in Namibia is defined as the Visa issued to people looking for: 1. Prospects to set up formal business in Namibia 2. Exploratory or fact-finding business missions 3. Business people attending meetings at subsidiaries of their parent companies 4. Official government visits 5. Attending conferences, corporate events (not work) and meetings for which no remuneration is received 6. Charities, voluntary and expedition missions 7. Attending short training courses (not more than 90 days) 8. Sports events 9. Expositions and trade fairs. 10. Business Invitation letter from the Namibian Companies/Institutions/Agencies required for applicants travelling for business to Namibia along with a letter from the local company giving details about the applicants position in the company, purpose of visit, period of stay and undertaking that the company will borne all expenses pertaining his/her visit.

Business visas are ideal for Indian citizens wishing to attend business meetings with Congolese companies or exhibit on behalf of companies outside the DRC.

faqs.question: What is the earliest I can apply for a Congo visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Congolese visa is 3 months before the date of travel to the country. Visas will not be processed for applications submitted earlier than 3 months ahead of planned dates.

faqs.question: How long does it take to process a Congo visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The application and approval for a Congolese visa normally takes 10-12 working days.

faqs.question: Do I get single or multiple entries on my Congo visa?
faqs.answer: In case of a tourist visa, a single entry is granted. For business visas, you can get multiple entry visas extending between three to six months.

faqs.question: Are there any additional charges to pay while applying for a Congo visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The visa fee is exclusive of taxes and is subject to change based on the Embassy’s directive.

faqs.question: How do I pay my Congo visa fees?
faqs.answer: You need to pay the visa fee online. These fees are non-refundable.

faqs.question: Do I need to submit my passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, as the Congolese visa is a vignette or sticker that is placed on an empty page of a passport. Please ensure your passport has at least 2 consecutive blank pages.

faqs.question: Is the Congolese visa valid for the whole of DRC?
faqs.answer: Yes, the visa is valid for travel through the whole of DRC through designated entry and exit ports.

faqs.question: Is it possible to expedite processing for a Congo tourist visa from India?
faqs.answer: The embassy in New Delhi does not currently offer any expedited visa processing services. It is advised, therefore, to apply well in advance of travel dates.

faqs.question: Can I extend a Congolese visa?
faqs.answer: You can request to get your visa extended at the nearest Office of Immigration. The approval of extension is subject to the officers’ decisions and Embassy directives.

faqs.question: Can I get a Congolese visa while in the country?
faqs.answer: No, you cannot get a Congolese visa while in the country or at any port of entry. They must be applied for well in advance of the dates of travel.

faqs.question: From when is my visa valid?
faqs.answer: Your visa is valid from the date your visa was issued. It should not be calculated from the date of entry into the DRC.

faqs.question: What if my Congolese visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: Decisions for a Congo visa rejection are made by the Embassy of the Democratic Republic of Congo, New Delhi. Upon refusal or granting of a visa for a shorter period, no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to get medical insurance to travel to the DRC?
faqs.answer: Medical insurance is not a mandatory part of Congo visa requirements. It is still advisable to purchase a medical insurance plan to cover your medical expenses in the DRC. Akbar Travels can assist you with the ideal travel insurance plan to insure yourself against medical emergencies during travel, damage and loss of baggage.

faqs.question: What is the easiest way to apply for a Congo tourist visa from India?
faqs.answer: The easiest way to apply for a Congolese visa is to apply through an experienced travel agency like Akbar Travels. Our visa experts have been in the travel and tourism sectors for 40 years and are well-versed in the ins and outs of visa application processes.To solve any doubt or query, fill out a query form and a Visa Expert will get in touch with you in a flash.The assigned visa expert will also be on hand to guide you over any hiccups in the process once it begins.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Solomon Islands?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Solomon Islands. The Immigration Division’s Border Control Unit is responsible for processing this visa class on behalf of the Director of Immigration. The type of visa to enter Solomon Islands will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Solomon Islands visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Short Term Visa: Short term visas are offered to foreign nationals who wish to visit the Solomon Islands for a short term stay. This can be for a maximum period of 3 months or 12 months depending on the visa type. 1.  Visitor Visa: Visitor visas are short term visas which allow holders to enter and stay in the Solomon Islands for a short term visit as a tourist or as someone visiting friends and family.The minimum period of stay for visa holders is 6 weeks with a maximum combined period of 90 days. 2.  Business Visa: Business visas are short term visas which allow holders to enter and stay in the Solomon Islands for business purposes.The minimum period of stay for visa holders is 6 weeks with a maximum combined period of 90 days.Before a visitor’s permit can be issued a visitor who wishes to engage in any business, profession or employment for more than 30 days, a work permit obtained from the Commissioner of Labour must be furnished to the Director of Immigration. Similarly a visitor who wishes to undertake research must also submit a research permit from the Education Minister or Department prior to a grant of a visitor’s permit. Long term Visa: Long term visas are offered to foreign nationals who plan to reside (usually for the purpose of setting up a business, investing, employment. Study, research, exchange or for religious purposes) must apply to the Director of Immigration for a visa to enter and reside prior to entering Solomon Islands. The maximum validity of a visa to enter and reside is two years. Current visa holders wishing to further extend their stay in Solomon Islands must apply to the Director of Immigration two months prior to the expiry of their existing visa with all requirements provided.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Solomon Island visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straightforward and effortless process to apply for a Solomon Island visa online through Akbar Travels. Choose your preferred type of Solomon Island visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Solomon Island visa online?
faqs.answer: Applicants are encouraged to apply three (3) weeks to (1) one month in advance of travel.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Solomon Island visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: A visitor’s permit entitles a visitor to remain in Solomon Islands for any period or periods in the aggregate, not exceeding three (3) months. It has a single entry facility.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Solomon Islands once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.question: Can I extend my stay in Solomon Islands?
faqs.answer: A visitor’s permit can be extended beyond the 3 months for a further period or aggregated period of up to 3 months provided there are special circumstances justifying the extension. A standard application form for extension needs to be filled up accompanied with a photo of the applicant (passport photo) together with the required fee.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit my passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Immigration division will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Solomon Islands visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa application is normally processed within 15 working days.

faqs.question: How do I receive my Solomon Islands visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Solomon Island visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Solomon Island How long you intend to stay in Solomon Island How will you support yourself during your time in Solomon Island What is the purpose of your visit to Solomon Island Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Solomon Island If you have a permit to Solomon Island the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Solomon Island

faqs.question: What if my Solomon Islands visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Solomon Islands visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Solomon Islands tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country on a Solomon Islands tourist visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the occurrence of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: Do I need visa for Nauru from India?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visa to travel toNauru. All Visa applications must be submitted to the Director of Immigration and Nauru.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Nauru visa?
faqs.answer: A Nauru visa is most appropriate for Indians travelling to Nauru for business and recreational purposes such as holidaying, sightseeing, or even short family visits. The type of visa to enter Nauru will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Nauru Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Nauru visas are valid for 30 days with multiple entries

faqs.question: I would like to stay in Nauru for a period of time longer than the e-Visa permits. What should I do?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can have your visa extended to Nauru. You will have to visit the immigration office in your area with your valid passport. The approval of extension is subject to the officers’ decisions and Embassy directives.

faqs.question: What is the eVisa processing time?

You are advised to print the visa certificate and carry it along with the other travel documents.

faqs.question: Which are the entry requirements after you arrive in Nauru?
faqs.answer: Passport valid for at least 6 months beyond your intended stay period Printed Nauru Visa certificate Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Nauru Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to your business trip

faqs.question:
Do I
                            need a visa for Hong Kong?
faqs.answer:
Nationals of about 170 countries including India may visit Hong Kong without a
                                visa/entry permit
                                for a period of up to 14 days. However Indian nationals are required to apply for and
                                successfully
                                complete the Hong Kong Pre-arrival registration (PAR) online before they can visit the
                                HKSAR
                                visa free.

faqs.question:
What is
                            a Hong Kong Pre-Arrival Registration (PAR)?
faqs.answer:
All Indian nationals who intend to visit Hong Kong visa-free are required to apply for
                                Pre-arrival
                                Registration (PAR) effective January 23, 2017, unless they qualify for one of the
                                categories
                                of exemption.  A successful registrant is allowed to visit Hong Kong visa-free for
                                multiple
                                visits during the validity period of the PAR and may stay up to 14 days per each entry.

faqs.question:
What if
                            I am unable to process my Hong Kong PAR?
faqs.answer:
Don’t worry about your Hong Kong Pre-arrival Registration. Simply contact us and we will
                                guide
                                you throughout your PAR application.

faqs.question:
Who can
                            apply for a Hong Kong Pre-arrival Registration (PAR)?
faqs.answer:
An Indian national can apply for a Hong Kong PAR if he/she: (i) Holds an Indian passport valid for at least six months; and (ii) Intends to visit or transit (except in direct transit by air and not leaving
                                the airport
                                transit area) the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR) for a stay not
                                exceeding
                                14 days.

faqs.question:
Are all
                            Indian nationals required to apply for Hong Kong PAR before visiting the HKSAR?
faqs.answer:
Subject to normal immigration requirements being met, the following categories of Indian
                                nationals
                                may visit the HKSAR without PAR: (i) Holders of a valid Indian diplomatic or official passport; (ii) Holders of United Nations Laissez Passer coming to the HKSAR or transiting the
                                HKSAR
                                to/from a third place for official United Nations business; (iii) Those who have successfully enrolled for e-Channel service for Frequent
                                Visitors; (iv) Holders of a valid HKSAR Travel Pass; and (v) Those who have obtained a valid entry visa for the HKSAR. Also, Indian nationals who are a member of operating aircrew or operating seacrew on
                                board vessels,
                                or a contract seaman may also come to the HKSAR without PAR, subject to normal
                                immigration
                                requirements being met.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the Eligibility for Pre-arrival Registration / and other important things to
                            consider before travelling?
faqs.answer:
You can apply for pre-arrival registration for visiting or transiting the Hong Kong
                                Special Administrative
                                Region (HKSAR) (if seeking to enter the HKSAR during transit) if you are: (a) An Indian national holding an Indian passport valid for at least six months; and (b) Intending to visit or transit (except in direct transit by air and not leaving
                                the airport
                                transit area) the HKSAR for a stay not exceeding 14 days. (c) Ensure that you have at least 2 blank pages on your passport when you arrive at
                                Hong
                                Kong Airport (d) In case you have renewed your passport after obtaining “Notification of
                                Pre-arrival registration”
                                and any particulars that does not match with your current valid passport, you must
                                re-apply
                                for “Pre-arrival Registration” on the strength of the new Passport.

faqs.question:
Is the
                            issuance of the Hong Kong Pre-arrival Registration notification slip a guarantee
                            of the applicant’s entry to the HKSAR?
faqs.answer:
No, the notification slip is not a guarantee of the traveller’s entry to the HKSAR. The
                                registrant
                                is still subject to immigration control under the provisions of the Immigration
                                Ordinance,
                                Chapter 115, Laws of Hong Kong. In general, a person who intends to enter the HKSAR for
                                visit
                                must fulfil normal immigration requirement such as: Valid Passport Hong Kong PAR notification slip Confirmed return flight tickets Sufficient expenses that will cover your expenses during the stay in Hong Kong Accommodation proof Demonstrate the intention to return home after the mentioned time of stay No intention to study or work unless or otherwise mentioned No record of criminal offenses Be able to provide any other documents upon request

faqs.question:
If an
                            Indian national intends to visit/transit the HKSAR for more than 14 days, or
                            if he/she intends to enter the HKSAR for a purpose other than visit/transit, what should
                            he/she
                            do?
faqs.answer:
An Indian national who intends to visit/transit the HKSAR for more than 14 days or
                                intends to
                                enter the HKSAR for a purpose other than visit/transit (e.g. employment, study, or take
                                up
                                residence in the HKSAR) must apply for an appropriate visa to the Immigration
                                Department
                                of the HKSAR under the existing arrangements.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the minimum passport validity to enter Hong Kong?
faqs.answer:
The minimum passport validity to enter Hong Kong is 6 months. Your passport must be
                                valid for
                                at least 6 months from the date of entry into Hong Kong.

faqs.question:
Do I
                            need to apply for Hong Kong PAR if I am transiting the HKSAR?
faqs.answer:
You do not need to apply for PAR if you are in direct transit by air and will not leave
                                the airport
                                transit area. However, if you are seeking to enter the HKSAR during transit, you need
                                to
                                apply for PAR.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the validity of the Hong Kong PAR?
faqs.answer:
A Hong Kong pre-arrival registration is normally valid for a six month period or until
                                the expiry
                                date of the Indian passport linked to it, whichever is earlier. During the validity of
                                the
                                registration, the registrant may make multiple visits to the HKSAR visa-free. On each
                                visit,
                                the registrant may stay in the HKSAR for up to 14 days. Provided that normal Hong Kong
                                Immigration
                                requirements are met, a traveller may, during the validity of the pre-arrival
                                registration,
                                use a valid notification slip together with the specific and valid Indian Passport
                                linked
                                to the successful pre-arrival registration to make multiple visits to Hong Kong
                                Visa-free.

faqs.question:
What If
                            my stay in Hong Kong is longer than 14 days?
faqs.answer:
If you intend to visit Hong Kong for more than 14 days, you may apply for a visa with
                                the Hong
                                Kong Immigration Department.

faqs.question:
How
                            early can I apply for a Hong Kong Pre-arrival Registration (PAR)?
faqs.answer:
You can apply for a Hong Kong Pre-arrival Registration up to 4 to 6 weeks prior to your
                                departure
                                date.

faqs.question:
Does the
                            Hong Kong PAR have any restriction on age?
faqs.answer:
No. There is no restriction on age in applying for the Hong Kong PAR. All Indian
                                nationals who
                                intend to visit the HKSAR, regardless of age, are required to apply for PAR, unless
                                they
                                belong to one of the exempted categories.

faqs.question:
I intend
                            to visit the HKSAR together with my wife and children. Do we need to apply
                            for the Hong Kong PAR individually?
faqs.answer:
Yes. You and your family members are required to apply for the Hong Kong PAR
                                individually.

faqs.question:
Do I
                            need to have a sponsor while applying for Hong Kong PAR?
faqs.answer:
No. However, if you have a local connection in the HKSAR, you should mention the same in
                                the
                                questionnaire provided by us.

faqs.question:
How soon
                            will my Hong Kong PAR application be processed?
faqs.answer:
We will update you within 24 hours regarding the status of your application. If your
                                Pre-arrival
                                Registration is approved by the Hong Kong Immigration, we will email you the PAR
                                notification
                                slip (Approval copy) which will need to be printed on an A4 size paper and carried
                                along.
                                We highly advice you to keep a copy of the PAR notification slip all through your trip.

faqs.question:
What
                            documents should I lodge with my PAR application?
faqs.answer: You can take a look at our checklists to find out what documents you need to provide.

faqs.question:
Can I
                            seek to enter the HKSAR on the last day of the validity of PAR? If yes, will
                            I still be allowed to stay in the HKSAR for a stay up to 14 days?
faqs.answer:
You can seek to enter the HKSAR on the last day of the validity of PAR. Subject to
                                normal immigration
                                requirements being met, you may be allowed to enter and stay in the HSKAR for a stay up
                                to
                                14 days.

faqs.question:
I have
                            just renewed my Indian passport due to its expiry or change of personal particulars,
                            etc. Can I still use the "Notification Slip for Pre-arrival Registration for Indian
                            Nationals"
                            linked to my previous passport together with my new passport to seek entry to the HKSAR?
faqs.answer: No. You must re-apply for PAR on the strength of the new passport.

faqs.question:
Is it
                            necessary to bring along the printout of the "Notification Slip for Pre-arrival
                            Registration for Indian Nationals" (notification slip) after successful application for PAR
                            for
                            boarding an aircraft, ship, vehicle or other forms of transportation bound for the HKSAR
                            and
                            arrival immigration clearance in the HKSAR?
faqs.answer:
After successful application for PAR, you must print the notification slip generated by
                                the PAR
                                system on a sheet of blank A4 white paper. Before boarding a conveyance ("conveyance"
                                means
                                a ship, aircraft, vehicle or any other means whatsoever of travel or transport) bound
                                for
                                the HKSAR, transport operators will check the notification slip. Failure to present the
                                notification
                                slip and the same and valid Indian passport which you have used to apply for PAR
                                successfully
                                will lead to refusal of your boarding a conveyance bound for the HKSAR and refusal of
                                entry
                                to the HKSAR.

faqs.question:
What
                            should I do if my notification slip is lost, defaced or damaged?
faqs.answer: You may contact us and we will reprint the notification slip for you.

faqs.question:
I have
                            successfully applied for the Hong Kong PAR. Can I come to the HKSAR to work
                            or study on the strength of the "Notification Slip for Pre-arrival Registration for Indian
                            Nationals"?
faqs.answer:
No. A person admitted as a visitor in the HKSAR is not allowed to take any employment,
                                whether
                                paid or unpaid; establish or join in any business; or become a student at a school,
                                university
                                or other educational institution in the HKSAR. If you wish to enter the HKSAR for
                                employment,
                                study, training or residence, you should apply for an appropriate visa to the
                                Immigration
                                Department of the HKSAR under the existing arrangements

faqs.question:
Is a day
                            trip to Macau from Hong Kong considered an EXIT and RE-ENTRY into Hong Kong?
faqs.answer:
Yes, a day trip to Macau from Hong Kong is still considered as an exit and re-entry into
                                Hong
                                Kong.

faqs.question:
Do I
                            need to take health/travel insurance?
faqs.answer:
You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself as
                                medical
                                treatment can be very expensive in Hong Kong. Your travel insurance offers protection
                                against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses,
                                flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For
                                financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase
                                travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

faqs.question:
Can you
                            fill out the Hong Kong Pre-arrival Registration for me?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Our Visa Experts work with you to collect all the information required for
                                successful completion
                                of the Pre-arrival Registration application process. We work as quickly as possible to
                                complete
                                & submit your application. We understand that your visa applications may be urgent
                                and
                                we have the capacity to deal with this.

faqs.question:
How will
                            you help me with successful application of Hong Kong Pre-arrival Registration?
faqs.answer:
Applying for a Hong Kong Pre-arrival Registration through us will be an easy and hassle
                                free
                                process as we will take care of your complete application process.

What is
                            the easiest way to apply for a Hong Kong Pre-arrival Registration?
faqs.answer:
The easiest way to apply for a Hong Kong Pre-arrival Registration is to contact us. We
                                are experts
                                in the travel and tourism sector with over 40 years of experience. Through our
                                expertise,
                                in-depth knowledge and integrity, we commit to delivering an exceptional experience to
                                our
                                customers each and every time you use our service. In order to help us understand your

                                visa needs, please drop in your query and our Expert will get in touch with you.

faqs.answer: All Indian Citizens require a valid Philippines visa to travel to Philippines, whether for business or tourism. We can help you to obtain a visa.

faqs.question: How long will it take to get my Philippines visa?
faqs.answer: All visa applications will require at least eight 10 working days of processing time from the time of receipt. But this largely depends on the prompt submission of required documents as well as the meeting of eligibility norms. It is highly encouraged that all applicants submit their Applications at least 15 working days prior to their intended date of travel to the Philippines.

faqs.question: Can I request for expedited visa processing time?
faqs.answer: No. Since 23 April 2018, expedited processing time has ceased.

faqs.question: Must I enter the Philippines only through Manila?
faqs.answer: No. You may also enter the Philippines through any of its international airports in Clark, Cebu, Davao, Iloilo, Laoag, Kalibo as well as through the international seaports in Zamboanga and Bongao.

faqs.question: What is the validity of my Philippines Visa?
faqs.answer: The validity of a single-entry temporary visitor's visa for both tourism and business is three months. This means that you should use your visa to enter the Philippines with three months from the date of issuance. Otherwise, you have to apply for a fresh visa. The validity of a multiple-entry visa temporary visitor's visa for tourism is six months. This means, that you can use the visa to enter Philippines many times within six months and stay within the authorized length of stay as indicated in your visa for each visit. Please note that issuance of a multiple-entry visa temporary visitor's visa for tourism with a validity of more than six months requires the approval from the Philippine Department of Foreign Affairs. The validity of a multiple-entry visa temporary visitor's visa for business is six months OR one-year. This means, that you can use the visa to enter the Philippines many times within six months OR one year from the date of the visa's issuance and stay within the authorized length of stay as indicated in your visa for each visit.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Philippines Consulate/Embassy to get my Visa?
faqs.answer: No. You do not need to visit the Consulate/Embassy. We will take care of the complete visa process right from verifying your documents to stamping of your visa.

faqs.question: What is a Myanmar eVisa?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Immigration & Population has launched an eVisa system permitting travellers to get their Myanmar visa online. Currently eVisa is only applicable for tourist and business purpose.

faqs.question: What type of Visa can I apply for online?
faqs.answer: You can only apply for Tourist and Business Visas with this eVisa system. In the case of Tourist Visa, a special 24-hour Tourist Visa Express Service is available for faster processing.

faqs.question: How do I enter to and exit from Myanmar using eVisa?
faqs.answer: With eVisa, you can enter at any one of the following: 1. One of the 3 International Airports: Yangon, Mandalay, Nay Pyi Taw 2. One of the 3 International Land Border Checkpoints: Tachileik, Myawaddy, Kawthaung To exit from Myanmar, you can use any one of above stated International Airports, International Land Border Checkpoints and furthermore, the Htikee Land Border Checkpoint as well.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Myanmar?
faqs.answer: With a tourist e-visa you can stay for up to 28 days in Myanmar within the term of validity of your e-visa. For a business e-visa you can stay for up to 70 days.

faqs.question: How long is the approval letter valid for?
faqs.answer: The Approval letter is valid for 90 days from the date of issue.

faqs.question: Is there any validity restriction of inviting company registration for Business Visa?
faqs.answer: The Inviting registered company must have at least 6 months of registration until 31 January 2018 onward, the inviting registered company must have at least 3 months validity of registration.

faqs.question: My trip is delayed and my eVisa is expired. Can you change my eVisa validity date?
faqs.answer: We are not able change the validity dates on your eVisa. We encourage you to re-apply for another visa.

faqs.question: I plan to travel from Myanmar to another country for a short trip and return to Myanmar again. Do I need to apply two Visas within such a short period of time?
faqs.answer: Yes, you will need to apply for two eVisas. Each eVisa is only valid for a single entry.

faqs.question: I plan to travel to Myanmar three months later, can I apply now? If not, when can I start applying?
faqs.answer: The validity of permitted visa is (90) days.

faqs.question: If my online eVisa application is denied, will I be able to apply for a Tourist/Business Visa through a Myanmar Embassy or Consulate?
faqs.answer: Yes. You may apply for your visa at a Myanmar Embassy or Consulate, or try your application again using eVisa facility. However, Visa application verification and approval policies are the same across all embassies and online applications.

faqs.question: Will Visa on Arrival be available, and Myanmar Embassies and Consulates continue to issue visa even with eVisa officially available?
faqs.answer: Yes, however Please keep in mind that Visa on Arrival is for Business Visa only, and proper documentation must be on hand or entry may be denied. Therefore, It is advisable to apply for a Myanmar visa with online eVisa facility or continue to apply at a Myanmar Embassy or Consulate near your location.

faqs.question: Will I receive my visa by post, or do I collect it at the Myanmar checkpoint?
faqs.answer: Your visa will be issued and stamped inside your passport at the Myanmar Immigration Arrival counter, after you show your printed copy of the eVisa Approval Letter. When your eVisa application is approved, the Approval Letter is sent directly to your designated e-mail address.

faqs.question: How do I receive my eVisa Approval Letter?
faqs.answer: When your eVisa application has been approved an Approval Letter is sent to your designated email address.

faqs.question: Do I have to print the Approval Letter, or can I show an electronic version or photo of it to the Immigration officer?
faqs.answer: You are currently required to print out the eVisa Approval Letter and present it to the Immigration Officer upon arrival. Failure to provide a printed copy may delay your entry.

faqs.question: What type of accommodation should I choose to stay in Myanmar?
faqs.answer: If you want to use the e-visa for Myanmar, you need to stay in one of the following types of accommodation: hotel, motel, inn, guesthouse, resort. If you stay in a different type of accommodation (for example a hostel) then your application will very likely be rejected in Myanmar.

faqs.question: How long will it take to receive my Approval Letter?
faqs.answer: The processing time is up to 3 working days for normal Business and Tourist Visa, and 24 hours for Tourist Visa Express Service. In all cases, processing time starts when the application acknowledgement e-mail is sent, after application is submitted AND online payment is successful.

faqs.question: Does my child need his/her own e-visa for Myanmar?
faqs.answer: Yes, minors need their own eVisa for Myanmar.

faqs.question: Can I extend my eVisa for Myanmar?
faqs.answer: No, it’s not possible to extend your eVisa for Myanmar.

faqs.question: May I know the reasons why a Myanmar application is rejected?
faqs.answer: Reasons will not be provided for rejected applications.

faqs.question: When applying, what is the policy for weekends and official public holidays?
faqs.answer: For regular Business and Tourist visa, processing is within 3 working days excluding weekends and public holidays Myanmar time. For Tourist Visa Express Service, processing is within 24 hours.

faqs.question: What are the advantages of applying for a Myanmar eVisa?
faqs.answer: Minimum document requirement; Swift processing-subject to qualifying the eligibility criteria and meeting the documents requirement, your visa can be processed within 3 working days; Convenient and cost effective i.e. most economical visa fee/charges; Electronic visa can be sent anywhere in the world through Email.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of applying for visa through Akbar Travels?
faqs.answer: By contacting Akbar Travels for your visa application, you can eliminate the need for personally visiting the Embassy for your application. All you will have to do is apply online on our website and get your visa processed within the set timeframe. Minimal documentation and quick processing is another of the key highlights. In most case, the visa processing takes only 3 working days.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Myanmar Consulate/Embassy to get my Visa?
faqs.answer: No. You do not need to visit the Consulate/Embassy. We will take care of the complete visa process right from verifying your documents to approval of your eVisa.

faqs.question: Do I need to take a health/travel insurance?
faqs.answer: You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself in Myanmar as medical treatment can be very expensive in Myanmar. Your travel insurance offers protection against unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel insurance and avail our special offer.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Togo?
faqs.answer: Yes.Indian citizens are required to obtain a visa prior to entering the Republic of Togo.Visas may be obtained from the Embassy of Togo in India. Entry and residence visas are issued by the Embassy and are valid from one to 90 days. Before applying for a visa please check which visa type you are eligible to apply for.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Togo visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straight forward and effortless process to apply for a Togo visa online through Akbar Travels: Choose your preferred type of Togo visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Togo visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Togo visa is one month before the date of travel to the country.In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted ten days, prior to travelling.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Togo visa online?
faqs.answer: Applicants are encouraged to apply three (3) weeks to (1) one month in advance of travel.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Togo visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The short stay visa is valid for 90 days.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Togo visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The processing time is 3 working days from the date of deposit and 1 day for an Express visa.

faqs.question: What is the Express visa fee?
faqs.answer: The Express visa cost is INR 1000/- over & above the visa fee.

faqs.question: Is it possible to obtain a visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: No. Indians travelling to Togo must obtain a visa before their arrival in the country. Visa on arrival service is not available for Indian nationals.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Togo once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Togo visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Togo How long you intend to stay in Togo How will you support yourself during your time in Togo What is the purpose of your visit to Togo Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Togo If you have a permit to Togo the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Togo

faqs.question: How do I receive my Togo visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: Do I need to obtain a transit visa for my layover flight?
faqs.answer: If your transit time is within 24 hours, and you fulfil basic requirements such as holding a valid passport, onward flight ticket and sufficient funds, you do not need a Togo visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Consulate/Embassy to submit my documents?
faqs.answer: No. You are not required to visit the Togo Embassy personally. We will submit the visa application on your behalf.

faqs.question: What if my Togo visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The granting of the visa is entirely the prerogative and at the discretion of the Embassy / Consul of Togo and no reasons will be provided for the delay/denial of a visa.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Togo tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country ona Togo tourist visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the event of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.answer: Yes.Indian citizens are required to obtain a visa prior to entering the Republic of Guinea.Visas may be obtained from the Embassy of Guinea in India. Based on the purpose of your visit to Guinea you may apply for a Business Visa, Tourist Visa, Visit Visa, Official Visa, Diplomatic Visa, Student/Research Visa, Transit Visa, Crew Visa& many more. Before applying for a visa please check which visa type you are eligible to apply for.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Guinea Visas?
faqs.answer: Ordinary Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to enter Guinea for tourism, leisure, visit or business. Transit Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to transit through Guinea within a period of three to four days. Diplomatic Visa: This type of visa is issued to diplomatic passport-holders who are assigned to assume duties for a long period of time at a foreign Diplomatic Mission or Consulate or International Organization in Guinea. Courtesy Visa: Issued to representatives of foreign governments or international organizations who do not qualify for diplomatic status but do merit expedited, courteous treatment.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Guinea visa online?

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Guinea visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The Guinea Embassy issues a single and multiple entry visa. The single entry visa is valid for 1 month whereas the multiple entry visa is valid for 3 months from the date of issue.

faqs.question: What is the cost of a multiple entry Guinea visa?
faqs.answer: The multiple entry visa is INR 9799/-. The visa is issued for 3 months and within this period of 3 months you can travel to Guinea multiple times.

faqs.question: Is the Guinea visa extendable?
faqs.answer: Yes the Guinea visa can be extended in Guinea itself for up to 1 year at an additional charge.However the final decision lies with the Immigration authorities in Guinea.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Guinea visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa application is normally processed within 5 working days.

faqs.question: Can I get the Guinea visa faster than the regular processing time?
faqs.answer: Yes. The Embassy provides an express service that get you the Guinea visa within 24 hours. This service is available at an additional charge. (Approx. INR 5000/- + Visa fee)

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Guinea visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: why are you visiting Guinea how long you intend to stay in Guinea how will you support yourself during your time in Guinea what is the purpose of your visit to Guinea type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid where do you intend to travel following your visit to Guinea if you have a permit to enter the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Guinea

faqs.question: How do I receive my Guinea visa online?

faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Guinea once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once.

faqs.answer: Yes. As per the Guinea Visa requirements, a yellow fever vaccination is mandatory. The certificate of the same is required to be attached along with other documents when applying for the visa.

faqs.question: How long is my vaccination certificate valid for?
faqs.answer: A certificate for yellow fever vaccination has a validity lasting up to 10 years. It must be counted 10 days post the date of vaccination.

faqs.question: What is a United Kingdomrainian visa?
faqs.answer: It is a document of varying formats that allows citizens of India to enter the Republic of United Kingdomraine for a stipulated number of days.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for United Kingdomraine?
faqs.answer: All Indians need a visa to travel to United Kingdomraine. The visa must be obtained from the United Kingdomrainian Embassy in India. There are many types of United Kingdomraine visas. The type of visa you need will depend upon your purpose of trip.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a United Kingdomraine visa online?

faqs.question: If I am a regular visitor to United Kingdomraine, will I have to provide with all documentation each time I apply?
faqs.answer: Yes. Every time you apply for a United Kingdomrainian visa, you must supply the recent supplementary documentation.

faqs.question: What are the different kinds of United Kingdomrainian visas for Indians?
faqs.answer: Indians travelling to United Kingdomraine can choose from different type of visas depending on their reason for travel. Tourist visa is granted for those applicants who intend to visit United Kingdomraine for tourism and sightseeing without having an invitation from a United Kingdomrainian referent. Private visit visa is for applicants visiting family and friends legally residing in United Kingdomraine. A Business visa is issued for business travellers and representatives of business organizations

faqs.question: What is the United Kingdomrainian visa processing time?
faqs.answer: United Kingdomrainian visa is normally processed in up to 10 working days from the day of application within regular service unless stipulated otherwise by United Kingdomraine’s international treaties. Processing time of an application filed within regular service may be extended for up to 30 working days if additional checks are necessary. There is also an express visa service wherein the visa is processed in up to 5 working days from the day of application within expedited service (specific number of days to be defined by each Embassy/Consulate);

faqs.question: What kind of entry is my United Kingdomrainian visa?
faqs.answer: Short term United Kingdomrainian visas are issued as single / double / multiple entry visas valid for 6 months or another period depending on supporting documents but cannot be issued for more than a 5 year-term

faqs.question: Do I need to submit my passport along when applying for a United Kingdomrainian visa online?
faqs.answer: Yes, the United Kingdomrainian visa is a stamp or sticker that is placed on an empty page of a passport. Therefore, the original passport with two consecutive blank pages is required to be submitted in person.

faqs.question: Can I enter United Kingdomraine with a valid Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: No, you cannot enter United Kingdomraine even though you possess a valid Schengen Visa.

faqs.question: From when is my visa valid?
faqs.answer: United Kingdomrainian visa for Indians are valid from the date it is issued and should not be calculated from the date of entry into United Kingdomraine.

faqs.question: Do I need a travel and medical insurance?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is necessary to purchase a travel insurance plan as it is one of the United Kingdomrainian visa requirements. Akbar Travels can assist you with the same to cover any medical expenses during travel, damage and loss of baggage.

faqs.question: What if my United Kingdomrainian visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy of the Republic of United Kingdomraine in New Delhi is responsible for United Kingdomrainian visa rejection or approval of United Kingdomrainian visa applications from India. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final. Travellers are advised to submit all necessary documents when applying for the visa.

faqs.question: Will my fee be refunded in case of visa refusal?
faqs.answer: No. The application fee covers handling of the application, irrespective of the final result.

faqs.question: What else do I need to know about the United Kingdomrainian tourist visa from India?
faqs.answer: A United Kingdomrainian visa is a legal document that allows Indians to lawfully enter the country. The passport having the visa must be kept in safe custody. Upon the damage or loss of the visa page, a new one will need to be applied for.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Tajikistan from India?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Tajikistan. Indians are eligible for an eVisa. The electronic visa system (eVisa) will allow foreign citizens to receive Tajikistan visa online, relieving them from necessity to stand in queues in Tajikistan consulates or at the border. It is the simplest and the fastest way to get your visa. Once your visa application is approved, you will receive the visa copy via email right in your inbox.

faqs.question: What is an eVisa?
faqs.answer: An Electronic Visa or "e Visa" is an electronically issued and stored authority for travel to The Republic of Tajikistan, which replaces the traditional paper visa process in most cases.

faqs.question: What is a Tajikistan eVisa?
faqs.answer: A Tajikistan visa is a legal document which lawfully allows its holder to enter and stay within the country for a certain number of days as mentioned on the visa.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Tajikistan visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: A Tajikistan visa is most appropriate for Indians travelling to Tajikistan for business and recreational purposes such as holidaying, sightseeing, or even short family visits. The type of visa to enter Tajikistan will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a traditional visa (sticker pasted on the passport) and an eVisa?
faqs.answer: The support is the only difference. Both documents allow to visit the Republic of Tajikistan in accordance with the legal framework governing the type of visa / eVisa obtained.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Tajikistan visas for Indians?
faqs.answer: The categories of visas available for Indians visiting Tajikistan depends on the purpose of the visit. Tourist visa (T) is issued to the following applicants: foreign citizens traveling to the Republic of Tajikistan as a tourist or a group of foreign citizens who are going to Tajikistan for the purpose of tourism in organized group (not less than 5 but no more than 50 persons in a group). Private visa (XC) is issued to the following applicants: foreign citizens who are going to the Republic of Tajikistan on a visit to relatives and friends; foreign citizens who are going to the Republic of Tajikistan on a vacation, for treatment or with the other purposes of private character. Business visa (К) is issued to the following applicants: -foreign citizens who are going to Tajikistan with the business purposes ( participation in business negotiations, at meetings, symposiums, forums, conferences, tenders, the conclusion of contracts, creation of joint ventures, studying of Tajik market, participation in auctions, exhibitions and fairs, rendering of advisory and auditor services and so forth).

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Tajikistan Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Electronic visa of the Republic of Tajikistan is valid for 90 days, however the visa holder can stay in the territory of the country for no more than 45 calendar days.  Electronic visa is not extendable and the visa holder have to leave the country in the specified date.

faqs.question: What kind of Documentation I need to apply for Tajikistan eVisa?
faqs.answer: Scanned copy of a valid passport. (Please note, passports must be valid for a minimum of 6 months from the date of arrival in Tajikistan) A recent color passport photograph (45mm x 35mm); all photos are to be on a while back ground only, and not altered or edited from its original state. Evidence of proposed journey into and out of Tajikistan i.e. ticket or confirmation of your booking from the travel agent. Proof of accommodation for the length of your stay or a letter of invitation from your sponsor. Students, must provide the acceptance letter from your school, and the details of where they will be staying during their studies. Individuals traveling on business are to provide a letter from your employer stating the purpose of your trip. (business covering letter, invitation letter etc) Proof of funds to finance the trip i.e. bank statements for the previous three months. Birth certificate for children travellers

faqs.question: What is the eVisa processing time?
faqs.answer: The Tajikistan visa is processed online within 5 working days.

faqs.question: How will I receive the Tajikistan visa online?
faqs.answer: Applicants will receive their visas via email, after filling the application form with the necessary information and submitting the supporting documents online. The eVisa must be presented upon crossing the state border of Tajikistan along with the valid travel document.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Tajikistan visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Tajikistan How long you intend to stay in Tajikistan How will you support yourself during your time in Tajikistan What is the purpose of your visit to Tajikistan Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Tajikistan If you have a permit to Tajikistan the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Tajikistan
