faqs.question: What is an Estonia Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
An Estonia Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all
                                the Schengen
                                countries including Estonia for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s
                                dream
                                where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along with
                                Estonia.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all
                                26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Estonia), unless it is marked
                                otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European
                                territory
                                of Estonia. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons
                                of
                                your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following
                                countries:
                                Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece,
                                Hungary,
                                Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands,
                                Norway,
                                Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your
                                passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This
                                means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The
                                precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the
                                heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only
                                once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A
                                two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the
                                Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number
                                of
                                entries".

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the
                                Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your
                                flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer:
You may appeal against this decision. The decision to refuse a Schengen visa and the
                                reasons
                                for the refusal are notified using a standard form that is handed out by the Member
                                State's
                                consulate that refused the visa. The notification of the refusal must include the
                                reasons,
                                on which the refusal were based, and the procedures and deadlines for submitting an
                                appeal.
                                You are free to re-apply again if your application has been refused earlier. However,
                                it
                                is recommended that you take note of the reasons for the earlier refusal before
                                submitting
                                a new application and make amendments, where necessary. The visa fee is not refunded if the visa is refused. The visa fee covers the cost
                                of the
                                examination of the visa application.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a
                                country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: the purpose of your trip when and where you intend to travel how your trip is going to be funded day-by-day itinerary for your trip duration of the trip

faqs.question: Is it possible to extend my Schengen Visa while in Estonia?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your short-stay visa while in Estonia except in special circumstances,
                                and
                                exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or
                                criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and
                                apply
                                for another Estonia Visa if necessary.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01".
                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during
                                the
                                validity of the visa.

faqs.question:
If my Estonia short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long can I
                            remain in the Estonia territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in an Estonia territory for a
                                maximum
                                period of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of
                                departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as
                                certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the
                                processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 10-12 working days from your
                                appointment
                                date.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain an Estonia Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, an Estonia Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 5 to 15 days to process
                                in the
                                Estonian Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Estonia Visa is dependent on
                                several
                                factors and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my Estonia Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Estonia visa application online using the Estonia VFS
                                Reference
                                number and Last Name. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of the Estonian
                                VFS
                                website.

faqs.question: Will I get my visa at the end of the process?
faqs.answer:
The issuance or refusal of an Estonia visa is the sole prerogative of The
                                Embassy/Consulate.
                                The Estonia Visa Application Centre cannot influence this decision in any way.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for an Estonia Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Estonia Visa in order to provide your biometrics
                                and submit
                                your visa documents.

faqs.question:
I have a valid long stay visa/residence permit for a country that is part of the Schengen
                            area. Do I need another visa to
                            travel to other Schengen states?
faqs.answer:
No. A long stay visa or a residence permit issued by a Schengen State allows you to
                                travel or
                                stay in other Schengen States, while respecting the maximum duration of a “short stay”
                                (a
                                stay of "90 days in any 180 day period")

faqs.question: My family is also applying for a Estonia Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question:
I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply for my
                            Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will
                                be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then
                                you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first
                                port
                                of entry.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01".
                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during
                                the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Vis
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only
                                once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a
                                multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity
                                period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from my
                            travel document with the Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At
                                the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional
                                documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and
                                the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the
                                documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation,
                                travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be
                                presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Estonia Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System
                                (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide
                                biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at
                                the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications
                                within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the
                                VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will
                                again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the
                                applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it
                                cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years
                                period.

faqs.question: What is the role of VFS?
faqs.answer:
VFS Global Services Pvt Ltd (VFS) is the Service Delivery Provider for the Embassy of
                                Estonia
                                in New Delhi. The role of VFS is to accept visa applications and to dispatch passports
                                and
                                documents back to clients, on behalf of the Embassy of Estonia. VFS does not play any
                                part
                                in or influence the outcome of your visa application.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel
                                insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical
                                reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their
                                stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid
                                throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended
                                stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: What are the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question: Can you process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa,
                                you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical
                                treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection
                                against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses,
                                flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident. For financial
                                safety
                                and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance
                                and avail our special offer.

faqs.answer:
The easiest way to apply for an Estonia Visa is to contact us. We are experts in the

                                tourism sector with over 40 years of experience. Through our expertise, in-depth
                                knowledge
                                and integrity, we commit to delivering an exceptional experience to our customers each
                                and
                                every time you use our service. In order to help us understand your unique visa needs,
                                please
                                drop in your query and our Expert will get in touch with you.

faqs.answer: We have you covered across India with presence in all the major cities like Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, Bangalore, Chennai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and many more.

faqs.question: Do I need a Turkey Visa?
faqs.answer:
All Indian Citizens require a visa to travel to Turkey, whether for business or tourism. We can
                                help you to obtain a visa for Turkey. Indians with a valid Schengen, USA, United Kingdom or Ireland Visa
                                or Residence Permit of any of these countries may get their single entry TurkeyVisas provided
                                that they meet certain conditions. Applicants not meeting certain conditions will need to
                                apply for a sticker visa at the Turkeymbassy or consulate. We are here to assist and help
                                you through the entire visa application.

faqs.question:
What is the criteria for the validity of my supporting document (visa or residence permit from Schengen or from US, United Kingdom and
                            Ireland)?
faqs.answer:
The only requirement for your visa/residence permit to be used as a supporting document is that
                                it should be still valid (by date) by the time you enter and exit Turkey. Please note that
                                eVisas of other countries are not accepted as a supporting document.

faqs.question: I do not have a valid Schengen, US, United Kingdom or Ireland Visa? Can I still apply for a TurkeyVisa?
faqs.answer:
No. You can only apply for a TurkeyVisa provided you have a valid Schengen, US, United Kingdom or Ireland
                                Visa. In that case, you will need to apply for a Turkey sticker visa at the Turkish mission
                                and we will be glad to assist you with a fast and hassle free visa application.

faqs.question: Is Turkey Visa a Sticker Visa OR an eVisa?
faqs.answer:
Turkey Visa is a sticker visa endorsed on the passport but if you fulfil some criteria, you can
                                opt for an eVisa as well.

faqs.question: What is a TurkeyVisa?
faqs.answer:
A TurkeyVisa is an official document permitting entry into and travel within Turkey. The eVisa
                                is an alternative to visas issued at Turkish missions.

faqs.question: How long will my TurkeyVisa be valid for?
faqs.answer:
Your TurkeyVisa is a single entry eVisa, valid for 6 months from the date of issue with a stay
                                period of maximum 30 days.

faqs.question: What if I want to stay longer than 30 days?
faqs.answer:
If your trip is longer than 30 days, you will need to apply for a sticker visa at the Turkish
                                Embassy and we can certainly help you with the visa application. We will simplify the visa
                                process for you. Applying for a Turkey Visa through us will be an easy and hassle free process
                                as we will take care of your complete visa process right from getting your documents ready
                                to stamping of your Sri Lanka visa.

faqs.question: How do I know my TurkeyVisa is official and how does it work?
faqs.answer:
We are a specialized service provider issuing official TurkeyVisas. Turkish eVisas are issued
                                electronically by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Turkey. Travel agents
                                like us can use the TurkeyVisa system to process an eVisa. We enter the information contained
                                in the applicant's passport into the TurkeyVisa system- The eVisa system interacts with
                                departmental systems to check the applicant's details. Following these checks, the service
                                provider is advised of the outcome of the TurkeyVisa application. If a TurkeyVisa is granted, it is linked electronically to the applicant's passport. If a denied
                                message is received instead, we refer the applicant to the nearest Turkish embassy or mission.
                                The TurkeyVisa is electronically linked to the passport and is accessible to the Department
                                of Foreign Affairs. We strongly recommend travelers print a copy of their Turkish eVisa in
                                case there is a problem with the computer terminals at the immigration office upon arrival.

faqs.question: Is this website secure to apply for the TurkeyVisa online?
faqs.answer:
Yes. We have been helping thousands of travelers since years and the Government of Turkey fully
                                accepts applications processed by specialized third parties like us. Only the necessary data
                                required to process your application will be collected and used for this purpose, we do not
                                share any of your data with third parties. Our payment gateway has also been designed in
                                accordance with the international standards.

faqs.question: Do I need to enter Turkey on the exact date specified in my visa application?
faqs.answer:
No. The validity period of your TurkeyVisa begins from the date specified in your application.
                                You can enter Turkey on any date within that period. Normally the evisa validity for Indians
                                is of 6 months from the date of issue and you can enter Turkey anytime within this validity.

faqs.question: Is the TurkeyVisa issued for a single entry or multiple entries?
faqs.answer: The TurkeyVisa for Indians is a single entry eVisa.

faqs.question: I am not able to print my TurkeyVisa, what should I do?
faqs.answer:
In that case, please get in touch with us. We will resend your TurkeyVisa copy in a different
                                format if you are unable to print it.

faqs.question: My passport expires soon and I’m going to apply for a new one before I travel, can I still apply for a TurkeyVisa?
faqs.answer:
No, for the validity of your TurkeyVisa, it is important that the details on your evisa correspond
                                to the details on the passport you are travelling with. So you need to have your new passport
                                details before you apply for a TurkeyVisa.

faqs.question: How do I receive my TurkeyVisa
faqs.answer:
You will receive your TurkeyVisa by e-mail. After we receive your eVisa, we will send it to
                                the e-mail address that you provided in your Turkey visa application.

faqs.question: Do I have to print out my TurkeyVisa?
faqs.answer:
We advise you to always carry a hardcopy (printed) or digital copy (on your smartphone, tablet
                                or laptop) of your TurkeyVisa with you during your entire trip.

faqs.question: For what type of travel can I use the TurkeyVisa?
faqs.answer:
The eVisa for Turkey is valid for tourism and business purpose only. For other purposes such
                                as work or study, you must apply for a sticker visa through the Turkish Embassies or Consulates.

faqs.question: Can I get a visa on arrival in Turkey?
faqs.answer: No, it is not possible for Indians to get a Turkey visa on arrival.

faqs.question: Does my child need his/her own eVisa for Turkey?
faqs.answer: Yes, children/minors need their own eVisa for Turkey.

faqs.question: By when should I apply for a TurkeyVisa?
faqs.answer: It is advisable to apply for an eVisa at least 5 to 7 days before your travel.

faqs.question: What is a Turkey Visa?
faqs.answer:
A Turkey Visa is a stamp or endorsement placed by officials of Turkey on a passport that allows
                                the bearer to visit Turkey. Visas are obtained from the Embassy or consulates of Turkey for
                                your visit. "Visit" is further defined as the reason for entry, usually business, tourist
                                or transitory.

faqs.question: Is the Turkey Visa issued at the Embassy a sticker visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, on complete processing of your visa application, your passport will be stamped with a Turkey
                                Visa.

faqs.question: How long does it take to process the Turkey sticker Visa?
faqs.answer:
Turkey Visa under normal circumstances will take approximately 4 to 6 working days depending
                                upon the city of application.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Turkey Visa at the Embassy?
faqs.answer:
You are strongly encouraged to file your Turkey Visa application at least 25 working days prior
                                to the date of departure and not more than 60 days before departure. This will allow an orderly
                                examination of your application and limit the chances for delay in decisions on visa applications.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Turkey Visa Application centre for my visa application?
faqs.answer:
No, you don’t need to visit the Turkey Visa Application centre personally. We will simplify the
                                visa process for you. Applying for a Turkey Visa through us will be an easy and hassle free
                                process as we will take care of your complete visa process right from getting your documents
                                ready to stamping of your Turkey Visa.

faqs.question: What would be the validity of Turkey sticker Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically 6 months with a maximum stay of upto 90 days. You can request for a longer stay duration,
                                but be sure to include proof/justification. Validity of the Turkey Visa is at the discretion
                                of the Turkeymbassy.

faqs.question: Is Turkey Visa tracking possible and if yes, how do I to track my Turkey Visa status?
faqs.answer:
Yes, Turkey Visa tracking is possible on the VFS Turkey website. You can track your Turkey visa
                                status by entering your Receipt Number and your last name.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to provide travel insurance for my Turkey Visa application at the Embassy/Consulate?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death. The insurance should
                                cover the entire period of the person’s intended stay or transit. The minimum coverage must
                                be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: Do you provide health/travel insurance?
faqs.answer:
You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself in Turkey
                                as medical treatment can be very expensive in Turkey. We can certainly assist you with the
                                travel insurance as it’s an absolute necessity for International travel in the event of unexpected
                                events such as medical emergencies, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: What are the travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer:
Your travel Insurance plan for Turkey Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for Medical Evacuation and repatriation expenses Coverage for Personal accidental death Coverage for Personal liability Coverage for Daily allowance in hospitalization cases Note: The travel insurance dates should end 2 days after the date of departure mentioned in the
                                flight ticket.

faqs.answer:
The easiest way to apply for a TurkeyVisa or sticker visa is to contact us. We are experts

Minimum document requirement; Swift processing-subject to qualifying the eligibility criteria and meeting the documents

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a Visa to travel to Samoa?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indians Visitors to Samoa can apply for a 90-day Visitor Permit on arrival. A visitor’s permit is issued on arrival for the purposes of holiday, business, visiting friends or family. Work is not permitted on a Visitor Permit.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for Samoa visa on arrival?
faqs.answer:
Before travelling to Samoa please ensure you meet the requirements listed below: Have a return onward ticket Possess a passport valid for a minimum of six (6) months after the intended date of departure from Samoa Have a valid visa or permit for entry into the country to which they will travel from Samoa State accommodation arrangements Have documented evidence of sufficient funds for self-support Have no record or deportation from other countries Have no health problems that would pose a risk to Samoa Have no history of criminal charges resulting in a minimum of one year sentencing
 Not appear on any alert or warning lists

faqs.question: How long is the Samoa Permit valid for?
faqs.answer: Indians will be issued a Visitor’s Permit valid for a stay of up to 90 days. Visitors wishing to extend stay beyond the sixty (90) days covered under the Visitor's Permit must apply for an extension of their permit. All applications must be lodged at the Immigration Office in Apia before the Visitor Permit expires.

faqs.question: How can I extend the Visitor’s Permit in Samoa?
faqs.answer: Visitors who are in Samoa and wish to apply for a further period of stay as a visitor should use the temporary residence form. To apply for this extension, you must: Complete the application form for temporary residence (MPMC100) Attach a photocopy of onward ticket out of Samoa Provide evidence of sufficient funds to support your extended stay Provide details of accommodation arrangements

faqs.question: What is a Business Visitor Permit?
faqs.answer: A Business Visitor Permit is for persons normally employed and paid offshore who are visiting Samoa for a short visit, to visit a branch of their company, to conduct business negotiations with a Samoan company or to attend a business conference.For other business activity in Samoa, a Temporary Resident Permit is required.

faqs.question: Is my permit valid for the whole of Samoa?
faqs.answer: Yes. The permit is valid for the whole of Samoa.

faqs.question: Can Indians apply for the Visitor Permit in advance before travel?
faqs.answer: No. There is no facility to apply for a Samoa Visitor Permit in advance. Applicants must obtain the permit on arrival itself.

faqs.question: Is there any fear of Samoa Visitor Permit rejection?
faqs.answer: Indians are not liable to face a rejection. However, the above said documents are necessary to enter the country. Failure to produce any of the documents may result into rejection of the Visitor permit, thereby barring you from entering the country. The final decision to grant an entry permit is solely at the discretion of the Immigration officials at Samoa airport.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get the permit?
faqs.answer: Usually, it takes around 20 minutes to get all formalities done and get the permit on arrival at Samoa. However, the time may vary depending on the peak travel period.

faqs.question: What is the process of getting a Samoa Visitor permit?
faqs.answer: After landing at Samoa airport, kindly head to the Immigration counter. The immigration authorities will most likely ask basic questions about the trip and request for supporting documents. Overall, it takes about 20 to 30 minutes to issue an entry permit. The whole method is hassle-free and easy.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the occurrence of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Belarus?
faqs.answer: Yes.Indian citizens are required to obtain a visa prior to entering the Republic of Belarus.Visas may be obtained from the Embassy of Belarus in India. Before applying for a visa please check which visa type you are eligible to apply for.

faqs.question: What are the types of Belarus visas?
faqs.answer:
The most commonly used visa
                                        is the short-term visa.
                                        These are valid for
                                        up to 90 days and suitable for: business travellers students private travellers on family business Short-term visas can be single, double or multiple entry,
                                        depending on requirements.Tourists usually
                                        receive a short-term group visa via their travel
                                        agency. Long-term visas are usually valid for one year and
                                allow multiple entry to Belarus. They are suitable for: frequent business travellers private travellers wishing to stay longer in the country Transit visas for Belarus are valid up to one year and allow the holder 2 days to travel across Belarusian territory.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Belarus visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straight forward and effortless process to apply for a Belarus visa online through Akbar Travels: Choose your preferred type of Belarus visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Belarus visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Belarus visa is three months before the date of travel to the country.In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted four weeks prior to travelling.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Belarus visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Belarus visa is one month before the date of travel to the country.In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted ten days, prior to travelling.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Belarus visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: This visa is valid for 90 days. The consular officer has the right to reduce the number of entries and the validity of the visa, increase the term of visa procedure.

faqs.question: Can the Belarus visa be extended?
faqs.answer: Yes. To extend the term of stay in the Republic of Belarus, a foreign national should apply to local office of Citizenship and Migration Department at the place of registration in order to obtain an exit visa

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Belarus visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Successful applications will be processed within 5 working days of receiving the request. Express visa service is not available due to the high volume of visa applications at the Embassy.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Belarus visa application?
faqs.answer:
To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state:
                                . why are you visiting Belarus how long you intend to stay in Belarus how will you support yourself during your time in Belarus what is the purpose of your visit to Belarus type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid where do you intend to travel following your visit to Belarus if you have a permit to enter the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Belarus

faqs.question: How do I receive my Belarus visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: Is there any visa exemption for Indian citizens travelling to Belarus?
faqs.answer: Yes.Foreign citizens of 74 countries including India can enter and stay in Belarus for up to 30 days and exit from the territory of Belarus only through the State border checkpoint of the Republic of Belarus “Minsk National Airport”. To enter the Republic of Belarus in the visa-free regime via the checkpoint “Minsk National Airport”, Indian nationals should have the following documents: Valid ordinary passport: The passport must be valid at least 90 days beyond intended date of departure from the Republic of Belarus Proof of Financial means: at least US $ 600 for each month of stay per person. For the period of stay in Belarus less than one month — at least US $ 25 for each day of stay per person. Return tickets with confirmation of departure from “Minsk National Airport” within 30 days Medical insurance policy with coverage for at least 10 000 euros, valid in Belarus during the whole duration of stay. Valid multiple entry visa of the European Union member states or Schengen zone bearing a European Union or Schengen Area entry stamp Before arrival Indian citizens need to submit in advance (not later than the established time frame) the documents to the Foreign Admissions Division (FAD) of the Consular Directorate of the Foreign Ministry of the Republic of Belarus, which is located at the airport: For short-term visas – not later than 3 business days before the expected arrival date. For long-term visas – not later than 5 business days before the expected arrival date. Eligible visitors who plan to spend more than 5 business days in Belarus must register with the territorial departments of the Citizenship and Migration Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Belarus

faqs.question: How many entries are allowed in Belarus visa?
faqs.answer: Short term visas may be single-entry, double-entry and multiple-entry, depending upon the purpose of travel and type of visa.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Belarus once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Consulate/Embassy to submit my documents?
faqs.answer: Do I need to personally visit the Consulate/Embassy to submit my documents?

faqs.question: What if my Belarus visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Belarus visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Belarus tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country ona Belarus tourist visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Yes. It is mandatory to purchase an overseas medical insurance plan before entering Belarus. The minimum coverage should be EUR 10000. A Travel/Medical Insurance secures your trip in the occurrence of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Saudi Arabia?
faqs.answer: Yes.Indian citizens are required to obtain a visa prior to entering the Republic of Saudi Arabia.Visas may be obtained from the Embassy of Saudi Arabia in India. The Embassy does not issue tourist visas. Applicants can only travel to Saudi Arabia for business purpose or for visiting family and friends. Before applying for a visa please check which visa type you are eligible to apply for

faqs.question: What are the different types of Saudi Arabia Visas?

The visa can be single or multiple-entry. Visa holders are not allowed to take up work or seek employment in Saudi Arabia. faqs.question: How long is the family visit visa for Saudi Arabia valid for?

faqs.answer: There are single and multiple-entry options for a Saudi Arabia Visa. The entry type will depend upon the type of visa you apply for.

faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Saudi Arabia How long you intend to stay in Saudi Arabia How will you support yourself during your time in Saudi Arabia What is the purpose of your visit to Saudi Arabia Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Saudi Arabia If you have a permit to Saudi Arabia the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Saudi Arabia

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Pakistan?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indians need a visa to travel to Pakistan. Pakistan visa for Indians can be obtained at the Pakistan Embassy or Consulate. In order to get visa forPakistan from India, it is necessary to fulfil the visa requirements and submit the necessary documents. A Pakistan visa for Indians can be private, tourist, business and work – depending on the purposeof a visit.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Pakistan visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straightforward and effortless process to apply for Pakistan visa online through Akbar Travels. - Choose your preferred type of Pakistan visa based on your travel type - Pay online - Submit documents through our pick up & drop service - Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: What are the different categories of Pakistan visas for Indians?
faqs.answer: At present the Pakistan Embassy does not issue Tourist visas. Visas are only granted for visits to family or friends and for official/business purpose. Visitors visas are issued to Indian Nationals to meet relatives, friends or for any other legitimate purpose. For business visas a letter from the company/organization in Pakistan sponsoring the applicant stating the purpose of visit is required.

faqs.question: What is not included in the Pakistani visa fee?
faqs.answer: The Pakistani visa fee does not include taxes, and this varies according to the circulars issued by the High Commission.

faqs.question: Will my passport need to be submitted with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, it needs to be submitted for the Pakistani visa vignette or sticker to be inserted on an empty page in the passport. So, the original passport having two consecutive blank pages is required.

faqs.question: Is it possible to extend a Pakistani visa?
faqs.answer: No, a Pakistan visa issued to Indian nationals cannot be extended.

faqs.question: What are my options if my Pakistani visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: A Pakistani visa rejection or acceptance is at the sole discretion of the High Commission of Pakistan, New Delhi. You cannot appeal against the decision or claim a refund.

faqs.question: What are the check posts for Indian nationals?

faqs.question:
What is
                            an Iceland Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
An Iceland Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all
                                the Schengen
                                countries including Iceland for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s
                                dream
                                where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along with
                                Iceland.

faqs.question:
What is
                            a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa allows you to travel throughout the 26 Schengen countries without having
                                to get
                                a visa for each individual country. You may travel in the Schengen Area for up to 90
                                days
                                within a 180-day period. The Schengen Visa was introduced to make travelling faster and
                                easier
                                between all the EU countries that signed up for the agreement. A Schengen visa is not
                                appropriate,
                                if you wish to remain in a Schengen country for longer than 90 days, take up employment
                                or
                                establish a business, trade or profession.

faqs.question:
The
                            Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all
                                26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Iceland), unless it is marked
                                otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European
                                territory
                                of Iceland. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons
                                of
                                your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following
                                countries:
                                Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece,
                                Hungary,
                                Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands,
                                Norway,
                                Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question:
How long
                            can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your
                                passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This
                                means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The
                                precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the
                                heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only
                                once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A
                                two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the
                                Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number
                                of
                                entries".

faqs.question:
Will all
                            Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the
                                Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your
                                flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question:
Can I
                            apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer:
You may appeal against this decision. The decision to refuse a Schengen visa and the
                                reasons
                                for the refusal are notified using a standard form that is handed out by the Member
                                State's
                                consulate that refused the visa. The notification of the refusal must include the
                                reasons,
                                on which the refusal were based, and the procedures and deadlines for submitting an
                                appeal.
                                You are free to re-apply again if your application has been refused earlier. However,
                                it
                                is recommended that you take note of the reasons for the earlier refusal before
                                submitting
                                a new application and make amendments, where necessary. The visa fee is not refunded if the visa is refused. The visa fee covers the cost
                                of the
                                examination of the visa application.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a
                                country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: - the purpose of your trip - when and where you intend to travel - how your trip is going to be funded - day-by-day itinerary for your trip - duration of the trip

faqs.question:
Is it
                            possible to extend my Schengen Visa while in Iceland?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your Iceland short-stay while In Iceland except in special
                                circumstances and
                                exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or
                                criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and
                                apply
                                for another Iceland Visa if necessary.

faqs.question:
Can I
                            leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01".
                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during
                                the
                                validity of the visa.

faqs.question:
If my
                            Iceland short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long
                            can I remain in the Iceland territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Iceland territory for a
                                maximum
                                period of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question:
How long
                            before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of
                                departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as
                                certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the
                                processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 5-15 working days from your
                                appointment
                                date.

faqs.question:
How long
                            does it take to obtain a Iceland Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU Visa Code, the maximum case processing time cannot exceed 15
                                calendar days,
                                or in exceptional cases 30 or 60 days, respectively. The Embassy aims to issue a visa
                                within
                                15 working days provided that we have full and satisfactory information about the
                                applicant.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the role of VFS Global Services Pvt. Ltd?
faqs.answer:
VFS Global Services Pvt. Ltd. is the preferred outsourced partner to Embassy &
                                Consulate
                                General of Iceland in India. VFS Global Services Pvt. Ltd. Iceland Application Centers
                                function
                                as collection and processing centers for Iceland Visas. VFS does not play any part in
                                or
                                influence the outcome of your visa application.

faqs.question:
How can
                            I check the status of my Iceland Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Iceland visa application online using the Iceland VFS
                                Reference
                                number and Date of Birth. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of the
                                Iceland
                                VFS website.

faqs.question:
Will I
                            get my visa at the end of the process?
faqs.answer:
As an application centre, the Iceland Visa Application Centre (VFS) will not be able to
                                guarantee
                                you a visa. The issuance or refusal of a Iceland visa is the sole prerogative of The
                                Embassy/Consulate.
                                The Iceland Visa Application Centre cannot influence this decision in any way.

faqs.question:
Is it
                            mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Iceland Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Iceland Visa in order to provide your biometrics
                                and submit
                                your visa documents.

faqs.question:
I have a
                            valid long stay visa/residence permit for a country that is part of the Schengen
                            area. Do I need another visa to travel to other Schengen states?
faqs.answer:
No. A long stay visa or a residence permit issued by a Schengen State allows you to
                                travel or
                                stay in other Schengen States, while respecting the maximum duration of a “short stay”
                                (a
                                stay of "90 days in any 180 day period")

faqs.question:
My
                            family is also applying for a Iceland Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question:
I am
                            traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will
                                be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then
                                you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first
                                port
                                of entry.

faqs.question:
Can I
                            leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01".
                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during
                                the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only
                                once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a
                                multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity
                                period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I
                            have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At
                                the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional
                                documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and
                                the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the
                                documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation,
                                travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question:
Do I
                            have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be
                                presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question:
I am a
                            family member of an EU-citizen. Are the standard requirements applicable to
                            me?
faqs.answer:
Family members of EU citizens who have exercised their right of free movement (meaning
                                that the
                                EU citizen resides in or travels to a Member State other than his/her country of
                                origin)
                                benefit from certain procedural facilitations. The basic criteria to be fulfilled are
                                the
                                following: the EU citizen has exercised his/her right of free movement the family member (applicant) belongs to one of the categories covered by Directive
                                    2004/38/EC the family member (applicant) accompanies the EU citizen or joins him/her in the
                                    Schengen
                                    State of destination.

faqs.question:
Why is
                            personal appearance mandatory for Iceland Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System
                                (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide
                                biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at
                                the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications
                                within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the
                                VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will
                                again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the
                                applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it
                                cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years
                                period.

faqs.question:
Do I
                            need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel
                                insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical
                                reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their
                                stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid
                                throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended
                                stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question:
What are
                            the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer:
Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following
                                requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question:
Can you
                            process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa,
                                you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical
                                treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection
                                against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses,
                                flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For
                                financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase
                                travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

What is
                            the easiest way to apply for an Iceland Visa?
faqs.answer:
The easiest way to apply for an Iceland Visa is to contact us. We are experts in the
                                travel and
                                tourism sector with over 40 years of experience. Through our expertise, in-depth
                                knowledge
                                and integrity, we commit to delivering an exceptional experience to our customers each
                                and
                                every time you use our service. In order to help us understand your unique visa needs,
                                please
                                drop in your query and our Expert will get in touch with you.

faqs.answer: We have you covered across India with presence in all the major cities like Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, Bangalore, Chennai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and many more.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Niger ?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Niger. The type of visa to enter Niger will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Niger  visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straight forward and effortless process to apply for a Niger  visa online through Akbar Travels: Choose your preferred type of Niger  visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Niger  visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Niger visa is one month before the date of travel to the country. In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted fifteen days, prior to travelling.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Niger visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: This visa is valid for up to 3 months from the date of issue. The Embassy issues both single and multiple entry visas.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Niger once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.question: What is the Niger visa fee for Indians?
faqs.answer:
Since the Embassy of Niger issues single & multiple type visas, the cost for each entry type differs as follows:
Single entry for 3 months – INR 7350/-
Multiple entry for 3 months - INR 10,160/-

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Tourist and Business visa?
faqs.answer:
Tourist visas are for those Indian citizens travelling to Nigerfor sightseeing, recreation and casual visits to friends or families. Business visas are ideal for Indian citizens travelling for Business Meetings, Conference, etc. for a shorter period of stay.
.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit my passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Niger visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa application is normally processed within 2 weeks.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Niger visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: Why are you visiting Niger How long you intend to stay in Niger How will you support yourself during your time in Niger What is the purpose of your visit to Niger Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Niger If you have a permit to Niger  the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Niger

faqs.question: How do I receive my Niger  visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: Do I need any specific vaccinations?
faqs.answer: The government of Niger requires submission of Yellow Fever vaccination certificate for the visa application as well as while travelling to Niger. Cholera vaccination is only required if applicant will be travelling from a Cholera infected area.

faqs.question: What if my Nige visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Nigervisa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Niger tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country on a Niger tourist visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the occurrenceof unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: What is the easiest way to get a Niger Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Contact our Visa Experts and apply for your Niger visa instantly with minimum documents and lowest visa fee. No need to visit our office and no need to deal with the Embassy. We do it all for you.

faqs.answer: Please feel free to contact us for all your Niger  Visa worries. We have you covered across India with presence in all the major cities like Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, Bangalore, Chennai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and many more. faqs.question: What is a B2/B1 visa to US?
faqs.answer:
The B2/B1 US visa is a non-immigrant visa which allows foreign nationals to enter into the U.S.
                                temporarily for activities like tourism, visiting friends and relatives, medical care, participation
                                in conventions, conferences, or convocations of fraternal or social organizations, participation
                                by amateurs in musical, sports and similar events.

faqs.question: How do I qualify for a US visa?
faqs.answer:
To qualify for a US Visa, you must demonstrate that: The purpose of your trip is to enter the U.S. for business, pleasure, or medical treatment. You plan to remain in the U.S. for a specific, limited period. You have a residence outside the U.S. as well as other binding ties, which will take you
                                    back to your home country.

faqs.question: How long in advance should I apply for a US Visa?
faqs.answer:
Even though most US Visa applications are processed in 2-3 business days, in case additional
                                processing is required, it may take up to 12 weeks. Moreover it is difficult to get appointments
                                as well. Therefore, you should plan to apply for your US Visa as soon as possible or around
                                3 months in advance.

faqs.question: Is it possible to get a multiple-entry USA visa to the United States?
faqs.answer:
Yes! As per the recent amendments to U.S. Immigration Laws, it is possible to get a multi-entry
                                USA visa. With this visa, you can come and go from the United States for countless times
                                without need to reapply every time you visit the U.S. The validity of the multiple-entry
                                USA visa may last up to 10 years, which means you only have to apply for another US visa
                                once in a decade.

faqs.question: My passport containing a valid US Visa has expired and I've obtained a new passport. Do I need a new US visa now?
faqs.answer:
If the passport in which your US visa is endorsed has expired, the visa in the old passport can
                                still be used, provided you carry a valid passport of the same nationality along with the
                                expired passport.

faqs.question:
My US Visa (B-1/B-2) expires after my intended date of arrival in the United States. Do I need to get a new US visa before
                            departure?
faqs.answer:
You can arrive in the United States right up to the last date of validity indicated on the visa.
                                The Customs and Border Protection officer on arrival determines the duration of your stay
                                in the United States. Your US visa can expire while you are still in the United States –
                                just be sure that you do not overstay the period of time the officer grants.

faqs.question:
My US Visa will expire in the next 6 months. Do I need to apply for a new US visa after my current visa expires or can I
                            apply in advance?
faqs.answer:
You do not have to wait until your current USA visa expires. You can apply for a new visa even
                                if your current US visa is valid.

faqs.question: How do I read and understand my US visa?
faqs.answer:
As soon as you receive your US visa, check to make sure all your personal information printed
                                on the visa is correct. If any of the information on your visa does not match the information
                                in your passport or is otherwise incorrect, please contact the issuing authority (i.e. the
                                U.S. Embassy) immediately. The expiration date of your US visa is the last day you may use the visa to enter the United
                                States. It does not indicate how long you may stay in the United States. Your stay is determined
                                by the Department of Homeland Security at your port of entry. As long as you comply with
                                the Department of Homeland Security decision on the conditions of your stay, you should have
                                no problem.

faqs.question: What should I do to renew my US Visa?
faqs.answer:
There is no provision in the US law under which a US Visa can be renewed. You will need to apply
                                for a fresh US visa.

faqs.question: If I get a 10 years US Visa can I stay in USA for 10 years?
faqs.answer:
No! The 10 years means the visa is valid for 10 years, but each visit stay will be determined
                                and governed by the I-94, at the Port of Entry in USA and generally cannot be more than six
                                months.

faqs.question: How much bank balance is required to show in applicant's bank account, if it is a self-sponsored trip?
faqs.answer:
For a self-sponsored trip, funds and a sound bank balance is certainly an important factor- If
                                it is a leisure/tourism trip, you must have enough money to justify that you can afford your
                                trip to USA; including return ticket fare, domestic expenses, lodging, boarding, shopping,
                                medical insurance etc considering the purpose and length of the trip. So you should always
                                have funds equivalent to your trip cost. More balance is good.

faqs.answer:
The easiest way to apply for a USA Visa is to contact us. We are experts in the travel and tourism
                                sector with over 40 years of experience. Through our expertise, in-depth knowledge and integrity,
                                we commit to delivering an exceptional experience to our customers each and every time you
                                use our service. In order to help us understand your unique visa needs, please drop in your
                                query and our Expert will get in touch with you.

faqs.question: Do I need to take a health/travel insurance?
faqs.answer:
You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself in the US
                                as medical treatment can be very expensive in the US. We can certainly assist you with the
                                travel insurance as it’s an absolute necessity for International travel in the event of unexpected
                                events such as medical emergencies, baggage delay or loss etc.
