faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Holy See?
faqs.answer: The Vatican (also known as Holy See) does not require its own visa even if it is an independent city state. The visa that one will need to gain entrance is the Italian visa. It will be your entry ticket to Rome since you will have to go through the Italian borders before you can get to the Vatican. Holy See does not have any visa requirements of its own. All Indian travellers visiting Holy See must enter via Italy. Therefore, even though there are no border formalities in Holy See, Indiantravellers are required to hold a valid Italy Visa or any other Schengen country visa. Simultaneously anyone visiting a Schengen country can enter Holy See with a valid Schengen visa.

faqs.question: Is Holy See (the Vatican) part of the Schengen territory?
faqs.answer: Although not a member of either the European Union or the European Economic Area, the Vatican City maintains an open border with Italy and is treated as part of the Schengen Area. Since the Vatican City is only accessible via Italy, entering the Vatican City is not possible without entering the Schengen Area first; hence Schengen visa rules apply de facto. Nevertheless, as the Vatican City has no tourist accommodations (hotels or rental apartments), it is therefore virtually impossible to stay overnight as a tourist.

faqs.question: So, in order to visit Holy See, I must apply for an Italy Visa (Schengen visa)?
faqs.answer: Yes. You must apply for an Italy visa or any other Schengen country visa.

faqs.question: What is an Italy Schengen visa?
faqs.answer: An Italy Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the Schengen countries including Italy for a maximum period of 90 days. This is a traveller’s dream which lets you travel to all the Schengen countries on one visa.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer: Schengen Area comprises of the following countries: Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Holy See on the basis of my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer: The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport. The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in 6 months.

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer: No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight & hotel bookings.

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer: You are free to apply again for a Schengen Visa if your application has been refused earlier.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer: The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: The purpose of your trip When and where you intend to travel How your trip is going to be funded Day-by-day itinerary for your trip Duration of the trip

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of departure.We recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain the Visa?
faqs.answer: Typically, a Schengen Visa takes approximately 10 to 15 days for processing.However, the processing time is dependent on several factors and can change without notice at the embassy's discretion.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Schengen Visain order to provide your biometrics and submit your visa documents.

faqs.question: I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy/Consulate of the country where you will be staying for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country, then you must apply to the Embassy/Consulate of the country which you will be entering first.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: A single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once, meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question: Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen externalborders apart from my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the border (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provideadditional documentation, for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient meansto cover the stay and the return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry withyou copies of the documents which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g.letters of invitation, travel confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of yourstay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be presented in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for an Italy visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: Why are you visiting Italy How long you intend to stay in Italy How will you support yourself during your time in Italy What is the purpose of your visit to Italy Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Italy If you have a permit to Brunei the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Italy

faqs.question: How do I receive my Italy visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: What should be done if my Holy See visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: In the case of a Holy See visa rejection, the Embassy will state the reason for rejecting your visa application. You may also appeal against the decision if you find it necessary.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Fiji?
faqs.answer: Citizens of few countries including India do not need to apply for a visa in advance. They can get a Fiji visa upon arrival in Fiji provided they have the valid travel documents. The visa application is done when your flight lands in Fiji.

faqs.question: What is the basic requirement for Fiji visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: A valid passport for at least six (6) months beyond the intended period of stay, a ticket for return or onward travel to another country and sufficient funds are required.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for Fiji visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: All Categories need: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry. Return ticket to your country Confirmation of accommodation for duration of your visit Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Fiji Detailed itinerary of your trip

faqs.question: What is the Passport requirement for Fiji visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Your passport must be valid at least 6 months beyond the completion of this trip. The passport must have at least two blank visa pages for entry and exit stamps.

faqs.question: What is the validity of Fiji visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Entry visas are granted on arrival for a stay of 4 months or less for Indian nationals.

faqs.question: Can I extend my stay in Fiji?
faqs.answer: Extensions can be granted after completing the relevant application forms and paying the necessary fees. Tourist visas can only be extended for a further two months and must be applied for before the initial visa expires.

faqs.question: What are the different entry types for Fiji Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Tourist visas for Fiji: Nationals of countries including Australia, Canada, South Africa, the United Kingdom, the USA and the Schengen countries, are exempt from needing a tourist visa for Fiji. These visitors are issued a visa upon arrival and will only need an onward ticket and a passport that's valid for at least six months from the date they intend to leave the island. Business visas for Fiji: Business visas for Fiji are granted to foreigners who are entering the country to take part in short-term business activities. Work permits for Fiji: The Fiji an Department of Immigration grants work permits for Fiji on a case by case basis. Work permits are generally granted to applicants who want to start a business in Fiji and invest in the local economy, and expats taking up a position that cannot be adequately filled by a Fijian citizen. Residence permits for Fiji: Residence permits for Fiji are granted to expats who want to settle down in the country but don't intend to work or set up a business Transit visa: If transit period is 3 hours or less, no visa is required however if transit period is longer than 3 hours than normal visa requirements will apply. Single Entry visa (SEV): This visa is valid for 3 months and can be used for a single journey to Fiji only. Multiple Entry visa (MEV): This visa is valid for multiple entries to Fiji for a period of 12 months from the date of issue. The duration of stay for each entry should not exceed 4 months. To sum it up: Visa for Purposes Other than a Holiday: Other purposes can mean, work, internship, study, research, investment, yachting or residential purposes.Applicants will apply for entry visa as per normal requirements however, upon entry into Fiji, will need to apply for the applicable visa within 14 days from their entry date.

faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the event of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.answer: Please feel free to contact us for all your Fiji Visa worries. We have you covered across India with presence in all the major cities like Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, Bangalore, Chennai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and many more.

faqs.question: What is a Switzerland Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Switzerland Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the
                                Schengen countries including Switzerland for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a
                                traveller’s dream where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries
                                along with Switzerland.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all 26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Switzerland), unless it is marked
                                otherwise on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European
                                territory of Switzerland. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for
                                the reasons of your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following
                                countries: Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany,
                                Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands,
                                Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number of
                                entries".

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight
                                & hotel bookings.

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer: You are free to apply again for a Schengen Visa if your application has been refused earlier.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: - the purpose of your trip - when and where you intend to travel - how your trip is going to be funded - day-by-day itinerary for your trip - duration of the trip

faqs.question: As a Switzerland short-stay visa holder can I extend my Schengen Visa while in Switzerland?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your Switzerland short-stay while in Switzerland except in special circumstances,
                                and exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and apply
                                for another Switzerland Visa if necessary.

faqs.question:
If my Switzerland short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how
                            long can I remain in the Switzerland territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Switzerland territory for a maximum
                                period of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 5-15 working days from your appointment
                                date.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain a Switzerland Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Switzerland Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 10 to 15 days to process in
                                the Switzerland Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Switzerland Visa is dependent
                                on several factors and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my Switzerland Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Switzerland visa application online using the Switzerland
                                VFS Reference number and Date of Birth. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of
                                the VFS Switzerland website.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Switzerland Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Switzerland Visa in order to provide your biometrics and
                                submit your visa documents.

faqs.question:
My family is also applying for the Switzerland Visa, how many appointments should we
                            make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question:
I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first port
                                of entry.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation, travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Switzerland Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years period.

faqs.question: What is the role of VFS?
faqs.answer:
VFS Global Services Pvt Ltd (VFS) is the Service Delivery Provider for the Embassy of Switzerland
                                in New Delhi. The role of VFS is to accept visa applications and to dispatch passports and documents back
                                to clients, on behalf of the Embassy of Switzerland. VFS does not play any part in or influence
                                the outcome of your visa application.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: What are the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question: Can you process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa, you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Uruguay?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Uruguay. Visas to enter Uruguay may be obtained from the Uruguay Embassy in India. The type of visa to enter Uruguay will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration. All Indian visitors entering into Uruguay must have a valid visa and passport or travel document, as well as onward tickets and sufficient funds to support themselves while in the country.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Uruguay visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straight forward and effortless process to apply for a Uruguay visa online through Akbar Travels: Choose your preferred type of Uruguay visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Uruguay visa online?
faqs.answer: Applicants are encouraged to apply three (3) weeks to (1) one month in advance of travel.In most cases, you’ll be informed within 5 calendar days whether your application has been successful.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Uruguay visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The validity of the visa is 90 days with multiple entry.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Uruguay once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.question: What is the Uruguay visa fee for Indians?
faqs.answer: There is no visa fee applicable for Indian Nationals for obtaining a Uruguay visa. However, Akbar Travels charges a nominal service fee for processing the application.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Tourist and Business visa?
faqs.answer:
Tourist visas are for visitors who wish to enter the country on a temporary basis with a motive of pleasure or leisure may apply for a Uruguay Tourist visa.
Business visas can be requested by visitors who wish to enter the country to perform business activities, for investment or commercial exchange with Uruguayan companies which are based in the Republic or Public organizations.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit my passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Uruguay visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa application is normally processed within 5 working days.

faqs.question: How do I receive my Uruguay visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Uruguay visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Uruguay How long you intend to stay in Uruguay How will you support yourself during your time in Uruguay What is the purpose of your visit to Uruguay Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Uruguay If you have a permit to Uruguay the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Uruguay

faqs.question: What if my Uruguay visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Uruguay visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Uruguay tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country on a Uruguay tourist visa.

faqs.question: What is a Malta Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Malta Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the Schengen
                                countries including Malta for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s dream
                                where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along with Malta.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all 26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Malta), unless it is marked otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European territory
                                of Malta. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons of your
                                stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following countries: Austria,
                                Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland,
                                Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland,
                                Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number of
                                entries".

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer:
You may appeal against this decision. The decision to refuse a Schengen visa and the reasons
                                for the refusal are notified using a standard form that is handed out by the Member State's
                                consulate that refused the visa. The notification of the refusal must include the reasons,
                                on which the refusal were based, and the procedures and deadlines for submitting an appeal.
                                You are free to re-apply again if your application has been refused earlier. However, it
                                is recommended that you take note of the reasons for the earlier refusal before submitting
                                a new application and make amendments, where necessary. The visa fee is not refunded if the visa is refused. The visa fee covers the cost of the
                                examination of the visa application.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: - the purpose of your trip - when and where you intend to travel - how your trip is going to be funded - day-by-day itinerary for your trip - duration of the trip

faqs.question: Is it possible to extend my Schengen Visa while in Malta?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your short-stay visa while in Malta except in special circumstances, and exceeding
                                your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or criminality. Instead,
                                you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and apply for another
                                Malta Visa if necessary.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the visa.

If my Malta short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long can
                            I remain in the Malta territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Malta territory for a maximum period
                                of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 10-12 working days from your appointment
                                date.

faqs.answer:
Typically, a Malta Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 5 to 15 days to process in the Malta
                                Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Malta Visa is dependent on several factors and

I have a valid long stay visa/residence permit for a country that is part of the Schengen
                            area. Do I need another visa to travel to other Schengen states?

No. A long stay visa or a residence permit issued by a Schengen State allows you to travel or
                                stay in other Schengen States, while respecting the maximum duration of a “short stay” (a
                                stay of "90 days in any 180 day period")

faqs.question: My family is also applying for a Malta Visa, how many appointments should we make??
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a Visa to travel to Vanuatu?
faqs.answer: Foreign nationals of any country do not need to apply for a Vanuatu visa in advance. They can get a Vanuatu visa upon arrival in Vanuatu provided they have the valid travel documents. The visa application is done when your flight lands in Vanuatu.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for Vanuatu visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Travellers must meet the following criteria: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry and with two blank pages within Return ticket to your country Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Confirmation of accommodation for duration of your visit Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Vanuatu Detailed itinerary of your trip

faqs.question: How long is the Vanuatu visa valid for?
faqs.answer: Maximum stay for visitors is 30 days only.

faqs.question: Can I extend my stay in Vanuatu?
faqs.answer: Immigration will initially allow passengers to stay for 30 days on a tourist visa, visitors are required to go to Vanuatu Immigration and extend the visa before the expiry date and pay a nominated fee. The maximum stay is up to 4 months from the date of arrival, each month a new extension visa must be applied for.Travellers are advised to book air tickets which permit date changes.

faqs.question: Is there any fear of Vanuatu visa rejection?
faqs.answer: Indians are not liable to face a rejection. However, the above said documents are necessary to enter the country. Failure to produce any of the documents may result into rejection of your visa, thereby barring you from entering the country. The final decision to grant an entry permit is solely at the discretion of the Immigration officials at Vanuatu airport.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get the permit?
faqs.answer: Usually, it takes around 20 minutes to get all formalities done and get the visa on arrival. However, the time may vary depending on the peak travel period.

faqs.question: What is the process of getting a Vanuatu visa?
faqs.answer: After landing at Vanuatu airport, kindly head to the Immigration counter. The immigration authorities will most likely ask basic questions such as the reason for travel and duration of stay. Overall, it takes about 15-20 minutes to issue an entry permit. The whole method is hassle-free and easy.

faqs.question: What is the currency in Vanuatu?
faqs.answer:
“Vatu (VUV)” is the currency of Vanuatu which is worth approximately 12 Australian cents.
1VUV=0.60 INR

faqs.question: Do they have ATMS and can I use my credit card?
faqs.answer: ATMS are available in the main street of Port Vila and most of the resorts accept credit cards. They also have money exchange services on Port Vila main streets. The national bank of Vanuatu is available from 8:30am to 3:00pm from Monday to Friday.

faqs.question: Can I use my Phone and Internet?
faqs.answer: Vanuatu has worldwide satellite communications. It also has 24hrs phone, fax, email, and web access with phone. Many resorts offer internet access with Wi-Fi. If you want to use your own mobile you need to check the international roaming status with you network provider.

faqs.question: When is the best time to visit Vanuatu?
faqs.answer: Vanuatu is a place where we can visit any time. April to October would be the best comfortable time to visit Vanuatu because the weather will be warm and sunny and less humid. As the tourist trade will little slower in February and the earlier months of the year it offers the best deals.

faqs.question: How do I get around Vanuatu?
faqs.answer: Getting around Vanuatu is easy. It has many metered taxis and bus services which offer cheap transport.

faqs.question: Are things Expensive in Vanuatu?
faqs.answer: Vanuatu is neither expensive nor cheap. Self- catering accommodation is one of the great range benefits in Vanuatu. Supermarkets and other number of markets can save you money on dinning out.

faqs.question: Is there any special clothing or equipment I should take?
faqs.answer: Vanuatu is an island on Pacific Ocean, so you can explore more adventures in crystal clear water. It is advisable to get some reef shoes to protect your feet from sharp coral.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the occurrenceof unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Bulgaria?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indian citizens require a visa prior to enter the Republic of Bulgaria. Bulgaria visas must be obtained from the Embassy of Bulgaria in India. The type of visa to enter Bulgaria will depend on several factors such as purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Bulgaria visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Single-entry visas for tourist visits are normally valid for three months from date of issue with a maximum stay of 30 days. Transit visas are valid up to 24 hours.If Multiple Entry Visa needed, then applicants should mention the reason for requiring a multiple entry in the cover letter.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Bulgaria visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Bulgaria visa is three months before the intended date of travel to the country. In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted at least twenty days prior to travelling.

faqs.question: Is there any visa exemption for Indians?
faqs.answer: Holders of valid Schengen visas may enter and stay in Bulgaria for a period of up to three months within each six-month period from the date of the first entry in this country without having a Bulgarian visa (with effect from 31 January, 2012).  Holders of single-entry Schengen visas and those whose Schengen visas have been utilized completely are, however, not being allowed to enter Bulgaria.

faqs.question: How much does the Bulgaria Tourist visa cost?
faqs.answer: The Bulgaria Tourist visa fee is INR 6,399/-.

faqs.question: Are the Bulgaria visa fees inclusive of all charges?
faqs.answer: The Bulgaria Visa fees are exclusive of taxes and are subject to change as per the Embassy’s notification.

faqs.question: What are the types of Bulgaria visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Bulgaria Tourist Visa: It is a visa which is issued to persons intending to enter Bulgaria for tourism, sightseeing, leisure or visiting relatives and friends. Bulgaria Business Visa: This visa is issued for a short visit to conduct conferences, trainings, discussions, seminars, negotiations, and/or any other commercial activities, but not to take up employment. Bulgaria Transit Visa: Transit visa allows a visitors to travel across or through Bulgaria on way to another country. The visa is issued for a limited period and the applicant of this visa must provide proof of a Visa of the destination country and/or onward ticket. Bulgaria Student Visa: Student visa is granted to Indian nationals who are enrolled at qualified educational institutions. This Visa may be issued for a specific period of time.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Bulgaria visa for Indians?

faqs.question: What is the Bulgaria visa photo size requirement?
faqs.answer: The Bulgaria visa photo must meet the requirements described below. If not, the application will be delayed until you provide correct photos. Photo must be 45 mm X 35 mm in size The face should cover 80% of the photo In colour. White and black photo won’t be accepted Taken against a plain white background Taken within the last 3 months Your head should face the camera directly. It should not be tilted or turned, even slightly The head must be centred in the image. You must look directly at the camera and show your full face Do not wear sunglasses or tinted/coloured glasses. If you normally wear glasses, your eyes must be clearly visible in the photo The photo must be different from the passport photo.

faqs.question: What is the relationship between the validity of a Bulgaria Visa, number of entries and duration of stay?
faqs.answer: Validity of a Bulgaria Visa refers to the period within which the visa holder is allowed to enter Bulgaria. The number of entries refers to the number of times the visa holder is permitted to enter Bulgaria within the visa’s validity. One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Bulgaria only once. Whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once within the visa validity. Duration of stay refers to the longest period the visa holder is allowed to stay in Bulgariaon each visit, and this is counted from the day following entry into Bulgaria. When all the permitted entries are used up, the visa will no longer be valid. Even if there are unused entries, the visa will no longer be valid if the validity has already expired. In either case, the visa holder should apply for a new visa if another visit to Bulgariais planned. The holder of a visa is eligible to enter Bulgariaat any time prior to the expiry of its validity provided that permitted entries on the visa have not been used up; the holder’s planned duration of stay in Bulgariamust not exceed the duration stated on the visa.

faqs.answer: The expiry date of your visa is printed on your visa sticker. faqs.answer: You are exempt from the Romanian visa requirement, for stays that of no more than 90 days during any 180-day period provide you: Hold a two or multiple entry short-stay visa issued by a Schengen member state; Hold a limited territorial validity visa issued by a Schengen member state; Hold a short-stay visa issued by Bulgaria, Cyprus or Croatia; Hold a long-stay visa issued by a Schengen member state Hold a long-stay visa issued by Bulgaria, Cyprus or Croatia You must also make sure that the above visasare valid, namely that the number of entries, right of stay and visa validity period have not been used up. Also, please note that your stay on the territory of Romania may not exceed the right of stay granted through the above-mentioned visas.

faqs.question: How much does the Romania Tourist visa cost?
faqs.answer: The Romania Tourist visa fee is INR 7,999/-.

faqs.question: Are the Romania visa fees inclusive of all charges?
faqs.answer: The Romania Visa fees are exclusive of taxes and are subject to change as per the Embassy’s notification.

faqs.question: What are the types of Romania visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Short stay visa for tourism (C/TU): This type of short-stay visa is issued to third-country nationals who wish to travel to Romania for tourism. Short stay visa for business trips (C/A): This type of short-stay visa is issued to third-country nationals who wish to travel to Romania for economic or commercial purposes; for contracts or negotiations; in view of installing, making operational or checking the use and functioning of goods acquired through commercial contracts and through contracts of industrial cooperation; for the training of staff in view of the aforementioned actions, as well as for third-country nationals who are or are bound to become associates or shareholders within companies from Romania. Long stay visa (D): The long-stay visa is granted to third-state nationals, upon request, for periods of 90 days, with one or multiple entries. The right of residence granted through the D-type visa can be extended by applying for such an extension of the right of residence on the national territory. The extension of the right of residence is materialised through a residence permit issued by the Inspectorate General for Immigration from the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Romania. The applications for the extension of the temporary right of residence must be personally submitted by applicants, at least 30 days before the expiry of the right of stay granted through the visa, at the territorial bureaus of the Inspectorate General for Immigration from the area of residence. Diplomatic & service visa: This type of long-stay visa allows third-state nationals to enter the territory of Romania, usually for a long-term stay, provided that they hold diplomatic or service passports and that they are bound to exercise an official function as members of the staff of foreign diplomatic missions and consular posts accredited in Romania. Transit visa: This type of visa allows third-country nationals to transit the territory of Romania. This type of visa can be issued for one, two or multiple transits, provided that each transit period does not exceed 5 days.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Romania visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Romania Visa application is normally processed within 15 working days.

faqs.question: Which are the necessary documents required to be presented on arrival in Romania?
faqs.answer: Passport valid for at least 6 months from your date of entry. Valid Romania visa Boarding Pass Return ticket to your country or next destination Accommodation proof or invitation letter for family visits Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Romania (cash, debit/credit card etc) Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to business trip (invitation letter, business card etc) Note: It should be noted that the possession of Visa is not a final authority to enter the Republic of Romania. The Immigration Officer at the Entry point may refuse a holder of visa to enter, if he is satisfied that the holder is unable to fulfil Immigration entry requirements or if the presence of such person or visitors in the Republic of Romania would be contrary to the National Interests.

faqs.question: What is the Romania visa photo size requirement?
faqs.answer:
The Romania visa photo must meet the requirements described below. If not, the application will be delayed until you provide correct photos. Photo must be 45 mm X 35 mm in size The face should cover 80% of the photo In colour White and black photo won’t be accepted Taken against a plain white background Taken within the last 3 months Your head should face the camera directly. It should not be tilted or turned, even slightly The head must be centred in the image. You must look directly at the camera and show your full face Do not wear sunglasses or tinted/coloured glasses. If you normally wear glasses, your eyes must be clearly visible in the photo
 The photo must be different from the passport photo.

faqs.question: What is the relationship between the validity of a Romania Visa, number of entries and duration of stay?
faqs.answer:
Validity of a Romania Visa refers to the period within which the visa holder is allowed to enter Romania. The number of entries refers to the number of times the visa holder is permitted to enter Romaniawithin the visa’s validity. One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Romania only once. Whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once within the visa validity. Duration of stay refers to the longest period the visa holder is allowed to stay in Romania on each visit, and this is counted from the day following entry into Romania.
 When all the permitted entries are used up, the visa will no longer be valid. Even if there are unused entries, the visa will no longer be valid if the validity has already expired. In either case, the visa holder should apply for a new visa if another visit to Romania is planned. The holder of a visa is eligible to enter Romania at any time prior to the expiry of its validity provided that permitted entries on the visa have not been used up; the holder’s planned duration of stay in Romania must not exceed the duration stated on the visa.

faqs.question: Are there any chances of my Romania visa application getting rejected?
faqs.answer: Yes. Like other country visas, your visa application for Romania can be rejected for a number of reasons. The most common Romania visa rejection reasons are: Invalid and damaged Passport Incomplete Visa Application form Applied Wrong visa category Current Romania visa still valid Incomplete documents submitted Intention of returning to home country not clear Purpose of travel not clear Insufficient bank balance Criminal history

faqs.question: How can I avoid a Romania Visa Rejection?
faqs.answer:
While there may be many more reasons for a Romania visa refusal, the most common reasons are mentioned above. If you hope of getting that refusal overturned, or a second application approved or above all just get the Romania Tourist/Business visa successfully in the first attempt itself, here are some of the things that you can do to avoid a Romania visa rejection: Make sure your passport meets the standard requirements for applying for Romania visa online It is really important that you provide all the documents required for your application. Different visa categories require several supporting documents, so it is important to make sure your application is specific to you, and that nothing is missed out. Be clear on your purpose of visit. If travelling for tourist purpose; specify that and submit documents supporting your Romania tourist visa application. Similarly, vice-versa for Romania business visa. Apply for the correct visa category. 
 Make sure that your previous visa is not valid before applying for a new Romania visa. Submit confirmed return tickets as an assurance that you will return back to your home country & your purpose of travel is temporary. Seek assistance from a reliable travel agent to process your application smoothly without any hiccups. They are professionals who have the right training and knowledge to guide you correctly.

faqs.question: What is a Luxembourg Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Luxembourg Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the
                                Schengen countries including Luxembourg for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s
                                dream where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along
                                with Luxembourg.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all 26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Luxembourg), unless it is marked
                                otherwise on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European
                                territory of Luxembourg. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the
                                reasons of your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following
                                countries: Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany,
                                Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands,
                                Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number of
                                entries".

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer:
You may appeal against this decision. The decision to refuse a Schengen visa and the reasons
                                for the refusal are notified using a standard form that is handed out by the Member State's
                                consulate that refused the visa. The notification of the refusal must include the reasons,
                                on which the refusal were based, and the procedures and deadlines for submitting an appeal.
                                You are free to re-apply again if your application has been refused earlier. However, it
                                is recommended that you take note of the reasons for the earlier refusal before submitting
                                a new application and make amendments, where necessary. The visa fee is not refunded if the
                                visa is refused. The visa fee covers the cost of the examination of the visa application.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: - the purpose of your trip - when and where you intend to travel - how your trip is going to be funded - day-by-day itinerary for your trip - duration of the trip

faqs.question: Is it possible to extend my Schengen Visa while in Luxembourg?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your short-stay visa while in Luxembourg except in special circumstances, and
                                exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and apply
                                for another Luxembourg Visa if necessary.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the visa.

faqs.question:
If my Luxembourg short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long
                            can I remain in the Luxembourg territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Luxembourg territory for a maximum
                                period of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 10-12 working days from your appointment
                                date.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain a Luxembourg Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Luxembourg Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 5 to 15 days to process in the
                                Luxembourg Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Luxembourg Visa is dependent on several
                                factors and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion.

faqs.question: What is the role of VFS Global Services Pvt. Ltd.?
faqs.answer:
VFS Global Services Pvt. Ltd. is the preferred outsourced partner for Embassy & Consulate
                                General of Luxembourg in India. VFS Global Services Pvt. Ltd. Luxembourg Application Centres
                                function as collection and processing centres for Luxembourg Visas. VFS does not play any

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my Luxembourg Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Luxembourg visa application online using the Luxembourg VFS
                                Reference number and last name. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of the Luxembourg
                                VFS website.

faqs.question: Will I get my visa at the end of the process?
faqs.answer:
As an application centre, the Luxembourg Visa Application Centre (VFS) will not be able to guarantee
                                you a visa. The issuance or refusal of a Luxembourg visa is the sole prerogative of The Embassy/Consulate.
                                The Luxembourg Visa Application Centre cannot influence this decision in any way.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Luxembourg Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Luxembourg Visa in order to provide your biometrics and
                                submit your visa documents.

faqs.question:
I have a valid long stay visa/residence permit for a country that is part of the Schengen
                            area. Do I need another visa to travel to other Schengen states?
faqs.answer:
No. A long stay visa or a residence permit issued by a Schengen State allows you to travel or
                                stay in other Schengen States, while respecting the maximum duration of a “short stay” (a
                                stay of "90 days in any 180 day period")

faqs.question: My family is also applying for a Luxembourg Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question: Which countries are part of the Schengen Area?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen area covers 26 countries ("Schengen States") without border controls between them.
                                These countries are: Austria, Belgium, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France,
                                Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta,
                                the Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden and Switzerland.
                                These countries apply the common visa policy for short stay Visas. This Visa allows you to
                                travel through Luxembourg and the Schengen area for up to 90 days.

faqs.question:
I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first port
                                of entry.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation, travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Luxembourg Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years period.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: What are the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question: Can you process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa, you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from my
                            travel document with the Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the
                                border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional
                                documentation
                                for example; evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and the return
                                trip.
                                It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the documents which you
                                presented
                                while applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation, travel confirmations,
                                other
                                documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be
                                presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Italy Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System
                                (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at
                                the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications
                                within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the
                                VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will
                                again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the
                                applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it
                                cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years
                                period.

faqs.question: Do I need to have purchase travel insurance?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel
                                insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical
                                reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their
                                stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended
                                stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: What are the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Honduras. faqs.question: What are the different types of Honduras Visas?
faqs.answer: Tourist Visa: This visa is issued to foreigners wishing to travel to Honduras for recreation, business or family reasons, who are holders of ordinary passports. Transit Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to transit through Honduras within a period of three to four days. Diplomatic Visa: This Visa is for those who are holders of diplomatic passports and who are working for a foreign government. Official Visa: This Visa is for those who work for a foreign government or for an international organization, or the holders of the Laissez Passer of the United Nations.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Honduras visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Honduras visa is two months before the date of travel to the country. In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted ten days, prior to travelling.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Honduras visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: This visa is valid for up to 90 days. The validity and stay period is decided by the Embassy on the basis of the purpose of your visit and visa type.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit my passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Honduras visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa application is normally processed within 15 working days.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Honduras visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: Why are you visiting Honduras How long you intend to stay in Honduras -How will you support yourself during your time in Honduras What is the purpose of your visit to Honduras Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Honduras If you have a permit to enter the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Honduras

faqs.question: How do I receive my Honduras visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: Is there any Honduras visa exemption for Indians?
faqs.answer: You do not need a visa to enter Honduras if you hold a valid visa issued by Canada, United States or a Schengen member state.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Honduras once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once.

faqs.question: Do I need any specific vaccinations?
faqs.answer: The government of Honduras requires proof of yellow fever vaccination only if a traveller is arriving from a country with risk of yellow fever.

faqs.question: What if my Honduras visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Honduras visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Honduras tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country on a Honduras tourist visa.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Argentina?
faqs.answer: Indian citizen holders of ordinary passport need Visa to enter Argentina. All applications for Tourist Visa and Business Visa to travel to Argentina must be submitted to theConsular Section of the Embassy of the Argentine Republic in New Delhi, India. Indians residing in Maharashtra and Karnataka must apply for the visa at the Consulate General of the Argentine Republic in Mumbai. Every applicant will called to visit the Embassy/Consulate in person for a personal interview with the Consular Officer. This interview is mandatory by law and admits no exceptions.

faqs.question: Is there any visa exemption for Indian passport holders visiting Argentina?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indian passport holders having valid USA or Schengen Visa are eligible to apply for an E-Visa (Electronic travel authorization, ETA), provided the purpose of travel to Argentina is tourism only.  The visa (US/Schengen) should be valid for at least 6 months. The E-VISA is valid for 3 months from the date of issue with multiple entries and one can stay for up to 90 days on each visit. The processing time for the E-VISA is 20 business days. Apart from Indian passport holders, Nepal and Maldives passport holders are also eligible for this facility.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Argentina visa for Indians?

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Argentina once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.
