faqs.question: Is United Kingdom Visit Visa also called as United Kingdom Standard Visitor Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes. The Standard Visitor Visa allows people to enter the United Kingdom for several reasons. This
                                includes
                                travel, tourism, and leisure purposes, visiting friends or relatives; as well as short
                                term
                                business appointments, academic conferences, participating in sporting events or
                                creative/artistic
                                work, and receiving private medical treatment in the United Kingdom. The Standard Visitor Visa has
                                replaced
                                the following types of United Kingdom Visas: Family Visitor visa General Visitor visa Child Visitor visa Business Visitor visa, including visas for academics, doctors and dentists Sports Visitor visa Entertainer Visitor visa Prospective Entrepreneur visa Private Medical Treatment Visitor visa Approved Destination Status (ADS) visa

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the United Kingdom on a Standard Visitor Visa?
faqs.answer:
A United Kingdom Standard Visitor Visa is usually valid for 6 months and allows multiple entries to
                                the United Kingdom.
                                You can stay for maximum up to 6 months only. You can apply for a longer-term United Kingdom Visa if
                                you travel regularly to the United Kingdom. These United Kingdom Visas are valid for 2, 5 or 10 years and allow
                                multiple
                                entries for up to 6 months on each trip.

faqs.question:
What is the eligibility for a short-term United Kingdom Standard Visitor Visa and long-term United Kingdom Standard
                            Visitor Visa?
faqs.answer:
The eligibility requirements for securing a short-term United Kingdom Standard Visitor Visa are as
                                follows: You must show that you will leave the United Kingdom at the end of your trip; You must be able to support yourself (and any dependents applying with you) for the
                                    duration
                                    of your trip; You must be able to pay for your return or onward journey; You must provide proof of any business or other activities you want to do in the United Kingdom
                                    (if you
                                    are not coming to the United Kingdom for a holiday). The eligibility requirements for securing a long-term United Kingdom Standard Visitor Visa are as
                                follows: You must be able to prove that you have a frequent and on-going need to come to the
                                    United Kingdom; You must be able to justify that the reason why you need to come frequently to the
                                    United Kingdom is
                                    not likely to change while your United Kingdom Standard Visitor Visa is valid; You must be able to prove that you plan on leaving the United Kingdom at the end of each visit.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase flight tickets for my United Kingdom Visa application?
faqs.answer:
No. Confirmed return tickets are not required for the United Kingdom Visa application. You may visit
                                our
                                website to check the flight ticket airfares, but we are clear that we do not expect you
                                to
                                purchase flights or confirm travel arrangements until your United Kingdom Visa decision has been
                                received.

faqs.question: Can I fast-track my United Kingdom Visa application?
faqs.answer:
United Kingdom Visa Immigration offer a number of added value services to suit individual needs.
                                These services
                                are designed to offer choice and convenience and to enhance speed of processing and
                                customer
                                experience. If you know that you need to travel at short notice, or want to have your United Kingdom
                                Visa application placed at the front of the queue for processing, consider purchasing a
                                Priority
                                Visa service or a Super Priority Visa service. However, using the Priority and Super
                                Priority
                                visa service does not imply or guarantee in any way that your United Kingdom Visa application will
                                be
                                successful. All applicants must meet the requirements of United Kingdom’s Immigration Rules. Priority visa Service - The Priority United Kingdom visa service is optional and costs GBP
                                184 (approx.
                                INR 20,342/- as per the local currency equivalent to latest consular rate of exchange)
                                in
                                addition to the standard United Kingdom Visa fee. Choose the priority service to place your
                                application
                                at the front of the queue. Eligibility: This service is available to the following applicants: All visitor visa applicants (excluding overseas domestic workers). All Tier 2, Tier 4 and Tier 5 applicants. Short term study applicants. The Super Priority Visa Service – The Super Priority United Kingdom Visa service is an
                                optional service
                                and costs GBP 919 (approx INR 91,733 as per the local currency equivalent to latest
                                consular
                                rate of exchange) in addition to the standard United Kingdom Visa fee. The target is to process
                                super
                                priority United Kingdom visa applications on the same day that they are received. You will be
                                required to
                                provide biometric information as part of the application process. Eligibility: This service is available to the following applicants: All visitor visa applicants (excluding overseas domestic workers). Tier 2 General and Intra Company Transfer applications – as well as Tier 2
                                    dependents applying
                                    at the same time as the main applicant or any time after providing the main
                                    applicant
                                    already has a valid visa. Tier 5 Sportspeople and Entertainers – as well as Tier 5 dependents applying at the
                                    same
                                    time as the main applicant or any time after providing the main applicant already
                                    has
                                    a valid visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to show my old passport when I apply?
faqs.answer:
It is highly advisable to submit your old passports (if any) especially if your old
                                passport
                                contains visas showing previous foreign travels (eg Schengen, USA, Canada etc.). It is
                                extremely
                                useful for the United Kingdom Embassy to see such direct evidence of previous travels abroad and
                                seeing
                                an old passport with good travel history can often enable them to process your United Kingdom Visa
                                application
                                much quicker.

faqs.question: What is 'biometric' information?
faqs.answer:
All United Kingdom Visa applicants are required to provide biometric data (10-digit finger scans and
                                a digital
                                photograph) as part of the United Kingdom Visa application process. You will have to go to your nearest United Kingdom visa application centre in person to provide your
                                biometrics.
                                Your United Kingdom Visa application will not be processed until you have provided the necessary
                                biometric
                                information. The finger scans are electronic so the staff do not need to use any ink,
                                liquid
                                or chemicals. You will have your digital photograph taken at the same time and the whole
                                procedure should take no more than five minutes to complete. You should make sure that
                                you
                                do not have any decoration (such as henna), or any cuts or other markings on your
                                fingertips
                                before having your finger scans. You should also make sure that if you have any cuts and

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Cyprus?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indians do need a visa to travel and enter the republic of Cyprus. The travel visa gives you the right for a continuous visit or several visits to Cyprus. The duration of visits in total should not exceed three months in any half of a year from the date of the first visit. In general, the short-stay Cyprus visa is issued for one or several visits.A Cyprusvisa for Indians can be private, tourist, business and work – depending on the purposeof a visit.

faqs.question: What is a Cyprus Visa?
faqs.answer: It is a legal document that allows citizens of India to enter the country of Cyprus for a certain number of days.

faqs.question: What is a validity of a Cyprus Visa?
faqs.answer: Visas for Cyprus are issued for 90 days within a 180-day period.

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for the Cyprus Visa?
faqs.answer: You may only submit your Cyprusvisa application 90 days before your date of departure.We recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain the Visa?
faqs.answer: Typically, a Cyprus Visa takes approximately 10 to 15 days for processing.However, the processing time is dependent on several factors and can change without notice at the embassy's discretion.

faqs.question: How many times can my visa be used?
faqs.answer: Cyprus visa can be used for multiple entries. However, the total period of stay must not exceed 90 days in any 180-day period.

faqs.question: Is Cyprus part of the Schengen agreement?
faqs.answer: No Cyprus is not a part of the Schengen agreement.

faqs.question: Can I enter Cyprus if I have a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: Yes. Schengen Visa holders are allowed to enter Cyprus, provided they have already entered another country using the Schengen Visa. The Schengen visa should be valid with multiple entries.

faqs.question: Which are the different types of Cyprus Visas?
faqs.answer: The different Cyprus visa types are: Short-stay or travel visas, including multiple-entry visas: This category of visa caters to people wishing to visit Cyprus for Tourist, business and visit purposes. Applicants will have to provide evidence that he/she falls under this category. Long-stay visas: If you are planning to stay in Cyprus for more than three months you will have to apply for a long-stay visa. Examples of Long stay visas are Work Permit, Student Visa and Resident Permit. Airport transit visa (ATV): If you have to pass through the international transit area of Cypriot airports without actually entering the national territory of Cyprus during a stop-over or transfer between two stages of an international flight, you might need an Airport Transit Visa. The requirement to have this type of visa is an exception to the general rule to transit without a visa through Cyprus. Transit visas: If you are traveling from one country to another country and you have to pass through the territory of the Republic of Cyprus, to do so you might need a Transit Visa. This visa may be issued for one transit, or exceptionally for several transits. The duration of each transit case should not exceed five days. The transit visa is issued provided that the entry of the traveler into the territory of the destination country is guaranteed and that the route taken normally requires transit through Cyprus. Group visas: The group visa is issued, provided that the members of the group enter the territory, stay there and leave it as a group.Group visas may be issued to groups of between 5 and 50 people. The person in charge of the group should possess an individual passport and, where necessary, an individual visa.

faqs.question: Can I get a refund in the case of visa rejection?
faqs.answer: In the case of visa rejection, no refund will be granted.

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a Visa to travel to Trinidad and Tobago?
faqs.answer: No, Indian citizens do not require a visa to enter Trinidad and Tobago, if the purpose of visit is tourism, visit or business. Indians enjoy visa free travel to the country.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Trinidad and Tobago without a visa?
faqs.answer: You can stay in Trinidad and Tobago for up to 90 days within a six-month period without requiring a visa, as long as the purpose of visit is strictly tourism, business and not to carry out a paid activity.

faqs.question: When should I apply for a Trinidad and Tobago visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: You will need a visa for visits longer than 90 days, for work, study or visits in which you will be compensated by an organization in Trinidad, including unpaid missionary work. Indians wishing to stay in Trinidad and Tobago for more then 90 days will need to apply for the Trinidad and Tobago Visa online before travel.

faqs.question: What are entry requirements for visitors entering Trinidad and Tobago?
faqs.answer: The immigration officials at the Airport may check the below documents: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry Dully filled Immigration Card Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Trinidad and Tobago Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to your business visa A person seeking admission to Trinidad and Tobago other than as a tourist or visitor must be in possession of one of the following, subject to the purpose of the visit: Work Permit Student Permit Missionary Permit Minister’s Permit Certificate of Recognition of Caribbean Community Skills Qualification

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a Visa to travel to Bhutan?
faqs.answer: No, Indian citizens do not require a visa to enter Bhutan for tourism purpose. Indians travelling by air will be issued a free Entry Permit upon arrival into Bhutan. Indian nationals who wish to drive their cars to Bhutan are required to obtain “Route Permit” from the Road Safety and Transport Authority office in Bhutan after obtaining the entry permit from the Department of Immigration.

faqs.question: How long is the Bhutan Entry Permit valid for?
faqs.answer: It will be valid for 7 days, which can be expandable in Thimphu for another 7 days up to a maximum of 30 days.

faqs.question: Is my permit valid for the whole of Bhutan?
faqs.answer: Bhutan entry permit is valid only for Thimphu and Paro only. The rest of Bhutan is considered a restricted area, and tourists need a "Restricted-Area Permit" to enter the same. What are the different types of Permits for travel to Bhutan? Entry Permit: This permit is issued on arrival when you travel to Bhutan by flight. The entry point is either in Paro airport (when travelling by flight) or in Phuentsholing Bhutan (when travelling overland either from Bagdogra or NJP). The Entry Permit is also a valid document to visit Thimphu and Paro. Route Permit: If you travel to Bhutan by road, you need to have a Route Permit. With a Route Permit, you can visit places like Punakha, Wangdue, Bumthang, etc) beyond Paro and Thimphu.

faqs.question: What is the Bhutan Entry Permit cost?
faqs.answer: The Entry Permit is free on arrival.

faqs.question: Are Indian citizens required to carry any travel documents?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indian travellers wishing to visit Bhutan need to carry either their passport, having a validity of minimum 6 months or a voter identity card, issued by Election Commission of India. For Children travelers it is advisable to carry Birth Certificate or Academic School ID Card.

faqs.question: What are entry requirements for visitors entering Bhutan?
faqs.answer: The immigration officials at the Airport may check the below documents: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry or valid Voters Identity Card Child below 5 years (Birth certificate is required) Child between 6 – 17 years (Academic School Identity Card is required) Dully filled Immigration Card Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Bhutan Detailed itinerary of your trip Passport size photograph (advisable)

faqs.question: Can Indians apply for the Entry Permit in advance before travel?
faqs.answer: The Royal Bhutanese Embassy in New Delhi does not issue any visa or entry permit. Bhutanese visas are only issued by the Department of Immigration, Ministry of Home and Cultural Affairs in Bhutan.

faqs.question: Is there any fear of Bhutan Entry Permit rejection?
faqs.answer: Indians are not liable to face a rejection. However, the above said documents are necessary to enter the country. Failure to produce any of the documents may result rejection of the Entry permit, thereby barring you from entering the country. The final decision to grant an entry permit is solely at the discretion of the Immigration officials at Bhutan airport.

faqs.question: What are the best flight connections for Bhutan?
faqs.answer: Currently two airlines operate flights to Bhutan: DrUnited Kingdomair and Bhutan Airlines. DrUnited Kingdom Air offers direct flights to Paro, which is the only international airport in Bhutan, from Mumbai, Delhi, Kolkata and Bagdogra.Visit saathivisa.com to book the cheapest air tickets. It's also possible to travel to Bhutan from India overland by road. The main border crossing is Jaigon-Phuentsholing. There are two others, at Gelephu and SamdrupJongkhar.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get the permit?
faqs.answer: Usually, it takes around 30 minutes to get all formalities done and get your Bhutan entry permit on arrival at Paro.However, the time may vary depending on the peak travel period.

faqs.question: What is the process of getting a Bhutan entry permit?
faqs.answer: An application form must be filled once you arrive in Paro. The immigration authorities will most likely ask basic questions such as the reason for travel and duration of stay. An official will click your picture and you must also give your fingerprints. There are a total of three counters where these processes are split. Overall, it takes about 25-30 minutes to issue an entry permit. The whole method is hassle-free and easy.

faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the event of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Morocco?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indians need a visa to travel to Morocco. Morocco visa for Indians can be obtained at the Morocco Embassy or Consulate. In order to get visa for Morocco from India, it is necessary to fulfil the visa requirements and submit the necessary documents. A Morocco visa for Indians can be private, tourist, business and work – depending on the purpose of a visit.

faqs.question: What is a Moroccan visa?
faqs.answer: A Visa is the permission that is granted by a sovereign nation to a traveler permitting entry into that country for a specific purpose. Moroccan visas are stamped in the travelers’ passport. The most common types of visas are granted for the specific purposes of tourism, conducting business or attending a cultural Event. A traveler must follow distinct guidelines and procedures established by each sovereign nation in applying for the appropriate visa category.

faqs.question: What are the different types of visas available?
faqs.answer: Indians travelling to Morocco can choose from 30-day tourist visas or 30-day business visas depending on their reason for travel. Moroccan Tourist visas issued to individuals for travelling to Morocco for tourist purposes such as recreation, sightseeing, casual visit to meet friends and relatives etc. Moroccan Business visas are issued to individuals for attending business meetings with companies in Morocco, sales or exhibiting on behalf of a company outside of Morocco. Other type of Moroccan visas are issued for the purpose of employment, work, family reunification, studies etc.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Moroccan visa?
faqs.answer: The earliest you can apply for a Moroccan visa is 1 month before your intended date of travel to Morocco. However, in case of extenuating circumstances, you can apply earlier.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Morocco Visa?
faqs.answer: Processing a Morocco visa application normally takes 3 to 5 working days.

faqs.question: What kind of entry is my Moroccan visa?
faqs.answer: In most cases, single entry is granted. You can also apply for a multiple entry visa if your required to visit Morocco frequently.

faqs.question: Is the Moroccan visa fee inclusive of all charges?
faqs.answer: No, it is exclusive of taxes and is subject to change depending on the Embassy’s directive.

faqs.question: Do I need to submit my passport along with my application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Moroccan visa is a vignette or sticker that is placed on an empty page of a passport. Therefore, the original passport with two consecutive blank pages is required.

faqs.question: Is the Moroccan visa valid for the whole of Morocco?
faqs.answer: Yes, the visa is valid for travel through the whole of Morocco, subject to Embassy directives.

faqs.question: Do children require a visa to travel to Morocco?
faqs.answer: Yes, all travellers including children must have a valid visa to travel to Morocco.

faqs.question: Can I extend a Moroccan visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can request to get your visa extended at a Moroccan Police Station. The approval of extension is subject to the officers’ decisions and Embassy directives.

faqs.question: Can I get a Moroccan visa while in the country?
faqs.answer: No, you cannot get a Moroccan visa while in the country. You need to apply for the visa in your home country before you travel.

faqs.question: From when is my visa valid?
faqs.answer: Your visa is valid from the date your visa was issued and not from the date of entry into Morocco.

faqs.question: What if my Moroccan visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy of the Kingdom of Morocco, New Delhi, is responsible for approval and rejection of Moroccan visa applications from India. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final, and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: Who decides if I will get a visa?
faqs.answer: The Embassy of the Kingdom of Morocco, New Delhi has the sole right to assess and decide visa applications.

faqs.question: I have a valid Morocco visa on my old passport? Can I travel to Morocco with my old and new passport?
faqs.answer: No. You must apply for a new Morocco visa which will be stamped on your new passport.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave French Guiana once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.answer: Tourist Visa: If you are planning to go to French Guiana for sightseeing, vacationing or meeting your friends or family, you will need a tourist visa. faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Panama?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indians need a visa to travel to Panama. you are required to obtain a visa from the Panamanian consulate in your country prior to traveling to Panama. You will not be allowed entry at the border if you do not have this visa stamped in your passport.A Panamavisa for Indians can be private, tourist, business and work – depending on the purposeof a visit.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Panama visa online?

faqs.question: Can I travel to Panama without a Visa?
faqs.answer:
The National Immigration Service has established that it will not be necessary to request a visa to enter Panama, regardless of your nationality, in the following circumstances: 
If the person has a multiple-entry visa, duly emitted by Australia, Canada, Great Britain and Ireland, the United States of America, Korea, Japan, Singapore or any other state of the European Union, with a validity of at least six (6) months before coming to Panama, 
and that the visa has been used previously in that territory.
Under this visa exemption decree, you are only allowed to stay in the country for 30 days as tourist and will need to apply for a visa extension at the Immigration Office when you are approaching the 30 days, even if your time approved to stay in STRI Panama was granted for three months or any other term.

faqs.question: So, I can travel to Panama without a visa?
faqs.answer: Yes. Those who hold a valid multiple entry visa from one of the following countries: USA, Australia, Canada, or United Kingdom, which has been used at least one time to enter these countries, may enter the Republic of Panama without a visa regardless of their nationality.

faqs.question: What are the types of Panama visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Indians travelling to Panama can choose from either a tourist/business visa based on certain criteria. The two applicable types of visas for Indian citizens are: Type (A) visa: It is applicable for Indians holding a valid visa and has at least once travelled with a multiple entries visa for the following countries: USA, United Kingdom Canada, Australia, European or the Schengen States. Type (C) visa: It is applicable if the applicant is not holding any valid visa

faqs.question: What should I do if I need a Type (A) Visa?
faqs.answer: If you all under the category of Type (A) visa, you are entitled to take a Visa on Arrival at Panama Airport for a fee of USD $35.

faqs.question: What should I do if I need a Type (C) Visa?
faqs.answer: If you fall under the category of Type (C) visa, you are required to obtain a stamped visa.

faqs.question: What are the important entry requirements for Panama visa?
faqs.answer: All foreign nationals need a passport that is valid for at least six months from the date of entry. Tourists must also be able to prove that they have at least US$500—a bank statement, travelers checks, or a credit card usually works. Finally, all travelers entering Panama must have a return or onward ticket out of the country.

faqs.question: What is the validity of my Panama visa?
faqs.answer: Visitors are allowed to stay in Panama for a maximum period of 1 month.

faqs.question: Do I need to submit my passport when applying for a Panama Visa online?
faqs.answer: Yes. A valid passport with a minimum of two blank pages is required to be submitted in as the Panama Visa is a stamp or a sticker duly placed on the same.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Panama visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Panama How long you intend to stay in Panama How will you support yourself during your time in Panama What is the purpose of your visit to Panama Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Panama If you have a permit to Panama the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Panama

faqs.question: What type of entry is granted for a Panama Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: A single entry is granted. The visa cannot be used for multiple entries into the country.

faqs.question: Can I extend the Panama Tourist Visa?
faqs.answer: Indians entering Panama as a tourist and offered a Panama Tourist visa for less than ninety (90) days, subject to discretion of the General Director of the National Service of Immigration, and before the expiration of the Panama Tourist visa, will be able to request personally or by means of legal attorney an extension up to completing a maximum time of stopover of ninety (90) days.Petitions are approved or denied on a case-by-case basis. Akbar Travels recommends you apply at least a week before your time is up

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a Visa to travel to Haiti?
faqs.answer: No, Indian citizens do not require a visa to enter Haiti for a short stay, if the purpose of visit is tourism, visit or business. Indians enjoy visa free travel to the country. All Indian passport holders travelling to Haiti must pay a tourist fee set at $10.00 at the airport. Visitors are also required to hold valid passport, proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay, accommodation proof and return flight tickets to their home country.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Haiti without a visa?
faqs.answer: You can stay in Haiti for up to 90 days without requiring a visa. Foreign nationals wishing to extend their stay in Haiti beyond 90 days must be issued a permit with the Department of Immigration and Emigration.

faqs.question: What are the requirements to extend a Haiti visa?
faqs.answer:
Visitors must fulfil the below requirements in order to extend the visa: The request letter Residence permit addressed to the Directorate of the Immigration and Emigration (DIE) The letter from the applicant’s employment A photocopy of the biographical page of the passport of the applicant The address and telephone number of the applicant A medical certificate is older than 30 days Two (2) passport photos in colour The photocopy of the landing at the last entry into the country A photocopy of the birth certificate and its translation into French A bank statement from a bank serving in Haiti with a minimum deposit of Seven Thousand Five Hundred (7,500.00) gourdes
                                        A criminal record The sum of Five thousand gourdes (Gdes 5.000.00) payable by check to the Treasury Department. According to a Note issued by the Ministry of Interior, Local Authorities and National Defense (MICTDN), dated January 27, 2012, Foreign Nationals staying for more than 90 days in Haiti or living on the national territory, are formally required to obtain a Residence Permit valid for a Fiscal Year (from October 1 to September 30) from the Department of Immigration and Emigration (DIE).

faqs.question: What are the Passport requirements?
faqs.answer: All visitors arriving in the Federated States of Haiti must have a valid passport or other travel document issued by the government of the country of citizenship or nationality. The document must be valid for at least 120 days beyond the date of entry.

faqs.answer: Yes. Mali visas can be further extended from the Immigration Service in Bamako or at any Police Station.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for Mali visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: -why are you visiting Mali -how long you intend to stay in Mali -how will you support yourself during your time in Mali -what is the purpose of your visit to Mali -type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid -where do you intend to travel following your visit to Mali -if you have a permit to enter the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Mali

faqs.question: Can I obtain a visa while in the country?
faqs.answer: Mali visa for Indians is not available on arrival.

faqs.question: Do I need to submit my passport when applying for a Mali Visa online?
faqs.answer: Yes. A valid passport with a minimum of two blank pages is required to be submitted in person as the Mali Visa is a stamp or a sticker duly placed on the same.

faqs.question: What type of entry is granted for a Mali Visa?
faqs.answer: A single entry is granted. The visa cannot be used for multiple entries into the country.

faqs.question: Do I need travel insurance?
faqs.answer: It is advisable for every visitor to purchase a health insurance plan before taking up travel. Akbar Travels can assist you with the same to cover your medical expenses, damage and loss of baggage that may occur during travel.

faqs.question: Do I need vaccinations?
faqs.answer: Yes. As per the Mali Visa requirements, Yellow Fever Vaccinations are mandatory to visit Mali.

faqs.question: What if my visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: Mali visa rejection or approval is wholly a decision by the Embassy of the Republic of Mali in New Delhi. If your visa is rejected, you will not get a refund. It is therefore important to adhere to the visa rules and fulfil the Mali visa requirements correctly.

faqs.question: What else do I need to know about the Mali tourist visa from India?
faqs.answer: A Mali tourist visa is an official document that allows Indian passport holders to legally enter Mali and hence, it must be kept in safe custody. Upon loss or damage, a new visa will be required.

faqs.question: What is the easiest way to apply for a Mali visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The easiest way to apply for a Mali visa is to apply through an experienced travel agency like Akbar Travels. Our visa experts have been in the travel and tourism sectors 4 decades. If you have questions about the Mali visa information, simply fill in a query form, and a Visa Expert will contact you.

faqs.question: What is a New Zealand Visa?
faqs.answer:
A New Zealand Visa also referred to as a New Zealand ‘visitor’s visa’, is a document that is
                                placed in your passport and used to enter or re-enter New Zealand. The visa can be viewed
                                as having valid permission to enter New Zealand for tourism, business or transit purpose.

faqs.question: Do I need a New Zealand Visa?
faqs.answer:
All Indians who are not New Zealand citizens or permanent residents of New Zealand require a
                                visa to enter New Zealand. The requirement for a Visitor Visa also applies to visitors who
                                are in transit through New Zealand.

faqs.question: How long will you take to process my New Zealand Visa application?
faqs.answer: The time taken to process your application can vary depending on: Fulfillment of the requirements of the New Zealand Immigration; The completeness of your application; Processing time can also depend upon how busy the New Zealand Embassy is.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a New Zealand Visa?
faqs.answer: You can apply for a New Zealand Visa up to 3 months prior to your departure date.

faqs.question: What is the maximum duration of a New Zealand visitor visa?
faqs.answer:
On a visitor visa the maximum allowable stay is 9 months. The visa is normally valid for 3 months
                                or in some cases upto 6 months. Business persons travelling to New Zealand frequently for
                                business purposes may be issued multiple entry visitor visas valid for a maximum period of
                                3 years. However the visa decision and its validity are at the discretion of the Embassy.

faqs.question: Is a confirmed ticket or a return ticket required for applying for a visitor visa?
faqs.answer:
An original travel ticket does not need to be submitted along with the visa application. We would
                                however need the original ticket in case of a transit visa application.

faqs.question:
Do I need to provide confirmed flight tickets or hotel reservation for my New Zealand
                            Visa application?
faqs.answer:
No. Confirmed flight or hotel reservations are not required for Tourist or Business visa application
                                but mandatory for Transit visa application.

faqs.question: How can my sponsor support my application if he or she is outside of New Zealand?
faqs.answer:
If a New Zealand resident/ citizen is outside of New Zealand at the time of sponsoring an application
                                he or she can complete the sponsorship form and send the same along with the visa application
                                and supporting documents to establish his eligibility as a sponsor. The sponsorship application
                                can be approved by a visa officer.

faqs.question: What is a transit visa?
faqs.answer:
Transit visas are only for people who will be in New Zealand for less than 24 hours and will
                                not leave the transit area of the airport. If you will be in New Zealand for more than 24
                                hours or want to leave the transit area, you will need a visitor’s visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to pay an additional fee for a longer validity visitor visa?
faqs.answer:
No additional fee is applicable for a longer validity visa. Please note that the validity of
                                the New Zealand Visa is at the discretion of the Embassy.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for a New Zealand Visa?
faqs.answer:
One can be granted a New Zealand Visa if the intention of Visit is genuinely expressed to
                                    the officer. Demonstrate sufficiency of funds to stay in New Zealand for the time of stay. Demonstrate the intention to return home after the mentioned time of stay. No intention to study or work unless or otherwise mentioned. No record of criminal offenses. Be able to provide any other documents upon request. Be healthy at the time of New Zealand Visa Application. Beyond this, you will need to also demonstrate your intended temporary purpose in New Zealand.
                                Do not forget that you are applying for a temporary document and an officer will wish to
                                see the temporary nature of your stay in all aspects of your application.

faqs.question: I have a valid New Zealand Visa in my old Passport which has expired? What do I do?
faqs.answer:
If you have a valid visa in your old passport and have recently renewed your passport (because
                                it has expired, was lost/stolen or your name has changed), you need to transfer your valid
                                visa into your new passport before you use it to travel. This applies regardless of whether
                                you have a physical visa label or an eVisa.

faqs.question: How can I extend my stay from within New Zealand?
faqs.answer:
After you arrive in New Zealand, you may want to change the conditions of your visit. This is
                                possible in special cases. To extend your stay; visa holders in New Zealand seeking further
                                temporary visas should apply at least one month in advance of their visa expiry date. To
                                extend your Visitor's Visa, you will have to show that during your stay: You have supported
                                yourself financially, and have enough money to continue supporting yourself; and You have
                                not worked, been sponsored, or held a Student Permit.

faqs.question: What will happen after I submit my New Zealand Visa application?
faqs.answer:
After receiving your complete Zealand Visa application, our Visa Experts will perform a completeness
                                check based on New Zealand Immigration requirements and will then submit your application
                                on your behalf to TT Services. Once the Embassy/Consulate has assessed your application they will make a decision and affix
                                a visa counterfoil in your passport or otherwise issue you with a letter explaining why a
                                visa could not be granted. The New Zealand Embassy/Consulate will then securely return your
                                passport to TT Services New Zealand and the same will be collected by us and handed over
                                to you.

faqs.question: How do I check my application status online?
faqs.answer:
You can check your visa status on the TT services website. TT services online tracking system
                                can provide only status updates on your passport movement and not on your applications progress
                                or decision. To track your documents, please enter your TTS receipt number OR Your passport
                                number and date of birth with valid Captcha Text.

faqs.question: Do I need to take health/travel insurance?
faqs.answer:
You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself as medical
                                treatment can be very expensive in New Zealand. Your travel insurance offers protection against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident. For financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

faqs.question: Can you fill out the application forms for me?
faqs.answer:
Yes, we do all this for you. Our Visa Experts work with you to collect all the information required
                                for successful completion of New Zealand Visa application process. We work as quickly as
                                possible to complete & submit your application. How long this takes can depend on factors
                                such as the type of visa you are applying for & how easy it is to collect your information.
                                At our initial consultation we will advise you on the steps to take for you to be in New
                                Zealand lawfully after which we will guide you throughout your application. We understand
                                that your visa applications may be urgent and we have the capacity to deal with this.

faqs.question: How will you help me with getting my New Zealand Visa?
faqs.answer:
Applying for a New Zealand Visa through us will be an easy and hassle free process. It is highly
                                advisable to process your visa through us as we will take care of your complete visa process
                                right from getting your documents ready to stamping of your New Zealand Visa.

faqs.question: What is the easiest way to apply for a New Zealand Visa?
faqs.answer:
The easiest way to apply for a New Zealand Visa is to contact us. We are experts in the travel
                                and tourism sector with over 40 years of experience. Through our expertise, in-depth knowledge
                                and integrity, we commit to delivering an exceptional experience to our customers each and
                                every time you use our service. In order to help us understand your unique visa needs, please
                                drop in your query and our Expert will get in touch with you.

faqs.answer: We have you covered across India with presence in all the major cities like Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, Bangalore, Chennai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and many more.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Papua New Guinea?
faqs.answer: Yes.Indian citizens are required to obtain a visa prior to entering the Republic of Papua New Guinea.Visas may be obtained from the Embassy of Papua New Guinea in India. Based on the purpose of your visit to Papua New Guinea you may apply for a Tourist visa, Visitor visa, Business visa – short term single entry, Business visa short term multiple entry, Student visa, Transit visa & working resident visa. Before applying for a visa please check which visa type you are eligible to apply for.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Papua New Guinea visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straight forward and effortless process to apply for a Papua New Guinea visa online through Akbar Travels: Choose your preferred type of Papua New Guinea visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: What are the different types of Papua New Guinea Visas?
faqs.answer: Tourist Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to enter Papua New Guinea for tourism, leisure or visiting relatives and friends Business Visa: This visa is issued for a short visit to conduct discussions, seminars, negotiations, presentations or any other commercial activity, but not to take up employment. Transit Visa: Transit visa allows a visitors to travel across or through Papua New Guinea on way to another country. Commonly, it allows the in-transit passenger to go out of an airport or port for an overnight stay.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Papua New Guinea visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Papua New Guinea visa is one month before the date of travel to the country.In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted ten days, prior to travelling.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Papua New Guinea visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The visa validity is decided on the basis of the visa type and duration of stay.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Papua New Guinea visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: For prior approval received from Papua New Guinea Immigration and Citizenship Service (PNGICS), processing of the application will take 3-4 working days. For applications lodged without prior approval from Papua New Guinea Immigration and Citizenship Service (PNGICS), processing of the application will take 7-10 working days. Please be advised that the timeliness for visa processing may differ due to unavoidable circumstances.

faqs.question: How do I receive my Papua New Guinea visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will bestamped on your passport.

faqs.question: What kind of entry is granted by Papua New Guinea visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: There could be single or multiple entry depending on the category of visa applied for. For Tourist visa, there is a single entry. For Business visa, there is both single and multiple entry.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Papua New Guinea once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Papua New Guinea visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Papua New Guinea How long you intend to stay in Papua New Guinea How will you support yourself during your time in Papua New Guinea What is the purpose of your visit to Papua New Guinea Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Papua New Guinea If you have a permit to Papua New Guinea the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Papua New Guinea

faqs.question: Can I extend my Papua New Guinea visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Papua New Guinea Visa issued to Indian nationals can be extended on payment of Rs. 10,300/- for every entry.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Consulate/Embassy to submit my documents?
faqs.answer: No. You are not required to visit thePapua New Guinea Embassy personally. We will submit the visa application on your behalf.

faqs.question: What if my Papua New Guinea visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Papua New Guinea visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Papua New Guinea tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country ona Papua New Guinea tourist visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the event of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: What is the easiest way to get a Papua New Guinea Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Contact our Visa Experts and apply for your Papua New Guinea visa instantly with minimum documents and lowest visa fee. No need to visit our office and no need to deal with the Embassy. We do it all for you.

faqs.question: Are you still having doubts about the Papua New Guinea Visa process?
faqs.answer: Please feel free to contact us for all your Papua New Guinea Visa worries. We have you covered across India with presence in all the major cities like Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, Bangalore, Chennai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and many more. Important Notice: The information provided here are subject to change without prior notice. For confirmation on visa requirements and fees, you may consult with the Papua New Guinea Embassy or Consulate near you.

faqs.question: What is an Austria Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
An Austria Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the Schengen
                                countries including Austria for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s dream
                                where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along with Austria.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all 26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Austria), unless it is marked otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European territory
                                of Austria. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons of
                                your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following countries:
                                Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary,
                                Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway,
                                Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number of
                                entries".

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer:
You may appeal against this decision. The decision to refuse a Schengen visa and the reasons
                                for the refusal are notified using a standard form that is handed out by the Member State's
                                consulate that refused the visa. The notification of the refusal must include the reasons,
                                on which the refusal were based, and the procedures and deadlines for submitting an appeal. You are free to re-apply again if your application has been refused earlier. However, it is recommended
                                that you take note of the reasons for the earlier refusal before submitting a new application
                                and make amendments, where necessary. The visa fee is not refunded if the visa is refused. The visa fee covers the cost of the examination
                                of the visa application.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: the purpose of your trip when and where you intend to travel how your trip is going to be funded day-by-day itinerary for your trip duration of the trip

faqs.question: Is it possible to extend my Schengen Visa while in Austria?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your short-stay visa while in Austria except in special circumstances, and
                                exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and apply
                                for another Austria Visa if necessary.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the visa.

faqs.question:
If my Austria short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long
                            can I remain in the Austria territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in an Austrian territory for a maximum
                                period of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 10-12 working days from your appointment
                                date.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain a Austria Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Austria Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 5 to 15 days to process in the
                                Austria Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Austria Visa is dependent on several
                                factors and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion.

faqs.question: What is the role of VFS?
faqs.answer:
VFS Global Services Pvt Ltd (VFS) is the Service Delivery Provider for the Embassy of Austria
                                in New Delhi. The role of VFS is to accept visa applications and to dispatch passports and
                                documents back to clients, on behalf of the Embassy of Austria. VFS does not play any part
                                in or influence the outcome of your visa application.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my Austria Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Austria visa application online using the Austria VFS Reference
                                number and last name. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of the Austria VFS
                                website.

faqs.question: Will I get my visa at the end of the process?
faqs.answer:
As an application centre, the Austria Visa Application Centre (VFS) will not be able to guarantee
                                you a visa. The issuance or refusal of a Austria visa is the sole prerogative of The Embassy/Consulate.
                                The Austria Visa Application Centre cannot influence this decision in any way.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for an Austria Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Austria Visa in order to provide your biometrics and submit
                                your visa documents.

faqs.question:
I have a valid long stay visa/residence permit for a country that is part of the Schengen
                            area. Do I need another visa to travel to other Schengen states?
faqs.answer:
No. A long stay visa or a residence permit issued by a Schengen State allows you to travel or
                                stay in other Schengen States, while respecting the maximum duration of a “short stay” (a
                                stay of "90 days in any 180 day period")

faqs.question: My family is also applying for an Austria Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question:
I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first port
                                of entry.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation, travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Austria Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years period.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: What are the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question: Can you process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa, you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

faqs.answer:
The easiest way to apply for an Austria Visa is to contact us. We are experts in the travel and

                                and integrity, we commit to delivering an exceptional experience to our customers each and
                                every time you use our service. In order to help us understand your unique visa needs, please
                                drop in your query and our Expert will get in touch with you

faqs.answer: We have you covered across India with presence in all the major cities like Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, Bangalore, Chennai, Hyderabad, Lucknow and many more.

faqs.question: Do Indians require a visa for Russia?
faqs.answer: Yes. Indians need a visa to travel to Russia. Russia visa for Indians can be obtained at the Russian Embassy or Consulate. In order to get visa to Russia from India it is necessary to fulfil the visa requirements and submit the necessary documents, among which is an Invitation to Russia. A Russian Visa for Indians can be private, tourist, business and work – depending on the purpose of a visit.

faqs.question: How can I obtain an Invitation from Russia?
faqs.answer: The Invitation letter must be issued by an inviting party. Depending on the purpose and type of Russia visa, it can be issued by a friend or a relative, a tourist company or organization, which is accredited at the Department of Consulate Service of the Ministry for Foreign Affairs of the RF or the Federal Migration Service.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Russia visa online?
faqs.answer: With Akbar Travels, the process of applying for a Russia visa online is easy and seamless. The steps are: Choose your preferred type of Russia visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit your documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa when approved

faqs.question: What are the different types of Russian visas?
faqs.answer: Tourist Visa is required in case you enter Russian Federation for tourism purposes. Tourist visa can be valid for up to 30 days and can be issued for single or double entry. Dates of validity of the visa will correspond with the dates mentioned on your tourist confirmation. Business visa is required in case you wish to enter Russia for business purposes. Business visa can be valid for up to 3 months and can be issued for single or double entry. Also, business visa can be issued for multiple entries and can be valid for up to 1 year. All applicants from India wishing to apply for multiple entry visa should obtain direct invitation letter from the inviting company in Russia (INN Letter) or a letter of invitation issued by a Main Directorate for Migration Affairs in Russia. Applicants should also have a single or double Russian visa in the last 1 year, without which they cannot apply for multiple entries. Visa copies need to be provided. Dates of validity of the visa will correspond with mentioned on your letter of invitation issued by a Main Directorate for Migration Affairs in Russia or a telex from the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Private visa is required in case you wish to enter Russian Federation to visit family or friends. Private visa can be valid for up to 3 months and can be issued for single or double entry. Dates of validity of the visa will correspond with the dates mentioned on your private invitation from relatives/friend in Russia. Foreign nationals may also be issued with a standard private visa due to the need to enter the Russian Federation because of urgent treatment or following the serious illness or death of a close relative and provided a written confirmation of the neked to provide urgent medical assistance or of the serious illness or the death of a close relative.

Due to an expansion in fake visas to UAE, many Indian passengers were deported back

                                departure and only after checking the visa authenticity, airlines update visa
                                message in the respective PNR.

                                against the PNR. Airlines generally will take at least 24-48 working hours to
                                update PNR after issuance of VISA.

faqs.question: What is the main purpose behind updating the OTB?
faqs.answer:
Your airline mandates you to update OTB message in the PNR primarily to confirm the
                                legitimacy of your Dubai Visa as well as other relevant travel documents, thereby
                                eliminating the chances of travellers making entry to the country with a forged
                                visa and subsequently getting deported by the UAE immigration.

faqs.question: What is the difference between validity of Thailand visa for Indians and period of stay?
faqs.answer:
Please note that the period of Thailand visa validity is different from the period of stay.
                                Thai Visa validity is the period during which a visa can be used to enter Thailand.
                                In general, the validity of a visa is 3 months, but in some cases, visas may be issued to be valid for 6 months, 1 year or 3 years.
                                The validity of a Thailand visa for Indians is granted with discretion by the Royal Thai Consulate-General and is displayed on the visa sticker.
                                The period of stay is granted by the Thailand immigration officer upon arrival at the port of entry and in accordance with the type of visa.
                                For example, the period of stay for a transit visa  should not exceed 30 days, for a Thai tourist visa should not exceed 60 days and for a non-immigrant visa should not exceed 90 days from the arrival date.
                                The period of stay granted by the immigration officer is displayed on the arrival stamp.
                                Travellers who wish to stay longer than such period may apply for extension of stay at offices of the Immigration Bureau in Bangkok, located at Soi Suan Plu, South Sathorn Road, Bangkok 10120, Tel 02-2873101-10 or at an Immigration office located in the provinces.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Serbia?
faqs.answer: No, Indian citizens do not require a visa to enter Serbia for a short stay, if the purpose of visit is tourism, visit, transit or business. Indians enjoy visa free travel to the country. On 22nd August, 2017, the Government of the Republic of Serbia adopted the Decision on visa exemption for the nationals of the Republic of India, holding ordinary passports.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Serbia without a visa?
faqs.answer: The nationals of the Republic of India can enter, transit through and stay in the territory of the Republic of Serbia without a visa, during a period not exceeding 30 days from the date of entry, within a period of one year.

faqs.question: What are the Passport requirements?
faqs.answer: All visitors arriving in Serbia must have a valid passport or other travel document issued by the government of the country of citizenship or nationality. The document must be valid for at least 6 months beyond the date of entry.

faqs.question: Do I need travel or medical insurance plan?
faqs.answer: It is always advised to be insured in case of medical or travel emergencies. Akbar Travels can assist you with the ideal insurance policy to protect yourself against medical emergencies during travel as well as damage or loss of baggage.

faqs.question: What are entry requirements for visitors entering Serbia?
faqs.answer: The immigration officials at the Airport may check the below documents: Passport valid for a least 6 months beyond intended date of return Dully filled Immigration Card Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Serbia • Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to your business visa Vaccination certificate (if applicable)

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the event of unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Serbia visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Serbia How long you intend to stay in Serbia How will you support yourself during your time in Serbia What is the purpose of your visit to Serbia Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Serbia If you have a permit to Serbia the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Serbia

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Turkmenistan?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Turkmenistan. Visa must be obtained from the Embassy of Turkmenistan in India. All Indian visitors entering into Turkmenistan must have a valid visa and passport or travel document, as well as onward tickets and sufficient funds to support themselves while in the country. The type of visa to enter Turkmenistan will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Turkmenistan visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straight forward and effortless process to apply for a Turkmenistan visa online through Akbar Travels: Choose your preferred type of Turkmenistan visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Turkmenistan visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: TheTurkmenistan Embassy issues a Single and Multiple entry visa for Indians. The Single entry is issued for a period of 10 days, 20 days, 1 month, 2 months, 3 months 6 months and 1 year, whereas a multiple entry visa is issued for 1 month, 2 months, 3 months, 6 months and 1 year.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Turkmenistan once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Brunei visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The processing time for a visa is 10 business days. It is possible, however, to expedite the process to 1-3 business days if all the paperwork is in order and an additional 100% of the cost of the visa is included in the payment.

faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Turkmenistan visa is three months before the date of travel to the country. In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted at least two weeks, prior to travelling.e times.

faqs.answer: In the case of aTurkmenistan visa rejection, the Embassy will state the reason for rejecting your visa application. You may also appeal against the decision if you find it necessary. Business visas are ideal for Indian citizens travelling for Business Meetings, Conference, etc. for a shorter period of stay.
