faqs.question: Who needs a visa for Australia?
faqs.answer:
All persons, other than Australian citizens require a visa or authority to enter Australia. All Indian
                                citizens
                                require an Australia visa.

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for an Australia Visa?
faqs.answer:
Applicants are advised to apply for an Australia Visa in advance but not earlier then 90 days prior to
                                the date of travel.
                                The Australian
                                High Commission recommends that you apply at least 3 weeks prior to your date of travel to accommodate
                                any
                                unforeseen processing delays.

faqs.question: Should I purchase my airline ticket before travelling?
faqs.answer:
You should not purchase non-refundable tickets or accommodation prior to the grant of a visa. Any such
                                purchases
                                are the sole responsibility of the visa applicant. The Department of Home Affairs recommends that you
                                lodge
                                your Australia Visa application well ahead of your proposed travel date and finalize travel
                                arrangements
                                after visa issue.

faqs.question: Is Australia Visa a sticker Visa OR an E–Visa?
faqs.answer:
The Australia Visa is an E-Visa i.e. it is not a Sticker visa endorsed on the passport, once decision
                                is taken
                                by the Australian High Commission; E-Visa will be mailed on the registered Email ID which is mentioned
                                on
                                the visa form.

faqs.question: How long can I stay In Australia?
faqs.answer: You may be allowed to stay for a maximum period of 3 months for each visit in a one year’s period.

faqs.question: When do I get a stamp in my passport?
faqs.answer: Your Australia Visa is electronically linked to your passport number; you will not require a stamp.

faqs.question: What would be the duration of Australia Visa? Single entry or Multiple entry?
faqs.answer:
Typically 3 months. You can request for a longer stay duration, but be sure to include
                                proof/justification.
                                Validity of the Australia visa is at the discretion of the Embassy.

faqs.question: How can I extend my stay?
faqs.answer:
If you want to stay in Australia longer than your original visa lets you, you will need to apply for a
                                further
                                visa of the same kind or another Australia visa. How much longer you can stay in Australia will depend
                                on
                                the visa that you have, or the visa that you apply for. If you have a ‘No further stay’ condition on
                                your
                                Australia Visa, you cannot apply for a new visa while you are in Australia. You must leave Australia no
                                later
                                than the date on which your visa ends.

faqs.question: What is the Australia Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Australia Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel. In your cover
                                letter you
                                should explain: the purpose of your trip when and where you intend to travel how your trip is going to be funded day-by-day itinerary for your trip duration of the trip

faqs.question: Am I required to undergo a medical examination or chest X-Ray for the Australia Visa?
faqs.answer:
All travellers applying for an Australia Visa must meet the health requirement. Whether you are
                                required to
                                undergo a medical examination and/or chest x-ray depends on your age, how long you intend to stay in
                                Australia
                                and your intended activity in Australia. You will be notified post submission of your Australia visa
                                application
                                if a medical examination is required.

faqs.question: Can I undertake medical examinations before lodging the application?
faqs.answer:
No. If a medical and/or x-ray examination is required, the New Delhi visa office will notify you after
                                your
                                Australia visa application is lodged. You will then need to make arrangements to attend an approved
                                immigration
                                panel doctor of your choice.

faqs.question: Do I need to take health/travel insurance?
faqs.answer:
You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself in Australia as
                                medical
                                treatment can be very expensive in Australia. We can certainly assist you with the travel insurance as
                                it’s
                                an absolute necessity for International travel in the event of unexpected events such as medical
                                emergencies,
                                baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.question: What is a Germany Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Germany Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the Schengen
                                countries including Germany for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a traveller’s dream
                                where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries along with Germany.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all 26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Germany), unless it is marked otherwise
                                on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the European territory
                                of Germany. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for the reasons of
                                your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the following countries:
                                Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary,
                                Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway,
                                Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number of
                                entries".

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer: You are free to apply again for a Schengen Visa if your application has been refused earlier.

faqs.question: What is the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: the purpose of your trip when and where you intend to travel how your trip is going to be funded day-by-day itinerary for your trip duration of the trip

faqs.question: As a Germany short-stay visa holder can I extend my Schengen Visa while in Germany?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your Germany short-stay while in Germany except in special circumstances, and
                                exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and apply
                                for another Germany Visa if necessary.

faqs.question:
If my Germany short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long
                            can I remain in the German territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Germany Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Germany territory for a maximum period
                                of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question:
How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Germany Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Germany Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of departure.
                                We recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as
                                certain types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the
                                processing time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 5-15 working days from
                                your appointment date.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain a Germany Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Germany Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 10 to 15 days to process in the
                                Germany Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Germany Visa is dependent on several
                                factors and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my Germany Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Germany visa application online using the Germany VFS Reference
                                number and Date of Birth. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section of the VFS Germany
                                website.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Germany Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Germany Schengen Visa in order to provide your biometrics
                                and submit your visa documents.

faqs.question: My family is also applying for the Germany Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question:
I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first port
                                of entry.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01". With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation, travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Germany Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years period.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: What are the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question: Can you process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa, you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

                                submitting
                                a new application and make amendments, where necessary. The visa fee is not refunded if the visa is refused. The visa fee covers the cost of the

                                of the visa application.

                                within
                                15 working days provided that we have full and satisfactory information about the
                                applicant.

faqs.question: What is the role of VFS?
faqs.answer:
VFS Global Services Pvt Ltd (VFS) is the Service Delivery Provider for the Embassy of
                                Czech Republic
                                in New Delhi. The role of VFS is to accept visa applications and to dispatch passports
                                and
                                documents back to clients, on behalf of the Embassy of Czech Republic. VFS does not
                                play
                                any part in or influence the outcome of your visa application.

faqs.question: How can I check the status of my Czech Republic Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Applicants can check the status of Czech Republic visa application online using the
                                Czech Republic
                                VFS Reference number and Date of Birth. Kindly visit the Track Your Application section
                                of
                                the Czech Republic VFS website.

faqs.question: Will I get my visa at the end of the process?
faqs.answer:
As an application centre, the Czech Republic Visa Application Centre (VFS) will not be
                                able to
                                guarantee you a visa. The issuance or refusal of a Czech Republic visa is the sole
                                prerogative
                                of The Embassy/Consulate. The Czech Republic Visa Application Centre cannot influence
                                this
                                decision in any way.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Czech Republic Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Czech Republic Visa in order to provide your
                                biometrics
                                and submit your visa documents.

faqs.question:
I have a valid long stay visa/residence permit for a country that is part of the Schengen
                            area. Do I need another visa to
                            travel to other Schengen states?
faqs.answer:
No. A long stay visa or a residence permit issued by a Schengen State allows you to
                                travel or
                                stay in other Schengen States, while respecting the maximum duration of a “short stay”
                                (a
                                stay of "90 days in any 180 day period")

faqs.question: My family is also applying for a Czech Republic Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question:
I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply for my
                            Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will
                                be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then
                                you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first
                                port
                                of entry.

faqs.question: Can I leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01".
                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during
                                the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only
                                once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a
                                multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity
                                period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from my
                            travel document with the Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At
                                the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional
                                documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and
                                the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the
                                documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation,
                                travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be
                                presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: Why is personal appearance mandatory for Czech Republic Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System
                                (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide
                                biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at
                                the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications
                                within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the
                                VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will
                                again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the
                                applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it
                                cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years
                                period.

faqs.question: Do I need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel
                                insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical
                                reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their
                                stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid
                                throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended
                                stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question: What are the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question: Can you process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa,
                                you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical
                                treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection
                                against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses,
                                flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident. For financial
                                safety
                                and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance
                                and avail our special offer.

faqs.question: Is Canada Visa also called as a Temporary Resident Visa (TRV)?
faqs.answer:
A Temporary Resident Visa (TRV), also referred to as a Canada ‘visitor’s visa’ or ‘entry visa’,
                                is a document that is placed in your passport and used to enter or re-enter Canada. A TRV
                                can be viewed as having valid permission to enter Canada for tourism, business or transit
                                purpose.

faqs.question: Do I need a Canada Visa/Temporary Resident Visa?
faqs.answer:
All Indians who are not Canadian citizens or permanent residents of Canada require a visa to
                                enter Canada. The requirement for a Canada Visa also applies to temporary residents who are
                                in transit through Canada.

faqs.question: What is a Canada Temporary Resident Visa (TRV)?
faqs.answer:
A Canada Temporary Resident Visa is an official document issued by the Embassy/Consulate General
                                that is placed in your passport to show that you have met the requirements for admission
                                to Canada as a temporary resident (either as a visitor, student, or worker). A valid Temporary
                                Resident Visa is not a guarantee of entry into Canada; an officer at the port of entry will
                                decide if you still meet the requirements for admission when you arrive. If there has been
                                a change in circumstances between the date of your application and your arrival in Canada
                                or if subsequent information is given which was not originally available to the visa office,
                                you may be refused entry.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to visit Qatar?
faqs.answer: Yes. All Indian nationals require a Visa to travel to Qatar.

faqs.question: What type of Qatar visas can I apply online?
faqs.answer: You can apply online for a Qatar Tourist and Business e-visa.

faqs.question: When can I apply for a Qatar e-visa?
faqs.answer: You can apply for a visa a maximum of 90 days and a minimum of 6 days before your intended travel date to Qatar. We recommend you apply as early as possible in order to avoid last minute delays.

faqs.question: How do I apply for my e-visa to Qatar?
faqs.answer: We have the complete process simplified for you and will take care of the complete visa process right from verifying your documents to approval of your e-visa. We have it all covered for you.

faqs.question: How long is the Qatar Visa valid for?
faqs.answer: Both Tourist and Business e-visas are valid for 3 months. One can stay upto 30 days on a tourist e-visa and upto 90 days on a business e-visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Qatar Consulate/Embassy to get my e-visa?
faqs.answer: No. You do not need to visit the Consulate/Embassy. We will process your e-visa online as Indians are eligible for a Qatar e-visa.

faqs.question: On arrival into Qatar, what documents do I need to present?
faqs.answer: At entry, you must show that you have a valid hotel booking, confirmed return tickets and sufficient cash in addition to your valid passport and e-Visa.

faqs.question: What are the advantages of applying for a Qatar e-Visa?
faqs.answer: Minimum document requirement; Swift processing-subject to qualifying the eligibility criteria and meeting the documents requirement, your visa can be processed within 3 working days; Convenient and cost effective i.e. most economical visa fee/charges; Electronic visa can be sent anywhere in the world through Email.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a visa?
faqs.answer: Provided all required documents are submitted correctly, visas are normally issued within 6 working days of your application.

faqs.question: Will I definitely get a visa if I apply online? If I get a visa, am I guaranteed entry in Qatar?
faqs.answer: The decision to grant entry visas for Qatar is entirely at the discretion of the country’s immigration authorities. The granting of a visa does not guarantee entry in Qatar, the final decision is made by immigration officers at the point of entry.

faqs.question: Do I have to submit my passport for stamping before I travel?
faqs.answer: No, you will receive an electronic visa, which does not require anything to be stamped on your passport ahead of travel. All visa copies are sent by email. You should print a copy of your e-visa and carry it with you when you travel to Qatar.

faqs.question: What are the passport requirements for applying for a Qatar e-Visa?
faqs.answer: The Applicant’s passport should be valid for atleast 6 months with minimum 2 blank pages from the date of entry into Qatar.

faqs.question: What is OK to Board (OTB) and why is it needed?
faqs.answer: Due to an expansion in fake visas to Qatar, many Indian passengers were deported back in the past. In order to control the fake visa issuance and any fraudulent activities; airlines and sponsors double check the Qatar Visa and Air tickets before departure and only after checking the visa authenticity, airlines update visa message in the respective PNR.

faqs.question: What is the time taken to get the OTB?
faqs.answer: The Airline verifies the Qatar Visa and only then updates an Ok to Board message against the PNR. Airlines generally will take at least 24-48 working hours to update PNR after issuance of the Qatar VISA.

faqs.question: What is the main purpose behind updating the OTB?
faqs.answer: Your airline mandates you to update OTB message in the PNR primarily to confirm the legitimacy of your Qatar Visa as well as other relevant travel documents, thereby eliminating the chances of travellers making entry to the country with a forged visa and subsequently getting deported by the Qatar immigration.

faqs.question: What if my OTB status is not updated?
faqs.answer: In such circumstances, your airline has the complete right to disapprove your boarding. To resolve this issue at the earliest, do not delay getting in touch with our Qatar Visa Experts.

faqs.question: Why was my visa application rejected?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, the Qatar Immigration authorities do not give reasons for rejecting visa applications, so we cannot provide specific reasons why your application was unsuccessful.

faqs.question: If my visa application is rejected, can I apply again?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can reapply if your visa application is rejected.

faqs.question: Do I need to take a health/travel insurance?
faqs.answer: You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself in Qatar as medical treatment can be very expensive in Qatar. Your travel insurance offers protection against unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel insurance and avail our special offer.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Taiwan?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Taiwan. Visas to enter Taiwan may be obtained from the Taiwan Embassy in India. The type of visa to enter Taiwanwill depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration. All Indian visitors entering into Taiwan must have a valid visa and passport or travel document, as well as onward tickets and sufficient funds to support themselves while in the country.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Taiwan visa online?
faqs.answer: It is a straight forward and effortless process to apply for a Taiwan visa online through Akbar Travels: Choose your preferred type of Taiwan visa based on your travel type Pay online Submit documents through our pick up & drop service Receive your visa once approved

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Taiwan visa online?
faqs.answer: Applicants are encouraged to apply three (3) weeks to (1) one month in advance of travel.In most cases, you’ll be informed within 5 calendar days whether your application has been successful.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Taiwan visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The Taiwan Embassy issues a Single and Multiple entry visa for Indians. The Single entry is issued with a validity of 1 to 3 months, whereas a multiple entry visa is issued with a validity of 6 months to 3 years. However, visitors can only stay for maximum 60 days from the following day of arrival.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Taiwan once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.question: Are there any visa exemptions for Indian nationals?
faqs.answer: Indian Nationals can apply online for an ROC Travel Authorization Certificate. This online application saves the stress of submitting original physical documents or visiting the Embassy. Basic requirements To be eligible for an ROC Travel Authorization Certificate, the following three basic requirements must be met: 1.The applicant’s passport must have remaining validity of at least six months starting from the date of arrival in Taiwan. 2.The applicant must possess an onward/return air or boat ticket. 3.The applicant has never been employed as a blue-collar worker in Taiwan. Additional requirements In addition to the aforementioned basic requirements, one of the following requirements must also be met: 1.The applicant possesses at least one of the following documents issued by Australia, Canada, Japan, Korea, New Zealand, any of the Schengen countries, the United Kingdom, or the United States: Valid resident or permanent resident card or status Valid entry visa (electronic visa must be printed out) Resident card or visa that has expired less than 10 years prior to the date of arrival in Taiwan 2.The applicant possesses an entry visa or resident card issued by the ROC at any point in the past 10 years and has no record of immigration irregularities or law violations in Taiwan. However, holders of ROC entry visas bearing the remark FL (i.e., foreign laborer) or X (i.e., others), as well as holders of ROC resident cards with stated purpose of residence being foreign laborer (i.e., 外勞), are not eligible for an ROC Travel Authorization Certificate.

faqs.question: What is the Taiwan visa fee for Indians?
faqs.answer: Since the Embassy issues single & multiple type visas, the cost for each entry type differs as follows: Sr.No Visa Type No of Entries Visa Validity Visa Fee 1 Single Entry Single 1 to 3 months INR 4,800/- 2 Multiple Entry Multiple 6 months to 3 years INR 8,350/-

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Taiwan once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Tourist and Business visa?
faqs.answer:
Tourist visas are for those Indian citizens travelling to Taiwan for sightseeing, recreation and casual visits to friends or families.
Business visas are ideal for Indian citizens travelling for Business Meetings, Conference, etc. for a shorter period of stay.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit my passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Taiwan visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting Taiwan How long you intend to stay in Taiwan How will you support yourself during your time in Taiwan What is the purpose of your visit to Taiwan Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to Taiwan If you have a permit to Taiwan the country you intend to travel to after your stay in Taiwan

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Taiwan visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa application is normally processed within 9 working days.

faqs.question: How do I receive my Taiwan visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: What if my Taiwan visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Taiwan visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Taiwan tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country on a Taiwan tourist visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the occurrenceof unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.

faqs.answer: Contact our Visa Experts and apply for your Taiwan visa instantly with minimum documents and lowest visa fee. No need to visit our office and no need to deal with the Embassy. We do it all for you.

faqs.answer: Yes.Indian citizens are required to obtain a visa prior to entering the Republic of Bolivia.Visas may be obtained from the Embassy of Bolivia in India. Based on the purpose of your visit to Bolivia you may apply for a Business Visa, Tourist Visa, Student/Research Visa, Transit Visa,Courtesy Visa& Humanitarian Visa. Before applying for a visa please check which visa type you are eligible to apply for.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Boliviavisa for Indians?
faqs.answer: This visa is valid for 30 days.

faqs.question: Can the Bolivia visa be extended?
faqs.answer: Visitors to Bolivia are normally granted a 30 days visa. This can easily be extended up to 90 days for free from Immigration offices in Bolivia.The 30 days initial entry period can be extended for free for an additional 30 days, and then again for another 30 days (for a total of 90 days)

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Bolivia visa application?

faqs.question: How do I receive my Bolivia visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will bestamped on your passport.

faqs.question: Is it possible to obtain a visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: YYes. Indians are eligible for a Bolivia visa on arrival. Itcosts US$ 60 and you can get it on arrival only at La Paz or Santacruz Airport Visa on arrival service is not available at all Bolivia airports.

faqs.question: How many entries are allowed in Bolivia visa?
faqs.answer: Single entries are allowed in Bolivia.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Bolivia once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave more than once.

faqs.question: What will happen if you overstay in Bolivia without extending the visa?
faqs.answer: When you overstay in Bolivia then for each day you will have to pay a fine of 20 Bolivianos or USD 3 at the border while leaving Bolivia.

faqs.question: Is Transit visa is required for Bolivia?
faqs.answer: No, Transit visa is exempted for 24 hours in Bolivia.

faqs.question: Do I need any specific vaccinations?
faqs.answer: Yes. As per the Bolivia Visa requirements, a yellow fever vaccination is mandatory. The certificate of the same is required to be attached along with other documents when applying for the visa.

faqs.question: How long is my vaccination certificate valid for?
faqs.answer: A certificate for yellow fever vaccination has a validity lasting up to 10 years. It must be counted 10 days post the date of vaccination.

faqs.answer: No. You are not required to visit theBolivia Embassy personally. We will submit the visa application on your behalf.

faqs.question: What if myBolivia visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Bolivia visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Bolivia tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country ona Bolivia tourist visa.

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a Visa to travel to Saint Vincent and the Grenadines?
faqs.answer: No, Indian citizens do not require a visa to enter Saint Vincent and the Grenadines for a short stay, if the purpose of visit is tourism, visit or business. Indians enjoy visa free travel to the country. Visitors are required to hold valid passport, proof of sufficient funds to cover their stay, accommodation proof and return flight tickets to their home country.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines without a visa?

faqs.question: What are the Passport requirements?
faqs.answer: All visitors arriving in the Saint Vincent and the Grenadines must have a valid passport with minimum two blank pages. The document must be valid for at least 120 days beyond the date of entry.

faqs.question: What are entry requirements for visitors entering Saint Vincent and the Grenadines?
faqs.answer: The immigration officials at the Airport may check the below documents: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry Dully filled Immigration Card Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Saint Vincent and the Grenadines Detailed itinerary of your trip Documents relating to your business visa

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Cuba visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Cuba visa is two months before the date of travel to the country.In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted ten days, prior to travelling.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Cuba visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: This visa is valid for 30 days. Visas can be extended on request. However the final decision lies with the Immigration officials in Cuba.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Cuban visas for Indians?

It is very easy to apply for and does not require sending your physical passport to us for processing.It is the simplest and the fastest way to get your visa. faqs.question: What is an eVisa?
faqs.answer: An Electronic Visa or "e Visa" is an electronically issued and stored authority for travel to The Republic of Tanzania, which replaces the traditional paper visa process in most cases. You will receive your Tanzaniavisa entirely online – without having to submit your passport for stamping.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Tanzania Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Its validity does not exceed 90 days for a single entry.

faqs.question: What is the Tanzania visa fee for Indians?
faqs.answer: The Tanzania tourist visa fee is INR 4,959/-, whereas the Tanzania business visa fee is INR 19199/-. Both the visas are for single entry and the stay should not exceed 90 days.

faqs.question: What kind of Documentation I need to apply for Tanzania eVisa?
faqs.answer: Scanned copy of a valid passport. (Please note, passports must be valid for a minimum of 6 months from the date of arrival in Tanzania) A recent color passport photograph (45mm x 35mm); all photos are to be on a while back ground only, and not altered or edited from its original state. Evidence of proposed journey into and out of Tanzania i.e. ticket or confirmation of your booking from the travel agent. Proof of accommodation for the length of your stay or a letter of invitation from your sponsor. Proof of funds to finance the trip i.e. bank statements for the previous three months. Birth certificate for children travellers

faqs.question: What are the types of Tanzania visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Ordinary Visa: This visa is granted to foreign national for the purposes of Visit, Tourism, Leisure, Holiday, attending Conference, Humanitarian and charity activities, Family Visit, Health Treatment or any other purpose as may be determined by the issuing authority. Its validity does not exceed 90 days for a single entry. Business Visa: Business visa may be issued for a period not exceeding 90 days to foreign nationals who wish to enter in the United Republic of Tanzania for one of the following purposes: To conduct special assignments such as fixing/repairing machines or to run short term training, etc. To conduct short time professional roles such as auditing accounts, making feasibility studies, establishing professionals and business contacts, making arrangements for investments during the startup period etc. To conduct any other short term lawful business-related task recognized by the laws of the country and as may be determined by the issuing authority. Transit Visa: This Visa may be issued to foreign nationals for the purpose of transiting through to another destination outside the United Republic for a period not exceeding seven days. The applicant of this visa may be required to provide proof of a Visa of the destination country and/or onward ticket. Student Visa: Student visa is granted to foreign national who enters the Country for the purpose of Academic conducts such as Research Students, Intern, Volunteering, EAC Students, Exchange students (EAC and Exchange students are free of charge) and Prospective Students admitted in recognized and legally registered Institutions. This Visa may be issued for a period not exceeding two years.

faqs.answer: If your requirements are complete, the Visa applications will be processed within ten days.Therefore applicants are strongly advised to observe the stipulated time frame while making their applications.

The categories of visas available for Indians visiting Zambia depends on the purpose of the visit. 
Single Entry visa allows you to enter Zambia one time. Valid for up to 90 days from date of issue. Once you have used it for an entry and exit, you cannot use it again.

Double Entry visa allows you to enter Zambia twice. Valid for up to 90 days from date of issue. Once you have used it for the two entries and two exits, the visa cannot be used again.

Multiple Entry visa allows for more than two entries into Zambia. Valid for 90 days.

faqs.question: Is Zambia a safe country, and what are the chances of approval of Zambia visa for Indians?

faqs.question: Which is the best time to visit Zambia?
faqs.answer: Winters in Zambia is from May to September and summers from November to March end. The climate is generally dry with cool early mornings and warm days, however in winters temperature can go down to freezing, so it is advisable to take warm clothes on Safari. The best time to visit the African country is between May to September as all the park are active, avoid going in October as the temperatures are too high to endure.

faqs.question: Is vaccination required for Zambia visa application?
faqs.answer: Vaccination for yellow fever is the requirement of Embassy in order to apply for Zambia visa for Indians whether via consulate or E-visa. Kindly submit original and one Xeroxed copy of the yellow fever certificate. However, it is advisable to get malaria shots and carry a prescribed medication to avoid catching the disease and ruining the trip.

faqs.question: Do Indian citizens require a Visa to travel to Laos?
faqs.answer: Indian nationals do not need to apply for a Laosvisa in advance. They can get a visa upon arrival in Laos provided they have the valid travel documents. Laos Visa on arrival is issued for 30 days. All visitors must hold a passport that is valid for at least six months from the time of entry into Laos.

faqs.question: At which Airports in Laos can I get a Visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Laos visa is available is available to visitors flying into the below airports: Wattay International Airport in Vientiane Capital. Luang Prabang International Airport in Luang Prabang Province. Pakse Internatioanl Airport in Champasack Province. Savannakhet International Airport in Savannakhet Province.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criterion for Laos visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Travellers must meet the following criteria: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry and with two blank pages within Return ticket to your country Confirmation of accommodation for duration of your visit Have enough funds to cover the expenses for duration of the stay inLaos Detailed itinerary of your trip Invitation letter and any additional original documents to supplement your purpose of visit (for business travelers)

faqs.question: How long is the Laos visa valid for?
faqs.answer: Maximum stay for visitors is 30 days only.

faqs.question: Can I extend my stay in Laos?
faqs.answer: Yes. Visa extensions are fairly easy to obtain and the maximum length of extension is fifteen days. You need to visit the immigration office on Hatsady Road in Vientiane before your visa expires. Here, visa extensions are issued at the cost of approx. $2 per day.

faqs.question: Is there any fear of Laos visa rejection?
faqs.answer: Indians are not liable to face a rejection. However, the above said documents are necessary to enter the country. Failure to produce any of the documents may result into rejection of your visa, thereby barring you from entering the country. The final decision to grant an entry permit is solely at the discretion of the Immigration officials at Laos airport.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get the visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Usually, it takes around 20 minutes to get all formalities done and get the visa on arrival. However, the time may vary depending on the peak travel period.

faqs.question: What is the process of getting a Laos visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: After landing at Laos airport, kindly head to the Immigration counter. The immigration authorities will most likely ask basic questions such as the reason for travel, duration of stay and collect the visa fee payment in cash. Overall, it takes about 15-20 minutes to issue avisa. The whole method is hassle-free and easy.

faqs.question: What is a China Visa?
faqs.answer:
A Chinese visa is a stamp or endorsement placed by officials of China on a passport that allows
                                the bearer to visit China. "Visit" is further defined as the reason for entry, usually business,
                                tourist or transitory. Chinese visas are obtained through a visa service provider known as
                                the Chinese Visa Application Service Center recognized by the Chinese Embassy or Consulate
                                General to handle the daily routine work of processing China Visa applications.

faqs.question: Do I need a China visa?
faqs.answer:
All Indian nationals require a visa for China. If you are traveling to mainland China, whether
                                for business or tourism, you require a Chinese Visa to be obtained from the Embassy/Consulate
                                prior to your trip.

faqs.question: How long is a China Visa valid for?
faqs.answer:
A Single and Double entry China Visa is valid for 90 days from issuance. You can enter China
                                within the validity of 90 days from the date of issue (please note the time difference between
                                China and India). And from the date of your entry, you can stay in China for 30 days (the
                                duration period is written on the visa label).

faqs.question: What would be the best time for me to apply for a China Visa?
faqs.answer: You can apply for a China Visa one month before your intended date of entry Into China.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a China tourist Visa and  China business Visa?
faqs.answer:
China Visas are issued according to the purpose of the trip; either for tourism or business activities.
                                In general, "tourist" visas are issued specifically for the purpose of travel for pleasure,
                                while "business" visas generally permits a traveller to engage in normal business-related
                                activities (sales meetings, visiting a factory, negotiating agreements, etc.)

faqs.question: What is the number of entries? What should I do if I have used up all the entries?
faqs.answer:
China Visa’s number of entries refers to the number of times the visa holder can make entry into
                                China within the validity period of the Visa. A China Visa is normally issued with single
                                entry, double entries or multiple entries. Single entry or double entries visa will expire
                                after the times are used up. If you go to China again you will need a new visa. If the entries
                                have not been used up but the visa has expired because the visa has reached the end of its
                                validity period, you will need to apply for a new China Visa. Anyone holding an expired visa
                                that goes to China will be refused entry at the border. It is essential that you check carefully
                                the number of entries and make sure your visa is valid.

faqs.question:
I am going to Guangdong, then to Hong Kong and back to Guangdong for one night. Does it mean that I must have a double-entry
                            China Visa?
faqs.answer:
Absolutely. Double-entry China Visa means you can enter into mainland of China twice. Since you
                                are going to Guangdong twice, you must have a double-entry China Visa.

faqs.question: What type of China Visa do I need? Should I apply for a special Visa when leaving and re-entering mainland China?
faqs.answer:
Single-entry China Visas are usually valid for 3 months from the issue date, and will permit
                                you to stay in China for a maximum of 30 days. This visa will allow you to travel as a tourist
                                or conduct general business activities. Most people need to apply only for a single-entry
                                China Visa. You need to apply for "double entry" or "multiple entry" China Visa if you need
                                to leave and re-enter mainland China. Even when you go to Hong Kong or Macau from mainland
                                China you still need to have a "double entry" or "multiple entry" China Visa.

faqs.question: Do I have to submit my Passport for the China Visa application?
faqs.answer: Yes. You will need to submit your original passport along with other documents.

faqs.question: What is the processing time of a China Visa?
faqs.answer:
China Visa process normally takes upto 4 working days if all your documents are in order, but
                                the time may vary depending on a case to case basis. If you intend to travel urgently, we
                                can also apply for the express service under which your visa can be processed in 2 working
                                days. Express China Visa service is not guaranteed in the Chinese Embassy and the eligibility
                                for express service is judged on a case to case basis.

faqs.question: Can I extend the duration of stay of my visa in China
faqs.answer:
You may apply for an extension of the “duration of stay” of your China Visa at a local public
                                security authority before it expires, but without an assumption that the application will
                                be automatically approved. Overstay violates the laws of China and will be punished.

faqs.question: Is the China Visa fee same for a child?
faqs.answer:
Yes. The China Visa fee is the same for a child, who is an independent applicant or an accompanying
                                applicant sharing the same passport with the principal applicant. Therefore, the child incurs
                                the same amount of visa fee.

faqs.question: What is the relationship between the validity of a China Visa, number of entries and duration of stay?
faqs.answer:
Validity of a China Visa refers to the period within which the visa holder is allowed to enter
                                China. The number of entries refers to the number of times the visa holder is permitted to
                                enter China within the visa’s validity. Duration of stay refers to the longest period the visa holder is allowed to stay in China on
                                each visit, and this is counted from the day following entry into China. When all the permitted entries are used up, the visa will no longer be valid. Even if there are
                                unused entries, the visa will no longer be valid if the validity has already expired. In
                                either case, the visa holder should apply for a new visa if another visit to China is planned. The holder of a visa is eligible to enter China at any time prior to the expiry of its validity
                                (allowed to enter China before midnight Beijing Time on the last date of its validity) provided
                                that permitted entries on the visa have not been used up; the holder’s planned duration of
                                stay in China must not exceed the duration stated on the visa.

faqs.question: Does the Visa Centre belong to the Chinese Embassy/Consulate General?
faqs.answer:
No. The China Visa Application service Center is a commercial service organization registered
                                in accordance with local laws and regulations and recognized by a Chinese Embassy or Consulate-General
                                to handle the daily routine work of processing China Visa applications. However, it operates
                                independently of diplomatic missions and is neither a branch nor an affiliated organ. Please
                                note that the Visa Centre does not participate in the assessment and approval of China Visas.

faqs.question: What are the things foreign citizens should pay attention to while in China?
faqs.answer:
Foreign citizens must abide by the laws and regulations of the People’s Republic of China after
                                they enter China, and must not conduct any activities other than covered by the purpose of
                                the visit as stated in application, or activities not approved by the authorities of the
                                Chinese government. If foreign citizens are seeking employment in China, they need to apply
                                for work permits from relevant authorities. They would face penalties if they breach relevant
                                laws and regulations.

faqs.question: Do I need to take health/travel insurance?
faqs.answer:
You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself as medical
                                treatment can be very expensive in China. Your travel insurance offers protection against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses, flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident. For financial safety
                                and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel insurance
                                and avail our special offer.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Ecuador?
faqs.answer: Citizens of few countries including India do not need to apply for a visa in advance. They can get a Ecuador visa upon arrival in Ecuador provided they have the valid travel documents. The visa application is done when your flight lands or your car crosses the border into Ecuador.

faqs.question: What is the basic requirement for Ecuador visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months from the date of arrival in Ecuador and should have at least 2 blank pages left in it. You should have proof of onward/return tickets out of the country.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for visa on arrival?
faqs.answer: All Categories need: Passport valid for a least 6 months from your date of entry. Return ticket to your country Accommodation proof Sufficient funds to cover your stay in Ecuador. Detailed itinerary of your trip

faqs.question: Is Ecuador an expensive country?
faqs.answer: Ecuador is a generous and welcoming country that won’t burn a hole in your pocket. Especially, when you are travelling from India, the budget should be the last thing on your mind as they have cheap public transportation, great budgeted restaurants to eat authentic cuisine and fully furnished and equipped hotels, inns and motels to stay. You per day cost of the trip won’t go beyond $100 even If you spend lavishly.

faqs.question: What are the regulations for Ecuador visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: If you are a citizen of India and want to visit Ecuador, then you don’t need a visa in advance. Though, in order to get visa on arrival traveller should have financial documents, passport with validity of 6 months and two blank pages, a return ticket, and travel insurance.

faqs.question: Is it a dangerous country? What is the crime situation?
faqs.answer: Ecuador is not a dangerous country, but there has been an explosion in 2018 in the bordering areas of Columbia. Get latest updates from Embassy or talk to the Visa Expert at Akbar Travels to know in detail about the Ecuador visa fees, crime rate, and safety guidelines while travelling to the paradise of birds.

faqs.question: Can a woman on Ecuador tourist visa from India explore the country all alone?
faqs.answer: Like every other tourist destination there are chances of petty thefts and mishaps if precautions are not taken. However, females need to be extra cautious as there have been reports of sexual harassment in Montanita, East Ecuador. Avoid interacting with strangers or drinking with them. Stay in groups, if you want to experience the nightlife.

faqs.question: Any particular region which should be avoided by the travellers on Ecuador visa?
faqs.answer: Currently, there were reports of explosions, kidnapping, and attacks in the border areas adjoining Columbia. It is advised to avoid visiting the restricted area, 20km from the Columbian border, even if it is under army now. Esmeraldas and Montanita are also the regions that should be avoided.

faqs.question: How long does it take to explore the country?
faqs.answer: The diverse country can be explored in two weeks that includes a week in Galapagos Islands, a weekend in Jungle including the safari and rest of the days in Highlands. A two-week itinerary must include hiking, safari rides, exploring the Columbia castles and churches, lastly the nightlife and coastline of the country with few hours of collecting souvenirs from the locale. If you love climbing, then the Andes should be given more days.

faqs.question: Should I travel light or pack heavy?
faqs.answer:
A diverse country with unpredictable climate deserves .
                                versatile packing. For Amazons and Islands, carry light,
                                comfortable and stretchable clothes, but for mountain regions,
                                you need multiple layers including sweatpants, sweaters, gloves,
                                etc. If you are planning a cruise or going to attend a party
                                then carry a formal dress,otherwise there is no need to carry heavy dresses with expensive jewellery and accessories. It is suggested to carry essentials like an umbrella, raincoat, torch, chargers, prescribed medications and extra pair of socks and undergarments. If you want to explore on the bike then preferably carry your own bicycle and headgears.

faqs.question: Do I need to get any special vaccinations?
faqs.answer: As per the current guidelines, Ecuador is a Zika virus-prone country. It is highly recommended to get yellow fever, Hepatitis A, Typhoid, and malaria vaccinations. Authorities may ask for yellow fever certificate, so it is suggested to carry one photocopy and an original copy of the same. Lastly, take a small pouch bag of prescribed medication including anti-malarial medicines.

faqs.question: Which are the most important places to visit?
faqs.answer: While in Ecuador do not forget to visit Otavalo, Cuenca, Banos, The Amazon, and Galapagos Islands.

faqs.question: Where to shop in Ecuador?
faqs.answer: The special markets of Cuenca and Gualaceo for handicrafts are the most popular markets with special ferias organised every day. Otavalo market is perfect for Indian and silver crafts, Plaza de Ponchos for tourists including textiles, painting, leather goods, and ornaments. The saquisli market of locals and Silver Stores in the capital are perfect for carvings, Panama Hats, woollen and handloom are great for souvenirs.

faqs.question: Do I need travel or medical insurance plan?
faqs.answer: It is always advised to be insured in case of medical or travel emergencies. Akbar Travels can assist you with the ideal insurance policy to protect yourself against medical emergencies during travel as well as damage or loss of baggage.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Brunei?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visit to visit Brunei. Visa must be obtained from the High Commission of the Republic of Brunei in India. All Indian visitors entering into Brunei Darussalam must have a valid visa and passport or travel document, as well as onward tickets and sufficient funds to support themselves while in the country. The type of visa to enter Brunei will depend on several factors such as nationality, purpose of your planned visit and duration.

faqs.question: How can I apply for a Brunei visa online?
faqs.answer: Applicants are advised to submit their visa application at least 30 days before travelling to Brunei Darussalam. This is to take into account any applications which may need to be forwarded to Brunei Darussalam for further processing.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Brunei visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The length of validity of the visa is a maximum of 3 months.

faqs.question: What is the Brunei Darussalam visa fee for Indians?
faqs.answer: The visa fees are as below: Sr.No Visa Type No of Entries Visa Validity Visa Fee 1 Tourist/Business Visa SINGLE 3 months INR 1900/- 2 Tourist/Business Visa MULTIPLE 3 months INR 2400/-

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single entry and multiple entry?
faqs.answer: One must carefully note what kind of entry is permitted. If the visa reads a single entry, its holder can only enter and leave Brunei once whereas, with multiple entries, he/she can enter or leave the country multiple times.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of Tourist and Business visa?
faqs.answer: Tourist visas are for those Indian citizens travelling to Brunei Darussalamfor sightseeing, recreation and casual visits to friends or families. Business visas are ideal for Indian citizens travelling for Business Meetings, Conference, etc. for a shorter period of stay.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit my passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Brunei visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa application is normally processed within 5 working days.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a Brunei visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting brunei How long you intend to stay in brunei How will you support yourself during your time in brunei What is the purpose of your visit to brunei Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to brunei If you have a permit to brunei the country you intend to travel to after your stay in brunei

faqs.question: How do I receive my Brunei visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: What if my Brunei visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: The Embassy has the final call when it comes to a Brunei visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.question: If I am travelling on a Brunei tourist visa from India, will I be able to work in the country?
faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country on a Brunei tourist visa.

faqs.question: Do I need to purchase a Travel Insurance?
faqs.answer: Applicants are strongly advised to purchase a Travel Insurance to secure their trip in the occurrenceof unexpected events such as medical emergencies, flight cancellations, baggage delay or loss etc.
