faqs.question: What is a Cambodia e-visa?
faqs.answer:
The Kingdom of Cambodia e-visa is an electronic authorization from the Government for short term
                                stay visitors for tourism purpose only. Cambodia e-visa permits you a stay of upto 30 days
                                only.

faqs.question: Do I require a visa to visit Cambodia?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Indian Passport holders can apply for the Cambodia Visa prior to their travel or can also
                                opt for the Cambodia Visa on arrival. However, it is recommended to get the Cambodia Visa
                                in India itself to avoid any last-minute problems and long queues at the Cambodia Airport.
                                Getting a Cambodia e-visa in India is an easy and hassle-free process.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the Cambodia Visa?
faqs.answer:
With Akbar Travels getting the Cambodia e-Visa has never been easier, simply follow the below
                                steps; Apply online; Share your documents; Receive your eVisa.

faqs.question: How long will my Cambodia e-visa be valid for?
faqs.answer:
Cambodia e-visa is valid for 3 months and an e-visa holder is entitled to stay up to a maximum
                                of 30 days in Cambodia. Each application can only be used once.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Cambodia with an e-visa?
faqs.answer:
You can stay in Cambodia for upto 30 days with an e-visa. Since an e-visa is a single-entry visa
                                only, you cannot re-enter again on the same e-visa after exiting Cambodia.

faqs.question: How soon will I receive my Cambodia e-visa?
faqs.answer: Upon approval the e-visa will be delivered to your email within 3 business days.

faqs.question: What should I do after my e-visa application gets approved?
faqs.answer:
Your Cambodia e-visa will be sent via email once your application is approved. Print a copy of
                                the approved e-visa and make sure the printed copy is clear and legible. Kindly be reminded
                                that your Cambodia e-visa printout is crucial and must be presented upon your arrival at
                                the Cambodian entry checkpoints.

faqs.question: Is the Cambodia e-visa a single or multiple entry?
faqs.answer:
The Cambodia e-visa can only be used once when entering Cambodia and it is necessary to process
                                another application on your subsequent visit. It is advisable to read the provisions that
                                are contained in the e-visa PDF file.

faqs.question: What can I do if my e-visa application got refused?
faqs.answer:
If your Cambodia e-visa gets refused, you cannot travel to Cambodia. You can re-apply for an
                                e-visa any time as you like. However please keep in mind that each application costs as much
                                as the first application.

faqs.question: How long in advance should I apply for a Cambodia visa?
faqs.answer:
We recommend applying your e-visa not more than one month and not less than five days prior to
                                your travel date.

faqs.question: Do all border checkpoints support Cambodia e-Visa?
faqs.answer:
Not all border checkpoints support Cambodia e-visa. E-Visas are accepted at the following entry
                                points: If you are traveling by air, you can gain entry through: Phnom Penh International Airport. Siem Reap International Airport. Preah SihanoUnited Kingdom International Airport If you are traveling overland, you can gain entry through: Cham Yeam (Koh Kong Province) (from Thailand). Poi Pet (Banteay Meanchey Province) (from Thailand). Bavet (Svay Rieng Province) (from Vietnam). Tropaeng Kreal Border Post (Stung Treang) (from Laos) Travelers with a Pakistani origin or carrying a Pakistani passport are advised to apply from
                                the Cambodian Mission for a regular visa. Please note that the e-visa is also not available for: Those who hold diplomatic passports Those who hold official passports Those who hold spouse or parent-endorsed passports Those who hold international travel documents

faqs.question: How does the process of the application for a visa to Cambodia look like?
faqs.answer:
Obtaining a regular visa to Cambodia can be time-consuming especially when you need urgent services,
                                and you do not have enough time to visit the embassy. Regular visas may not suit your current
                                Cambodia visa requirements. Undoubtedly, e-visas will suit those who seek quick and secure
                                processes. It is a convenient way to secure your visa for Cambodia for a short (30 day) vacation
                                time.

faqs.question:
I plan to travel from Cambodia to another country for a short trip and return back to Cambodia again. Do I need to apply
                            two Visas within such a short period of time?
faqs.answer: Yes, you need to apply for two e-visas. Each e-visa is only valid for a single entry.

faqs.question: Is e-visa endorsed officially by the Cambodian Government?
faqs.answer:
Yes, Cambodia e-Visa or Electronic Visa has been introduced by Ministry of Foreign Affairs and
                                International Cooperation in April 2006 to promote the Cambodian tourism industry.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Cambodia Consulate/Embassy to get my e-visa?
faqs.answer:
No. You do not need to visit the Consulate/Embassy. We will process your e-visa online. Indians
                                are eligible for a Cambodia e-visa.

faqs.question: On arrival into Cambodia, what documents do I need to present?
faqs.answer:
At entry, you must show that you have a valid hotel booking, confirmed return tickets and sufficient
                                cash in addition to your valid passport and e-visa.

faqs.question: What are the advantages of applying for a Cambodia e-visa?
faqs.answer:
Minimum document requirement; Swift processing-subject to qualifying the eligibility criteria and meeting the documents
                                    requirement, your visa can be processed within 3 working days; Convenient and cost effective i.e. most economical visa fee/charges; Electronic visa can be sent anywhere in the world through Email.

faqs.question:
What is
                            a Lithuania Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
A Lithuania Schengen visa is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all
                                the
                                Schengen countries including Lithuania for a maximum period of upto 90 days. This is a
                                traveller’s
                                dream where with one visa you can travel to any of the other 25 Schengen countries
                                along
                                with Lithuania.

faqs.question:
The
                            Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer:
A Schengen Visa (issued by a consulate or embassy of a Schengen State) is valid for all
                                26 States
                                of the Schengen Area (including the European territory of Lithuania), unless it is
                                marked
                                otherwise on the visa sticker. So you do not need another visa to enter or stay in the
                                European
                                territory of Lithuania. However, you must be in possession of documentary evidence for
                                the
                                reasons of your stay and your means of support. Schengen Area comprises of the
                                following
                                countries: Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France,
                                Germany,
                                Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta,
                                Netherlands,
                                Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question:
How long
                            can I stay in the Schengen area on the basis of my visa?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your
                                passport.
                                The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This
                                means
                                that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in any period of 180 days. The
                                precise
                                length of validity of your Schengen Visa is indicated on the visa sticker under the
                                heading
                                “Duration of visit”. With a single-entry visa you can enter the Schengen area only
                                once.
                                This is indicated on the visa sticker under the heading "Number of entries" by "1". A
                                two-entry
                                or a multiple-entry visa allows for two or several entries during the validity of the
                                Schengen
                                Visa. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "02" or "MULT" under the heading "Number
                                of
                                entries".

faqs.question:
Will all
                            Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer:
No, not necessarily all Schengen Visas will be granted for 90 days. You may get the
                                Schengen
                                Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your
                                flight
                                & hotel bookings

faqs.question:
Can I
                            apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer:
You may appeal against this decision. The decision to refuse a Schengen visa and the
                                reasons
                                for the refusal are notified using a standard form that is handed out by the Member
                                State's
                                consulate that refused the visa. The notification of the refusal must include the
                                reasons,
                                on which the refusal were based, and the procedures and deadlines for submitting an
                                appeal. You are free to re-apply again if your application has been refused earlier.
                                However, it
                                is recommended that you take note of the reasons for the earlier refusal before
                                submitting
                                a new application and make amendments, where necessary. The visa fee is not refunded if the visa is refused. The visa fee covers the cost
                                of the
                                examination of the visa application.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer:
The Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a
                                country
                                that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: - the purpose of your trip - when and where you intend to travel - how your trip is going to be funded - day-by-day itinerary for your trip - duration of the trip

faqs.question:
Is it
                            possible to extend my Schengen Visa while in Lithuania?
faqs.answer:
You cannot extend your short-stay visa while in Lithuania except in special
                                circumstances, and
                                exceeding your permitted period of stay is considered an act of illegality or
                                criminality.
                                Instead, you must return to your home country within the permitted period of stay and
                                apply
                                for another Lithuania Visa if necessary.

faqs.question:
Can I
                            leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01".
                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during
                                the
                                validity of the visa.

faqs.question:
If my
                            Lithuania short-stay multiple entry Schengen Visa is valid for a year, how long
                            can I remain in the Lithuania territory?
faqs.answer:
A short-stay Schengen Visa allows you to enter and stay in a Lithuanian territory for a
                                maximum
                                period of 90 days within a period of six months.

faqs.question:
How long
                            before the start of the intended visit should I apply for a Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
You may only submit your Schengen visa application 90 days before your date of
                                departure. We
                                recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as
                                certain
                                types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process. For instance, the
                                processing
                                time of your Schengen Visa Application will take between 10-12 working days from your
                                appointment
                                date.

faqs.question:
How long
                            does it take to obtain a Lithuania Visa?
faqs.answer:
Typically, a Lithuania Visa (Schengen Visa) takes anywhere from 5 to 15 days to process
                                in the
                                Lithuanian Embassy/Consulate. The processing time for a Lithuania Visa is dependent on
                                several
                                factors and can change without notice at the consulate's discretion.

faqs.question:
Will I
                            get my visa at the end of the process?
faqs.answer:
The issuance or refusal of a Lithuania visa is the sole prerogative of The
                                Embassy/Consulate.
                                The Lithuania Visa Application Centre cannot influence this decision in any way.

faqs.question:
Is it
                            mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Lithuania Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Lithuania Visa in order to provide your biometrics
                                and submit
                                your visa documents.

faqs.question:
I have a
                            valid long stay visa/residence permit for a country that is part of the Schengen
                            area. Do I need another visa to travel to other Schengen states?
faqs.answer:
No. A long stay visa or a residence permit issued by a Schengen State allows you to
                                travel or
                                stay in other Schengen States, while respecting the maximum duration of a “short stay”
                                (a
                                stay of "90 days in any 180 day period")

faqs.question:
My
                            family is also applying for a Lithuania Visa, how many appointments should we make?
faqs.answer: Every member of the family needs an individual appointment.

faqs.question:
I am
                            traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply
                            for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy / Consulate of the country where you will
                                be staying
                                for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country then
                                you
                                must apply to the Embassy / Consulate of the country which would serve as the first
                                port
                                of entry.

faqs.question:
Can I
                            leave the Schengen area and return again with my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Schengen Visas may allow for a single-entry or multiple entries. With a single-entry
                                visa you
                                can enter the Schengen area only once. This is indicated on the visa sticker by "01".
                                With
                                a visa allowing for two or multiple entries you may enter twice or several times during
                                the
                                validity of the Schengen Visa.

faqs.question:
What is
                            the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen
                            Visa?
faqs.answer:
According to the EU, a single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only
                                once,
                                meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a
                                multiple-entry
                                Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity
                                period
                                (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question:
Do I
                            have to present any other document at the Schengen external borders apart from
                            my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At
                                the border
                                (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provide additional
                                documentation,
                                for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient means to cover the stay and
                                the
                                return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry with you copies of the
                                documents
                                which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g. letters of invitation,
                                travel
                                confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of your stay).

faqs.question:
Do I
                            have to apply in person for the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer:
Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be
                                presented
                                in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question:
Why is
                            personal appearance mandatory for Lithuania Visa?
faqs.answer:
As from 2nd November 2015 following the introduction of the Visa Information System
                                (VIS), all
                                Schengen visa applicants in India have to appear in person in order to provide
                                biometric
                                data (fingerprints and digital photography). The photograph can be digitally taken at
                                the
                                time of the application or scanned from an existing one. For subsequent applications
                                within
                                the 5 years the fingerprints can be copied from the previous application file in the
                                VIS.
                                In case of reasonable doubt regarding the identity of the applicant, the consulate will
                                again
                                collect fingerprints within the 5 year period specified above. Furthermore, the
                                applicant
                                may request that they be collected if, at the time when the application is lodged, it
                                cannot
                                be immediately confirmed that the fingerprints were collected within this 5 years
                                period.

faqs.question:
Do I
                            need to provide travel insurance for my Visa application?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Applicants should prove that they are in possession of adequate and valid travel
                                insurance
                                to cover any expenses which might arise in connection with repatriation for medical
                                reasons,
                                urgent medical attention and/or emergency hospital treatment or death, during their
                                stay(s)
                                on the territory of the Schengen Member States. The insurance should be valid
                                throughout
                                the territory of the Member States and cover the entire period of the person’s intended
                                stay
                                or transit. The minimum coverage must be EUR 30000.

faqs.question:
What are
                            the Schengen Visa travel insurance requirements?
faqs.answer:
Your travel Insurance plan for a Schengen Visa must meet the following
                                requirements: Minimum coverage of 30,000 Euros (approx. USD $34,000) Coverage for repatriation for medical reasons Coverage for emergency medical treatment Coverage for expenses resulting from your death Coverage for the entire period of your intended stay Valid in all Schengen Area countries

faqs.question:
Can you
                            process the Travel Insurance for me?
faqs.answer:
Even though Travel Insurance is a mandatory requirement for processing Schengen Visa,
                                you are
                                strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to secure yourself as medical
                                treatment
                                can be very expensive in the Schengen country. Your travel insurance offers protection
                                against
                                unexpected emergencies on international travel such as coverage of medical expenses,
                                flight
                                delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For
                                financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase
                                travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

What is

faqs.question: What is an Armenia E-Visa?
faqs.answer:
It is an Electronic Visa that can be issued online through us, without the effort of applying
                                through the embassy, making it easy to obtain from any place in the world. The E-Visa is
                                also called as a Visitor Visa.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Armenia E-Visas?
faqs.answer:
There are two types of Armenia E-Visas; 21 Days Short term Armenia E-Visa and 120 Days Long term
                                Armenia E-Visa.

faqs.question: What is the validity of the Armenia E-Visas?
faqs.answer:
The 21 days Armenia E-Visa is a single entry visa; valid for 90 days from the date of issue and
                                one can stay in Armenia for a total number of 21 days, whereas the 120 days Armenia E-Visa
                                is also a single entry visa; valid for 180 days from the date of issue and one can stay in
                                Armenia for a total number of 120 days.

faqs.question: The Visitor Visa can be issued for what purposes?
faqs.answer:
The Armenia Visitor visa can be issued for the purpose of tourism, business, sports/cultural/events,
                                medical treatment, family reunion, study/education, aircraft/transport crew and any other
                                activity as permitted by the Armenia Immigration.

faqs.question: What is the Armenia E-Visa processing time?

The E-Visa takes upto 2 to 3 days for processing. After you submit your documents to us, our

faqs.question: Is the Armenia E-Visa a single entry or valid for multiple entries?

faqs.question: How will I receive the Armenia E-Visa?

faqs.question: Do I need to print out the Armenia E-Visa once received?
faqs.answer:
Yes, you need to print out the E-Visa to present it at the airport. It is highly advisable to
                                always keep a copy of your E-Visa throughout your trip.

faqs.question: What should be the validity of my passport?
faqs.answer: Your passport should be valid for at least six months from the date of travel.

faqs.question: Do I need to personally visit the Armenia Consulate/Embassy to get my Visa?
faqs.answer:
No. You do not need to visit the Consulate/Embassy. We will take care of the complete visa process
                                right from verifying your documents to approval of your E-Visa.

faqs.question: Do I have to submit my passport for stamping before I travel?
faqs.answer:
No, you will receive an electronic visa, which does not require anything to be stamped in your
                                passport ahead of travel. All Armenia E-Visas are sent by email. You should print out a copy
                                of your Visa before you travel and carry it with you.

faqs.question: Do I need to take a health/travel insurance?
faqs.answer:
You are strongly advised to purchase a health / travel insurance to cover yourself in Armenia
                                as medical treatment can be very expensive in Armenia. Your travel insurance offers protection

                                flight delay and cancellations, passport and baggage loss or personal accident.  For financial
                                safety and security on your international trip we highly recommend you to purchase travel
                                insurance and avail our special offer.

faqs.question: What is a Liechtenstein Schengen visa?
faqs.answer: A Liechtenstein visa (Schengen visa) is a special kind of visa which allows you to travel among all the Schengen countries including Liechtensteinfor a maximum period of 90 days. Liechtenstein is part of the Schengen agreement. This is a traveller’s dream which lets you travel to all the Schengen countries on one visa.

faqs.question: The Schengen Visa is valid for which countries?
faqs.answer: Schengen Area comprises of the following countries: Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, and Switzerland.

faqs.question: How long can I stay in Liechtenstein on the basis of my Schengen visa?
faqs.answer: The LiechtensteinVisa (Schengen visa) is a short stay visa and takes the form of a sticker affixed to your passport. The definition of “short stay” is a stay of "90 days in any 180 days period". This means that the total duration of stay is of maximum 90 days in 6 months.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Liechtenstein Visas for Indians?
faqs.answer: Depending on your reason for travel, you can either choose tourist or business visa. Both of them are issued for a period of 90-days. A tourist visa is for you if you are willing to visit Liechtenstein for sightseeing and recreational purposes. Business visa is for you if your reasons are professional in nature and have business-related meetings with Liechtenstein companies.

faqs.question: Will all Schengen Visas be granted for 90 days?
faqs.answer: No, not necessarily all Liechtenstein visa (Schengen Visas) will be granted for 90 days. You may get the Schengen Visa only for the number of days that you present in your travel itinerary and your flight & hotel bookings

faqs.question: Can I apply again for a Schengen Visa if my application has been refused earlier?
faqs.answer: You are free to apply again for a Schengen Visa if your application has been refused earlier.

faqs.question: What is the Liechtenstein Schengen Visa cover letter?
faqs.answer: The Liechtenstein Schengen Visa cover letter is a letter which summarizes your intent to travel to a country that is part of the Schengen area. In your cover letter you should explain: - the purpose of your trip - when and where you intend to travel - how your trip is going to be funded - day-by-day itinerary for your trip - duration of the trip

faqs.question: How long before the start of the intended visit should I apply for the Liechtenstein Visa?
faqs.answer: You may only submit your Liechtensteinvisa application 90 days before your date of departure.We recommend that you apply at least 20 working days before the date you wish to depart as certain types of travel purpose may take longer than usual to process.

faqs.question: How long does it take to obtain the Visa?
faqs.answer: Typically, a Schengen Visa takes approximately 10 to 15 days for processing.However, the processing time is dependent on several factors and can change without notice at the embassy's discretion.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for me to take an appointment for a Liechtenstein Visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, an appointment is mandatory for Liechtenstein Visain order to provide your biometrics and submit your visa documents.

faqs.question: I am traveling to multiple Schengen countries. From which Consulate should I apply for my Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: Schengen Visa must be applied from the Embassy/Consulate of the country where you will be staying for maximum number of days. If your stay has equal number of days in each country, then you must apply to the Embassy/Consulate of the country which you will be entering first.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a single-entry Schengen Visa and a multiple-entry Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: A single-entry Schengen Visa allows entry to the Schengen area only once, meaning you are not permitted to re-enter the Schengen Area after leaving, while a multiple-entry Schengen Visa allows multiple entries into the Schengen Area within the visa’s validity period (90 days total within 180-day period).

faqs.question: Do I have to present any other document at the Schengen externalborders apart from my travel document with the Schengen Visa?
faqs.answer: The short-stay visa does not automatically entitle you to enter the Schengen area. At the border (or during other controls) you may have to show the visa but also provideadditional documentation, for example; sufficient evidence that you have sufficient meansto cover the stay and the return trip. It is therefore recommended that you carry withyou copies of the documents which you presented when applying for the Schengen visa (e.g.letters of invitation, travel confirmations, other documents stating the purpose of yourstay).

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Liechtenstein Visa (Schengen Visa)?
faqs.answer: Yes, applications by mail will not be accepted. The Schengen visa application should be presented in person because biometrical data must be recorded.

faqs.question: Do I have to inform my exact travel dates and itinerary while applying for visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is important to provide a day wise detailed itinerary of your trip along with the internal sector travel tickets.

faqs.question: Can I travel the whole of the Schengen area with this Visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can travel to all Schengen area. However, at the border you may have to show supporting documents along with your visa. Hence, it is recommended that you carry a set of all the documents which you presented while applying for the visa.

faqs.question: What should be done if my Liechtenstein visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer: In the case of a Liechtenstein visa rejection, the Embassy will state the reason for rejecting your visa application. You may also appeal against the decision if you find it necessary.

faqs.question: Do I need travel insurance?
faqs.answer: Travel medical insurance with minimum coverage of 30,000 EUR is one of the mandatory Liechtenstein visa requirements. The insurance should cover all the Schengen countries as well.Akbar Travels can also assist you in choosing the perfect travel or medical insurance policy to protect you against unforeseen medical or travel emergencies.

Our visa experts have the experience and knowledge to make your visa application process a smooth one. If you have any questions or need more Liechtenstein visa information, all you have to do is post your query online and our visa experts will contact you in no time.

faqs.question: What is a UAE eVisa?
faqs.answer:
It is an Electronic Visa that can be issued online through us, without the effort of
                                applying through the embassy, making it easy to obtain from any place in the world.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Dubai Tourist Visa?
faqs.answer:
The Dubai Visa is a single entry visa; valid for 58 days from the date of issue and
                                one can stay in UAE for a total number of 30 days.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the Dubai Visa?
faqs.answer:
With Akbar Travels getting the Dubai Visa has never been easier, simply follow the
                                below steps; Apply online; Share your documents; Receive your Visa.

faqs.question:
How many days prior to the date of travel can I apply or process the Dubai Visa
                            application?
faqs.answer: You can apply for your Dubai Visa a maximum 1 month prior to the date of travel.

faqs.question: What are the advantages of applying for Electronic UAE Visa?
faqs.answer:
Minimum document requirement; Swift processing-subject to qualifying the eligibility criteria and meeting the
                                    documents requirement, your visa can be processed within 3-4 working days; Convenient and cost effective i.e. most economical visa fee/charges; No hotel booking is required, you may stay at a place of your choice; Electronic visa can be sent anywhere in the world through Email.

faqs.question: What is the Dubai Visa processing time?
faqs.answer:
The normal Dubai Visa processing time is upto 5 working days. There is also an
                                express service at an additional charge wherein your Dubai Visa will be processed
                                within 48 hours. After you submit your documents to us, our team of Visa experts
                                will review your application and contact you.

faqs.question: Is the Dubai visa a single entry or valid for multiple entries?
faqs.answer:
The Dubai Visa is valid only for a single entry; within the validity period of 30
                                days from the date of issue of the visa.

faqs.question: How will I receive the Dubai Visa?
faqs.answer: Once the Dubai eVisa gets issued it will be sent immediately to your email.

faqs.question: Do I need to print out the Dubai eVisa once received?
faqs.answer:
Yes, you need to print out the eVisa to present it at the airport. It is highly
                                advisable to always keep a copy of your eVisa throughout your trip.

faqs.question: Can the entry and exit be from any Airport in UAE?
faqs.answer: The visa is valid for entry and exit for all airports within UAE.

faqs.question: Is this Dubai Visa valid for whole UAE or only restricted to Dubai?
faqs.answer: The Dubai Visa is valid for whole of UAE and you can visit any place within UAE.

faqs.question: Can I extend the Dubai Visa once it expires?
faqs.answer:
No, all Dubai Visas are NOT extendable & departure from Dubai must be before the
                                visa deadline date.

faqs.question: What are the repercussions of staying beyond the validity of visa period?
faqs.answer:
You may never be issued a Dubai Visa again in future. It may also result into a
                                heavy penalty of overstay besides legal action in Dubai.

faqs.question: Can I get a physical Dubai Visa stamped on my passport?
faqs.answer:
The UAE Embassy does not issue Dubai Visas stamps on ordinary/normal passports. It
                                is issued in the form of an Electronic visa.

faqs.question: Why is OK to Board (OTB) needed?
faqs.answer:
Due to an expansion in fake visas to UAE, many Indian passengers were deported back
                                in the past. In order to control the fake visa issuance and any fraudulent
                                activities; airlines and sponsors double check the UAE Visa and Air tickets before
                                departure and only after checking the visa authenticity, airlines update visa
                                message in the respective PNR.

faqs.question: What is the time taken to get the OTB?
faqs.answer:
The Airline verifies the Dubai Visa and only then updates an Ok to Board message
                                against the PNR. Airlines generally will take at least 24-48 working hours to
                                update PNR after issuance of VISA.

faqs.question: What is the main purpose behind updating the OTB?
faqs.answer:
Your airline mandates you to update OTB message in the PNR primarily to confirm the
                                legitimacy of your Dubai Visa as well as other relevant travel documents, thereby
                                eliminating the chances of travellers making entry to the country with a forged
                                visa and subsequently getting deported by the UAE immigration.

faqs.question: What if my OTB status is not updated?
faqs.answer:
In such circumstances, your airline has the complete right to disapprove your
                                boarding. To resolve this issue at the earliest, don’t delay to get in touch with
                                our Dubai Visa Experts.

faqs.question: What if my Dubai Visa gets rejected?
faqs.answer:
The approval of the Dubai Visa is solely regulated by the government of the UAE and
                                governed by their rules & regulations and the rejection of the Dubai visa
                                application is the sole prerogative of the immigration authorities, therefore Akbar
                                Travels will not be held responsible in case of visa rejection or delay.

faqs.question: Is the Dubai Visa fee refundable if it has been rejected?
faqs.answer:
No, the Dubai Visa fee is non-refundable in all cases, including if the visa
                                application is rejected.

faqs.question: Will the North Korea be stamped on my passport?
faqs.answer: No. Your North Korea visa will be issued on a separate paper and given on the day of departure.

faqs.question: Can I travel to North Korea on my own without joining a tour?
faqs.answer: No. You must join either a group tour or a private tour. All travellers to North Korea must be on an approved, guided tour organized by an authorized tour operator. Independent travel to North Korea is not possible. It is not possible to organize your North Korean visa yourself

faqs.question: Which are the tours available for North Korea?
faqs.answer: The majority of tours depart from China, most commonly Beijing but often Dandong, Shanghai, and Shenyang. Departures from Vladivostok, Russia are also possible. It is the responsibility of the traveller to ensure they have the appropriate Chinese or Russian visa to join and return from their tour back to China or Russia. After lodging your application, the North Korea visa will be issued on a separate paper and not on your passport. The tour operator will collect the visa on your behalf and hand over your visa copy on the day of your tour departure.

faqs.question: What is the North Korea visa processing time?

faqs.question: What are my options in case of rejection of my North Korea visa?
faqs.answer: A North Korea visa rejection or approval is at the sole discretion of the Embassy of North Korea, New Delhi. You have to accept their decision, and no appeal will be entertained or refund given.

faqs.question: Does visiting North Korea affect travel to other countries?
faqs.answer: No. Visiting North Korea will not affect your travel to other countries. Your North Korean visa is also issued on a separate visa card, not in your passport. Your passport will not be stamped on entry or exit to the DPRK.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for a North Korea visa application?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state Why are you visiting North Korea How long you intend to stay in North Korea How will you support yourself during your time in North Korea What is the purpose of your visit to North Korea Type of passport you hold and for how long it is valid Where do you intend to travel following your visit to North Korea If you have a permit to North Korea the country you intend to travel to after your stay in North Korea

Before applying for a visa please check which visa type you are eligible to apply for.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Malawi Visas?
faqs.answer: Tourist Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to enter Malawi for visits, residence or business. Official Visa: It is a visa issued to a person holding an official or a service passport on official business visit to Malawi. Transit Visa: It is a visa which is strictly issued to persons intending to transit through Malawi within a period of seven days. Diplomatic Visa: It is a visa which is issued to a person holding a diplomatic passport for official visit or mission to Malawi. Courtesy Visa: It is a visa issued to a person visiting Malawi with an invitation sent by the Government, but is not entitled to a diplomatic passport. It enables him/her to enter Malawi for the purpose of paying courtesy calls.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for a Malawi visa online?
faqs.answer: The earliest date to apply for a Malawi visa is one months before the date of travel to the country.In order to allow for adequate time for visa processing, it is advisable that all visa applications are submitted one week, prior to travelling.

faqs.question: What is the validity of a Malawi visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: To enable the authorities to process your application, you must clearly state: This visa is valid for 30 days

faqs.question: Is the visa extendable in Malawi?
faqs.answer: This visa is valid for 30 days and you can extend it up to 60 days more for a total of 90 days maximum. It will cost you 5000 Malawi kwacha (MWK) to extend your visa for 30 days and 10000MWK for 60 days.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit passport along with the application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Embassy will stamp the visa in the original passport. Therefore, two blank pages are required in the passport. Your passport should also be valid for minimum six months beyond the intended stay.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get a Malawi visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa application is normally processed within 3 to 4 working days.

faqs.question: How do I receive my Malawi visa online?
faqs.answer: The visa will be stamped on your passport.

faqs.question: What type of entry is granted for a Malawi Visa for Indians?
faqs.answer:
The visa can be issued for a single entry, multiple entry and transit entry depending on the nature of the visit. The single entry visa is valid for three months and can be used once upon entry into Malawi.If you are planning to stay only in Malawi, this is the best option for you. The multiple entry visas are valid for six or twelve months and can be used for multiple entries within the validity period.If you are planning to leave Malawi and come back during your trip, for example to Zambia, this option might interest you.
                                        The transit visa is valid for a period not exceeding seven days and can be used once.

faqs.answer: The Embassy of Malawi, New Delhi, has the final call when it comes to a Malawi visa rejection. If your application is rejected or is granted for a shorter period, the authorities’ decision is final and no refund will be issued.

faqs.answer: You cannot take up any kind of paid employment in the country ona Malawi tourist visa.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa for Israel?
faqs.answer: Yes, all Indian passport holders require a visa to travel to Israel. Whether you're visiting for tourism, business, or other purposes, you must obtain a visa before entering the country. Visa on arrival is not available for Indian citizens.

faqs.question: How can I apply for an Israel visa online?
faqs.answer:
It is a straightforward and effortless process to apply for an Israel visa online through our trusted visa partner:
1. Choose your preferred type of Israel visa based on your travel purpose
2. Pay online

4. We verify, complete your application and schedule an appointment if required

faqs.question: What are the different types of Israel Visas?
faqs.answer:
Tourist Visa: For leisure travel, sightseeing, and visiting friends or family.
Business Visa: For attending meetings, conferences, or trade fairs.
Student Visa: For students enrolled in academic institutions in Israel.
Transit Visa: For short layovers en route to another destination.
Work Visa: Issued for employment purposes through a sponsoring employer.
Each visa type has specific documentation and eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for an Israel visa?
faqs.answer: The earliest you can apply is three months before your planned travel date. However, it is advisable to apply at least 3-4 weeks before departure to allow sufficient processing time.

faqs.question: What is the validity of an Israel visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The Israel Embassy generally issues Single Entry and Multiple Entry visas. A Single Entry visa is typically valid for up to 3 months, while a Multiple Entry visa may be issued for longer durations depending on purpose and documentation.

faqs.question: What is the Israel visa fee for Indians?
faqs.answer:
The visa fee varies based on visa type and entry category:
- Tourist Visa (Single Entry): INR 6,800/-
- Tourist Visa (Multiple Entry): INR 10,500/-
Additional service charges may apply if processed via agencies like our trusted visa partner.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a Single Entry and Multiple Entry visa?
faqs.answer: A Single Entry visa allows you to enter Israel once during the validity period. If you exit, you’ll need a new visa to re-enter. A Multiple Entry visa allows you to enter and exit Israel multiple times within the visa’s validity.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit my passport along with the visa application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Israel visa is a sticker visa that is stamped in your original passport. Therefore, your passport must be submitted and should be valid for at least 6 months with a minimum of two blank pages.

faqs.question: Do I have to apply in person for the Israel Visa?
faqs.answer: In most cases, personal appearance is not required if you apply through a reputed agency. However, the Embassy reserves the right to call applicants for an interview or biometric submission if necessary.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get an Israel visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa applications are normally processed within 10 to 15 working days. Delays can occur due to additional document verification or peak travel seasons.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for an Israel visa application?
faqs.answer:
You must clearly state:
- The purpose of your visit to Israel
- Duration of your intended stay
- Proof of accommodation and financial support
- Travel itinerary and return ticket
- Valid passport and past travel history

faqs.question: What documents are required for an Israel visa?
faqs.answer:
Required documents include:
- Original passport (valid for 6+ months)
- Recent passport-sized photos
- Completed visa application form
- Travel insurance
- Hotel bookings
- Return air ticket
- Cover letter explaining the purpose of visit
- Financial proof (bank statement, ITRs)

faqs.question: How do I receive my Israel visa?
faqs.answer: Once approved, the visa will be stamped in your passport and returned to you via courier or pickup from our office, depending on the service chosen.

faqs.question: Is travel insurance mandatory for an Israel visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, travel insurance is highly recommended and often mandatory. It should cover medical emergencies, trip cancellations, delays, and baggage loss for the entire duration of your stay in Israel.

faqs.question: Is vaccination required for Israel visa application?
faqs.answer: Vaccination is not mandatory for most short-term visitors. However, travelers are advised to stay updated with routine vaccines and carry a Yellow Fever certificate if arriving from a Yellow Fever-endemic country.

faqs.question: Can I work in Israel with a tourist visa?
faqs.answer: No, a tourist visa does not permit any form of paid employment in Israel. You must obtain a work visa sponsored by an Israeli employer to work legally.

faqs.question: What should I do if my Israel visa is rejected?
faqs.answer: In case of a visa rejection, the embassy will mention the reason. You can reapply with corrected or additional documents, or appeal if you believe the rejection was incorrect.

faqs.question: Can I extend my stay in Israel?
faqs.answer: Visa extension requests must be submitted to the Israeli Ministry of Interior while in the country. Extensions are not guaranteed and are usually granted only under special circumstances.

faqs.answer: Yes, an appointment may be required depending on your location and visa category. Our experts will assist in scheduling your appointment and preparing your documents accordingly.

faqs.question: How long does it take to get an Solomon Islands visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: Visa applications are normally processed within 10 to 15 working days. Delays can occur due to additional document verification or peak travel seasons.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for an Solomon Islands visa application?
faqs.answer:
You must clearly state:
- The purpose of your visit to Solomon Islands
- Duration of your intended stay
- Proof of accommodation and financial support
- Travel itinerary and return ticket
- Valid passport and past travel history

faqs.question: What documents are required for an Solomon Islands visa?
faqs.answer:
Required documents include:
- Original passport (valid for 6+ months)
- Recent passport-sized photos
- Completed visa application form
- Travel insurance
- Hotel bookings
- Return air ticket
- Cover letter explaining the purpose of visit
- Financial proof (bank statement, ITRs)

faqs.question: How do I receive my Solomon Islands visa?
faqs.answer: Once approved, the visa will be stamped in your passport and returned to you via courier or pickup from our office, depending on the service chosen.

faqs.question: Is travel insurance mandatory for an Solomon Islands visa?
faqs.answer: Yes, travel insurance is highly recommended and often mandatory. It should cover medical emergencies, trip cancellations, delays, and baggage loss for the entire duration of your stay in Solomon Islands.

faqs.question: Is vaccination required for Solomon Islands visa application?
faqs.answer: Vaccination is not mandatory for most short-term visitors. However, travelers are advised to stay updated with routine vaccines and carry a Yellow Fever certificate if arriving from a Yellow Fever-endemic country.

faqs.question: Can I work in Solomon Islands with a tourist visa?
faqs.answer: No, a tourist visa does not permit any form of paid employment in Solomon Islands. You must obtain a work visa sponsored by an Solomon Islandsi employer to work legally.

faqs.question: What should I do if my Solomon Islands visa is rejected?
faqs.answer: In case of a visa rejection, the embassy will mention the reason. You can reapply with corrected or additional documents, or appeal if you believe the rejection was incorrect.

faqs.question: Can I extend my stay in Solomon Islands?
faqs.answer: Visa extension requests must be submitted to the Solomon Islandsi Ministry of Interior while in the country. Extensions are not guaranteed and are usually granted only under special circumstances.

faqs.question: Do I need an appointment for submitting my Solomon Islands visa application?
faqs.answer: Yes, an appointment may be required depending on your location and visa category. Our experts will assist in scheduling your appointment and preparing your documents accordingly.

faqs.question: What are the different types of Guinea-Bissau Visas?

Tourist Visa: For leisure travel, sightseeing, and visiting friends or family.
Business Visa: For attending meetings, conferences, or trade fairs.
Student Visa: For students enrolled in academic institutions in Guinea-Bissau.
Transit Visa: For short layovers en route to another destination.
Work Visa: Issued for employment purposes through a sponsoring employer.
Each visa type has specific documentation and eligibility criteria.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for an Guinea-Bissau visa?
faqs.answer: The earliest you can apply is three months before your planned travel date. However, it is advisable to apply at least 3-4 weeks before departure to allow sufficient processing time.

faqs.question: What is the validity of an Guinea-Bissau visa for Indians?
faqs.answer: The Guinea-Bissau Embassy generally issues Single Entry and Multiple Entry visas. A Single Entry visa is typically valid for up to 3 months, while a Multiple Entry visa may be issued for longer durations depending on purpose and documentation.

faqs.question: What is the Guinea-Bissau visa fee for Indians?
faqs.answer:
The visa fee varies based on visa type and entry category:
- Tourist Visa (Single Entry): INR 6,800/-
- Tourist Visa (Multiple Entry): INR 10,500/-
Additional service charges may apply if processed via agencies like our trusted visa partner.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a Single Entry and Multiple Entry visa?
faqs.answer: A Single Entry visa allows you to enter Guinea-Bissau once during the validity period. If you exit, you’ll need a new visa to re-enter. A Multiple Entry visa allows you to enter and exit Guinea-Bissau multiple times within the visa’s validity.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to submit my passport along with the visa application?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Guinea-Bissau visa is a sticker visa that is stamped in your original passport. Therefore, your passport must be submitted and should be valid for at least 6 months with a minimum of two blank pages.

faqs.question: How early can I apply for an Jordan visa?

faqs.question: What is the validity of an Jordan visa for Indians?

faqs.question: What is the Jordan visa fee for Indians?

faqs.question: What is the difference between a Single Entry and Multiple Entry visa?
faqs.answer: A Single Entry visa allows you to enter Jordan once during the validity period. If you exit, you’ll need a new visa to re-enter. A Multiple Entry visa allows you to enter and exit Jordan multiple times within the visa’s validity.

faqs.answer: Yes, the Jordan visa is a sticker visa that is stamped in your original passport. Therefore, your passport must be submitted and should be valid for at least 6 months with a minimum of two blank pages.
